author: H1D1Bale
review_text: The best tactical shooter with incredible sounds and immersive gameplay. Appreciate the game while it exists, as such masterpieces are no longer being made

author: Cropac
review_text: Jugué la primera entrega de Insurgency y me encantó por completo. Sus modos de juego, el ritmo, ese equilibrio entre arcade y realismo me parecieron una experiencia única dentro de los shooters en primera persona. Insurgency: Sandstorm mantiene ese mismo espíritu, pero elevando todo a otro nivel. Gráficamente es muy superior, el sonido es espectacular cada disparo, cada explosión se sienten intensamente reales y la jugabilidad sigue siendo su punto más fuerte.Este no es un shooter para cualquiera. Tiene un enfoque más táctico y realista que Call of Duty, pero no llega a los extremos de simulación de Arma, quedando justo en ese punto medio que lo hace tan especial. Su gunplay es excelente, el arsenal está muy bien trabajado, y los mapas y modos están diseñados para ofrecer combates intensos, inmersivos y llenos de tensión. Si encajas con este estilo de juego, es muy probable que te quedes por decenas o incluso cientos de horas. Y aunque no seas ese jugador “ideal”, Sandstorm sigue ofreciendo razones de sobra para jugarlo, sobre todo si tienes amigos con quienes compartir la **** definitiva, lo recomiendo sin dudar por su jugabilidad, por el realismo bien medido, por sus gráficos mejorados y por su sonido impresionante. Un multijugador diferente que merece más atención de la que tiene.

author: MrJAR
review_text: Just like my favorite game of all time L4D2 this game is extremely replayable the community might be toxic to certain people Yes i can see that but I LOVE them I interact with some of the same people here and there and they give me a good laugh. The game gets updates pretty frequently for things like cosmetics, maps, double xp (for account level) it doesn't let the game hang out to dry like what Rockstar games did to Red Dead Redemption 2 MP. The reason i put it as a 9/10 instead of a 10/10 is phasing issues when i shoot someone sometimes the bullet goes through them and hits behind them and there's a weird bug recently I've recently got in the pass few days of ground texture being black but it stops when the game is done, none the less if i had 30 bucks and trying to get an fps that will last me a long time, if im looking for a game that isn't COD, Rainbow 6, and im not looking for a game like ready or not/arma/squad, THIS IS THE GAME!!!

author: LatvianButter
review_text: A perfect blend of gritty realism with nice arcadey elements that make for a wonderful serious game, and a wonderful 'lets **** around' game at the same time.

author: jdmsjmsrscgm
review_text: Insurgency: Sandstorm,stands out in the crowded field of first-person shooters with its intense and realistic depiction of modern combat. Launched as the sequel to the original Insurgency, Sandstorm enhances the franchise’s reputation for delivering gritty, tactical gameplay that rewards teamwork and strategy over lone-wolf **** of the most notable aspects of Insurgency: Sandstorm is its commitment to realism. The game eschews the more arcade-like elements found in many of its peers in favor of a more grounded approach. Weapons behave realistically, with significant recoil and authentic ballistics. This makes gunfights tense and deadly, where a single bullet can be fatal. The sound design further amplifies the immersion, with gunfire and explosions resonating with a visceral, bone-rattling intensity that places players right in the heart of the **** tactical gameplay is another strong point. Insurgency: Sandstorm requires players to communicate and coordinate effectively to succeed. Each match demands careful planning and precise execution, whether you’re capturing objectives, defending positions, or escorting valuable assets. The game’s various modes, including Push, Firefight, and Checkpoint, offer diverse challenges that test different aspects of tactical proficiency.Visually, Insurgency: Sandstorm may not boast the cutting-edge graphics of some AAA titles, but it compensates with meticulously designed maps that offer a variety of environments, from dense urban centers to sprawling rural landscapes. These maps are not only visually distinct but also intricately designed to support a wide range of tactical approaches.However, Insurgency: Sandstorm is not without its flaws. New players may find the steep learning curve daunting, as the game does little to hold your hand. The realism that hardcore fans love can be a barrier to entry for those accustomed to more forgiving shooters. Additionally, while the game has seen numerous updates and content additions, it still suffers from occasional bugs and performance issues that can detract from the overall experience.Despite these drawbacks, Insurgency: Sandstorm offers a refreshing alternative to more mainstream shooters. Its emphasis on realism and tactical gameplay creates a uniquely intense experience that stands out in the genre. For players who crave a challenging and authentic depiction of modern combat, Insurgency: Sandstorm is a compelling choice that rewards patience, precision, and teamwork.

author: Keener01
review_text: It just feels like a copy and past of other fps games ive played. It doesn't stand out i and is just another multiplayer fps game. Its pretty good, but just nothing special.ndependently

author: keksivaras
review_text: really great game. I like the realism, especially shotguns. not that many games get it right. good comms with teammates.

author: Hypor
review_text: Love the realism and attention to detail in graphics, animations, and mechanics! Although I like it being sort of an arcade game, the optimization does ruin the gameplay but the game is fun generally.

author: exclulsive
review_text: best arcade and sim shooter to this day

author: ARSM
review_text: The performance eventually became stable by 2022. Overall, they found a balance between hardcore simulators and arcade fun. All weapons are available from the first level, but it takes time to find your most suitable options and set of mods. The death is a matter of a couple of hits or one headshot, but it will not be easy to land those shots. Updates are relatively rare, but there are funky game modes in rotation that change every two weeks.

author: S3XU4LH34L1NG
review_text: A way more strategical take on the COD / BF / CS formula. The time to kill is extremely low making any weapon viable and making the game more about strategy and reflexes. Sadly there is no real progression system. Due to that many players quit and the player number are rather low.

author: KYV
review_text: Absolutely do not recommend this game. Because it has two useless classes - the Observer, who is always running wherever and does not fulfill his functions and the Commander, who can do nothing because he is FULLY dependent on the Observer, who is running wherever!

author: carnivorCactae
review_text: No dedicated servers, means you can only play with randoms and strangers and have basically zero control about anything.

author: ImSoNotSorry
review_text: The game is absolute dogs**t. You wait more to respawn than that you actually play the game. All the game modes are also terrible. Would refund immediately if I could.

author: Jumpup
review_text: Not able to review this for PS4 so I will drag the PC score down until I can: this game has been out 3 years on PC, it’s become quite apparent that PC footage was used to sell the PS4 version as the PS4 Day one version in no way looks like or has the fidelity of the PC version. It’s a stuttering, Tearing un optimized mess on day one, a new developer I would give a by ball but this is a 3 year old game and it looks and runs like a PS2 game with the graphics of MGS 1. Lets run down the list of issues this scummy developer thought they would get away with: No Hit Detector, No Kill Detector, A weird marker for friendly’s that appears to the side of them and at some distance from them, a broken comms system where enemy conversations can be heard, screen tearing, lack of any anti-aliasing, Lack of HD graphics, this things running in standard def, lack of textures, broken load out system that fails to remember saved load outs, Lack of progress markers, lack of round information, lack of scoring system, an extremely low draw distance, a gutted game mode system, no vehicles, pop in everywhere, lack of 60fps (in an FPS of all things) a mess of a menu system, a diabolical weapon modification system that remembers nothing, a class system that’s all over the place with standard sniper, heavy, light and assault classes all behind paywalls. And the most important part the bullet physics, I understand the game is built around this but with the exceptionally low graphics there is simply no point to it, I cannot see the drop to correct the shot through the tearing and jaggy choppy gameplay. A f*cking disgrace of a day one release after 3 years to polish. Its no wonder medicritic has reviews switched off on the PS4 and Xbox versions. Well let’s hope users who can’t review it over there come here and drag the PC score down with this sinking ship cause these scum don’t deserve to get away with this at £59.99… (DO NOT BUY ON CONSOLE! UTTERLY BROKEN)

Some guns are just objectively better than others with no regards to what their actual performance is. Case and point is the AS VAL. It somehow does less damage than 9x19mm, despite shooting 9x39mm. author: facknrite
review_text:
Sooooooooooo after waiting 6 months waiting for an update and optimization for the game, DEV's launched 1.6 test version which includes 1 mediocre map and 2 new guns that have an excesive stupid recoil and added it to the advisor class removing the SVD and EBR MK14 that were the most used guns by players on that class.

They also added the most stupid feature called DEATHCAM which is total trash because now you can see from where you got shot from and all the enemies on that area, meaning that the tactical part of the game is lost.

Once again after hundreds of complaints about that stupid feature they are still going to implement it on the stable version which demonstrate that they don't give a **** about their community feedback and they will still do whatever they want.

So my question is...what is the point of asking feedback when DEV's really don't care about your opinion unless you kiss their a$$es with every stupid decision they make.

Just to make a quick summary of what you will be getting by buying this game is:

- 0 optimization (optimization for this DEV's means, removing stuff from the maps)
- Updates every 6 months which are just gonna be trash.
- Hit Reg issues
- Abandoned Server Owners (Meaning no new cvars, no server side optimization)
- Terrible Hit Reg
- Unknown Performance(The game can run amazingly well on a top tier PC ro it can run like trash on the same PC)
- Fed Up Community (Tired of all the **** of the game and DEV's that got stucked with a facked up game without the option to refund it)

So if you are willing to go through all of that then buy it, if not then save your money and wait for some amazing titles being launched this year.

author: Nstarnoe
review_text:
I was really looking forward to playing this game and it seem like a fun game when I tried it. But the performance is the worst I have ever experienced in any game.

Despite barley using a third of my cpu and GPU processing power the game runs a a very unstable 70 FPS on the lowest possible settings (I easily get 160 FPS on high setting in much more demanding games) on top that there is constant lag.

It’s a pity, it seems like a cool game and it would be nice to see a small studio make something great. But the performance is truly abysmal

author: ForsCZ
review_text: This game is full of fun! Great references from Starship Troopers. Well it is based on the movie or more likely on the book. Shooting is great, enemies, tactics, all the ways how to achieve victory for democracy is flawless. Even more fun with friends or just randomly join other players. This game has very friendly and funny **** only flaw might be getting new guns, getting some standard pieces is not a problem, but for other bundles with skins, emotes, guns etc., you need to either buy game credit or spend some time in the game in order to find these credits. In my case, I spent around 45 hours before I got enough credits for new bundle. Game credits are not that easy to find and you will find just a few of them per game.

review_text: Super chill player base and the most toxic-free online game I’ve ever played. Has some performance issues they’re still working through.

review_text: Legendary game with Great detailing. Really Fun co-op and non-repetitive gameplay since you can unlock more things as you go on and fight with different loadouts every time. Lost 1 point because of some still existing Bugs and Physics Glitches, But that makes it more fun sometimes in multiplayer.

author: Silnariis
review_text:
This game is a lot of fun for many hours, especially while discovering the different factions and difficulty levels.

In-game events happen regularly, adding new enemies, new missions, and community objectives to complete within a limited time.

However, there are also frequent bugs — some funny, like enemies dying and suddenly flying off into the sky, and others less amusing, like game crashes or your character getting randomly launched across the map with all their ****’s perfectly playable solo, but I think the experience is much more enjoyable with friends.

author: KLASHIUS
review_text: It's fun. IT'S FUN !That's something you don't see these days very often. And it's not even that expensive.

author: dcxdarklegend
review_text: What started as one of the most fun experiences of the modern gaming generation was stunted by a former dev team that doubled down on their questionable decisions. Now heralded by a dev  team that appears to prioritize enjoyment and game feel, the game is back to what it was at the start. Mindless fun that you could log into for a couple of hours and enjoy with friends. The movement sometimes clunky, the bugs infuriating, and the friendly fire always hilarious. If you're a fan of action multiplayer games that are PVE(or PVP depending on how your allies are feeling), then this game is one you shouldn't miss.

author: Xegotter
review_text: Helldivers 2 is a masterpiece in the action and cooperative shooter genre, bringing the gaming experience to a new generation with its stunning blend of strategy, teamwork, and adrenaline. The community is active, and there are always teammates ready to fight by your side. Moreover, the extensive character customisation and progression options provide excellent motivation to keep playing and improving. In short, it's a cracking game—the kind that only comes around every 15 or 20 years.

review_text: While the core gameplay is extremely fun, the game is plagued by sever (and ever growing with each new patch) performances issues. While I can still play with 60 fps (half of what I had a year ago) my friends can't and gave up on the game. Unfortunately the devs seems more eager to release new content and adding to the never ending list of bugs and broken mechanics (like the stun weapons that don't work as intended because of bugs that have been present since the game's release), than fixing their game and making it enjoyable for everyone, which is not very democratic. review_text: 地狱潜兵2本体是一款非常棒的游戏，当然它存在着当今游戏圈的各种通病包括优化，bug以及非常少的内容。但相信我，它是好玩的，尤其是有朋友一起的时候。但是现在它已经是一款AH用来恶心玩家的产品了，仿佛一切都是用来恶心玩家们的。它不在是一款好玩的游戏，以至于让我非常怀疑当初制作游戏本体的根本不是AH，至少现在这个工作室对游戏是没有最基本的理解的。

author: Ser3ndip1ty
review_text: This game is full of bugs and crashes. The balancing update is really funny. But overall, it's gameplay is fundamentally great.

author: Deccarand
review_text: One of the greatest games in the roguelike genre. On par with such giants as Hades, TBoI and Dead Cells. The music is excellent and suits the game very well, the visuals are pleasant and understandable, the plot is a bit weak, but not bad at all, the replayability is cosmic, and the variety is huge. An amazing game. I understand those people who have more than 500 hours, 1k hours and more in it. The game is 5 years old since its release, and I still enjoy coming back to it. The community of this game has not disappointed either. They make funny memes and excellent mods with guides. What more could you want from dedicated fans? In co-op, the game reveals its full potential.

author: Belaruseach
review_text: An absolute game masterpiece. Despite some minor conflicts, like regarding early seekers of the storm DLC, it is still a masterpiece. Lore is tragic and well-made, secrets are secret enough and game is actually challenging. So I would recommend it to anyone. Literally.

author: Bunsy55
review_text: Risk of Rain 2 has become one of my favorite games of all time I have 560 hours in the game and once the next DLC comes out I plan on playing it for even more the game has so many characters items and maps to master, there is a reason why this game has such a massive fan base even 5 years since it came out once you pick it up

author: ntorix
review_text:
Très bon jeu, avec un système de difficulté augmentant avec le temps, et non le niveau dans lequel vous êtes. On voit au fur et a mesure de la partie son build devenir de plus en plus fort, avec une multitude de synergies disponibles, ce qui est très plaisant. 
Les differents personnages disponibles offrent tous un gameplay different, chacun ayant sa facon de tirer, ses propres capacités, assurant une très bonne rejouabilité.
J'ai joué la majorité du temps en multijoueur, et c'est une superbe expérience, parfois hilarante quand votre ami oblitère tout sur son passage.
Si vous aimez les roguelikes, il est impératif de jouer a ce jeu.

author: Eggieye
review_text: of any rougelike, this one does it the best, with every run being a unique experience and every other aspect being perfected as well

author: SassyCritic
review_text: A very good game with a bunch of surprises packing, I like how the difficulty increases as you go on making it harder & more worth it if you like intense 3rd person shooters, its controls are a little janky but overall, a good game.

author: Nazrielau05
review_text:
I blew 10 hours into Risk of Rain 2. I couldn't get past through Mithrix **** this playthrough made me appreciate this game a whole lot more.

I was never too impressed with the game's presentation. I think i just needed more time to get comfortable with the game's general direction. It's not the most visually interesting game I've played, but at least the character design, enemy designs, level design, and colour grading all comes together to deliver a solid package of a visual style. I want to emphasis on the enemy designs here. Their designs are what sold me to the game's visual direction. The larger creatures has a certain aesthetic to them that compliments the background setting a lot.

I was also mixed on the music for a good while. I don't dislike them or anything, but i think i got very overwhelmed by the game's stimuli. The default settings for this game's audio was really loud and it made me uncomfortable. It's not until i turned down the volume until i could appreciate the game's audio design. The soundtrack elevates the hectic and chaotic battle sequences at least 10 times. Of course, this is only possible if the sound effects were good in the first place, and they are! the sound designs has so much weight to it. It really sells you the scale of the larger enemies in the game. Sound clues are also very effective here. A lot of sounds are exclusive to a certain type of threat. So a headphone/earphone is recommended to get the full experience.

This game's mechanics is the spotlight here. Risk of Rain 2 is a 3D Third person shooter game, and it uses that concept until the point of exhaustion. It's a philosophy that's very integral for any type of Art. You thought of a concept? use it over and over again until you couldn't think of anything more. Some of the most memorable enemies for me are the airborn ones! That's a serious feat in my opinion. And some of the on-ground enemies could jump/float! just to mess with your sense of vision. This game's battle sequences are extremely hectic and chaotic. This experience is probably what made me uncomfortable about the game for a good while. So many things could happen in a blink of an eye! the stimuli is insane.

Another thing about RoR 2's mechanics I've seen being brought up by the community is the Rogue-like implementation. Other Rogue-like video games won't allow you to have too many abilities in a single run, just because they don't want you to be too powerful. Like Hades, Inscryption, and Buckshot Roulette, just to name a few. Risk of Rain 2 is perfectly fine with you stacking up so many insane power ups on top of the external helps (Drones, Turrets, Guardians etc.). RoR 2 allows the player to feel like an absolute monster. How did the game balance this mechanic? The final boss could steal your items and abilities. You get them back by dealing damage at the bastard. Insane video game. The game's battle system oozes so much polish and care behind it. I couldn't help but feel inclined to boot up RoR 2 day after day just to experience it again. Risk of Rain 2 is a very fresh experience in the Rogue-like space. Not necessarily the absolute king of the genre, but a unique exprience nonetheless.

This recent playthrough made me see Risk of Rain 2 in a whole new light. A very complex and nuanced 10/10.I'll keep playing this game over and over again until i defeat that bastard Mithrix...

author: Lowerj
review_text: what have they done, came back to ROR2 recently and the massive changes made have ruined the game.  a lot of items just don't work any more.  Feels bad man...

author: Sepherim
review_text: Inicialmente, Risk of Rain 2 me gustó mucho, pero a medida que fueron pasando las horas rápidamente se fue transformando cada vez más en aburrimiento. Las razones hablaré de ellas ahora, pero quiero que quede claro que lo jugué en solitario, con lo que probablemente las sensaciones y eso para quienes lo jueguen en multiplayer con amigos (como está diseñado) sean mejores. Si resumimos mucho, el juego es un shooter rogue-like, con mogollón de enemigos, cada vez más y más duros, en lo que explorar zonas para conseguir mejoras aleatorias y desbloquear el teleportador previa batalla contra el boss. El problema es que se hace muy repetitivo porque le faltan cosas típicas de los roguelike. Una de esas cosas es que los mapas aquí son fijos (con variaciones menores como zonas pequeñas que pueden estar accesibles o no), con lo cual se acaba conociendo los mismos demasiado, si además tenemos en cuenta que los primeros los ves todo el rato, se acaba haciendo muy repetitivo. Luego le falta una historia así como un sistema de progresión de cualquier clase que otorgue objetivos o razones para jugar, pero en este caso cada intento es completamente independiente. El único cambio que queda de una partida a otra es lo que vas desbloqueando, que se hace en base a conseguir logros, algunos de los cuales ocurrirán simplemente por ir jugando, pero la mayoría acaban dependiendo del azar de que te caigan los bonos adecuados, de que una habilidad ocurra de cierto modo, etc. lo cual acaba siendo muy frustrante. Igual que lo es el hecho de que, llegado cierto punto y con una build decente, al final el juego se resume en "te vas cargando todo sin que te hagan nada hasta que llegas al lugar equivocado y sin que puedas evitarlo, de una hostia te bajan entero". Gráficamente el juego tiene una estética muy suya pero personalmente no me ha gustado nada,  y tiene además ciertos problemas de legibilidad en la distancia (como que los cadáveres de ciertos enemigos parecen cofres). La música ahí ya es cosa de gustos, para mi es demasiado electrónica noventera, que es un género que no me convence, pero ahí habrá a quien si le parezca perfecta y sin duda, no puedo decir que sea mala pese a que no encaje en mis gustos. No hay voces como tales, los efectos de sonido son muy básicos. Y el juego tiene ciertos bugs ocasionales como cosas que spawnean dentro de paredes, una baja IA de enemigos y aliados, **** todo ello, Risk of Rain no me parece un juego terrible, pero tampoco gran cosa. Y acaba repitiéndose como una cena que te sienta pesada. Un 4.

author: Lumiaxelite
review_text: This game takes too long to be developed, too little new features and nothing has really changed for years.

author: Yusufte4353
review_text:
PROUD AMERİCANS!!
Pros: Intense atmosphere - Realistic gunplay - Teamwork is crucialCons: Steep learning curve - Outdated visuals - Not newbie-friendly Rising Storm 2: Vietnam stands out among war games with its emphasis on realism and tactical depth. It’s not the most accessible title, but once mastered, it offers a deeply satisfying and immersive experience. The game captures the chaos of the Vietnam War with great authenticity—from the crack of gunfire to the intensity of large-scale firefights. Teamwork is absolutely crucial, as success depends more on coordination than individual skill. While its dated visuals and steep difficulty may deter newcomers, players who enjoy a strategic and 
realistic FPS will find RS2 Vietnam to be a uniquely rewarding experience.

author: apokalipto
review_text: Very good game. I enjoyed playing this game a lot. I strongly recommend this.

author: ehtaco
review_text:
This game is really fantastic. It's the game Battlefield wants to be.

It's tough and will kick your ass, but it's such a blast to play. It's not perfect. The game never feels "stable," and stuff like ping is constantly all over the place across the board. But it doesn't really detract from the experience too much.  It's really a good time.

There are some aspects that aren't ideal. The community is pretty toxic at times, but it's not something that plagues the entire player base. There are also a lot of classes where you will not be able to play 99% of the time. A lot of the classes can only have a certain amount of people select it at once, and it's based on a mostly first come, first serve basis around how quickly you load into the game. If you don't have the best SSD & setup, prepare to play rifleman and whatnot most of the time. Even then, it's still great fun.

author: Jackie_Jackson
review_text: еСЛИ БЫ ЛЕНИВЫЕ РАЗРАБЫ НЕ ЛЕНИЛИСЬ СО СВОИМИ КРИВЫМИ РУКАМИ И МИЗЕРНЫМИ БЮДЖЕТАМИ ДОПИЛИТЬ ИХРУ ТО ЭТО БЫЛА БЫ ПРОСТО ПУШШКА БРАТ АА

author: Eabdoom
review_text: The most realistic war based, tactical fps ive ever seen. You can die and kill in one shot. Due to its realistic nature, many first timers get killed without even knowing where the enemy is. It does have a steep learning curve. When i first started this game out, i was running everywhere, not being too wary of oncoming fire, because i was used to cod. This is nothing like it. You have to move slowly to not catch a snipers eye. Teamkilling happens often, to everyone. Just apologize

author: Klewer
review_text: Another solid and intense shooter from Tripwire. Has a couple of little weird bugs and frame rate issues but overall if you have enjoyed Red Orchestra and are looking for something with enough difference this is worth a look.

author: warcry1100
review_text:
This is hands down the best FPS game released since Battlefield 2142 (Maybe Battlefield 3 at a push).  A game for the proper Gamer, where a modern Call of Duty approach of 'Spray & Pray' will be met with a swift bullet to the head at 50meters!

If you are considering purchasing and are exacerbated by the ever reducing quality and dumbing down of games (CoD, Battlefield 4, V etc..) then please give this a shot!  The realism is top notch and the mechanics are very balanced.  Yes it is challenging, but it makes it all more the satisfying when you manage to get a kill on the other team!

Those that have been negative about this game I would lump with the idiots that ruin modern mainstream games these days :(

author: Mr_Impulsive
review_text:
Solid all around shooter, very fun to play online in large scale battles.  A great representation of the Vietnam war.  Team work is key, had a blast playing online with friends several hours of fun and frustration.  Great online shooter with a multiplayer campaign mode, large selection of classes, weapons, and tools.

Pretty solid graphics and mechanics, def a must buy fr anyone that like large scale open battles with multiple objectives.

author: xboxlikewater
review_text: Pretty fun shooter to just pop in and play for an hour or so. Fairly cheap, too. Good if you're looking for something slightly more tactical than CoD or just a Vietnam game

author: Muzketin
review_text: The gameplay itself is not that bad... but the developers made very dumb choices regarding the game. For example the cartoonish style of the characters (yet it's supposed to be a game where it feels like real war) , only few maps are actually good and therefore played by the users while the other maps are basically never voted (at the end of the match the players must vote for a map). For some reason, the developers implemented the possibility to chat with the enemy team... without being able to mute users tho, so far too often you will encounter toxic users on the enemy team who spams insults ruining the game experience. Shame as it could have been far better.

author: PasiMetaAho

author: Anaaliapina

author: TobiasReaper
review_text: No single player mode in the f***ot game. I'm glad I didn't pay for this crap.

author: Cthulhu5000
review_text:
This review is based on experience playing RS2:V after EGA giveaway. If you grab game for free this might help you decide is it worth actually downloading.

It's my first realistic MMOFPS, I enjoyed it so much at first, I'd made a little research through guides and game history, and now ready to present my opinion.

IF IT WAS 2017, I'D RATE GAME 8 OR 9 OUT OF 10. BUT THERE ARE TO MANY "BUTS" NOW. As you could've guessed, FOR SHORT VERSION READ ONLY CAPS from now on.

GAME IS BASICALLY ABANDONED BY DEVELOPERS. That's it. It was free giveaway because company no longer interested in the game. Original developer team is long gone and had to be recontacted to do EGS-transfer and troubleshooting.
There is stuff just cut out from the game. It's three maps and M16A2. Game realistically doesn't have over 9000 guns, so it's really important. There are some balancing issues never to be resolved (Long Tan map for example). No event support at all (like Halloween). Graphics are just bad. No bulletholes on surfaces, you can't zero your gun properly while training. No internal guides, just two training areas, one of which being actual map, no ability to train with bots there. There are nasty bugs, I'd seen on 2017 videos and even 2015 CBT footages. Going prone and standing up can result in your legs being under the ground and you will limp excessively. In this condition, moving prone is the fastest way. If your helicopter crashed, you survived and some ally is near by, it mostly results in autokick from server for excessive team damage. There are of course some smaller bugs, but these two are the biggest pain.

CONTENT CREATORS ARE GONE. Basically no channels. Old guides with obsolete information. Placeholders, work-in-proogress, no longer supported everywhere.

PING IS HELL. Don't believe ping value of server in search. Multiply by at least 3, be ready for x4, expect x5. And magically 20 ping becomes 100. Sometimes, when we're losing, I check ping values of players. Losing team has higher values.

TO GET FULL GAME PAY EXTRA ~50$ MONTHLY. There are 2 types of servers. Official and private. Private costs money. You can't just create a room with setting, no-no, pay to third party. Official servers have some of only two game modes: Territory (capture the objective) and Supremacy (capture and hold for points). If you want to play Skirmish (team deathmatch), Campaign (consequent battles with its own rules) or Green Army Man DLC as Free Grunt (Territory and Supremacy) you have two options: go for someone's server hope for the best (ping, rules, community, quantity of players) or buy one for yourself and hope for the same best. Same applies for different settings (called mutators), like visibility of allied troops marks, making game more realistic.

GAMING COMMUNITY ****.
You get new players, that don't want to learn, grab most important classes, and try to play RS2V as generic MMOFPS, aiming for good K/D ratio, that they will never get, and not playing the objective.
On the other hand you have salty people that send anyone to training areas to learn to fly, for example. Well, it's really easy with 0 ms ping and when no one is firing at you.
Again, on some other hand you have kickers. They want your class just because. Or don't like you. Most notorious one changed team and kicked me. Why others agreed? I suppose, they thought "if votekick is going, it's definitely for a reason". So, I ask you, if you'll play, never votekick if you don't know the crime.
Just bad commanders.
Radiomen not sticking to commander and actually picking up this class just because it's a class. They don't even use the smokes.
Macrosusers atop this cake to definitely ruin your day.

author: PedroMetas
review_text:
Rising storm 2 is one of the best, while one of the worst multiplayer games I've ever played!

Combat, gameplay, pace, maps, guns, sound, and Community are awsome.

Servers, Graphics, and animation ****!

Gameplay-
Its just divine, you feel like you are really in the war, and you can't just run for the objective, you need to be careful, cooperate with your teammates.
The shots feel real, and every decision you make will have an impact (good or bad).
The community always tries to help and is respectful.

Now the bad points:

Graphics and animations-
They look kinda bad and outdated, even for a 2017 game, I mean, its unreal engine 3 and there are a lot of visual bugs.

Servers-
Now, this is THE big problem:
The worst servers I've seen in my entire life (including MW)... The game is free right now, and 20k people are playing the game, but it cant handle such amount of people! my question is: if they cant handle 20k players, why is it free? I mean, it is just a dumb move, and no one will want to return to the game, and it will die AGAIN...
I can't find servers and the servers that are not full have 200 ping.
Everyone complaining about how poorly made the game is...
AND THE **** MENU AND SETTINGS LITTRELAY BROKE I CAN'T MAKE SOUND LOWER AND THE BROWSER SISTEM JUST STOPS WORKING SOMETIMES (2000 GAMES PROBLEMS)

3/10 (i hope ALL of this gets better after everyone stops playing)

author: vi15rus
review_text:
Изначально брал в стиме с последующим рефандом т.к. система "на ключевых ролях пусть играют отборные тупицы" мне не зашла. Сейчас получил в эпике нахаляву и не опленился зайти в надежде что чето поменялось. Не поменялось - как была год назад фуфлом так и осталась.
Хотя система отсеивания нубья с ролей прям сама напрашивается - если ты за простого пехотинца покажешь результат - допускаешься к очереди на роль. Но видимо эта простейшая концепция противоречит веселому духу игры для отбросов на главных ролях.

Awful, probably the worst shooter I've ever played.

author: Dragoi
review_text: I've got no problem with unforgiving games, but this game gives you literally nothing. There's a really steep learning curve, and really no reason to do it. The gameplay isn't unique. The maps are boring and straight up poorly designed, and the hitboxes and general controls just feel sloppy. If you like it, you like it, but there are many objectively better shooters out. It's just not fun.

review_text: Post Void succeeds in being one of the most pulse pounding and hectic games I've ever played. Good

author: grihajedy
review_text:
This game - is a true work of art!
Although it is a banal shooting range for speed,
But, the music makes this experience unforgettable and infinitely replayable, I respect the composer, this "inducing" motive, which, after passing the middle of the game, becomes generally mad - it's incredible.
The plot here, most likely, is about a drug addict who is trying not to die and get out of the "binge", and, of course, there is not enough full-fledged story up to 10/10, but you can imagine any story convenient for you in your head, where the main character needs to run until the end and not die. Another flaw of the game for me is not very well-developed shooting, I completed game with a shotgun, it's much easier, but the "aim-challenge" is losted.
Well, I can also say that sometimes quite beautiful locations are generated, all the sounds are of high quality.
And yet, the game is quite easy, in fact, it takes 4-7 hours to complete, even if you don’t know how to shoot (again, shotgun helps you), lacks some kind of hardcore mode, but it would be even better to get the second part)

Subscribe on my Steam Curators page:
****/curator/41977550/
/
Это игра - настоящее произведение искусства!
Хоть и представляет из себя банальный тир на скорость,
Но, музыка делает этот экспериенс незабываемым и бесконечно реиграбельным, композитору моё почтение, вот этот "нагнетающий" мотив, который после прохождения середины игры становится вообще бешенным - это невероятно.
Сюжет тут, скорее всего, про наркомана, который пытается не умереть и выбраться из "запоя", и, полноценной истории до 10/10, конечно, не хватает, но вы можете представлять в голове любую удобную вам историю, где главному герою надо добежать до конца и не умереть. Ещё один недостаток игры для меня в не очень проработанной стрельбе, я проходил только с дробашом, так гораздо легче, но "аим-челлендж" теряется.
Ну а так, ещё могу сказать, что иногда генерируются довольно красивые локации, все звуки качественные.
И ещё, игра достаточно лёгкая, на самом деле, проходится за 4-7 часов, даже если вы не умеете стрелять (опять же, шотган в помощь), не хватает какого-то хардкор режима, а лучше было бы вообще получить вторую часть)

[POST VOID] is a fantastic yet ultimately too short FPS experience.

I would highly recommend [POST VOID] yet it will definitely leave you wanting more.

author: AOtello
review_text: Gritty, raw, and unforgiving. Post Void is a perfect example of art direction and gameplay meeting abrasively (in the best way) to create a unique and whole experience. Better move at a break-neck speed and hit shots with pinpoint accuracy or you'll never reach the end. This was the most fun I've had playing a game in a long time, can't recommend enough.

author: KeroTheWanderer
review_text: Turbo Overkill is an excellent game that doesn't shy away from sending dopamine directly to your brain, I surprised myself playing the game Over and Over again without really thinking about it. The weapon roaster is extremely enjoyable to shoot and gibbing the enemies is music to my ears. Overall it's a more than competent game and Civvie should play Part 2.

author: afazdavayli
review_text:

BAD SIDE

According to 2025

author: gameking
review_text: This game is like low budget doom. I liked it but after a while it gets repetitive and boring.

author: zelaxi
review_text:
Hits hard, with killer gameplay and legit boomer shooter gunplay that reminds me of what the genre is all about. I don't play these games for the story or the visuals - I play them for the fun factor, and Turbo Overkill (for the most part...) excels.
Episode 1: 10/10
Episode 2: 7/10
Episode 3: 3/10
Might just be an example of too much being a bad thing, but by the time I hit ep3 I was kinda over it. Levels are all a bit long and my god these final boss fights are rough, with punishing lack of checkpoints etc. Still I'd say the fights are fun as hell, with all the movement tech the game provides coupled with furious guns blazing. Worth a play. Just be prepared to wonder how long the ride is going to last.

Oh and why the fk is there a sniper in a retro shooter? And why in the fk are there multiple segments dedicated to it?

author: Pickle
review_text: Uff, es un juego increíble.Tiene una historia minimalista, pero llena de personajes y de humor. El combate es extremadamente satisfactorio, tienes una serie de diversas armas para diferentes situaciones y con distintas habilidades que mejoras mientras juegas. También obtienes distintos elementos de tu equipo que te ayuda en la movilidad, así como en el **** diseño de niveles es excelente en su mayoría, hay uno que otro nivel que puede durar un poco más tiempo del que uno quiere y despúes hay otros que intentan diversificar las cosas añadiendo vehiculos y cosas así; algunos de estos ultimos funcionan bien, otros -en mi opinión-, no **** grafícas son bastante particulares, mezclan entre sprites, así como arte en tercera dimensión, eso sin contar lo bueno que es la banda sonora.Además, el juego tiene muchos secretos, modos de juegos extra, distintos trucos que uno puede desbloquear por medio de secretos, así como la habilidad de siempre poder volver a jugar cualquier nivel manteniendo su progreso; tiene un sistema universal de desbloqueo, entonces uno puede jugar el primer nivel con todas las armas y mejoras del ultimo, por ejemplo. Si no te gusta esto, siempre puedes empezar desde cero borrando tu **** general, es un juego de los mejores del género de disparos que han salido en epocas recientes.

author: kwstas2
review_text: I have not finished this game but I just really felt I had to say a few things about it.This is one of the greatest examples of what a small new studio with a brand new IP and a very limited budget can do when time and opportunity is given to people with incredible talent and video game design understanding. I have played so many shooters from huge AAA titles to AA to indies and truly very few can come even close to how this game is managing to capture the old school boomer shooter aesthetic while at the same time looking super modern and have amazing graphics. The combat is just so fast, so satisfying with some of the most spot on sound design and fps mechanics I've ever experienced.

author: Bleachedentity
review_text: It is the most fun I've had in a very long time plain and simple nothing more to it.

author: SB442
review_text: Really fun boomer shooter, where every weapon is fun to shoot, the enemies are varied enough to be interesting and the arena levels are okay. Level design is very poor, sadly, with unclear directions and it' frequently difficult to understand what the game wants from you. The ammo and health distribution is also an issue, there is no reliable way to get these from the enemies, unless they are fodder enemies. So it's not quite Doom Eternal level combat and some opponents fall into the bullet sponge category, but that's a small issue, since the game provides really fun weapons to engage with them.

author: alceb
review_text: Amazing retro style FPS. Hadn't had a fill of adrenaline like this since I finished Doom Eternal. Super recommended game!

author: poland31
review_text: Turbo Overkill AKA Chainsaw Man The Game 10/10.

author: RogerFK
review_text: Haven't had this much fun since ULTRAKILL and DOOM Eternal. The game looks amazing despite it's pixelated models, and the gunplay feels amazingly fun. When people say "Chainsaw Man", the first thing that comes to mind is Turbo Overkill.

author: Zoidsberg
review_text:
Great world-building. Fantastic music. Creative level design. They nailed the feel of bouncing around in games like Quake, and built a genuinely creepy and fun game around it. 

My main complaint is that some weapons are objectively much better than others, so as things get harder you pretty quickly get forced into using the same couple of weapons while ignoring the rest. The games of this genre that I've enjoyed the most have revolved around switching between well-balanced weapons to take advantage of their various strengths, but that aspect just isn't here. 

Still a great game.

author: dl_MARFI_lb
review_text: One of the best boomer shooters of nowadays. Some levels have pretty meh level design, but that's it!

author: Nazrielau05
review_text: After a little over 3 hours on DUSK, with having finished the first episode; I could confirm this game is incredible. The presentation is on point! The sound design, the soundtrack, the colour grading and general art style sells you the game's rural horror lovecraftian-ish **** combat design too are amazing. It took everything that made Quake worked and made it it's own thing! From the non-linear level design as well as the enemy boss fight **** easy 10/10 from me. An amazing addition to my gaming library, and a must-play for any fan of Boomer shooters.

author: Ronthelover
review_text: Good boomer shooter. A little simple gameplay wise but it has a really cool horror flavor

author: JakobBinkley6
review_text:
The atmosphere, gameplay, soundtrack, level design, sound design, visuals, and everything else is top-tier.
I'd argue it's the second best game of all time, right behind Elden Ring.

author: Fluffito
review_text: Having grown up on some of the OG FPS' like Duke Nukem and Unreal, this is a blast to play.

author: Babutto
review_text:
It's a cool game.
Pros.:
- Old-school vibe and aesthetics.
- References to Quake (first one) and Blood.
- Creative levels. Especially in Episode 3.
- Plenty of secrets.

Cons.:
- IDK. Most of the things are cool. Music is fine. Probably, sounds are too primitive sometimes.

author: dedcorrect
review_text: really good retro movment shooter the soundtrack is great

author: filip6666
review_text:
Great boomer shooter. Big variety of weapons, memorable enemies and levels. This is clearly a work of passion and talent, everything pieces together perfectly. If you feel like you might like it from the trailer you will most definitely love it, it's pretty straight forward. 

I had to cut one point because there are parts of the game that didn't click for me. Sometimes I got lost in the level and wasn't sure how to progress, but not for long fortunately. The flipping mechanic is very confusing with the perspective change on the camera. There were also certain spots where the enemies would get stuck, but not too many. 

These are all just nitpicks. This game is absolutely gorgeous.

author: Zski
review_text: This is a game that has to be played to understand why the reviews are so high. I watched videos and thought it looked neat, but it wasn’t really pulling me in. It sat in my library for over a year, and within 5 minutes of experiencing it, I understood. A couple days later, I finished the game, and what a wonderful treat for people who grew up with the original Quake. This game seriously captures the same energy of Quake without making the formula feel in any way dated. The gameplay is very simple, but it’s a nice refreshing throwback to when games required the fast paced run and gun movement rather than relying on cover. Where I think the game really shines is the atmosphere - who would have ever thought that this game with its intentionally retro graphics and play style would have a creepier atmosphere than many modern horror games. The initial part of the game gave me the atmospheric feeling of Resident Evil 4, except better. Some of the later sections of the game are truly unsettling. Between the beautiful yet extremely simple graphics and the phenomenal sound design, it helps tell the story of the game without the game actually having much of an overt story at all. Everything is told through the atmosphere and level design. It was actually pretty fun guessing what was going on and trying to create a story for yourself, since there is hardly any written or spoken dialogue. The sound design in this game is fantastic, a master in its class and it outsides most major modern horror games - especially some of the settings in the later portions of the game. It’s a pretty challenging game, but its highly rewarding. While it got frustrating at times, the satisfaction of pushing through a level and completing it after multiple tries was something I rarely experience in games anymore. The only flaw I would say is regarding some of the level design, which is true to the classic genre, but it didn’t age the best. I found myself lost pretty regularly because a lot of the textures and buildings look the same. Sometimes it allowed for some fun exploration, other times I was just running around for several minutes unable to figure out where I last saw something. There are a few really dark levels that were particularly irritating because of how difficult it was to find your way around. Overall, this is an excellent game that I think fans of the classics and modern shooter fans can both enjoy all the same. Everything this game sets out to do it excels at.

author: The_D4RknesS
review_text: Incredible indie game, it has a high resemblance to DOOM, even the keys, red, yellow and blue are present. I love the originality of this game! author: CrackDiet
review_text:
Overall a very fun, unique and interesting experience. The world of S#*t city is pungent, and fits exceptionally well with its art style (both in game and within the intro cutscene and accompanying art), atmosphere, tone and, best of all, the soundtrack. 
Gameplay is engaging. As you progress and complete challenges within missions, you acquire a new pair of trainers which give you modifiers which range from a second life, explosions when you kick doors, giving enemies big heads, etc. It bodes well for replayability. The game at its core isn’t so challenging, but when going for the challenge stars, it makes the game a lot more difficult. 

The thing I like the most about this game is the artstyle, music, atmosphere and setting, I think it all fits together exceptionally well, and gives a breath of fresh air to the genre. A unique experience, and something that will stay in my mind for a while. Highly recommend if you enjoy underground counterculture, pungent violence, somewhat challenging gameplay, and rave music

author: CthlhuCory
review_text: This game reminds me a lot of the Ghostrunner series where it's definitely a first person shooter/melee game but it's less about just shooting your way through levels and more about being precise. Feels more like a puzzle game to an extent than just a straightforward shooter. Definitely a game where it's all about trial and error and you will absolutely have to play a level multiple times to get your run down perfect. A little frustrating because of this and because it feels like a grind and I constantly feel like even if I am doing well I could get killed going through a new doorway and have to restart the whole level all over again. The music is great and it is kind of a ridiculous concept of the world run by gangs and you being the one guy who's not in a gang. Gameplay is super solid though which is bringing me back into it for sure. The random driving mechanics they threw in to the last two levels of the game totally threw me off and they were not intuitively controlled at all and that dropped the score for me because a solid shooter became a janky Drive Fest in the very last stretch of the game.

author: ArdhazzGamer
review_text: (MY SCORE : 7.9 /10) Fast-Paced Action Game that is exciting and quite challenging! Combat in this game, apart from Shooters using Pistols or Guns with limited ammunition, we can also rely on kicks with Feet which we can wear with Shoes or Sandals, which we can unlock with the number of Stars we get in each Stage. There are 5 areas that must be passed on the **** City Map to complete this game, including: The Violence Gang (15 Stage + Boss), The Pollution Gang (13 Stage + Boss), The Business Gang (15 Stage + Boss), The Debauchery Gang (13 Stages + Boss), Crime Tower (4 Stages + Boss). LIST OF BOSS I Faced: Goocopkopter / Goocopbomber / 1997 Lucida. The Sludge Baron / The Unflushable / The Filth Mind. The Ceo / Mega Ceo / Mecha Ceo. Pizza Pig / Unholy Corpulence / Spider Pig. The Crime Minister. There are 2 endings in this game, namely Bad and True Ending. Bad Ending if we choose to accept The Crime Minister's offer to join and enjoy Nice City by kicking Premium Sneakers into the fire. Or choose Premium Sneakers and kick The Crime Minister! (True Ending).

author: abarosant
review_text:
Like the first Hotline Miami, but 3D. 

Better movement, gameplay and control that most of the Doom/Quake-like out there. 
The music its great, like in Hotline, without the music this game wouldn`t be half of what it is.
Good art style, coherent with its setting and story. 
Can replay the levels multiples times to get all stars and not feel discouraged in failure. However, once completed in full, there`s nothing that makes you try again. What`s the problem about this? The game is short already, and the full levels don`t add much time of play to the pool.

The game is short. I want more, and I wish they have added a map editor.

I'm gonna begin with a question.
Do you like Doom or Doom Eternal ?
Yes ? Then stop reading and buy that game  i m m e d i a t e l y.
Ultrakill is an awesome game that will ask all of your focus to be fun, you will need to not be interrupted to get the best experience. I won't spoil the game here, however, after playing it and playing another game, even Doom, you feel what i call the "Ultrakill syndrome". What's the Ultrakill syndrome ? Well it makes you feel like you're slow as hell everywhere, in every games. Because Ultrakill is the fastest game I've ever played, while Doom Eternal can be considered as a Fast FPS, Ultrakill is an Ultrafast FPS.

author: ByteMyPixels
review_text:
I am rating this 0 out of 10... just so you know exactly what Ultrakill is. This is the 1st game in which I can the epilepsy warning should be taken seriously.

It is the best ADHD Simulation of all time! And a passion project made on a shoe string budget, with a combat system that is so artisanally tuned that you can compare this to a Rolex.  The devs are meme lords, and the publisher loves puppies. The game know what its best parts are and leans in it, and the parts that are bad, it openly mocks.  The game is 99% amazing.

The 1% ruins it.

What is that 1%... its not finished... and playing it on the hardest difficulty will leave you physically tired.

un juego simple con una mecánica innovadora y una historia también simple pero que te **** hubiera gustado que agregaran mas mecánicas o mas cosas en general pero este juego no necesita ser tan grande, de hecho su simpleza es lo que lo hace brillar aparte de que puedes jugar el sh:mcd y el vr, el juego base en si no es que lo jugaría por horas (para eso prefiero severed steel) en realidad lo que me gusta de superhot es su historia mas que el gameplay en si, además de que algunos niveles se me hacian un poco injustos poniendo muchos enemigos que te disparan por todos lados al mismo tiempo y te dejan sin muchas opciones, además de que no puedes mirar a tu alrededor ya que esto supondría que el tiempo avance y por ende mueras, sin embargo es muy satisfactorio cuando completas el nivel y lo ves todo en velocidad normal.

review_text: Maneirinho pra passar o tempo. Não tive vontade de zerar agora, mas antes de deixar pra depois, tudo que vi até aqui me agradou bastante. A gameplay é o grande UAU do jogo. O lance de tudo ficar em câmera lenta e só se mover quando você se move dá um tempero a mais nos desafios, que vão aumentando e te mantendo instigado, às vezes até parecendo injusto. Acho massa como o jogo brinca com a ideia de computador e sistema, trazendo uma imersão diferenciada, principalmente nas partes em que ele realmente executa ações no seu PC, tipo avisar que vai fechar e de fato fechar. Curti demais, espero finalizar em breve. 0 Likes 0Open review

author: Frozya
review_text: Superhot — это необычный шутер, который выделяется своим уникальным игровым процессом. Идея того, что время движется только тогда, когда двигаешься ты, заставляет продумывать каждый шаг и делает игру похожей на своеобразную стратегию в реальном времени. Атмосфера минимализма и яркий визуальный стиль тоже играют свою роль: красные враги на фоне белого окружения смотрятся стильно и придают всему происходящему особый шарм.Но, несмотря на оригинальность, есть моменты, которые могут надоесть. Кампания довольно короткая, а после прохождения основного сюжета остается не так много причин возвращаться. Кроме того, сама концепция замедления времени интересна, но в какой-то момент она перестает быть чем-то необычным и превращается в рутину.В итоге Superhot — это отличная игра для пары вечеров, но ее идеи не раскрываются в полной мере. Если вам интересен необычный взгляд на жанр шутеров, то она стоит внимания, но не ждите слишком глубокого опыта. 7 из 10.

author: BongoLongo
review_text: I can't believe I wasted my time on this. Superhot is a total letdown. The "time moves when you move" mechanic gets old so fast, and the gameplay becomes a repetitive slog. The story is non-existent, the graphics are painfully dull, and there’s nothing here to keep you engaged for more than an hour. This game is overrated, and I can’t understand why anyone would recommend it. If you’re thinking about buying it, save yourself the frustration and look elsewhere. 2/10.

author: PlatonicAnger
review_text: First off, let me just say that this game is a ******* nightmare. The whole concept of time only moving when you do sounds intriguing on paper, but in execution, it's just a headache-inducing mess. Trying to strategize and plan your moves while everything is frozen in place is enough to make anyone want to pull their hair out. And don't even get me started on those damn red men. They pop up out of nowhere, relentless in their pursuit to take you down. It felt like no matter what I did, they were always one step ahead, ready to dish out another frustrating defeat. In conclusion, "superhot" is a frustrating, infuriating mess **** that I would not recommend to my worst enemy. Save yourself the headache and the rage-inducing moments, and spend your time playing something actually enjoyable. Trust me, you'll thank me later.

author: Highwayy
review_text: Legends of Runeterra is a brilliantly designed online trading card game. Most importantly, LoR innovates game mechanics with a back-and-forth format that objectively make this game more tactical (but maybe less beginner-friendly) than its peers (like Hearthstone). With most actions that a player takes, the opponent has an option to respond, which often results in chains of actions with sometimes incredible comebacks/upsets. The artwork and animations are stellar, and the universe the game takes place in is advantaged by a rich legacy lore due to the producer's other products like League of Legends and Arcane. The game offers an incredible and near-endless PvE experience in addition to PvP: in fact, PvP has sadly taken a back-seat in the last couple years but is by no means dead as matches only take minutes to find. The future is difficult to predict and I hope that PvP will grow more as my heart will always be in PvP gameplay. Perhaps the most admirable quality of this game is its refusal to be "pay-to-win" as free cards and resources are given generously and consistently so that any player looking to play competitively can do so free of financial cost if they desire, at least for PvP. And that is something Hearthstone cannot boast.

author: CaptCrunch
review_text: A big problem I had was the card picking. Depending on your starting hand, and how you play it, will the computer "choose" the cards you pick up in your deck, I find in most cases. So at that point, it's only strategic for like, the first 25% of the round, and the next 5 - 7 mins is just the computer stalling to make the game longer, REGARDLESS of whether you are winning or losing. I felt this isn't an ACTUAL card game because you don't get your cards by chance, but the cards you pick up are heavily influenced by the (winning/losing) stance you are in (Losing = **** cards each round, winning = Stronger cards each round), The probability of getting certain cards is sealed depending on whether you are winning or losing, unlike REAL card games, the chance of getting any card is always 1 / Total number of cards.

author: Noiza
review_text:
The game is something between Meh and OK.
F2P friendly, nice Graphics/Artwork and regual new content makes it fun for a game now and then.

The biggest let down for me are Bugs, Metaplay and communication.
Bugs appear on a dayli base and range from grafics glitches into others to cards wont work or you cant place them (even though i encountered gamebreaking bugs very rarely).
Bugs stay in the game for very long until they get fixed e.g. Shurima came out 8 Months ago and Azirs voice lane is still cut during the lvl up animation.

Communication means, i have the feeling they only hear positiv feedback and ignore negativ feedback/player suggestions, one reason i post my critic here.
Imo the Report Side is not comfortable (i was not able to use it for a long time) and i dont like the big chatroom on discord, i feel ignored.

There are a lot builds you can play but only for the Memes, not for winning. In ranked, you can see only flavor of the month, the Metagame is very strong in this one.
Off-Meta builds are really not fun to play and the few Meta Builds change on every patch.
Power Creep is a huge problem in LoR, every patch, the new Cards are way more powerfull then the "older ones", either by having way better Stats/cost ratio or have the same stats but really good keywords.
The game makes no secret that it has its focus on fast games, thats why rush decks are Meta and lategame or control decks feel useless. E.g. Seamonsters needs you to throw 25 of your 40 cards away ,literally(!), to have theyr keyword work.
The only reason i do sometimes recommend it to some die hard League fans is its because its F2P.

EDIT: New expansion is out, tonns of skinns, new power creep no balancing.

author: YusufBolluk
review_text: Hikayesiyle, oynanışıyla, sanat tasarımıyla, şarkılarıyla, ses tasarımıyla çok güzel tam paket bir oyun. Oynanış JRPG tarzına parry ekleyerek çok güzel bir tat katıyor. JRPG kısmının derinliği aşırı değil ama gayet yeterli ve oyun boyunca sizi tutabiliyor. Parry sistemi de JRPG'lerin kaçınılmaz olarak düştüğü tekrardan kurtarıyor. Normalde JRPG'lerde bir yerden sonra ekrana bile bakmadan oynarsınız. İsterse Persona olsun ister Sea of Stars olsun, en iyisi bile bir yerden sonra eksik kalır. Ancak bu oyun o sınıra çarpsa da parry sistemi sürekli odaklı kalmanızı sağlıyor. Oynanış kısmında tek sıkıntı diyebileceğim kısım level scaling olmaması. Yan görevlere falan giderseniz çok güçleniyorsunuz ve ana hikayede her şeye tek atar hale geliyorsunuz. Yan içeriklerde gücünüze uygun düşmanlar var ancak ana hikaye seviyenizin çok gerisinde kalıyor. Oynayacaksanız önce ana hikayeyi bitirip sonra yan görevlere gitmeyi düşünebilirsiniz. Hikayesi çok güzel, hiç spoiler vermeyeyim ilk kez oynarken deneyimleyin. Sadece şunu söyleyeyim hikaye olay örgüsü olarak bence süper değil ancak karakterler asıl lezzeti veren şey. Sanat tasarımı, ses tasarımı zaten harika. Oyuna başladığınız andan itibaren sizde fark edersiniz. Çok güzel oyun, oynayın oynattırın. Ancak sıra tabanlı hiç çekemem ben diyorsanız tavsiye etmem.

author: BonoDedo
review_text: Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 is a stunning masterpiece. Its painterly aesthetic feels alive, with animations that flow like brushstrokes in motion. The voice acting is exceptional, giving every moment emotional weight. But the real highlight is the innovative combat system—fluid, strategic, and refreshingly original. A rare blend of beauty and brilliance.

author: GustavoLaciola
review_text: This is one of the greatest game of the last 15 years. Made with love and passion, a real team with real ideas that sets a new standard for the genre. the music is incredible, the arts are amazing and the narrative is movie-worthy. and for 50 euros? Makes you think about the 80 euros black ops 7 wants. Just play it, this is one of those rare 10/10 games

author: expeditioner00
review_text:
It's the best game i played in all my life (i'm over 30). The story is not only deep and touching but also twisted and unforeseeable (at least some elements).

The soundtrack is 11/10. I can not believe the composer was found on some obscure french forum by the CEO of sandfall. It's extremely impressively composed. In fact, i listen to it outside of the game for quite some time.

Graphics and animations are also very nice. Unfortunately, no native FSR4 support - but nothing OptiScaler can't fix.

I feel very lucky to be privileged to be able to be playing this game (currently 80+ hours in). It's a one-of-a-lifetime thing i think. Easily gamef the decade. I didn't even know i like JRPG turn-based, but this game opens your eyes and ruins every other game for you.

author: duc1912
review_text:
This game reminded me of the magical feeling when I first play Final Fantasy. It offers an experience you will only get once every 5 years or so. 
The art design breathe life into the world; everything looks amazing and stylish. 
The music fits perfectly with the scene and elevated the experience to a whole new level. Even listening by themselves, they are phenomenal track.
The story has the best hook in all of gaming and lots of unexpected twist and turn along the way. The story deals with serious theme but knowing when to add funny moment, there's never a tonal inconsistency throughout the gameplay. 
The addition of dodge and parry to the game, a simple addition, but combining with terrific boss animation, makes the combat experience very engaging and enjoyable.
Overall, a game you must experience in your lifetime.

author: Tarquin
review_text:
Bought this game with the expectations of getting the masterpiece, the best game ever made, the true ultimate legend ****. Instead I got huuuge disappointment and wasted dozens of euros. I got a game with falsely described genre, a game with shallow characters, a game which is now a new king of running simulators, as there is literally nothing else to do, you just run, and then you fight, and then run again, and fight, and run, and fight, .... I was told it was great turn-based game with real-time mechanics, instead I got QTE game, but with control over up to 3 characters (so I did QTE in turns for them). Combat is also extremely unbalanced, as literally just parrying can win every single fight in this game, while missing a dodge or parry in later stages of the game means instant fail, team death and reset from last save. This is tied to abilities and perk-buy management. There are multiple distinct abilities (at least the text is different), however because of the lack of game balance I mentioned previously, it actually does not matter what abilities does player pick, as dodging or parrying perfectly is the only singular requirement to win every single fight in the entire game without any exceptions. Adding to that, this results in excesive repetitivness of gameplay. Next up, I was expecting bit of a roleplaying (that is this "RP" in RPG), but I got no dialogues at all while playing the game (except for the camp, there I was able to read few lines of dialogues, and except for cutscenes, obviously). Many praised this game for story, but somehow I got another cheap premise with rushed second half of the story. The idea was good though, just the execution was simply bad. Nonchalant "cute" cutscenes did not fit the narrative and were breaking the "immersion" for me, although immersion is veeeery strong word to use here, as this game does not deliver immersion of any kind. The same goes for OST, which was quite good, however some anime-like combat bangers absolutely did not fit the atmosphere at all. Last but not least I will mention the visuals, which are as good as in any UE5 game, so nothing special there, but nothing to complain about either, except for two things - 1) developers tried to make every environment special, unique and distinct, but the result is quite the opposite as all the locations feel simmilar in every way except for colours used in them; and 2) glitches were EVERYWHERE.

In conclusion, the hype around this game is as artificial as it gets, driven by "30 devs" story, which is also not true. This game has nothing much to offer for people with some standards. If you like empty corridors, endless running and QTE, this is a game for you. Objectively, if this was not advertised as "game of the generation" I would give this game like 4/10, however, I expected 100x more from advertised "masterpiece" and ended up deeply disappinted, like I probably never was before.

author: puchinho
review_text: Obra maestra. No hay adjetivos para describir este juego, es perfecto. Todo el mundo debería probarlo.

author: underblue
review_text: This was my first time playing a game with turn-based combat, and I was completely hooked. The amount of freedom is incredible—whatever you can imagine, you can actually do. Between the massive variety of dialogue choices and the fact that every NPC is killable, the possibilities feel endless. This game is a must-play. It is easily one of the top 3 RPGs, if not the best, I've ever played.

author: ohHaiThere
review_text: To be frank I didn't enjoy it as much as other people did. Yes, it's very fun and deep game, yet it's just RPG that we had back in 2000. All critical acclaim comes from the fact that we don't have such games anymore.

author: Richemont75
review_text: A ce jour, la meilleur adaptation de D&D en jeu vidéo. Une campagne à l'écriture impeccable, des personnages attachants et des graphismes superbes. Le jeu mérite son titre de GOTY 2023, même si il n'est pas sans quelques **** défauts. Le rythme est assez lent, rien ne se fait rapidement. La musique est parfaite et s'écoute avec plaisir, mais la caméra devient parfois horrible à gérer. La difficulté est bien équilibrée, mais certains affrontements sont un véritable cauchemar en terme de stratégie... Pour ce qui est de l'équipement et des objets magiques, c'est un vrai capharnaüm. Pour le reste... Ce jeu est d'un richesse incroyable !

author: praiseTheSun33
review_text: i was pretty scared to play this since it was not my type of game. but man… what a PEAK game. the amount of freedom this game gives you, i dont think theres another one near in terms of freedom. definitely top 3 games of decade with expedition 33 and elden ring

author: Wartrek91
review_text: Baldur’s Gate 3 gilt für viele als das beste Rollenspiel der letzten Jahrzehnte – und das völlig **** Spiel verbindet unglaubliche Charaktertiefe, intensive Entscheidungen, perfekte Atmosphäre, fantastisches Writing und ein taktisch brillantes Kampfsystem zu einem einzigartigen Erlebnis, das man sonst nirgendwo bekommt.Jede Entscheidung hat echte Konsequenzen, jede Figur wirkt lebendig, und die Welt reagiert glaubwürdig auf das Handeln des Spielers. Die Freiheit, Situationen kreativ zu lösen – sei es diplomatisch, chaotisch, brutal, schlau oder komplett verrückt – macht jeden Durchlauf anders und **** seiner epischen Story, den emotionalen Momenten, großartigen Begleitern und dem riesigen Umfang setzt Baldur’s Gate 3 neue Maßstäbe für RPGs.Fazit: Ein Meisterwerk, das mehr bietet als die meisten Spiele in fünf Jahren zusammen. Für viele das beste Rollenspiel aller Zeiten.

author: Diabhal
review_text: PEAK PEAK PEAK PEAK PEAK PEAK PEAK PEAK PEAK PEAK PEAK PEAK PEAK PEAK PEAK PEAK PEAK PEAK PEAK PEAK PEAK PEAK

author: IvanLevin14
review_text: Thank you, thank you for this game. I’m waiting for something new by Larian. I’ve recently finished this game with my friend and we got a good experience

author: GiveMeCoff3e
review_text: Vous arrivez dans un temple ou a lieu une cérémonie précédant un enterrement. Différents choix de dialogues s'ouvrent à vous :- Mes condoléances. Qui était ce ?- Magnifique prestation des choristes, ce sont les funérailles les plus réussies auxquelles j'ai pu assister !- Joli cadavre ! qu'est ce qu'on fête ?...Enfin un vrai RPG avec des véritables options de dialogues et des vrais conséquences sur le long terme. Votre personnage de base, votre race, votre historique, et les relations que vous avez noués avec les autres personnages de l'aventure, tout ça influe sur les options de dialogues et c'est super ! Les personnages sont bien écrits et attachants, on a l'embarras du choix pour se construire son équipe, quand on a pas 3 amis avec qui jouer. Il faudrait faire le jeu au moins deux fois pour en profiter, notamment pour pouvoir être un véritable méchant une fois dans sa vie, être violent sans raison et dominer le monde ! J'ai eu beaucoup de mal avec les combats au tour par tour, encore plus façon DnD. Un enfer au début mais on s'y fait et ça devient un plaisir d'en maîtriser les subtilités à la fin. Et putain les missclicks à 3 mm du perso et tu tapes dans le vide et tu perds ton tour, ou bien tu sautes dans un gouffre sans fond quel enfer.N'allez pas vous spoilez sur internet, vous le regretterez. Et abusez du F5 (sauvegarde rapide). Il y a quelques rares sauvegardes automatiques, et après chaque campement mais ca reste rare. Et franchement juste le F5 pour tester les options de dialogues ca vaut le coup .

review_text: I can see why Hades is so popular. I just can’t seem to get into the game. There is too much chaos and button mashing for my liking. It just feels to chaotic.

author: Fab75000
review_text: Hades 2 is a very disappointing for such a highly anticipated sequel. The gameplay is still solid, but it feels too much familiar. The story moves too slowly, and the new features don’t really change much. Some bosses feel frustrating rather than challenging. Too bad,  the first game set the bar so high.

author: AhtiMcCloud
review_text: Hades II looks great at first glance, but once you dive in, the cracks show. The combat is messy, progression feels sluggish, and the magic of the first game just isn’t there. It’s not terrible, but it’s nowhere near the masterpiece its predecessor was.

author: Ahti
review_text: I loved the first Hades, but the sequel feels like a step back. The pacing is slow, fights are unbalanced and drag on with spongey enemies, and the new characters lack the charm of the original cast. Technically it’s rough too, with performance drops and clunky controls. Instead of fresh ideas, it often feels like recycled content packaged as a new game.

author: sadboiinfinite
review_text: Got it gifted to me after watching two of my friends froth out the mouth over it and uhhhhh it's fine. Sure, the graphics are really polished and the high speed gameplay is really engaging, but the music and voice lines are legitimately so annoying to me that I've just been playing with most of the audio muted. Not to mention, some of the enemies themselves often end up turning the combat into feeling more akin to something like Contra with the infuriating amount of bullets and attacks being thrown at you. Most of the actual gameplay itself is fine, but there's definitely more I dislike than enjoy.

author: Predpreimec
review_text: this game is one of the worst roguelikes in terms of gameplay. It's literally Click-Click Dash. You just click on enemies from afar, and the game takes the worst aspects of combat in isometric games - the enemies are dumb, there are a lot of them, and they're so fat that you have to click on them for about 30 seconds. The gameplay is terrible, there's no depth, and there's nowhere to explore. The build system is the same - there's no variety or depth to the build - you choose one thing and focus on that for the entire run, because if you try to focus on multiple things, you won't have enough damage. It hurts me to see that many people consider this game to be one of the best roguelikes. It's not a bad game, but it's a shame for the genre as a roguelike. It's a roguelike for those who have never played a roguelike before.

author: Macaroney
review_text: This game is the most fun I have ever played. From the start with food and water being my biggest  challenge to late game when I’m pretty much a super soldier, I just cant get enough. With every block in the game able to be destroyed to build mechanics that afford you unlimited creativity. You can do anything you want. Plus with the base game you have options to add mods to include overhaul mods. You literally can play this game for a lifetime. Checkout Glock9 on YouTube and see the fun!

author: retroisback96
review_text: It was a better release than some early access games but a little disappointed to see a big V1.1 update coming out so soon after release, the update does contain some critical stuff so unfortunately it does feel like this game was out earlier than it was ready to, but unlike some other early access titles that come out of development this one was fun and pretty much bug free day one.

review_text: Класная игра что бы поугарать с друзьями Рекомендую

author: GarbageGal
review_text: This game is one of my favorites, and I have a collective time playing it of over 700 hours and still climbing. At first glance, it seems generic, even bad to some. Its graphics are still a bit rough, but even they are still improving with each update. It has an addicting gameplay loop and has a wonderful community backing it. It's a fun first person zombie survival game with base building and even some level of tower defense. It has a learning curve, but it's worth putting in the effort to get past it.
