author: KyleHog
review_text: This game has been in development for more then 10 years and for the last several years those old, delusional devs made 7 Days To Die just worse. They didn't add any real new content, but just messed existing content, changing things and existing mechanics for no reason whatsoever. They also hate their player base with passion. The game is technical mess, graphics are bad, survival elements are mostly removed, and bright colored magic zombies killed all immersion.

author: SpecialFriend
review_text: The grindathon forever nature of the last few years of updates have really soured this game for me. Can't scavenge water anymore. You basically have to do those radiant quests to get anything in this game, otherwise the loot tables are set so low. If i wanted to do radiant quests unending, i'd buy a subscription to Fallout 76 Plus.

author: MzK
review_text: Tam sürüme çıkınca oynadım ve fak ettim ki bu oyun en az 10 yıl önce çıkmalıymış. Şuan ölü doğmuş bir yapım bence.

author: Wave1982
review_text: It sure have an overall suite of working game mechanics, so you can consider this game as "playable". However these gameplay elements are not fully fleshed out and instead of polishing those systems, the devs want to rebuild each system over and over. Some updates may be better than others however they forcefully remove genuinely liked parts and replace them with untested systems. They now have a roadmap to Version 1.0 but we have to wait for the changes up untill then.

author: Kheiku
review_text:
Eu particularmente estou viciado no título, porém não posso esconder os diversos problemas que ele apresenta.

Acho um jogo que tem uma boa proposta de sobrevivência em um apocalipse zumbi, entregando um mundo aberto extenso, com diversos recursos e possibilidades para se explorar.
Mecânicas interessantes que fazem muita coerência e realismo para o game.
O multijogador funciona bem, joguei sem ter problemas. Sistema de paty, pvp e distribuição de recursos funcionais. Torna o jogo muito mais divertido.

O jogo não tem uma história para explicar aquele mundo, existem muitos bugs que podem atrapalhar a experiência do jogador, o jogo é mal otimizado, pouca variedade de designer dos zumbis comuns, os gráficos deixam a desejar em vários aspectos, uma interface pouca intuitiva para o jogador e comandos que o jogador não consegue modificar.
Sound effects bem duvidosos e mal distribuídos em muitos momentos.

Eu sou apaixonado pelo game, mas eu entendo os seus defeitos e fiz uma análise que acredito ser coerente e sincera.

author: Wavew
review_text:
Por la razón que sea, esta mierda de pagina es incapaz de publicar las reseñas cuando le das al botón de enviar.

Y como no pienso repetir una reseña de 15 líneas lo pondré fácil: Este juego es una basura absoluta, pero no tan basura como metacritic.

author: ivanvladisov
review_text: 7 Days to Die suffers from significant optimization issues, making it challenging to run smoothly on anything below a mid-range GPU, typically priced around $500. This necessitates setting graphics to low for acceptable performance. The gameplay experience is marred by a cumbersome and perplexing interface. Base construction, for instance, can be particularly frustrating; any mistakes require players to manually dismantle structures, a time-consuming process that hampers creativity and expansion efforts. Additionally, the zombies exhibit an uncanny ability to detect the player from great distances, which can become exceedingly bothersome. In comparison, other survival games like "Project Zomboid" and "Valheim" offer a more polished and enjoyable experience. Unless you relish frustration, it might be best to look elsewhere for your survival game fix.

author: KepasaAmigo
review_text: This game is just bad. they never finnished this game i think. even with friend its just bad. spend like 2h in and went out never go back. 2/10

author: Onelight
review_text:
Good things
-a magnificent literary expression
-impressive music
-good characters
-very good psychological dialogues
-a ton of political and philosophical information
Bad things
-LGBT propaganda
-unimpressive endings
-very bad story
-a story and characters that contain a lot of nonsense and illogicality
-an overly utopian universe that will make one bored
-elections don't actually have much impact

author: Merisandus
review_text: This game goes beyond merely crafting an engaging story—it breathes life into its character. Rather than simply stating that someone is struggling with inner conflict, it takes the bold step of showing you exactly what’s happening inside his mind.

author: Twinkyeater2000
review_text: Disco Elysium is a masterpiece of video games. And a strong contender for one of the best RPGs ever made. It’s one of the few games that manages to make political commentary that is compelling, funny, and digestible to anyone reading it regardless of affiliation. All the while supplementing it with hilarious slapstick comedy and humor, as well as a thrilling whodunit murder plot. Not one aspect of this game can be criticized, becides maybe one instance where you can miss some of the best end game content due to a failed dice roll

author: egeiscimen
review_text: Revolutionizes narrative RPGs with unmatched writing and reactive storytelling. A cerebral experience like no other.

author: razzzor
review_text:
Are all the critics on a rush of putting anything intellectual and different as game of the year? I just got done playing Journey (late on the PC) and was just as puzzled as to how that was game of the year.This is standard point-and-click adventure gaming, absolutely nothing ground-breaking apart from just good writing. If you like that sort of thing and love reading books of that style, you'll enjoy it I suppose.

The only difference is it's much longer than your standard adventure game, more depth in the skills and the dialogue just goes on and on. Half a million lines they say? Do I really want to read all that? Much of it is just pointless dribble. You have all these inside voices that speak, but it's not really that interesting. The most interesting dialogue in the whole game was the humour from the two kids near the start and the ringing the police station.

The art/design is all beautiful. But it's still stuck in an overhead isometric camera view. For sure if they had a AAA budget they would do a third-person mouse look, that's far more immersive. Can you imagine watching a movie, or even a 20 hour TV series, where its just this one view above their heads? It would be laughed at. But somehow, 40 years since the start of the isometric point and click, we're still stuck on this low budget camera angle. You never see the characters faces. Even in the small picture frame you get of the characters, which often barely resemble the model on-screen, it's just a static picture. The main character never even has a voice, and your sidekick is deadpan in everything he says. This is lacking in any expression or emotion. When you only have the budget to do a single isometic angle, this simply can't be a 9+/10. You'll also have to fight through sluggish movement, constantly bumping into invisible walls absolutely everywhere trying to work out the small path to walk. I even had a few game ending bugs that I had to reload from.

The overall gameplay revolves around slowly walking back and forth for hours clicking things until something happens in the game, because it's often unclear what you're supposed to do so you just have to click everything, exhaust every dialogue tree, until one of the many missions you have resolves something so you can continue. You'll get a dialogue dead-end where you don't have the skills or research necessary to continue, so you do random tasks to unlock it, or reload the game over and over until you pass the check my chance. I also didn't load a lot into the skills because it's so unclear what's really going to help, as well as how many skill points you have. So I just left it until the end game to when I thought I would need them, but I still didn't. I'd probably only used 5 skills points throughout the game.

The skill sets and requiring certain skills, items and tasks to be completed to unlock dialogue is still a nice idea overall and I'm not sure how you could tweak it to make it better. But a 9/10, nope.

What was good about most of the game was the story, which had me continuing to play it to see how in unravelled. But in the end, without spoilers, the conclusion really had absolutely nothing to do with anything up till that point and just felt like the writer didn't have any idea how to finish it so just threw something in there to wrap things up. A major disappointment.

This is a nice simple point and click adventure, but it goes on for far too long. Over 20 hours I spent on it and was ready for it to be over before then. The highlights for me are just seeing a nice new area of the map. It's not the mountains of dialogue, the story that was never properly concluded, or the very basic puzzle solving. But I can see much better looking design in a full 3D game and countless adventure games already look this beautiful.

I'd give it a 7/10. I think the critics have just forgotten what normal adventure games are like and got all hung  up on intellectual dialogue and skill trees.

author: nanukfather

author: southernboy
review_text: As good as gaming gets. Strange, beautiful, engaging and painful. Does an amazing job of bringing you into its world.

author: iamrutra
review_text: Disco Elysium is more than a game Disco Elysium is a unique detective game where you live the life of an amnesiac alcoholic, investigate a murder and make moral choices that determine everything. The game is like a book, where every day is a new chapter, and the characters come to life thanks to their vivid characters and unforgettable dialogues. The world is filled with details: from key items and weapons to the little things that affect the development of the plot. You are given complete freedom to be whoever you want to be, make decisions and build your character. This game is suitable for those who want to feel the atmosphere of a real detective, dive into a deep story and feel responsibility for every choice.

author: Alvene
review_text: Un chef-d'oeuvre savamment écrit et un RPG culte pour les années à venir ! Un système intuitif et des personnages attachant. Un banger.

author: DeusXCom
review_text: Hardcore, hardcore to the mega! This is the closest we got to Planescape: Torment in decades. Fantastic world building, story, art and music. It’s a click & read type game, no fluid gameplay and even years after release, there are still many technical glitches, so it’s definitely not for everyone, but if you give it a shot it will reward you with extremely unique experience and atmosphere that you won’t forget. 9/10

review_text: "The mask of humanity fall from capital. It has to take it off to kill everyone -- everything you love; all the hope and tenderness in the word. It has to take it off, just for one second. To do the deed.

author: MetaCriticallol
review_text:
This is not a game. It's a text simulator filled with pseudo intellectual trash that doesn't make sense. It reads like a college freshman in a sociology class' essay. I suppose if you are into that you can play this and feel "smart".

Seriously. You click around and read text that's poorly written. That's it.

author: OHMYHEAD
review_text: First of all, it's not an rpg. Second, it's not a good game as a quest either. There are no interesting characters or plot. Literally none of the choices are thought-provoking. The only good thing about this game is its interesting original visual style. But even it's basically just a recolor from a bunch of other similar quests

author: FanOfRPGs
review_text: Oh I love RPGs with a lot of text! - I thought and sat down to play this game. WHAT A DISAPPOINTMENT. Lots of text, zero meaning. Brain gum for pseudo-intellectuals. Moreover, this is not an RPG. This is one long drawn out quest. Like one from Skyrim where you have to track down a maniac in Windhelm, you know =) And there is absolutely no RPG component here. You can't create a character. And even the characteristics don’t affect anything (otherwise why are the “stupid” character’s lines NOT different from the other 2 branches? You can’t choose normal options in dialogues, because they simply don’t exist, and those that exist don’t affect anything (try not to wake up in the first dialogue, for example). But there will be a bunch of texts about what to do with material things. WHAT IS THIS, A TEXT SIMS??? The characters are worthless, there is literally no empathy for anyone, because they are just only cardboards - decorations for the riots and tomfoolery of the main character. By the way, the humor here is also bad. The level of marginal drunks. The setting is certainly unusual, but damn, even in The Wolf Among Us there are more plot RPG elements. The only thing I can praise Disco for is that it’s interesting an original avant-garde visual. This is where its merits end

author: PenetratorGod
review_text:
I played the game and it was definitely one of the worst and boring games I've ever seen and I deleted it. It's not a game, it's more like an e-book.

First of all, this is not an open world game. I have no idea how it can be marketed like this, have the makers ever seen an open world game? The NPCs do nothing but sleep at night and the world is a small and frankly empty map. It's static and dead and never changes. It's not even a world, let alone an open world.

It's not a real RPG either. Yes, you have stats and inventory and dice rolls, but that's it. Also, these are just game mechanics, there's a skill tree and inventory like in a lot of games, but they don't make a game an RPG game, and there's no real choice, because the whole difference is tied to dialog options, which you'll click on anyway, further destroying the role-playing part, and for a lot of things, choosing to do something will actually be a dice roll, and the mechanics of retrying the roll are overly complicated and too overwhelming to take the time.

No matter what you do, you'll be dragged towards a single ending, which makes sense since it's a murder mystery, but as a player you have no choice, the only real choice is at the character creation screen, and from that point on it's pretty much set how you're going to play the next 30-40 hours of the game, which is filled with dialog just to drag it out.

Yes, you can click on options in dialog windows, but the game will decide for you whether that happens or not, and it will mostly depend on your character's stats and some modifiers. Yes, again, it's an RPG mechanic, but as a player, you don't really get to choose anything or do anything.

An example **** where your choices really matter would be Detroit Become Human. Or even Witcher 3. Disco Elysium is nowhere near that level, Detroit is already not an RPG game, Witcher 3 is not a pure RPG, but supposedly Disco Elysium was marketed as open world and a pure RPG, but it's not even half as successful as those games.

In short, Disco Elysium is not a game to be played even if it's free. I never understood what they liked about this game. It is one of the most overrated games of recent years.

author: Boatakp
review_text: The game is incredibly fun, well worth the price, and offers some surprising gameplay toward the end. It’s definitely worth completing to experience the True Ending

author: Kai82
review_text: One on hand an incredibly good old school turn based RPG and on the other they use a lot of design choices I dislike. It is inspired by old RPGs like Chrono Trigger / Chrono Cross. You can play as Valere or Zale who are Solstice Warriors. If you are born on summer or winter solstice you are special and can unlock sun or moon magic. Back in the past an evil alchemist named the Fleshmancer developed near godlike powers and nearly destroyed the world. His creations the Dwellers still exist and are only vulnerable on Eclipses to sun and moon magic. The story starts with Zale and Valeres training to become Solstice warriors and evolves to a fight to the fate of the world. The story and characters are superb. I felt the emotions and impacts the character face. I struggled with them and it was an intense feeling. The story evolves and has many surprises and turns. I think it is some of the best stuff in years. The gameplay is a bit mixed. I feel bad for mentioning it as it could just be not my taste. The turn base battles have a gimmick. Special attacks by the enemies can be nullified. Locks are displayed when an enemy cast a special attack. For example a moon and sword symbol. If you attack with a moon and sword attack (or both) before the counter reaches zero the attack is nullified. Normal attacks create mana orbs which can be used to power up your actions. Each character has his/her unique elements and used mana orbs are converted to their mana types.  Now to the choices I dislike. Your level ups are rare and give not much stat wise. You are give a choice to boost some stats on each level up but that makes not much difference. At the time I was in the final dungeon I was just on level 23 with a lot of grinding. They also don't want you to power level. The experience points from battle decrease on each level up. Also the true ending requires a lot of effort that feels like a chore. Here I had a bug that prevents me from getting it. Luckily there is YouTube. Finally the resource management is a bit of a chore too. You can switch to auto heal after each battle which gives a total different gaming experience. If not you have a boring cycle of collecting food and cooking to replenish health. Sadly you have a very limited storage for cooked items. The Wheels mini game is really nice and I enjoyed it. The presentation is superb. The graphics look really great and the soundtrack is memorable. Overall I ended up enjoying the game even with its flaws. I give an 8/10 because lower or higher feels wrong for me.

author: Bolo_Blas
review_text: Is a 8 **** itself but the postlaunch care put it in a solid nine. The dedevelopers have studied and refresh old school ideas to keep their game nostalgic but fresh. The combat never gets old and the world feels like a platformer somehow. Is also a lesson of pixel art

author: HxCore
review_text: Superbe petit jeu, graphisme old school, systéme de combat au tour par tour dynamique avec des parades, des attaques a améliorer via la pression du bouton action au bon moment, ce qui rend les affrontements vraiment interressant. L'exploration est assez sympathique, beaucoup de petites enigmes, puzzles a résoudre pour trouver des coffres secrets ou juste avancer dans l'histoire, excellente surprise que ce RPG old school.

author: Aegy
review_text: O Sabotage Studio, como em "The Messenger", conseguiu criar uma história cativante, cheia de reviravoltas, personagens carismáticos e uma trilha sonora absurda de boa. Só não dou 10/10 por conta do combate ser um pouco simples em algumas situações. De resto, jogo incrível.

author: Oldbluey
review_text: Exactly what I have been searching for as a follow up to Chrono Trigger from my younger days. Great story, art, and especially the music.

author: Stormcrow82
review_text: Game could have certainly been higher. I think the combat is fun, music slaps, and the story surprisingly interesting (at times). However, the dialogue is often too long, and the game takes a little bit to show its true colors. The first third of the game is pretty boring before you unlock more characters, more abilities etc. and the story begins to take shape. Still a good game

author: Jiahuil7
review_text:
Am a big fan of JRPG games, but this game is not in the same league of Square Enix or Atlus classic RPGs.
Don't expect Chrono Trigger or FF6 quality, as this game suffers from very simplistic and overly shallow writing. Story telling is quite weak as this is the developer's first RPG game. Combat is decent and does keep me interested. 
Ending is not really satisfying, which bums me after spending 40 hours playing the game. The "real" ending is locked behind some frustrating requirement, so most players wont get to see it.
Overall, a decent game but not very polished and overated by community.

author: Fallconex
review_text: A true gem. Took the best from JRPG. Every aspect of the game is perfectly made by this small studio, bravo! Although, for me personally, the story itself (which is actually rich) and the narrative are rather messy and don't close up very well. And the game doesn't encourage you to use the camp mechanic very much, hard to say if that's a bad thing. But overall, the game is still great. I look forward to seeing more in this genre from the creators!

author: JKaiya
review_text: The story in this game is so bad, and the worst part is the whole game is making you sit through the constant filler content to beef up your artificial playtime. They really hired someone incompetent to write the story for them. There isn't enough actual gameplay as most of it is spamming next to skip the **** story. The movement was pretty cool, and some of the art, but the same cant be said about the pixel characters. They needed a bit of work and they often looked nothing like their image / animated scenes. Like the girl protag having a burnt scar on her forehead in her pixel version which is supposed to be just a poorly done shadow

author: bardokhofmeier
review_text:
I really, really, really wanted to love this game, but I can’t.

In the beginning, it seems to do everything right: the characters seem good, the plot is interesting, the world feels alive, and the fights are engaging. But most of that fades way too fast.
While the story stays compelling for a while, the first cracks in the characters appear pretty soon. And even though you can forgive some blunders, they accumulate, and by the time you get to the middle of the story, they are all but falling apart. 
That is also the point where I noticed that I don’t care for the story anymore. It wasn’t that great before, but it became bad afterwards.Sadly, even the fights are way too monotonous, with each character having basically the same moves throughout the game.

I never finished it, but I watched videos (in hopes of rekindling the flame), and apparently, it gets even more unravelled later on.

author: Mauraer
review_text:
IT'S A TRAP! Nice graphics but... HORRIBLE story. Flat and surreal characters. Absurd mechanics, you can't escape from the fight in progress, you can't teleport at will (unlocking points of interest) but only in a few cases after an exhausting USELESS backtracking. Avoid if you are looking for something more by pressing random buttons while looking at beautiful backgrounds

Don't fall for this.. this is the definition of rose tinted glassess nostalgia bait.

author: Pumpkinpunker
review_text: This game is vapid nostalgia bait. Please dont listen to the critics who just have nostalgiia for the pixel art JRPG past that was replaced by better systems. They yearn for simpler times when they were 15 years old. Those times aren't coming back. I'm tired of these people being unable to look at things objectively and propping up retrogressive crap like this.  I was so bored that I couldn't finish this cutesy snoorefest.

author: Ebantero
review_text:
The graphics? Gorgeous. The tunes? Absolute bangers. It’s like they’re screaming, “This is gonna be epic!”

But man, once I got into it, it was like expecting a gourmet meal and getting fast food instead. The characters? They’re kinda there, but not really making me feel anything. They’re supposed to shape the world, but everything just felt… meh.

And the fights, they started out cool, but didn’t go anywhere. It’s like playing the same level over and over. Plus, there’s this one character who keeps breaking the fourth wall, pointing out all the clichés. Just let me get lost in the game!

I really wanted to get into Sea of Stars, rooting for it to be my new obsession. But it’s like it’s stuck in the shadow of the old-school legends, trying too hard to be like them without bringing anything new to the table. It’s a feast for the eyes, sure, but it doesn’t hit you in the feels like the classics do.

author: Kraiss
review_text: Just like ready player one the movie. It's beautiful and full of nostalgia and that's it. The gameplay is boring after 5 hours and the story have been written by a 6 years old..

Los personajes tienen cierta profundidad y es imposible no sentirte identificado y empatizar con alguno de **** nota que los desarrolladores han puesto mucho cariño al diseñarlo.

author: mugen_is_here
review_text: This is a very relaxing game! No pressure to do the quests. Lots of exploration. You're contributing to someone's wellness so has a good heartwarming feel. Lots of new things to do as you slowly keep unlocking more and more. The only cons were one of the main characters (the deer) is extremely self-absorbed and narcissitic. And all dialogues are extremely verbose and boring. Who talks like that in real life? Besides these 2 things it's pretty awesome. There's a variety of gameplay like cutting trees, smelting, cooking exploration, island exploration, navigating to new places on the map etc. I played it for 7-8% and I'm saving it for my retirement. This would be a good one to play in the future.

author: Sleepy-Sheepy
review_text: I love this game I can't describe how much I love this game the characters and everything else I absolutly love it my Favorite game of all time and my Favorite character is and stay forever like this Daria

author: Teash
review_text: All i can say about spiritfarer is this is a made with love down to the tiniest details

author: emaxe03
review_text: Spiritfarer is a beautifully crafted gem that offers a unique blend of soothing gameplay and heartfelt storytelling. The game's cozy atmosphere is unmatched, making it a perfect escape to unwind. Improving your ship adds a satisfying layer of customization and creativity, while exploring its vibrant, hand-drawn world is endlessly engaging. With its gentle rhythms and emotional depth, "Spiritfarer" feels like a warm hug **** yet brimming with adventure. Whether you're connecting with its memorable characters or simply enjoying the journey, it's a delightful experience worth savoring.

author: Okami_7274
review_text: The game is beautifull , relaxing , have a great community , he is easy to play no need to be skilled , you will not have to defeat some eldrish abominations. Try it , the game will make you cry with his delightfull story. The other games of the studio are really cool too try it. In resume very good story , gameplay and graphic and attentive dévelopers

author: berkerzararsiz
review_text: I started this game thinking, 'What even is this?' and ended it feeling like it had etched itself into my very bones. Every spirit I bid farewell to made me reflect on my own life. It makes you feel something—something deep, melancholic, yet strangely comforting. Spiritfarer isn’t just a game; it’s an experience, a beautifully crafted meditation on loss, love, and letting go. The hand-drawn visuals are breathtaking, the soundtrack lingers in your soul, and the balance between management mechanics and heartfelt storytelling is masterful. Even in its quietest moments, the game never feels dull; instead, it invites you to embrace the journey, one farewell at a time.

author: victizin
review_text:
Não é apenas um jogo, é uma experiência. Um novo conceito de como contar uma boa história. Se você se permitir mergulhar na magia do jogo, tenho certeza de que irá se encantar.

A gameplay pode ser um obstáculo para alguns, já que é simples, sem grandes desafios ou dificuldade. No entanto, todo o encanto do jogo está em sua proposta: uma narrativa cativante, uma ambientação repleta de carisma e personalidade, com um estilo visual único e músicas incríveis. Cada nova descoberta ao longo da campanha é um verdadeiro deleite.

author: adeza
review_text:
Beautiful graphics and art style.
Beautiful music.
Beautiful and profound game that teach us about life and death. I cried so many times while playing this game. It really touched me.
Charming characters and amazing story that you unfold during your playtime.
A very cozy game in general.

review_text: Game just goes on and on. The pacing is terrible and it just feels like a waste of time and made me quit before I finished the game. Everything is so sluggish, I really do not like these wholesome type games. Especially if it wastes my time like this game tries to do.

author: Nousernam3
review_text:

I had very high expectations thanks to the tons of overrated reviews, the game has a cute art style but is very buggy and it may appeal people who never has been engaged with a proper dramatic script.
I wish I could get my money and time back.

Sorry for the incendiary title, I'm just extremely disappointed to see everyone going crazy for this.

author: Dangusse
review_text: there is no reason why a game that sold over 1 million copies should still have such a broken menu interface. you also can't do borderless fullscreen, and the pause in background toggle not only does not work via the normal controls, but it also does nothing when you switch it on and off. this effectively makes the game impossible to stream. this game is still selling a lot of copies, and the lack of care or follow through is extremely disappointing.  there is absolutely no way im going to invest dozens of hours of my time playing something made by a team that refuses to even get it's menu or user interface to work properly.

One of few games from Paradox that have quite good tutorial after which you can go straight to the game without need to watch countless videos on youtube just to understand basic mechanic of the game. review_text:
is it a flawed game? yes. is it enjoyable to play? also yes.

while there are some bugs and the dlcs are expensive, and some mechanics are underdeveloped, i like the game. its fun.

author: nbdiden
review_text: Crusader Kings III remains the crown jewel of character-driven grand strategy: a sprawling medieval soap opera where secrets, stress, hooks, and schemes make people—not provinces—the real battlefield. Five years on, a steady cadence of expansions and free patches has turned a strong launch into a remarkably rich sandbox. Royal Court introduced artifacts, court grandeur, and a deep culture rework with traditions and hybridization. Tours & Tournaments overhauled activities and travel so your ruler actually roams the map to host tournaments, weddings, and realm tours that blend story and statecraft. Legends of the Dead added prestige-building legends and frightening, map-wide epidemics that finally put mid-to-late-game comfort at risk. Roads to Power revitalized the Byzantine experience, layered in administrative government and family estates, and even let you play as a landless adventurer. 2025’s Khans of the Steppe brought a sharper nomadic identity and seasonal pressures to the steppes, while the small Coronations pack turns being crowned into a dramatic, choice-filled ceremony. With All Under Heaven on the horizon expanding the map into East Asia, CK3 continues to widen its **** result is a game that excels as a story engine first and a map painter second. Cultures feel alive rather than static tech trees, court identity gives you long-term goals, and activities pull you out of menus and into your realm’s politics. New playstyles—from imperial intrigue to nomadic ambition—keep campaigns fresh, and the mod scene supercharges longevity with total conversions and quality-of-life tools. That said, warfare and economy remain intentionally broad-brush, which may disappoint players chasing crunchy tactical depth or intricate economic loops. Very large realms can still snowball into stability unless you lean on game rules or self-imposed challenges, and each big chapter tends to arrive with balance bumps that need hotfixes. The DLC web is real, too: while major patches are generous, the “full modern CK3” experience is spread across multiple add-ons. On platforms, PC is definitive thanks to mods, but the PS5 and Xbox versions have matured into genuinely comfortable ways to play, even without mod support.Verdict: Crusader Kings III is still the most entertaining medieval drama generator you can buy. With its expanding cast of systems and consistently surprising emergent narratives, it turns dynastic pettiness into grand history better than anything else out there. Expect occasional rough edges and a growing DLC bill, but the core magic remains unmatched. Score: 9/10.

author: Nivvy_
review_text:
Probablement le meilleur simulateur d'affaires extra-conjugales disponible pour nos petites pupilles, CK3 est un jeu au gameplay assez profond pour offrir un grand nombre de possibilités à ses joueurs sans pour autant tomber dans l'absurde complexité d'autres jeux Paradox (oui, je pense très fort à Hearts of Iron 4).

Les seuls points négatifs sont la musique plutôt plate à mon goût mais surtout les problèmes de desync pendant les parties multijoueur.

author: DosluQ
review_text: Crusader Kings III, benim için büyük bir merakla başladığım ama sonunda hayal kırıklığı yaşadığım bir oyun oldu. İlk 10 saat boyunca gerçekten keyifli bir deneyim sunuyor, ancak sonrasında her şey tekrara biniyor. Farklı ülkelerle oynamak, sadece aynı şeyleri daha güçlü ya da daha zayıf bir devletle yapmak gibi hissettiriyor. Bu da birkaç farklı ülkeyle oynadıktan sonra oyunu sıkıcı hale getiriyor. İleride nasıl olur bilemem ama şu anki haliyle içerik açısından oldukça eksik.

author: AdrixCora82
review_text: Gran juego de estrategia, para mi gusto uno de los mejores actualmente, muy completo con una gran cantidad de mecánicas por explorar, la única queja que se puede sacar de este juego es que sigue la ética habitual de paradox interactive de partir el juego para despues sacarlo en dlcs, aun así considero que la experiencia vanilla del juego sin dlcs es en gran medida disfrutable y con los mods de la store de steam la experiencia es incluso mejor, recomendable en gran medida.

author: Fjarie
review_text: An excellent game that shines again and again with every new update. This is a role-play simulation game so you should roleplay a lot if you want to enjoy it to the fullest. The game gives you the entrée. Rest is on your imagination and creativity. If you enjoy this kind of gameplay, you will fall in love with this game.

author: QualityPlus
review_text: Excellent strategy game from start to finish. Super immersive and addictive love this game

author: S1mon3
review_text: Crusader Kings III is a deep and engaging grand strategy title that can keep you hooked for hours, thanks to its rich dynastic, political, and narrative mechanics. Managing your house, navigating tricky diplomatic decisions, and reacting to emergent story events make for an extremely immersive medieval experience for fans of the genre.However, a significant drawback is the absence of an official Italian localization. The volume of text is huge—beyond menus and mechanical descriptions, there are intrigues, legends, dynastic stories, and historical details that deserve to be read calmly and thoroughly. For many non-English speakers, this represents a real barrier that can discourage newcomers or prevent them from catching every narrative and gameplay **** Italian community has stepped in with fan-made translation mods on Steam Workshop or Paradox Mods—often updated with care and covering a very high percentage of strings. These “do-it-yourself” solutions greatly improve accessibility but have two main limits: they require manual updates after each patch or DLC, and even when done well, occasional translation inconsistencies or unlocalized strings can slip through, disrupting the **** a text-heavy, narrative-rich game like this, an official translation would ensure consistency and completeness, avoiding the frustration of missing strings or mod incompatibilities. It would also signal that Paradox Interactive values the Italian market, helping grow the player base by making the game more approachable for those less comfortable in English or who simply prefer playing in their native language.Setting aside this issue, the gameplay itself remains outstanding: the interface is polished, the tutorial helps you start but mastering the complex mechanics still takes time, and multiplayer offers compelling challenges with friends. The historical depth and freedom to craft unique stories make Crusader Kings III one of the best titles in its genre, despite the steep learning **** summary, I give it 8/10 because at its core the game is excellent and deeply satisfying for grand strategy enthusiasts, but the lack of an official Italian localization significantly reduces accessibility for many players. Fan translations are a great resource, but they can’t replace a professional localization effort: if Paradox released official Italian support, I would raise this score.

review_text: The story is unclear, where does Russian come from, where is this word from the 860s. Perverted nations.

author: astronut
review_text:
It feels like the devs don't understand what makes CK2 a great sandbox roleplay game. The events are repetitive, most civs play the same, the balance is absolutely broken (in particular, the way the activities' costs scale is one of the dumbest idea I've seen in a video game and makes any attempt at roleplaying a doom to your whole economy), no strategy in war: enemy ai armies are just lost and confused, just like Paradox' devs.
So, RPG elements are repetitive and overall way inferiors to CK2, most game mechanics are either broken or just unfun, 5 years and 150€ of dlc for this result...

author: Quazder
review_text: Got bored after 10 hours of playing it I guess my adhd is just too big to play this game

author: max_gradient
review_text:
Can't recommend in this state at this price.

* Too much focus on RPG part of the game (frequent random events that get repetitive/annoying very quickly) instead of the mechanics. Many parts of the game could use new/deeper mechanics (HRE, papacy, crusades, diplomacy, republics etc.). Unfortunately the DLC seems to focus on even more RPG events instead of core game mechanics.

* Game too easy overall. Limitless aggressive expansion is possible. Intrigue is too powerful.

* Bad UI, even by Paradox standards. The new map lacks many important viewmodes that were essential in CK2, and requires you to zoom in/out constantly to finally fade in the content you need (armies, counties etc. - but at the same time you get useless terrain features, snow effects etc.). This requires constant use of the mouse wheel, which makes for very poor ergonomics. UI Scaling beyond 130 % not possible without losing content, making text too small on UHD displays.

author: pale81
review_text:
First half top, second half flop.

The first half of the game was super interesting, fun and exciting, although often not easy to figure out what to do.

From about halfway through, however, this gets out of hand. 
You have no plan where to go, what to do, or why to do anything.
The puzzles, which are logical and fun at the beginning, become too frequent and illogical over time, making them frustrating.

The game relies too much on its scripted events.
If you haven't done A exactly as planned, you'll find yourself standing in front of closed doors at B.

It gives you a false sense of freedom of choice and is actually very hard railroading. 

A lot of potential was wasted and I hope the second part is better.

author: theBobOfBobs
review_text: It seems fine but clearly not meant to be played solo. Gets boring fairly quickly.

author: Mrfuzz117
review_text:
The opening was quite difficult which is an issue.
The ending dragged **** the middle was incredible, I couldn't put it down.
I think it was awesome that most of the sidequests were the same quality (approximately) as the main story, some sidequests I couldn't even tell were sidequests, and in a market where we barely even get a finished game released, to say nothing about quality of story or sidequests, this was nice.
I picked this up with Divinity; Original Sin 2 to decide if I would like to buy Baldur's Gate 3, I wanted to see if the DND type of gameplay would interest me, and it did. I think I might pick up Baldur's Gate 3 in a little while. We will see if I play through the sequel first.

author: Prometheus1241
review_text:
Divinity: Original Sin( i will call it just DOS) is first from the wave of "modern CRPGs". And it was quite revolutionary for it's time, i must say. Is brings interesting story, quest and characters. As RPG it is very good: you can be an altruistic hero or a veeery bad guy.

The main disadvantage of the is, as for me, it's tactics. The thing is that it is based on random stunning effect, and you easily complete the game if you are lucky( or ruin if you are unlucky).

The second disadvantage is that it becomes quite boring in the end. I thing it is mainly caused by tactics system.

So, i think that DOS is a good game, and deserves 8/10. I can recommend this game to anybody, wgo likes RPGs, CRPGs or love good games.

author: EnclaveMK2
review_text:
Вся игра это какое то одно большое превозмогание. Боевка просто отвратительная, меня постоянно не покидало чувство, что я играю отрядом инвалидов, которые имеют много умений, но они нихуя не юзабельны. Система сохранений - сохраняет когда ей вздумается. Баланс классов просто отсутствует - вор и лучник бесполезны чуть больше чем полностью. Ахуеть, вместо того, что бы получать радость от игры у меня постоянно было чувство страдания. Походу целью разработчиков была проверка игроков на прочность. Система таргетинга откровенно хуевая - время от времени то и дело, что получаются миссклики. Вместо того что бы ударить - персонаж начинает пиздовать кудато, что невыносимо выводит из себя. Враги постоянно имеют преимущество над персонажами. Взять для примера вражеских лучников - они стреляют чаще и точнее чем персонаж лучник. Я хз за что игре выставили такие большие оценки.

Юмор присудствует это правда, сюжет вроде как не плохой, графика сойдет.

Но геймплей это пиздец. Контактниками играть невозможно, постоянно поджоги, подскальзывания, отравление, хоть бери да просто круги нарезай вокруг врагов, ожидая того как маг и лучник через 9000 ходов одолеют врагов. После того как я проиграл один из боев и попытался загрузится, оказалось, что последнее автосохранение было хер знает когда и совсем в другой локации. Я просто не выдержал, нажал alt+F4 и удалил игру к хуям от греха подальше.

author: AngryIgor
review_text: boring combat, old mechanics, ugly graphic and terrible story and lore... once again cash grab from glitchstarter end up as failure... go buy something thats actually a game not dead-genre corpse

author: AntonyRhetoric
review_text: It's a pretty game, with fun story. The only reason in the end, I found it's good, is that it's voice acted. The AI is broken, making the game easy. The loot system almost seems discouraging and tedious. The lewd mini stories are also questionable. Overall I have it a 4, due to the AI breaking and lewdness. If you can look past, a tedious loot system, a broken AI in the late game and the sexual lewdness then, you maybe think better of it that I.

author: Broyax
review_text:
Larian Studios bien connu pour ses jeux de rôle bâclés nous sort son petit épisode indé aux graphismes à la Casimir, couleurs criardes, direction artistique sans direction. Le machin fait chauffer la carte graphique comme s'il s'agissait de Crysis 3 alors qu'on ne compte guère plus de 256 couleurs à l'écran.... où va le monde. Le moteur 3D foireux limite même l'angle de vue sous peine d'artefacts graphiques quand on force l'option : pour un jeu en vue aérienne, ça fait tache.

L'univers générique s'avère des plus niais et seules des voix anglaises sont disponibles. Le système de combat en tour par tour n'est pas mal mais là aussi la niaiserie s'invite dans tous les coins : on dirait un jeu Nintendo. Franchement les gars de chez Larian, vous n'avez ni les moyens, ni les ambitions nécessaires pour vous atteler à un genre aussi exigeant que le jeu de rôle et encore moins de talent. De grâce, cantonnez-vous à des **** jeux casuals pour smartphones et tablettes, c'est plus de votre niveau.

author: TemplarGR
review_text:
Terribly overrated game. Let me tell you something kids, as a hardcore RPG veteran with decades of experience: Just because you are starved for a new RPG, doesn't mean that every piece of garbage that arrives at the stores and has character stats is worth it. Back in the day, we experienced a similar RPG drought, which ended with Fallout, Baldur's Gate, Diablo, and Final Fantasy VII. See? We celebrated with real classics, not this overrated garbage.

This game is huge, but only because it is tedius. You will go pixel hunting like a mad man for no reason. It is filled with containers that have nothing inside. It has plenty of mechanics and stats to master but once you finally understand the system it lacks serious depth. The turn based combat is slow, boring, and has no reason to be turn based. The story is meh. The dialogs are cringe-worthy. Decent graphics and voice acting, and after patches is at a very good shape, but this is not enough.

It will demand a lot of time and patience from you, but it won't satisfy you. It doesn't really deliver as an RPG. Those who compare this to the classics like Baldur's gate, are out of their minds and i am fairly certain they have never played it.

I suppose if you like co-op with a friend, it could be worth it. As a single player experience, just replay BG again.

Deserves around a 6, giving it a 1 to counterbalance the overinflated scores.

author: Voyou
review_text:
Looking for a real RPG (as opposed to a Hack n' Slash or a platformer with skills tree), I start DOS, and immediately notice I'm in amateur territory: barely readable fonts, and no way to increase them. If you asked me 30 years ago, I would have guessed that the bigger our monitors would become, the better we could read. How it came to the exact opposite is obviously due to a conspiracy of ophthalmologists bribing game developers. Anyway, barely, but still readable, so I keep going. Instead of resting my eyes 15 minutes per hour, I'll just have to swap and actually play 15 minutes per hour.

Character creation time. A very exciting step in an RPG for sure, and usually a long one. Here, we start with a surprising surprise: we create 2 characters. Hmm... I'm a bit confused. I like talking at the singular 1st person about myself, and my avatar. That's what happens when a player feels invested in a game, and that's a plus for said game. So, will I have to use the plural, like the famous British tapeworm, Queen Victoria ? We want to be amused, and we are all for experiments, even doomed ones, so we keep going.

Characters creation was actually very quick, and very underwhelming. A few skills, some of them opening a talent pseudo-menu (pseudo because it offers actually no choices,) and we are done. Also, there are only 2 races: male and female. Err... I meant... only 2 species: bodybuilder and barbie doll. Anyway, you get our meaning. I mean, my meaning.

I both hop on a beach (confusing, isn't it ?) It's a pretty 3d world, not gorgeous like these 2d painted games, but it will do nicely. Someone is talking near the west edge, but stays invisible. These long range constant chatters will prove very annoying in the future, specially in town. They'll make you want to go away instead of doing what you plan on doing.

And then, the pixel hunting starts. Pixel hunting is the meat of this game. In the following hours, I will have hovered over, then opened, hundreds of crates and vases. Most of them empty, yet my dreadfully cumbersome inventory screen will look like a huge pile of junk. And that will be enough for me to quit and have no desire to come back. I feel like I've been playing a hack n' slash without the hack. And, mostly, pixel hunting. In 2015.

Sure, a few nice things happened in the mean time: playing mostly a thief, I discovered an amusing take on the sneaking trope, and a challenging and interesting pickpocket mechanism. I got involved in a couple of fights, and backstabbing proved satisfying at this early stage. Using magic scrolls also proved very helpful, unlike in any other game (I usually can't be bothered, but here it felt natural.) And that's about it.

It's an RPG, so there are dialogues and interactions and story lines and stuff, but one word is enough to summarise them: childish.

After the disappointing PoE, I let myself be influenced by the reviews here. Now I will avoid kickstarted games like the plague, since backers suffer from a very peculiar mental block that renders them unreliable.

author: BlackVoid
review_text:
This game is more like an adventure game with illogical puzzles and quests.
I could not progress anything without a walkthrough, then it becomes a tedious errand running exercise.
And when you leave the starting town, it is either empty or full of higher level enemies who kill you quickly.

Space is way too slow. Levelling up is weird, the game will not let you increase certain stats to 2. Sank in 6-8 hrs and apart from a few errand quests, could not do anything.
If you like slow paced RPGs and adventure games, you may like this, otherwise stay away.

author: Batman11
review_text: Oyunun açık dünyası güzel büyülerle kombo yapmak eğlenceli ama yan görevler vasat sadece karakter geliştirmek için yapılır sonra affedlimez lanetleri açın oyun katlanabilir oluyor sebastian dışındaki karakterler çöp ana hikayede idare eder

author: JustKai__x
review_text: Never watched nor read Harry Potter before, so I went into this game completely blind and not sure what to really expect. The game did a good job at teaching what different things were and what certain things meant, even if it wasn't important to gameplay, which helped me understand the world a bit more. The fighting felt fluid and amazing, the character customization was nice, the story was fun, the graphics were beautiful, this game was just amazing through and through.

author: Avoocado
review_text:
O trabalho envolvido no desenvolvimentodo jogo é realizado com muito carinho, por fãns da franquia mesmo pois o jogo é muito bem detalhado com referências e designs únicos, verdadeiras obras de arte.
Graficamento fora de hogwarts o mundo é bem modelado e distribuido mas um pouco vazio, ainda que você trombe com 1 grupo de vira latas ou uma pessoa caminhando na estrada a maior parte do tempo vai ser você e os pensamentos do seu personagem durante a viagem.

Jogabilidade é muito divertida, a escolha de parry com combos das magias somadas a fluidez do combat e das animações são sensacionais, muito divertido, elegante e satisfatório. Mesmo com bastante combos interativos com determinados inimigos o jogo sofre ainda de baixa variedade de inimigos e de tempo de vida pós missão principal, se tal decisão foi para promover a performance do game, ainda sim não resultou em boas performances no PC, o jogo mesmo com uma maquina potente ainda sofre para renderizar alguns ambientes principalmente voando em altas temperaturas.

author: HappyBull7404
review_text: Wizardly Freedom. Finally getting an open world harry potter game. Wish it was MMORPG but this game was pretty great. Having mounts and numerous spells. Wish the story had more grit but had a great time playing.

author: royaleagle87
review_text: Un juegazo! Yo ya era medio fan de HP, pero este juego mehizo super fan, me vi todas las peliculas de nuevo despues de jugarlo. De verdad que no tiene desperdicio, lo unico malo es que es corto, en comparacion a otros juegos y que la historia no es tan buena. Pero en todo lo demas 10/10

author: asfbr
review_text:
So just finished this after 30 hours of gameplay or so.
I really liked Harry Potter as a kid, read the books since goblet of fire as they were launched, good times... 
That automatically makes us like the game, although I feel there were lots of missed opportunities here.

The main story and quest line is great. Kudos for that. The rest, however, leaves it to be an average game. 

Main issues, in my view: 
#1 Side quests, although are not repetitive per se, gave me no incentive to me for doing that (with some exceptions in the beginning for spells etc.). 
#2 That is also linked to a mediocre item mechanics. You get better items, you upgrade with same materials, breed pets, that's it. After some time it's all legendary items. Also always same price in shops. No sets, only traits for gameplay styles. Could be a lot better.
#3 Natty side quests seemed empty. Game would be better without it and I can see why people complain and even say this was a ESG filler. That does not bother me, but the character is annoying and quests are bad
#4 Alohomora mechanics is a pain in the... really whoever was the game designer responsible for this did a terrible job. Not only boring, but annoying. Also the demiguises statues. I just found myself at the end of the game with level 1 alohomora and need to spend now 1 hour I guess to get the statues to finish the rest that I was locked out. What a pain. This alone to me warrants one star less. No wonder one of the main mods is to remove this
#5 the "mini bosses" or "infamous foes" could be a lot lot better. No development around them, instant petrific totalus on them. 
== All in all, this is a great Harry Potter game. But that's it. Remove the Harry Potter world and this would be an average skippable 6 or 7 game. I had a good time playing this for the nostalgy (I guess first game since Philosopher's stone for GBA back in 2001), but I really hope devs make a better job in HL2. Sales were great so I hope they take some real feedback other than total revenue.

author: MorfenA
review_text: Hogwarts Legacy is a dream come true for fans of the Wizarding World, offering an immersive journey into the halls of Hogwarts and beyond. The game beautifully captures the magic and wonder of the Harry Potter universe, with stunning visuals, an expansive open world, and gameplay that makes you feel like you're truly living in that world. From casting spells to exploring hidden secrets, every moment is filled with nostalgia and **** gameplay is a highlight, providing a mix of exploration, combat, and puzzle-solving that keeps you engaged throughout your adventure. The world of Hogwarts Legacy is nothing short of amazing, with every corner of the castle and surrounding areas meticulously crafted to create an authentic experience.However, the game isn't without its flaws. One of the noticeable drawbacks is the boss battles. While the encounters are visually impressive, the bosses lack a certain aura of intimidation and challenge that you’d expect. They often feel underwhelming, which detracts from the overall excitement of these key moments.Additionally, while the game’s world is rich and detailed, the lore and story can feel a bit flat at times. Some aspects of the narrative don’t quite

author: oxeonofficial
review_text:
This game is good, but it felt like we were at Hogwarts for a walk, not to be students. My overall rating is that the game is good, but it's not a masterpiece.

Story: 5/10
This game's story is average. I didn't play it for the story. Being a Harry Potter fan, I was able to endure the story.

Combat: 8/10
The combat is very good, but the difficulty in switching between spell sets and the limited number of spells are annoying.

Characters: 5/10
Almost all the characters in the game are very boring. Including our main character. The only character I really liked was Sebastian Sallow. The dialogue from all the characters is very boring.

Quests: 7/10
Except for some quests, the quests are poor and unimpressive, but they're still quite good. If you're a Harry Potter fan, you won't be bored.
Gameplay: 8/10
The gameplay is good. Simple. The switching between spell sets is annoying. Flying in the game is fine, but it would be nice if there were more things to do while flying.

Graphics: 8.5/10
The game's graphics are quite nice. The landscapes look great, but they're not 10/10.

The side activities in the game are quite nice.

My overall rating for the game is 8/10.

author: tariq_almandhar
review_text:
متعة ممتازة في تجسيد العالم ونقله من الرواية للعبة بعالم متفاعل بالحوارت بينك وبين الشخصيات أو بين الشخصيات نفسها 
مهام جميلة متنوعة ومهمات جانبية مهمة للشخصيات الفرعية لانها تحكي قصصهم 
أسلوب لعب رائع وتعويذات مهمة في اللعب تتناسب كل تعويذة مع عدو معين وفي حالات معينة 
قصة جميلة ليست قوية وليست سخيفة وضعيفة وقوتها في كونها تحكي قصتك الخاصة

author: JakorVT
review_text:
As someone who isn't the biggest Wizarding World fan but still bought the $70 deluxe edition I would give the game a 7.1. Its been about 1-2 years since I last played, but this is my review from what main take aways I remember from playing during the first month after release. 
It had some features that were cool to have and others that just fell flat. I think the attention to detail with the world was really cool as it felt you were truly in the movies. I think the story was also really good and engaging. It also was a nice touch with how your decisions can change your ending. 
My biggest regret was buying the deluxe edition as I mainly bought it for the Thestral mount but by the time you finally unlock mounts you will already have your broomstick lvl 2 or 3 and it will be faster to use and easier to control. I also liked how we got our own customizable rooms to use but after unlocking it and customizing the room after the tutorial I never went back besides when new sections got added. The combat is ok as I like that it forces you to use a mixture of the spells but the switching between spells during combat was not the smoothest and required you to remember the layout of what you had to quickly/smoothly transition to them but is kind of hard as you are adding spells pretty regularly.

author: DarKNG
review_text: Talvez Hogwarts Legacy não fosse o jogo esperado pelos maiores fãs do universo de Harry Potter, mas nisso nao significa que seja um jogo ruim. O mundo de hogwarts é (sem trocadilhos intencionais) MÁGICO, e essa é definitivamente amelhor versão de hogwarts já vista nos jogos. Explorar esse universo por si só ja é uma experiencia incrivel, complementada por uma historia que apesar de simples, conta com bons personagens. Um dos maiores destaques da história no entanto está em uma quest opcional, o que pode fazer com que alguns jogadores percam essa excelente experiência.

author: wingwinder
review_text:
Me just entering Hogwarts: killed a lot of people already. 
The gameplay feels repetitive, side quests are basiclly killing and killing and finding hidden stuff. The story is full of rubbish, cannot relate a single bit.

author: Amagendon
review_text:
Start of game was rough with performance but it was fun. The game gets pretty empty after a while but otherwise mods helped solve both problem along with nice updates. 
Until publisher decided to make their own mod browser and 2 account system for it along with monopolization for future. Right not they are free but im 100% sure they will be paid later on. They also broke all the mods from previous update and it include breaking performance with new update going from 200 fps to 60? This is really a joke. I am really, really glad that its only game i bought from them, it seems like they treat their own community as joke and milking cows. I will also edit it if they fix those problems as for now its Solid 1 but gamestory i still enjoyed so its bonus 1 point.

author: Oyundaryus
review_text: OPTIMIZATION **** ASS but game isnt that bad..musics are good sometımes and ıt has good animations but dialogs are so cringe and forced and pointless... ooo here you are, yes i am here, i glad you are here, its nice to see you come back ,i hope you came more often, ....GOD DAMN I JUST CAME MOVE ON

author: Falie
review_text:
Great aesthetics and nostalgic feeling for HP fans.
Period. The rest is empty, vast and hollow. The lore is shallow, the characters flat, the gameplay is downright terrible.
I had to remove any item from me just to have a slight challengebutcould still oneshot bosses.
It is just an exploration experience in the Hogwarts world, which is beautifully painted.
Negative extra: they purposefully removed Quidditch to sell it separately.. be better

author: ripear
review_text: Llevo algo más de 7 horas con este título, al que le tenía muchas ganas desde el momento en que salió a la venta. Lo he abandonado porque tras tantas horas de juego, este no remonta. Si buscas un juego precioso estéticamente, pero hueco en su interior, este es ideal. Recuerdo pocos juegos como este, es como hablar con un maniquí, muy bonito de fuera, bien vestido, pero no responde ni tiene vida. Los NPC de este juego están allí para rellenar un poco el mapa, no tienen líneas de diálogo ni hacen nada más que no sea andar de un lado para otro (me refiero a fuera de Hogwarts). Lo peor del juego, es que te lleva de la mano en todo momento, todo está "cerca" o hay un punto de viaje rápido a 4 pasos. Las misiones no tiene ningún sentido con la trama principal, ni hacen nada para que conectes con los personajes secundarios que te las mandan. Todas son cortadas con el mismo patrón, camina, mata, vuelve, repite. Los puzles son extremadamente básicos y las secuencias de vídeo soporíferas. Debo reconocer que la primera hora y media de juego es alucinante, una maravilla, pero siento que tras ese corto período de juego, no tengo más ganas de perder tiempo con este título (SUERTE QUE NO LO COMPRÉ A PRECIO COMPLETO DE SALIDA). En lo técnico, un desastre, no puedes selecionar la resolución que mejor se adapte a tu hardware, si no que siempre va a arrancar con la resolución nativa de tu monitor (a menos que lo ejecutes en modo ventana). La utilización de los núcleos del procesador es pésima, resultando en un rendimiento inaceptable por muy buen hardware que tengas, por lo que (en mi caso) con una RTX4070 Super, podía jugarlo en medio a 1440p 60fps o ultra 30fps. Lo dicho, no puedo pedir reembolso por el tiempo de juego que es demasiado largo, ya que tenía la esperanza de que mejoraría con el tiempo. Se que es una review demasiado larga, pero espero que no te pase lo mismo que a mi, todo el mundo lo ponía por las nubes, alabando todo lo que tenía que ver con este título. Supongo que si eres un pre-adolescente o persona de corta edad, es un juego divertido, pero para un adulto creo que se queda a medias en todo lo que ofrece.

author: lemoshare1221
review_text: The world is so empty and shallow, makes the ubisoft games look great lol,story doesnt make sense at all, no need to mention so many ethnicities in game which in reality harry potter universe doesn't have any ethnicity other than white british, what a shame.

Only real good thing on this game is the map and castle , both is beautiful. But except that it is just money maker on well known brand for money. review_text: It's not a AAA game, it's an AA game. I was happy to play an HP game after so many years, but I was disappointed. The game is an empty game made to make money. I said very nice things to those who caused this game to be so bad from the bottom to the top, you get it :)

author: kinsang
review_text: เป็นเกมที่เล่นได้เพลินๆ ไม่มากไม่น้อยไปกว่านั้น เกมเพลย์ก็ rpg turnbase ทั่วๆไป มีเพิ่มเติมระบบนู่นนี่นิดหน่อย กราฟฟิคค่อนข้างสวย มีเอกลักษณ์ ส่วนเนื้อเรื่องค่อนข้างจะดาษดื่น มีหลายจุดที่รู้สึกว่าช้าเกินไป แต่ก็เร่งไม่ได้ ทำให้หงุดหงิดค่อนข้างบ่อย

author: RPGLMNTZ
review_text: Octopath Traveler is less of an RPG and more like eight mini RPGs rolled into one. The diverse character cast allows for widely different stories and a vastly different experience. It is wildly unlike anything I could have ever hoped to expect, and it would be better if there were more games like it. It is an absolute masterpiece that everyone should play.

author: apokalipto
review_text: Very good game. I enjoyed playing this game a lot. I strongly recommend this.

author: jorge1102
review_text:
值得一玩的RPG，音樂非常強大好聽

author: Daitya
review_text:
A beautiful game, great soundtrack and an interesting story. The best thing about this game is the secret/true ending where all 8 stories are combined and the characters share an ending. The difficulty of the game is enough to challenge you, especially because of the final boss, and you will need to understand each class/profession. Finally, we recommend that you complete all the secondary stories, to unlock the true ending and prepare for the last boss.

A game that when you complete it 100% (all the stories and the true ending) you will love.

author: shin777
review_text: One of the best games i have played. Even played it a second time to get the true ending

author: JonaSCX
review_text: Unos pixeles hermosos, unos cuantos principales olvidables, y unas ciudades y locaciones bastante interesantes, son algunas de las cosas que componen este juego, aunque tambien lo conforman una subida de nivel con grindeo, ciudades vacias y misiones secundarias realmente repetitivas. Realmente no es que esperes mas de un juego de este estilo, pero la sensacion que te da el estar jugando despues de unas 30 horas de juego (30 horas en las que aun no termino la historia principal del personaje principal debido a que necesito subir de nivel) es de cansancio, nada te apega a seguir la historia de los demas companeros que no te interesan, es un juego realmente entretenido al inicio de partida con batallas deasafiantes, pero nada te detiene a desinstalarlo despues de saber lo que te ofrece este juego.

author: FoxForce
review_text: Overpriced and underdeveloped generic JRPG. I would give it 5/10 if it was under 8 dollars.

author: YusufAli11
review_text: Bu oyunun görseli güzel. 16 bit görüntü ve unreal engine 4 ikilisi güzel ama, oyun bok gibi. Hikaye desen yok, aksiyon, macera vb. yok. Ve oyun 60 küsür dolar. Şimdi bu oyun indi bir oyun mu yoksa triplay oyun mu belli değil. O yüzden oyuna 10 üzerinden puanım 2 veya 3. Görsel güzel ama enfes donemindeki animasyonlar gibi yapmanıza gerek yok.

author: overratedhuman
review_text:
Is this a joke? I don't understand how we can have such a poor designed game in this day an age, you might as well get a SNES emulator and play any of the games in that platform.

The storylines are plain out generic, made a million times over, the fight system has very little going on for itself. The game is a massive grind, you get generic story after generic story, I'm guessing you're supposed to collect all 8 travelers but after collecting 2 or 3 of them you realise you're in a silly grinding loop filled up with generic content, generic monsters which don't pose any challenge after a short while, and I didn't finish it, but I'm going to guess the completion of each story must be more of the generic content you have. Wrapped up in graphics from 20 years ago, you've got yourself a huge scam of a videogame, and somehow the internet is piled up with positive reviews, I've got no idea what on earth they're doing, maybe it's very young people who haven't seen this a million times? I don't know, if you managed to play this for more than a few hours I commend you on your stubbornness, it has worst graphics, worse gameplay and worse story than an average money grabbing gacha mobile game.

author: Frankie321
review_text: I stopped playing this game because it's graphics are so primitive.  The look of the game is so primitive it's not even cute or nostalgic.  Developers, maybe there's a fine game in there, but please provide games with modern graphics, and, especially, drop that strong depth of field blur.

author: TsukasaHiiragi
review_text:
Pro's

Amazing artstyle that pays homage to classic jrpgs
8 characters each with their own story and playstyle
Good voice overs,  nice music

Cons

Inexcusably tedious combat
Boring
Lacking polish

Octopath Traveler would have been great on SNES or PS1 back in the late 90s but for this era it is very dated which is a shame because graphically, it has a lot of vintage charm with nice graphics and some interesting story telling that unfortunately is let down by obnoxiously slow paced combat that makes the game get exceptionally boring fast forcing the player to either not bother and move on to a faster paced game,   even by all classic snes jrpgs virtually none have the same tedious turn based combat style.

Square Enix, you know better!  Don't ever make a turn based JRPG that takes several minutes just to beat one basic monster this makes for a tedious eye rolling slog.  It doesn't matter how deep the combat system is if you have players bored in the first hour of playing.

author: Bertucciop
review_text:
Octopath traveler, they haven't worked enough on it and ask for 60€ for it. Made on Unreal Engine for quick development I think for commercial reasons. Below I break down the different aspects of the game.

Fantastic music, sound track is the best of the game. Each character has his own music theme, maybe too melancholic but is a 10/10.

The plot is too simple and linear, cliche characters, there is no evolution in them over time. Too Manichean, evil and good well separated. A noble girl becomes a prostitute seeking for vengeance for no reason, instead of using her money and inheritance for it. Anyways narrative is ok, it is ok even if it is full of topics and empty of plot twists. It is a game for kids, not a book. Hire a Jewish screenwriter to review it before starting though, Square Enix 6/10.

Gameplay is horrible, it is a typical 90's RPG game, but dynamics are too slow.

They made a weakness point counter system which stuns and weakens enemies when they came to 0. But there are not any strategic but this in the game. In addition, they made an initiative point system, these points increase if you do not use them, and they boost your skills and attacks.

Both systems combined make combat so tedious as you have to wait turns taking enemies weaknesses points as you wait to your initiative points to increase for making massive damage.

Boss fights long the same as common fights. And skills are limited, attack, heal, low, and increase defense and attack. Enemies can blind, sleep, etc. you but it is very limited to you to do these things. You have very powerful ultimate skills at your disposal that end a combat after gaining some initiative points.

These long fights appears each two steps on map, so you can't walk at all, unless you have a mage on team who provides of an extension walking longitude before fighting. Game is hardly bearable even with this mage's skill, it is unplayable if u don't have this.

You do not need to properly manage your items, you are full of healing things and other things, you will never run out of them, even resurrection items.

There is not any puzzle on map, just walking, taking treasure chests (some are hidden by 2D vision perspective) and fighting.

The interaction of the NPCs is the 90's RPGs and they added that, depending of which character is in your team, you can steal or trade items with them, even fight a duel or investigate them, which improves skills or shows you the positions of hidden items, which is a great thing, but the plot is linear so when you get to a village you just examine, steal or trade with everyone to get new items and upgrade skills, you can also have an NPC character following you and help you in battles, you cannot control them .

You cannot make any decision, there are not dialogues which spread a list of answers, plot is linear.
3/10

Talking about graphics, all goods things and effects came from Unreal Engine basics, so they didn’t have to work so much on it, they made low quality sprites for characters, and cartoon textures for the 3D maps and a static camera angle imitating 90's RPG quality, Low-cost graphics which did not provide budget for extending other game features.2/10

In conclusion this game is just an experimental game made by Square Enix for commercial researches.
Using a very portable graphic engine, great music, cute story, bad game development and cheap graphics budget. 4/10

author: Greyd_Grom
review_text: [SPOILER ALERT: This review contains spoilers.]

author: JanaWonderland
review_text:
This is among the most disappointing JRPGs I've ever played.

At first I was pulled in by its beautiful artstyle and more than beautiful soundtrack, but that is pretty much it. You could compare it to a disfigured and moldy pumpkin trying to hide its atrocities behind make up and plastic surgeries.

The writing is beyond horrible. Characters that almost constantly act out of character, don't make sense whatsoever and doing things that - sure keep the story going but - do not make sense whatsoever. And instead of anyone questioning their behaviour like a normal person would, everyone just takes it the way it is. Good writing shouldn't need these inconsistencies only to keep the story going, instead its characters should keep it going naturally. Other than that it was able to partake in the biggest sin of story-writing possible: Overexposition. Whatever you see on screen, the game will not hesitate to think you stupid enough not to have taken in what happened and explains it in great depths, over and over again. Then of course it also mostly deals with themes explored by many RPGs before it, making it feel even lazier and more uncreative.

If that was the only gripe I have with this game, at the very least it could be a fun little gameplay-heavy game, but the gameplay is subpar at best for that to happen. Enemies, no matter if random encounter or bosses, are the epitome of bulletsponges. Fights are far from hard, after hours of playing it not once did I die, but instead fights are stretched out like an old stepped upon bubblegum. They are merely there to artificially make the game longer. Enemies weaknesses do not make sense most of the time and unlike other, good, JRPGs are just a guessing game, which makes the fights even more atrocious. The animations, slowdowns and particle effects at least make the actual attacks feel satisfying, but if the main parts of the fighting system can't hold up, that doesn't save it either.

So the fighting system is frustratingly annoying and the story-writing is insultingly bad... What else makes a good RPG? Freedom and exploring! The game is rather free with you being able to choose from 8 different characters that have different stories from the start to fit your playstyle. However outside of battle - in which they all behave relatively same-y - they only get one "skill" for you to use. Things like being able to steal from people, charm them or provocate them for a fight should make the game more interesting, but they barely have any consequences outside of what items you got, how much experience you get or which places to go. Places are by the way scarce. The big "open" world is designed in such a linear fashion, that exploration mostly consists of going off the path for a few seconds to open randomly placed chests. Now linearity is not a bad thing per se, but in a game where there isn't much of anything else, it was the last hope to get some good out of it.

The controls weren't problematic, as I've played it with my gamepad instead of using my mouse and keyboard, as that is just my preferred way of playing JRPGs. So I can't say much about how it does control with mouse and keyboard.

My recommendation is to save your money for something better. The gameplay, the story and the exploration are beyond disappointing. Listen to the soundtrack on YouTube or buy it extra somewhere else and avoid this game as well as possible.

author: Hanishaw
review_text: This is an old fashioned J-RPG game with lengthiness dialogue and turn-based fight that would cost the player massive time. The interest in the plots is faded in such a long and boring time. BTW, Xbox controller is not supported in this game, and keyboard input **** too.  I recommended you not to spend your time and money on Octopath Traveller. If you really a J-RPG lover and want to try this game, I suggest you buy the NS edition that controller is supported and you can sell the game card after finishing it.

author: Nipple

Парни, единственный русский обзор
