author: PublicNuisance
review_text:
I have seen a lot of people online saying how they liked Fran Bow but didn’t like Little Misfortune due to the lack of puzzles. I can understand that because I have the opposite reaction for the same reasons. Fran Bow was a puzzle game that had a fantastic narrative while Little Misfortune is just a narrative game without the puzzles. I disliked the puzzles in Fran Bow so Little Misfortune was basically giving me what I enjoyed from Fran Bow and leaving out what I didn’t. The art style is great and carries onto the credits which is a unique one. The voice acting is fantastic. Both Misfortune and The Voice. There are moments which are sad, funny and in between and they nail all of them. Misfortune has a interesting accent and way of speaking which is a mix of child and adult. There are a lot of points which are pretty macabre, to the point where I surprised the developers took it as far as they did  but was glad they did. The nightclub full of hamsters comes to mind. I don’t think the game would have grabbed a hold of me the way it did if they had of held back. The music was also very interesting as it made me think of an Eastern European disco and a cyberpunk synth type of vibe. There isn’t much in terms of “game play” here. Most of the game is you making choices and interacting with the environment to proceed. I don’t say this as a slight against the game because the story was great. Had the story been bad then the game would have fallen apart because there was nothing else to hold it together but luckily it was good. In regards to choices when The Voice says that there are no good or bad choices, just consequences, they mean it. It made me think of the episode of The X-Files with a genie who when granting your wish would always find a way to warp what you asked for in a way you hadn’t expected. For instance a person asked for a boat and got it but then realized they would have to pay docking fees, maintenance fees and taxes on the boat that they hadn’t thought of and thus they couldn’t even use the boat that they had asked for. There are a lot of things like that associated with the choices you make in Little Misfortune so don’t try to over analyze it, the Voice will find a way to turn your choice bad regardless and I have to say that was a sadly realistic take on things from the developers. I was left with some questions such as just how Morgo was defeated; who was responsible for what happened to Misfortune; what role we the player played seeing as how the Voice talked to us as well but overall enjoyed myself. The middle part of the game had some stretches where not much happened in the story but it got past that.

I played Little Misfortune on Linux. It never crashed on me and I didn’t notice any bugs. There was an option for V-Sync; PostFX and resolution. Alt-Tab didn’t work. You could manually save whenever you wanted and there were 3 save slots available. You could also just use the auto save feature if you wanted. You can’t pause or skip cut scenes. The game ran great with no drops in frame rate.

Game Engine: Unity
Graphics API: OpenGL
Save System: Manual and Auto
Input Used: Mouse and keyboard
Game Version Played: 1.0

Game Settings Used: V-Sync and PostFX on; 1920x1080
GPU Usage: 0-57 %
VRAM Usage: 685-1219 MB
CPU Usage: 3-8 %
RAM Usage: 2.2-2.7 GB
Frame Rate: 132-144 FPS

If you are willing to accept narrative over game play then Little Misfortune has a lot to offer. A great story; voice acting and art style. It has it’s limitations and leaves some questions on the table but overall I came away impressed. It is equal parts cute; macabre; sad; and funny. There is a demo available for those who want to try it first.

My Score: 8/10

author: TitaniumDragon
review_text:
Little Misfortune is a walking simulator masquerading as a point and click adventure game. There are no puzzles of note here, and the game is a strictly linear path from start to finish.

I don’t have anything against walking simulators, but a walking simulator lives and dies on plot and presentation. And unfortunately, Little Misfortune falls short on both.

This is a game that is deliberately ugly. The characters are all deliberately drawn to be “off”, and everything is drawn to have a run-down and often outright creepy vibe. The main character has a veneer of innocence but obviously has had a messed up life with a messed up family, and the only really nice thing in the game – “Mr. Voice”, the voice in her head – is obviously evil, with the first thing he tells us being that Little Misfortune, the “protagonist” of the work, is going to die.

And while all of this can work if there’s a strong plot and purpose to it, honestly, this game isn’t impressive at all in that department. The problem is that Little Misfortune isn’t a particularly interesting character – she’s a little girl from a messed up family, and she is more or less the same person at the start as she is at the end. The entire plot of the game is an excuse to take us through a series of rather morbid areas while being led on by Mr. Voice, and while the game does try to misdirect us about when and how Misfortune is going to die, that’s really the only “trick” it has up its sleeve. The game is very transparent about almost everything that is really going on, and the overall morbid and gross-out “humor” that the game leans on wears on the audience after playing for only a short while. It is just too one note, and as I never actually came to care about Little Misfortune, there was nothing to connect with here.

I can’t recommend this. It is endlessly morbid, but the messed up humor of the walking simulator is basically three hours of variations on the same joke, and there is a great deal of meandering around before the work finally goes somewhere.

author: frozentis
review_text: Balatro: почему эта игра — полный провалПервое впечатлениеС первого взгляда Balatro кажется многообещающей карточной игрой. Однако за привлекательным фасадом скрывается настоящая катастрофа для любого игрока, который ищет качественный игровой опыт.Геймплей, от которого хочется плакатьМеханика игры построена на крайне примитивных принципах. Комбинации карт настолько предсказуемы, что уже через пару часов игра превращается в унылое повторение одних и тех же действий. Никакого разнообразия или инноваций — просто бесконечное перетасовывание одних и тех же карт.Графика и звукВизуальная составляющая оставляет желать лучшего. Скудные, однообразные визуальные эффекты и унылая цветовая палитра создают атмосферу, в которой невозможно долго находиться. Звуковое сопровождение не лучше — набор примитивных звуков, которые быстро начинают раздражать.Проблемы с балансомСложность игры распределена крайне неравномерно. Первые уровни настолько просты, что вызывают зевоту, а последующие — настолько сложны, что кажутся практически непроходимыми без использования специфических комбинаций. Это создаёт ощущение искусственности и несправедливости.Отсутствие глубиныПрокачка и развитие в Balatro реализованы на уровне казуальной мобильной игры. Никаких глубоких стратегий или продуманных механик развития персонажа. Всё сводится к банальному накоплению очков и открытию новых карт, которые мало что меняют в игровом процессе.ИтогBalatro — это яркий пример того, как не нужно делать карточные игры. Отсутствие инноваций, примитивный геймплей, скучные визуальные эффекты и несбалансированная сложность делают эту игру настоящим разочарованием. Лучше потратить своё время на что-то действительно стоящее.Если вы цените качественный игровой опыт — обходите Balatro стороной. Это игра, которая не заслуживает ни вашего времени, ни ваших денег.

author: johko
review_text:
I'll be honest. I was very much on the fence about whether I wanted to play the full game after trying the demo but I sure am glad I did. Inscryption is more than it appears to be on the surface and did not fail to delight me all the way through.

The card game itself is fun. It is pretty much a stripped down version of Magic: The Gathering or Hearthstone, but the rogue-like campaign format suits it well as you can beef up your deck in ways that would be considered game-breaking in a traditional CCG against human players. If you ever fantasized about having OP cards in these types of games, Insrcyption can very much fulfill that fantasy. The drawback of that is that perhaps it allows a bit too much freedom; if you are at all familiar with the fundamental principles of CCGs and have some basic understanding of deck building and card value, the game will not be a challenge to you.

But I liked that. I honestly did not need the game to be challenging for it to be entertaining. I got to play it the way I wanted to play it, and that was fun for me. The difficulty curve is a bit wonky and it does somewhat lessen the impact by failing to provide a steady increase of difficulty, but this is a minor complaint on my end. The good thing is that it is highly unlikely that you will feel stuck or frustrated at this game for not being able to get through it. The focus here is on the experience rather than the challenge. Inscryption actually has a pretty elegantly integrated hand-holding system to nudge you in the right direction without being overtly obvious about it.

I have to praise the tone and atmosphere of this game. The music and sound design is perfect and the visuals set a unique, haunting tone. Even the camera movements bring about a sense of nostalgia without making the game feel clunky. There are certain parts of the game I would like to review but I am trying to keep this spoiler free, so I'll just say that it never gets boring and that there's always something new to delight your eyes and ears.

The weakest part of Inscryption is probably the "puzzles." A lot of these can be passed just by pure random guessing and maybe that was the point. If puzzles aren't your thing, you don't have to worry because they're quite frivolous.

Take your time with this game and savor it. Be creative. It's a good one.

Verdict: EXCEPTIONALLY GOOD

author: Bahia8000
review_text:
Interesting game. Inscryption is pretty decent, an adventure that changes gameplay and art per acts, tons of secrets, fun gameplay and a interesting lore.

Gameplay wise game is divided into 3 acts that play pretty different. They are each different in gameplay and style each with its own secrets. The first act is pretty fun, explorable, filled with secrets, great art style and a nice pacing. Second one and third one are kinda spoiler ish, but they change, the second one is more about strategy, you do your deck and also have a little adventure. The third one is similar to the first but its less luck based and more skill. The first one is by far the best, well done gameplay system and mechanics, more secrets than any other act, characters, a very interesting place you can walk on and its kind of short but it hits the sweetspot.

Art style and visuals are interesting, they are done with care and suprisingly good, the first and third act have a dark tone while the second ressembles more like a classic rpg (a lot darker). I liked most of the designs and i liked how unique it looks.

Story wise, there are 2 parts. The direct one which is easy to understand, but it is kinda generic, the first act does a good job in keeping it mysterious and interesting, while the second and third kind of abandon that or at least doesnt execute it as well as the first. You have the indirect one, told trough IRL videos and secrets hidden in the game which is pretty complicated, but can be fun.

As for other stuff, OST was decent, nothing id listen but fits the game neatly and thats more than enough. Controls and gameplay is agile for experienced players but you can play it slow until you know more the stuff. 

Its a fun experience, Worth 7-10$, it doesnt last long, after whatever time you take on act 1, the others are 2 hours each, second maybe less, third, maybe more. First like an average of 3 hours, but if you like discovering secrets maybe more

author: Geeksace_

It lures you in with accessible mechanics, then drags you through layers of unsettling, genre-defying brilliance. For fans of rogue-likes, puzzles, and games that dare to experiment, Inscryption is a must-play.  Geeksace  .  com

author: Nazrielau05
review_text:
Act 1 :I loved the experience. Like i'm usually not into card games at all but this game's presentation and art style in general absorbed into the game almost immediately. It's dark as **** but not in a way that you couldn't see anything, you see just enough for you to put things together and try to figure out the puzzle pieces in the game. The game has this sort of gritty feel to it. I don't wanna say edgy cause it's definitely not that, but it's atmosphere is creepy and unsettling enough to make me wanna piss myself(Positive sentiment).

Act 2 :This part of the game is probably the most controversial one. It changes the presentation drastically. Even though yes the core gameplay is still the same turn based deck building card mechanics, the visuals take a huge turn here. From a heavily stylized 3D gritty horror-ish art direction, it turns itself to a pixelated 2D perspective. It was a necessary decision to build a visual direction that could explain the lore and lay out the general gameplay effectively. While i do think this visual presentation breaks the previous act's immersion and atmosphere, it was inevitable for this game to present itself in the more usual card game aethethic. BEFORE it brings you back to it's previous gritty/horror-ish atmosphere in the third act. I'm getting way ahead of myself here. But with that knowledge in mind, act 2's visual direction actually worked pretty well for a change of pace in contrast to the game's often gritty visual style.

Act 3 & overral thoughts :Absolutely my favourite part in the whole game. The visual presentation is incredibly good, the soundtrack elevates the experience, and stack it up with a genuinely well-made deck-building card game mechanics. Another thing that made this game popular is it's lore, overral story, and the Meta usage of how a video game works. They legit access some of your steam file for **** and giggles lmao i love this game. The story, the lore, and the creepy atmosphere immediately caught my attention and immersed me into the game entirely. I love it. This game is amazing. I could see myself playing this game over and over again just for the sake of it. The replayability of the title due to the rogue-lite mechanics is a huge part of my appreciations towards this game as well.

author: ddtv0236
review_text:
A Near-Perfect Blend of Strategy and Replayability. Slay the Spire is one of those rare games that hooks you in with a simple concept and keeps you coming back with endless depth. The mix of deck-building, roguelike progression, and turn-based combat is executed with near-flawless precision. Every run feels different, and the synergy between cards, relics, and enemies keeps strategy at the heart of every decision.
What really sets it apart is how well-balanced and rewarding the gameplay loop is. Whether you’re a newcomer experimenting with basic card combos or a seasoned player chasing Ascension levels, there's always something new to discover. The four unique characters add even more variety, each offering radically different playstyles that keep the game **** art style is charming and distinct, and while the visuals may not blow you away, they suit the game perfectly. The soundtrack quietly enhances the atmosphere without ever getting in the **** you love strategic thinking, risk-reward decisions, and games that respect your intelligence and time, All in all, Slay the Spire is an absolute must-play. It’s one of the most satisfying and replayable indie titles of the last decade.

author: ArxadeBugQueen
review_text: Roguelikes are, in some ways, comparable to shuffling a deck of cards: all the parts are there, they just need to be rearranged to make a random order. You would think, in this way, that a roguelite with the central gimmick of a deck of cards used for almost every action would be a match made in heaven, but Slay The Spire needed only one swing at it to prove to me that the idea should have stayed nought more than a concept for all of time. It's problem is, simply put, that it isn't an enjoyable system, and adding the two ideas together only makes for double the number of ways that you can be unfairly executed. Along with this, I just personally don't like the sense of "you will eventually just have to take damage", because it feels like if I get damaged or not is entirely out of control. Commit to dealing damage, or allow me to influence it directly. To sit in the middle just feels like poor design, and forcing that to then rely on RNG? That just makes no sense to me.

author: hac00
review_text: This game is as good as any Yugioh game that is focused on multiplayer can get, the gameplay is fast, precise and noob-friendly. It also has nice scenarios/missions that work as a single player experience and lore expansion that are pretty fun and add to the value of the game. The crafting system seems fair enough and its not pay to win, which is already a good thing in today's industry. It also has good graphics and an epic soundtrack that never looks or sounds dull. They also have done a lot of events to shake things up, though maybe they could have had some different modes, like a legacy one for those that are a little tired of the current meta, but that maybe is asking a little too much. But yeah, obviously a must play for those that like the franchise.

author: RafaelGR
review_text:
PROS

- Unlike other TCGs (Duel links etc), Master Duel is F2P. With minimal daily grind anyone can make one meta deck per month.
- Smooth Yu-Gi-Oh simulator with great visuals.
-This game managed to bring back to Yu-Gi-Oh, players that haven’t touched a single card since 10-15 years ago. Also the replay feature is a great learning tool for not top tier players.

CONS

-The game feels empty. There’s only the ranked ladder mode and the occasional event for a few days every month.
-It can be very cruel for beginners, especially those that don’t even have knowledge of the TCG.

ONE LAST NOTE

This game has a different card pool (not up-to-date) and different ban list from the TCG. Many players find that a huge minus. But I feel that this is more a plus. This way there can be more diversity in the meta (for example Mathmecks) and also avoid bad metas (Tearlament tier 0 meta)

author: eThot
review_text: This is what brought me back into Yu-Gi-Oh!, and convinced me to but my own deck (Speedroids) in real life for the first time ever. Thinking about getting Floo for tournaments and such, and Ancient Warriors for fun.

author: Cloudzy
review_text:
I've been a fan of Yu-Gi-Oh for as long as I can remember. And while not perfect, Master Duel is fine. Any deck, if the player behind it is a good pilot, can climb the ranked ladder into Diamond. It also takes luck but we don't talk about that part. Just some broad points from playing the game for a year:

1.) For a game that's purely a multiplayer online battle simulator, the economy in Master Duel is above other popular online multiplayer games. 2.) Being a best of one format leads to more degenerate strategies like stun, obsessive amounts of flood gates, entries strategies dedicated to infinite negates, and ftks, that lead to some games being just plain unfun to play.

3.) The solo gates in my opinion do a fairly good job of not only teaching players all 6 of the summoning gimmicks, but also give players a insight to a number of different archetypes in solo mode so they can get an idea of what deck they would want to make in the game proper.

4.) I do wish there was more prominent modes besides ranked, the occasional festival, and maybe solo (if you squint hard enough.) Even with casual, team battles, and duel rooms, they either don't do anything to flaunt or show those modes off, or the only real enjoyment you can get is with friends.

5.) I wish there was more of an incentive to push in ranked. With the same rank up rewards you find in Bronze also being the rewards in Diamond, I feel like asides for bragging rights, Konami doesn't currently offer enough to sit down and grind on Master Duel.

Overall, like I started with earlier, this game is fine. There's things that I both like and dislike in this game. Hopefully in the future, Komoney can fix the flaws present in Master Duel to have it reach a new level of standards.

author: Renzokuken
review_text:
Yu-Gi-Oh in general, but especially Master Duel, are a masterclass in why the developers of games of this nature need to guard closely against power creep. The majority of duels are won before they begin based on the initial coin flip, because cards are so insanely powerful, special summoning and searching mechanics are incredibly unbiqutious and deck consistency is near perfect. Win conditions these days involve going first, and special summoning a field of heavy hitting monsters with various effects that negate anything your opponent plays. The player going second, loses before they even get to play a card.

The game makes no concessions for new players, you will be dumped in with very little explanation, no ability to pause the game, and a 300 second timer to understand what your opponent is doing, make your plays and complete your turn. It's not uncommon for your opponent to pull out a 20 card combo on turn 1 to set their field up and you'll be given zero opportunity to digest this information overload.

The game is broken, the community is toxic, there are many better alternatives out there, there's absolutely no reason to download this game.

It's not enough to ban cards, this game needs a complete makeover.

author: redjohto
review_text:
Looking for a great simulator game that you can play Monopoly, Cards Against Humanity, Munchkins, and all your favorite board games and card games on?

Look somewhere else because now that the game has been released, thousands of mods are being taken off the Steam Workshop through DMCA and devs are looking to monetize every single form of popular board game out there and re-release it as DLC. They've also completely closed the nature of the game, dropping support for their DRM-free version of the title and putting content behind paywalls.

TL;DR Had potential, now it's lost because mods are going behind paywalls.

Great game to own if you're ready to shell out hundreds or thousands of dollars on virtual mods and microtransactions for a tabletop physics engine.

author: Saume
review_text:
It's a great deck builder that introduces a completely different mechanic to the traditional combat.

Diplomacy might sound like it's just combat, but with a different name, but it is not so. Combat works as you'd expect from other games in the genre. Diplomacy, however, functions fundamentally different and has potentially multiple arguments you need to deal with, while also potentially dealing with or ignoring the "side objectives". It's a refreshing mode and you often get to choose between combat or diplomacy.

This also features more choices than usual for this genre. Usually these choices end up making someone love or hate you, which can provide different benefits.

author: hardkot
review_text:
Deck Building Gem

Visual (8/10) I like general sci fy design and drawing characters, but card design a bit average, for example in battle deck you can find a lot of card with same dagger, also after upgrading cards they will have same picture and same design, so you need to double check description, for card game is a minus. Also music is average and almost don't change in different locations. Interface is very important in card games. So my first impression was - emm another one messy over headed interface, but after some games I can say that it's very helpful, you just need to get used yo it.

Gameplay (8/10) Gameplay is very addictive because you constantly upgrade your perks, cards, get new one and you can check different playstyles through one party. Great Idea to have more playable characters with different styles and story missions. On the other hand not so many perks are really unique and main strategy is pretty straightforward.

Story (7/10) Story is pretty average, but I really like characters. And the fact that to know full picture you need to play this game more than one time. I think that all sci-fi lovers can fnd some references to different universes.

So all in all, I like this game and still have it installed on my PC, so I can play it time to time. I definitely can recommend this game to everyone, neither you are big fan of card game, or just want to start your journey.

author: Gamer2077
review_text:
Appalling experience and very overrated game defines Griftlands for me. The stories are rather uninspiring, short to enjoy them and too long for the type of gameplay. The game is repetitive and very slow.

The cards offer no enjoyable synergies nor mechanics, poorly explained and unnecessarily complicated. All classes do pretty much the same things just cards are reworded.

Negotiation battles are original but don´t add that much value to the overall experience and it´s hard to fully understand what is going on. These just drag the gameplay.

Variety of monsters and graphics are about right. Unfortunately, this game looks good but all the mechanics feel very bland, it lacks depth.

author: Pteromyin0
review_text:
Deep, varied turn-based deckbuilding RPG with accessability options to switch off permadeath. I like the non-grim style and the perfectly polished UI works great with remote play on tablets. Story mode with 2D maps and quests is a great addition to the linear and repetitive structure of Slay the spire, which playstyle is covered with "realm mode". It's hard to put the game down.

However, the many (many!) mechanics are not perfectly balanced yet, a lot of the options thrown at you are not properly introduced and kind of overwhelming, as it is very easy to **** up your build while progressing, at least the first time you play. Has a steep difficulty curve too, the first two acts are easy-peasy but then it may start to become really difficult.

author: Sepherim
review_text:
Gordian Quest sin duda es un juego excelente, uno de los mejores juegos de cartas para un jugador que he jugado y ya van unos cuantos. La campaña no tiene una historia memorable, es cierto, pero cumple bien. Y fuera de eso, todo lo que es la jugabilidad, la diferencia entre los distintos personajes, la mejora de los mismos y las barajas, etc. Todo ello es simplemente inmejorable, y además tiene básicamente contenido infinito, siempre puedes ir haciendo más cosas, subiendo más niveles, haciendo dungeons y cosas así aleatorias y más difíciles. Los enemigos también están muy bien diseñados, con variedad de estilos y ataques. Y, finalmente, creo que es de los pocos juegos de cartas que consiguen hacer que el posicionamiento en el mapa de combate realmente sea muy significativo, interesante y divertido.

Gráficamente el juego peca un poco en el sector de las animaciones, pero las ilustraciones de personajes y escenarios están muy bien. El sonido también cumple bien, con una música que acompaña bien a los eventos y efectos de sonido apropiados. Y, al menos en mi experiencia, no me he encontrado con ningún bug.

Por todo ello, sin duda Gordian Quest es muy recomendable. Un 9.

review_text: Celeste kesinlikle bir başyapıt. Platform oyunu denince akla ilk gelecek yapımlardan biri. Kaybetmek veya sürekli ölmek sizi soğutmuyor, aksine 'öldükçe oynayasınız' geliyor. Aynı durum çilek toplamak için de geçerli; o meydan okuma ve rekabet hissini size çok iyi veriyor. Hikaye ilk bakışta çok ön planda gibi durmasa da, arka planda insanın iç dünyası ve psikolojisiyle ilgili derin bir anlatım var. Kısacası; eğer bir platform oyununa başlamak istiyorsanız, bu kesinlikle Celeste olmalı.

author: 0celot
review_text: This is l the greatest platformer game I have ever played. The controls are extraordinarily tight and responsive, and the level design constantly provides interesting and fun new gameplay. The game gets a bit tricky at points, but is consistently very forgiving. The game also looks and sounds quite nice, and the story is a good edition. The platforming is based in a few simple actions, but the tech can get incredibly deep. I have played 300+ hours across multiple consoles and would gladly play 300 more. Cannot recommend this game enough to any platformer fans.

Un titolo da giocare assolutamente

review_text: A really good game. At its core it is just a platformer, but it has some really advanced and interseting mechanics, introduced gradually meanning you are never confused about it. The difficulty is just right, and there are plenty of ways to make it easier/harder. The story is really good, and the music and art are both fantastic. If you like platformers, play this game. If you have never tried a platformer, play this game. If you like good games, play this game. The only real criticism I have is that diagonal inputs are a bit finicky with a controller, which can get a bit frustrating. However it is a relativly minor issue.

author: RetroMatero
review_text:
Todo el mundo en su momento me ha tratado de convencer para que juegue a este juego, que por ser indie, que por recordar a los juegos de los 90, que bla, bla, bla.
Y voy a ser sincero. Lo consideré sobrevalorado en su momento, y lo sigo considerando así. Tuve que terminarme este juego a remolque. Y odio hacer eso cuando quiero jugar a un juego, pues me deja eso de que no quiero volver a tocarlo más en mi vida.
El apartado gráfico: meh, no es nada malo, pero eso no salva lo poco inspirado que está el diseño artístico.
La música: podría dedicar tiempo a escucharla, pero el resto de apartados hizo que la música quedara en un cuarto plano. Lo que me da bastante repelús son las "voces" que les pusieron a los personajes, ese horrible balbuceo que le metieron a Celeste es un dolor en el oído. Hace que no me tome la historia del juego en serio.
Y hablando de la historia: ni siquiera tiene una historia, sino una EXCUSA para perder mi tiempo y paciencia en este horrible juego.
El diseño de niveles: a los creadores del juego, se nota que odian los videojuegos pero les gusta sacar dinero fácil. Era buena idea combinar mecánicas de Metroidvania con diseños propios de un demente? Si este juego hubiese sido creado con mecánicas de los 90 (vidas limitadas y sin guardar partida), muchos jugones irían a sus casas con antorchas para lincharles.
Y la jugabilidad: sería muy buena si no fuese por el planteamiento del diseño de niveles. Cuanto daño hicieron juegos como Hollow Knight, o Super Meat Boy (aunque SMB es muy divertido y por lo menos da unos respiros en un nivel).

RESUMIENDO: Si eres masoquista... una sesión de BSDM es un picnic al lado de esta cosa más que sobrevalorada. No se lo recomendaría ni a mi peor enemigo.

author: johko
review_text:
For years I had been eyeing the infamous Cuphead, the notoriously difficult run-and-gun platformer that made everyone throw their hands up and say "this game is hard." I was never all that into run-and-gun games – the only ones I enjoyed were I Wanna Be the Guy and Valorant (hah). Megaman wasn't really my thing and I always associated the run-and-gun genre with confusing hitboxes and awkward controls. I knew that Cuphead was visually stunning -- I could never stop looking at it – but I just wasn't sure if it was fun. Still, its reputation of being a truly difficult game drew me in and I gave it a shot. And it's fun. Really fun.

I'm not good enough of a writer to give Cuphead the praise it deserves in the art and sound department. It's a masterpiece. Tasteful, clever, delightful, pristine, maybe even flawless – these words come to mind when I think about what Cuphead looks and sounds like. But you knew that because you've seen the trailer and the promotional art and probably also watched some streamer or Youtuber play it. So read on to learn more about how the game actually plays.

One aspect of the game that I didn't expect to enjoy so much and also enjoy more and more as I play the game is the customizable loadout feature of the game. Being able to switch weapons, ultimate abilities, and charms seemed unnecessary at first, complicating what could have been an elegantly simple game. But I had so much fun switching out my weapons and abilities to suit my playstyle for each level that I can't imagine playing Cuphead any other way.

One of the coolest things about Cuphead is the strategic element. Make no mistake: Cuphead is first and foremost a skill-based game. You won’t be able to “strategize” your way up to the Devil if you don’t have some basic platforming skills, at least not on “regular” mode. However, I’d venture to say that you’d have an almost equally difficult time if you don’t use your brain. I went into Cuphead expecting it to be a muscle-memory trainer in that I’d just play each level that was impossibly difficult over and over again until my fingers somehow learned how to dodge every attack and get the win. But I noticed that I could make a boss considerably easier just by studying the patterns and strategizing the most optimal moves. Where are the safest areas of the screen? When is the best time to switch weapons to maximize damage? Should I hang up in the upper portion of the screen to lob torpedoes or hang back to preserve my life? I found that I could magically make certain sequences that initially seemed impossible into cakewalks just by playing smart. And that is not a bad thing. Cuphead is not only an action-packed finger gym but also a game about experimentation and creative thinking.

Now, I'm going to start nitpicking. My main gripe about the actual gameplay of Cuphead is the frustrating RNG projectile moments. If projectile A is coming at me and I jump to evade it... and projectile B launches while I'm still in my evasion arc from projectile A and collides with me, I get frustrated. Now, you might just tell me to "get good" or whatever because there are probably Cuphead-heads out there that can 100% the game without taking a tick of damage but at my level, I have definitely felt robbed of my life just due to bad luck. It’s not a big problem, and I get why the RNG is in there but that didn’t make it any less frustrating.

Another small detractor from the game was the order of difficulty. Maybe I found a style of gameplay that made certain bosses easier, but I felt that some bosses were way out of order in terms of difficulty. Not a huge gripe, but why is the Devil easier to beat than some of the earlier bosses?

All-in-all, I love Cuphead. My plan for this game was simply to beat it so I could tell people that I beat Cuphead. I didn’t need all the perfect scores or anything like that, I was never one to be attracted by the idea of 100%-ing a game. I was going to beat it once, write this review, and be done with it. But I’m still playing. I can’t stop. I don’t know what I’ll do if I stop playing this game.

Verdict: SUPERB

review_text: Simply a fantastic experience, especially in co-op. The game is extremely challenging, but that only makes the rewards feel greater. At the start of each boss or level, you think defeating them is impossible - but as you learn the patterns, eventually you get the upper hand, and that feeling of triumph never gets old. And we don’t have to talk about the graphics and sound: unique and absolutely stunning.

author: Coatlith
review_text: Le jeu nous propose un jeu de plateforme qui nous change des Mario très redondants avec une D.A sublime et des boss très réussis qui ont tous leur particularité. Ce côté cartoon rend sa complétion très satisfaisante d'autant plus que l'on peut y jouer à deux. Certains boss peuvent paraitre insurmontable mais comme un jeu Fromsoftware il suffit de s'accrocher pour y arriver. Je recommande d'y jouer à deux la frustration y est moins présente même si les boss ont évidemment plus de vie. En point négatif on peut tout de même noter une trop grosse différence de la puissance des améliorations disponibles et les niveaux run&gun qui sont bien en dessous des boss (même si ces  niveaux ne sont pas obligatoires au final). En bref CupHead est un excellent jeu indépendant que je vous conseille de faire d'autant plus qu'il n'est pas cher et pas trop long pour ceux qui ont peur des jeux longs.

author: Hushy2300isme
review_text:
The gameplay is more comparable to Sonic than Wario Land as there is a huge emphasis on speed and momentum especially if you aim to 100% which requires getting every collectable and secret in each level while keeping a combo.
Each level introduces new mechanics including transformations which are very reminiscent of Wario's transformations in Wario Land, there are also some difficult but fair bosses that are also similar to bosses in Wario Land. The art style is simple but charming and the soundtrack is extremely energetic.
The level design is perfect for speedrunning and the move set has lots of depth which made replaying levels over and over again for 100% incredibly fun.
All of this stuff may be overwhelming at first but mastering it made me feel like a speedrunner and gave me so much adrenaline, this is a game I could never get bored of.

author: dogukansapmz
review_text:
Giriş

Bağımsız bir ekip olan Tour De Pizza’nın ilk büyük projesi Pizza Tower, oldukça hızlı tempolu bir 2D platform oyunu. Platform türündeki diğer yapımlar arasında bile kendine özgü bir yer edinen Pizza Tower, yalnızca platform oyunu hayranlarını değil, her türden oyuncuyu kolayca kendine çekebilecek bir yapım.

Oyunda Türkçe dil desteği yok ancak zaten metin miktarı yok denecek kadar az olduğundan bu bir sorun oluşturmuyor.

Hikâye ve Atmosfer

Peppino Spaghetti adındaki İtalyan restoran sahibi, borçları nedeniyle dükkanını kapatmak zorunda kalır. Bu borçları ödeyebilmek için ise Pizza Tower’a girer. Yani hikâye oldukça basit ve oyunun da hikâye anlatımına önem vermemesi, bunu bir sorun olmaktan çıkarıyor.
Oyun yapısı şöyle ilerliyor: Her katta 4 bölüm bulunuyor. Bu bölümlerden kazandığınız paralarla bir boss odası satın alıyorsunuz. Boss’u yendiğinizde bir sonraki kata geçiyorsunuz. Döngü bu şekilde devam ediyor. İlk bakışta metroidvania havası verse de aslında oldukça bölüm bölüm lineer bir ilerleyişi var.

️Oynanış Mekanikleri️

Pizza Tower genel olarak basit ama akıcı bir oynanışa sahip. Bir saldırı tuşunuz, bir zıplama tuşunuz var. Zıplarken saldırı tuşuna basarsanız “slam attack”, yukarı doğru saldırı tuşuna basarsanız “jump attack” yapıyorsunuz. Oyunu özel kılan en önemli mekanik ise koşu tuşu. Bu sayede hızlanarak hem parkuru çok hızlı geçebiliyor hem de hızlanma ile gelen mini mekani̇kleri kullanarak basit kontrolleri çok daha çeşitli hâle getirebiliyorsunuz. Kısacası: Öğrenmesi kolay, ustalaşması zor.

Savaş mekaniği de basit. Ana amaç hızlı ilerlemek olduğundan düşmanlar, neredeyse “yürüyen tuzak” gibi. Yeterli çeşitlilikleri var ve boss’lar dışında tüm düşmanlar tek vuruşta ölüyor, böylece tempoyu bozmuyorlar.

Boss savaşları ise şaşırtıcı derecede başarılı. Her boss’un iki fazı var. İlk fazda 4-5 farklı saldırı kullanıyorlar, ikinci fazda ise hem bu saldırılar hızlanıyor hem de sahaya ekstra düşmanlar ekleniyor. Sonuç: kaotik ama keyifli dövüşler.

Keşif elementleri üçe ayrılıyor: 10 dolar veren kafesler , üç gizli mini oda , önce anahtarını bulup ardından girebileceğiniz gizli oda. Kafesler ilerleme için zorunlu, diğerleri ise tamamlanma yüzdesini ve bölüm puanınızı artırıyor.

Basit yapısına rağmen, sadece bu koşu mekaniğiyle bile oyunun bu kadar eğlenceli olması , sadece belirli bir şeyi güzel yapmanın bile bazen yeterli olacağına kanıt niteliğinde.

️Ek Olarak️

Oyun, elle çizilmiş hoş cartoon gibi bir sanat tarzına sahip. Mizahi tonu, karakter tasarımları ve bölüm dizaynıyla uyum içinde. Ortam tasarımları hem eğlenceli hem de tema ile bütünleşmiş.

Müzikler ve ses efektleri beklentinin üzerinde. Her parça, oyunun enerjik temposuna uyum sağlıyor. Sesler ise hem mizahı hem de atmosferi destekleyici.

️️Teknik Durum ve Performans️️

Teknik açıdan kusursuz. Hiçbir hata, bug veya optimizasyon sorunu yaşamadım.

Sonuç ve Değerlendirme

 Oldukça hızlı ve eğlenceli oynanış
 Kaliteli boss tasarımları
 Mükemmel sanat tarzı
 Güzel mizah
 Harika ses ve müzikler

Pizza Tower, türündeki çoğu oyundan ayrılarak herkesin ilgisini çekebilecek bir yapım. Zorluğu aşırı değil ama kolay da sayılmaz. Bundan rahatsız olanlar uzak durabilir. Ancak farklı ve enerjik bir deneyim arayan herkesin denemesi gereken bir oyun.

🅐🅛🅣🅘🅝

author: ScrempBootyCall
review_text:
I didn't really want to play Pizza Tower at all because I thought it looked gross, but I promised my friend that I'd play it if they played Ghost Trick and here we are. The game does look gross but in like a sick nasty radical way. It is astounding how good it feels to move fast in this video game and I don't understand how Sonic couldn't do this for 25 years. Every part of Peppino's arsenal feels specifically made to make going fast feel like you just had intercourse in a sick nasty radical way. I love his dives and his different speedy punches they're really fun. I used to hate little things about Peppino's moveset like the way he dashes and the different ways that he throws enemies, but the more I play the game the more I am just infatuated with the way he does everything. It might be my favorite game to control behind Celeste it is so insanely good.

The animation is so incredibly amazing. If you hold down the taunt button Peppino just starts busting it down sexual style and that's chill. I love the little Tv in the top right that shows little buddy and how much character it gives him. I'm usually not paying attention because of how fast he is going but every so often I'll take a little peaksie up at the screen and this jokester will be making a very funny face! John Gutter is so fugly that it won't seem like it at first but every single other stage is an absolute feast to the eyes.

Speaking of the stages, it is amazing what lengths that they've gone to making every single one so unique. One stage you'll be running through the desert into a UFO and then you're going to space and then you're at the whims of Mort the Chicken from the hit game Mort the Chicken on the PS1 and then you're in Freddy Fazbear's Pizzeria and then you are in war it is so fun. A big part of the stages that I love is that the devs are not afraid to make a gimmick to fit a stage and keep it in the stage. I love Mort the Chicken as much as the next guy but I don't think he would really fit any other stage in the game, and he doesn't need to.

When I first played this game it was a very low 8 out of 10, then after a bunch of time playing it was a 9 out of 10, and at the very moment everything finally clicked it became one of the easiest 10 out of 10s that I have ever experienced.

author: OnlyOneHere
review_text: This game currently ranks #1 in Top 150 highest rated Steam games of 2023 by game reviewers. I had to see what the fuss is all about, only to find out that this is nothing more than a generic 2D platformer. The pizzas with the red lips make annoying noises. The running animations are very cringeworthy. The pizza guy always makes incredibly cringeworthy faces. To make matter worse, there is a stupid TV on the right-top corner where the pizza guy makes even cringier faces. When you pass a level, there is music that is extremely cringeworthy. It is over-exaggerated and tries too hard to be upbeat in a pathetic attempt at making players excited when they win. It didn't make me excited in the slightest. All this cringe made me grab my monitor and slam it against the floor out of frustration. There is no multiplayer, but I didn't expect one at a cheap price. Did I say cheap? The greedy developers are charging $20 for a flash game. I immediately refunded this garbage after nearly 2 hours. I don't want to torture myself any further with this garbage. Besides, there are plenty of free flash games on the internet. I don't recommend this game at all, unless you like looking at cringeworthy faces literally every second. ● P.S. I originally wrote this review back in early 2023, so that's when it ranked #1 on Steam and I had to see what all the fuss is about. All the crazy things that happened to me this summer made me realize it's best for me to just quit gaming altogether. College Football 25 would've been my last review. I have 0 faith on these lazy and greedy devs, so that was the plan. But after the deletion of this review, I'll postphone my departure. I'm not letting you toy-collecting millennials get away with controlling the narrative, and I'll let these devs know why it's a mistake to listen to you. I'll make sure they develop a highly successful $70 game (regardless if I like it) that will trigger the nerds, before I quit gaming for good. Anyways, I slammed my monitor because of this game. So it deserved this score, Metacritic. Speaking of which, I need to pick up a new TV after destroying it. When I come back, I'll continue gaming.

author: dogukansapmz
review_text:
Giriş

Devolver çatısı altındaki bağımsız stüdyo Sabotage’ın ilk oyunu olan The Messenger, 8-bit , 16-bit retro tarzında ninja temalı bir platform oyunu. Özellikle Celeste tarzı zorlu platform oyunlarını sevenlerin ilgisini çekebilecek bir yapım.

Hikâye ve Atmosfer

Ninja köyümüzde sakin bir gün geçirirken şeytanlar saldırıya geçer. Tam her şey bitecek derken, Batının Kahramanı ortaya çıkar ve saldırıyı durdurur. Ardından bize bir parşömen vererek bunu dağın tepesindeki Üç Bilge’ye ulaştırmamızı, dünyanın kaderinin buna bağlı olduğunu söyler. Biz de bu yolculuğa çıkarız. Kısaca bu şekilde , oldukça basit görünen bir hikayesi var.

Oyun, başlangıç , final ve arada görünen minik sinematikler dışında hikâyeyi pek doğrudan anlatmasa da çevresel detaylarla derinleşen, özenle kurgulanmış bir yapıya sahip. Klasik bir kahramanlık hikâyesi gibi görünse de, aslında çok daha farklı , şaşırtıcı ve derin bir yöne evriliyor.

Oyunda bir “sahte son” bulunuyor. Gerçek sona ulaşmak için tüm collectible’ları toplamak gerekiyor. Ancak bu, diğer oyunlarda olduğu gibi sadece küçük bir ek sahneyle bitmiyor; oyunun içinde mantıklı bir şekilde açıklanıyor ve tatmin edici bir şekilde işleniyor. Bu yüzden 'sahte son' ve 'gerçek son' olarak 2 farklı sonun varlığı bu oyun içerisinde oldukça mantıklı bir hale açılıyor.

Harita tasarımı, başlangıçta lineer tarzda olsa da oyunun ilerleyen kısımlarında metroidvania tarzına dönüşüyor. Başlangıçta geçtiğimiz her yerden yeni bölgeler açılınca sanki yeni bir oyunu oynuyormuşsunuz hissi veriyor.

️Oynanış Mekanikleri️

Oyuna başladığında oldukça basit bir side scroller aksiyon platform oynadığınızı hissettiren bir oynanışa sahip oyun. Genel olarak mekaniksel derinliği oldukça sıradan oynanışı basit bir yapım gibi. Bu açıdan oyunun oldukça basit ve öğrenmesi kolay bir oynanışı olduğunu söyleyebiliriz. Ama oyunun ikinci yarısından sonra , oyunun mekaniklerinin zirve noktasına çıkmasıyla birlikte oldukça Celeste seviyesinde kaliteye sahip bir platform oyunu oynadığınızı hissediyorsunuz. Yani kolay başlayan ama mekaniksel olarak fazla gelişen bir yapısı olduğu söylenebilir.

Başta dediğim gibi oyunun gerçek sonuna ulaşmak için belirli şeyleri toplamamız gerekiyor. Bu toplama işlemi ise Celeste'teki özel bölgeler ve çilekler mantığında. Normal oyundaki platform oldukça ortalama zorlukta iken bu toplamamız gereken item'ları almak için yapmamız gereken platformlar oldukça zor ve oyunun mekaniksel derinliğini uç noktalara kadar kullanacak şekilde dizayn edilmiş.

Harita tasarımı başta oldukça sade , sadece aralarda gizli odalar bulduğun gizli odalarla ilerlerken belirli bir dönüm noktasından sonra metroidvania'ya dönen bir yapıya evriliyor ve oyunda daha önce gittiğiniz her bölgeden yepyeni bölgeler ortaya çıkıyor.

Düşman çeşitliliği az ama yerinde. Gereksiz sayıda düşman yerine, platform tasarımını öne çıkaran bir denge tercih edilmiş. Her bölgenin kendine özgü teması var ve çoğu bölümün sonunda kaliteli, çok aşamalı boss dövüşleri bulunuyor. Bu boss'ların kalitesinin oldukça üst seviyede olduğunu söyleyebilirim. Hepsi genel olarak 2 ya da 3 faza sahip şekilde tasarlanmış ve birbirinden tamamıyla farklı tarzda boss'lar.

️Ek Olarak️

Oyun kendine özgü çok güzel bir sanat tasarımı kullanmış. Oyunun başında oynadığımız karakter ile oyun 8-bit eski tarzda ilerlerken belirli bir dönüm noktasından sonra oyun karakteri 16-bit tarzla değişen bir şekilde tasarlanmış. Böylelikle çok güzel bir görüntü çeşitliliği ve kendine haslık yaratılmış. Zaten retro havasını oldukça benimseyen bir yapı olduğundan animasyonlar ve genel tasarım oldukça buna bağlı kalmış ama aynı zamanda modernliği de hala kendinde barındırmakta.

Müziklerin oldukça kaliteli olduğunu söyleyebilirim. Her bölgeye özel birden fazla müzik bestesinin yapıldığı ve hepsinin belirli bir kalite seviyesinin üstünde olduğunu söyleyebilirim.

Oyunun en iyi yaptığı şeylerden biri mizah. Mizah ise oyunun en güçlü yanlarından biri. Dördüncü duvarı sık sık kıran, absürt ve kendini ciddiye almayan bir anlatımı var. Cidden çok özel bir yapım.

Çok Oyunculu ve Ek İçerikler 

Oyun bittikten sonra bedava olacak şekilde 3 boss dövüşünün ve 2 farklı bölgenin eklendiği bir DLC'ye sahip. Bu DLC genel olarak oyunun yaptığı seviyede bir kaliteyi korurken aynı zamanda kendine özgü ana oyunda hiç görmediğimiz çok mükemmel mekaniksel değişiklikler de getirmiş.

Sonuç ve Değerlendirme

Oyunun son yarısının aşırı üst seviye olması
Güzel evrimleşen bir platform
Oldukça fazla karakter gelişimi
Kaliteli müzikler
Oldukça komik ve kaliteli mizah

Oyunun ilk yarısının oldukça ortalama kalması
Oyunun metroidvania'ya dönmesinden sonra önceden geçtiğimiz yerleri tekrar tekrar dolanma gereksinimi

The Messenger, Celeste seviyesinde kaliteli bir platform deneyimi sunarken, kendine has mizahı , mekanikleri ve sürprizleriyle öne çıkıyor. Oynayan herkesi memnun edecek özel bir yapım. Kesinlikle tavsiye ederim.

🅐🅛🅣🅘🅝

author: Korelis
review_text:
A cute retro-style indie platformer, just like many other games in this genre. But oh boy does this game feel different. First, let's begin by what really matters : gameplay. This game is really fluid, with quick but still precise movement. The characters are a masterpiece of design, with their own sense of humour, quite absurd yet very effective. The time travel mechanic, with this completely different 16-bit style is a great game mechanic, that allows for exciting challenges. The Metroidvania part where the levels that you got through in a classic left-to-right 2D platformer show much more depth is a great idea, although some may find it a bit repetitive. And finally, the OST. Probably one of my favorites OST, with this 8-bit style music that where most songs ended up on my playlist. The NewGame+ mechanic also allows for some replayability if you really enjoy the game.
In conclusion, The Messenger is definitely a great game, and itreally is worth your time.

author: Magenta_black
review_text: Tedioso y repetitivo en la mayor parte de aspectos, pero creativo, para mí fue de calidad muy inconsistente, con picos muy bajos y también altos, pudo haber sido mejor, me hizo reír muchas veces el vendedor.

author: Baiano02
review_text: Jogo incrivel! Me apaixonei pela arte linda do jogo, história muito cativante e o jogo é simplesmente viciante. Diálogos engraçados e não tediosos, e dá pra perceber que foi feito com muito carinho.

author: APolChrome
review_text: (Reseña sacada de mi cuenta de Steam: APolChrome) The Messenger es un juegazo. Y es que cuando lo empiezas te esperas que es un plataformas más, que está entretenido, pero ya está. Créeme que no. Por si acaso quieres jugarlo, va a contener spoilers la reseña, así que te recomiendo no seguir leyendo o leer sabiendo las consecuencias. Después de esa parte plataformera, el juego se convierte en un metroidvania sobresaliente que también combina de forma magistral la exploración y el plataformeo, haciéndolo un indie maravilloso. Voy a hablar largo y tendido, así que poneros cómodos y empezamos.Jugablemente, es una maravilla. Al principio nos presenta un plataformas de juego de los 80 que está bastante bien. Un diseño de niveles bastante bueno, bastantes mecánicas que hacen a cada zona única, unas boss-fights increíbles y unos controles y mecánicas de movimiento sobresalientes. Hasta aquí, el juego está bastante bien, pero es que en un momento el juego pega un giro tremendo y ahora sorpresa, puedes viajar en el tiempo y tienes que recorrer todas las zonas como si de un metroidvania se tratase. Esto puede sonar a extensión artificial. Pero es que aquí reside el núcleo y mejores partes del **** exploración que se luce The Messenger es una barbaridad. Recorrer los mundos es una gozada (gracias a las anteriormente mencionadas mecánicas de movimiento y controles) y realmente sientes que hay muchas cosas por hacer en zonas que son realmente pequeñas. Los sellos de poder, por ejemplo, expanden la exploración una barbaridad y nos permiten tener retos más difíciles apartados de la historia principal. Pero de la mecánica principal que quiero hablar es de los viajes en el tiempo.Estos nos permiten alternar entre los 8 y 16 bits (cosa que le da un toque cómico al juego) y así cambiar el entorno en el que estamos. Esto al principio no se nota mucho, pero la mecánica se desarrolla muchísimo a lo largo del juego, basando muchos puzzles del entorno solo en cambiar de tiempo para poder avanzar o teniendo hasta mecánicas únicas en una línea que no hay en la otra. Donde más me han gustado las ideas a mí ha sido en el futuro. Siento que hay más variedad de jugabilidad, las boss-fights son sobresalientes y tiene mecánicas únicas que lo hacen diferente.Audiovisualmente, es un 10. El juego visualmente es incrreíble, tanto en el estilo de 8 como en el de 16, ofreciendo un diseño de zonas, enemigos, personajes y de todo. Pero es que ya la banda sonora de este videojuego no tiene ningún tipo de sentido. No entiendo cómo alguien puede hacer temazo tras temazo y encima dos versiones y que todas queden bien. Es una barbaridad. Encima mientras juegas, es como volver a los 80/90. Increíble.Narrativamente, es donde me parece que más flojea The Messenger. No está mal y de hecho la trama me ha gustado bastante, pero cómo se cuenta la historia es un poco raro. Sí que es verdad que los personajes están muy bine hechos y tiene un humor bastante bueno, pero la historia se concentra sobre todo en el final, haciéndolo un poco extraño. Aunque lo compensa también con pequeñas historias que están bien. Está lejos de ser malo en este apartado, pero simplemente, es donde peor está el **** resumen, The Messenger es una obra maestra moderna. Que no te deje engañar ese estilo simple y de los 80 o te parezca que va a ser un juego retro, porque estás ante una carta de amor al medio y a los juegos clásicos, que sabe innovar en lo suyo y ofrecer un juego diferente y divertidísimo que te enganchará hasta que te lo pases. Un must-play sin ningún tipo de duda

author: TrueOptimist
review_text: One of the best 2D platformers out there. Fast paced combat/movement and puzzle platforming with lots of secret goodies and upgrades to grab along the way.

author: caiovito
review_text: The Messenger é um jogo que cativa por sua premissa bem simples, gameplay e mecânicas precisas, ótima história e personagens, trilha sonora acima da média e gráficos lindos, aliados a belíssima direção de arte.Tudo isso culmina em um jogo divertido, em que o elemento de plataforma se destaca, surpreendendo o jogador com novos desafios a cada área que é liberada. Aliado a isso temos excelentes boss fights e mobs estrategicamente posicionados para dificultar nossa aventura o suficiente. Isso torna a gameplay bem dinâmica e instigante pois ela é bem fluida e tem a dose certa de desafio, sendo assim um jogo quase que perfeitamente balanceado.

author: finalbosspro
review_text: The Messenger es un juegazo sin ningún tipo de dudas. De los creadores de Sea of Stars, Este juego empieza siendo un juego de acción y plataformas y termina siendo un metroidvania exquisito. Una música excelente así como un escenarios llenos de trampas para sacar lo mejor de nosotros. La experiencia puede durarte 10-15 horas pero tiene una gran cantidad de tareas secundarias y retos desafiantes.

author: Zekigin
review_text:
The gameplay in this game is super good and feels great and greater, with well-designed stages rhythm the continuous gameplay fun and skill progression keep you engaged. Surviving and solving interactive areas lead to boss fights. The pixel-art design is top-notch, and the story is captivating sinful witty and humorous dialogue. Much content n playtime.
《 ORIGINAL 》

author: Babutto
review_text:
Pros.:
- Great characters and dialogues.
- Great idea of platformer then mutating into mild Metroidvania.
- Weapons - not many but effective.
- Mechanics mostly are intuitive.
- So many Easter Eggs about previous franchises and games (Ninja Gaiden, Battletoads at least).
- Friendly to achievement seekers.
- Special secret areas.

Cons.:
- I hated that "hit" jump. Why didn't do normal double jump? Because of that some seal areas are quite annoying.
- Phantom and Muse - I found these names quite lame for the characters. But it's personal thing.

The game is awesome. Buy and play :D

author: maject
review_text: good game . I can feel the respect  . I like the way it changing music version .the walkthrough is smooth and satisfied .

author: Zer0TheHer0
review_text: Good at beginning, it becomes incredibly frustrating and irritating after a certain point.

author: pianoguy13
review_text: Fantastic 2d platformer/action game. It's not quite the level of polish and perfection that Celeste and Katana Zero are, but it's still an incredible game, with very satisfying gameplay and abilities. One thing with many lesser 2d platformers I see is that they tend to increase difficulty by added cheap tactics and unfair elements to the obstacles. I loved how Messenger was pretty straightforward, and you'd know what to expect with everything just by briefly observing it. Every success was earned, and every failure was my fault. If I knew how to clear something, and timed it correctly, I could do it every time without fail.

Never did i read something as stupidly bias in my life before as this and almost every point is wrong. Game is not flawless but still one of the best platformers ive played in years.

author: Xrayplayer
review_text: It's an outstanding side-scrolling game I can't explain much more in detail about how great it is and why it is soo good, it's a fresh new take on the series that makes the game a step in the right direction for more installments.

author: 29ILDAR29
review_text: Отличная игра. Если ожидаете от неё того же типа геймплея, что и в оригинальном лопатном рыцаре - проходите мимо. Это аркадный рогалик с основным движением сверху вниз, а не слева направо, как в оригинале. Некоторых механик из оригинала больше нет. Но я не могу назвать это минусом. Единственный возможный минус - это сложность игры. Но может я просто мало наиграл. И потом, сложность - понятие относительное. Кому-то будет в самый раз.

author: Jt0429
review_text:
Good-
The core Shovel Knight gameplay has aged like fine wine; The updated look manages to maintain Shovel Knight’s aesthetics without going overboard; Simple progression and story mean more time to actually play the game.

Bad-
Music can get repetitive; Randomly-generated levels mean less overall challenge.

Thoughts-
Ultimately, however, Shovel Knight Dig manages to pull off just about everything it was going for. The new roguelite gameplay loop works quite well with the protagonist’s limited-but-adaptable move set, and the game does as much as it can to engender the “one more run” mindset. It doesn’t bog you down with an overly-complex story or complicated progression systems. All it really wants you to do is dig downwards, and have fun doing it.

author: Xedmed
review_text:
The game's a pile of balls. Loses all the balancing from other Rogue Likes by having:

Infinitely spawning enemies.
The most sluggish combat (1:1 with OG shovel knight. But OG Shovel Knight worked with the combat).
An instakill drill which spawns when you sit in an area for a minute, meaning you can't plot your route or attack plan. 
A constant feeling that this should have been a regular platformer. 

It gets a 4 as it's music is amazing. But overall avoid it. Play Dead Cells instead if you want a decent Rogue Like.

author: davygravy93
review_text:
Good-
The core Shovel Knight gameplay has aged like a fine fecal matter; The updated look manages to maintain shovel knights boring retro aesthetics while also going overboard; Simple minded progression mean big idiot like a whole lot.
Bad- Music can get repetitive, because it ****; Randomly-generated levels means the level design **** too. Thoughts- Ultimate cheeseburger, however, Shovel Knight Dig manages to pull off just about everything that's terrible with modern games, but I'm an idiot so I love it.

author: GameforGamers
review_text: bad game, it's a disgrace to the original shovel knight, how they managed to destroy the core of the OG game is beyond my comprehension.

author: goccezar
review_text: Amazing game! Everything fits together perfectly. The incredible soundtrack, the challenging gameplay, the charismatic characters, the difficulty just right. Only the story mode is a bit too short, in my opinion. Even so, I highly recommend it.

author: efsanesavas
review_text: Really really great music. Great rhythm game to be honest. And it was one of those games where I listen to the music to this day. It doesn't matter if you are a beginner or a master of rhythm games. You'll love this game.

author: FuriousAegon
review_text:
Just Shapes & Beats is amazing!
The main game alongside with its DLC Lost Chapter is outstanding.
The title of the game says what’s happening in the game - Shapes and **** how these shapes and beats are executed is magnificent.
Gameplay provides player with a huge variation of colorful and challenging level, yet there’s a casual mode, but I find original difficulty fair and giving player a satisfaction upon defeating a boss or difficult level.
Unfortunately I cannot say something like that about lore or story, the only thing I can say it **** it only serves as justification of gameplay.
Soundtrack is consists of lots of cool songs from some famous musicians such as Bossfight, Chipzel, Nitro Fun, Shirobon and **** the soundtrack is magnificent.
Also these arguments also perfectly fit DLC, but I’d like to add that Undertale Easter eggs, and even a whole level called Spider Dance is pleasing to see.
8.5/10

author: TTVHeadshot56
review_text: I remember the first time I played this game; I completed the game in a single session (would recommend) with a friend in 2 player mode. The music is PHENOMINAL and at some points i got up and started dancing. Sometimes it can be a little slow doing the 3 level parts to unlock the next story part, but the boss fights make it all worth it. This game is a blast and I love it! It's sad that the game isn't very re-playable though as I crave more jsb. My favorite Boss fight is the pyramid as the music and visual effects are stunning! 10/10 play this game!

author: maxdechiaro
review_text: Sarebbe bellissimo trovare nella tracklist anche dei brani di undertale. Cmq il gioco è quasi perfetto.

author: 4y4
review_text: One of the most enjoyable split screen games for 4 players. Me and my friends had great time playing this.

author: aktasakinarda
review_text: Shapes, beats and extremely fun gameplay. (But the game is short 3.2 hours) Musics are great too.

author: Epic_Gamer_07
review_text: This game has AMAZING music and really good graphics. It is simple, yet challenging, and the music and shapes/attacks are perfectly synced. A must for anyone who likes addicting music-based games.

author: DragonHeart000
review_text:
I first heard about this game from a YouTuber I watch on his Favorite Game Animation of 2018 video. When I saw it there I found it kinda interesting, how can a 2d game with just simple shapes be considered one of the best-animated games of the year? I looked a bit more into the game and figured the concept seemed fun and it had some songs I like so I bought it to give it a try and boy was it worth it.

First off Just Shapes & Beats 100% deserved that spot on New Frame Plus's video. The animations are sublime. You'd never expect to see simple shapes convey such personality but Berzerk Studio does it so well! Everything in the entire game is just loaded with personality and creativity to the point that you can just get a feel for the dev team behind it and how much they enjoyed it themselves.

The only negative note I have on it is that my typical rule of thumb is that I get 1 hour per $1 I spend but in this game, I beat story in 4 hours. Typically this would make me more hesitant to recommend but with how beautifully crafted it is I am totally fine with letting this one issue slide. This issue could also be taken care of if the devs release a way to make custom maps, this would become one of my most played games if that was a thing.

All in all this game is wonderful and I would highly recommend it!

author: Virus_Driggy
review_text: I like bullet hell games and rythem games. Its a pretty good game. Controls very good. It has a very simple look to it, well it is just shapes whit edm in the background so ofc its simple.

author: DosluQ
review_text: Unrailed!, tek başınıza veya arkadaşlarınızla oynayabileceğiniz eğlenceli bir tren rayı döşeme oyunu. Amacınız, treninizi mümkün olduğunca uzağa götürmek. İlk oynayışlarda oldukça keyifli olsa da, 3-4 saatlik bir deneyimin ardından sürekli aynı şeyleri yapmak sıkıcı hale gelebiliyor.

author: LT_Gruber
review_text:
Fun game with fresh concept.

(Played via Remote Play)

There are many small indie games out there, many of them with exactly the same concept, idea, game mode etc. However, Unrailed! has something unique. You need to transport a train from point A to point B, while completing the tracks under its wheels. 

You need to collect stone and wood to build tracks, cool down the engine from time to time using a water bucket and keep an eye of the movement of the train at all times. The multitasking makes it fun, especially with friends, where everyone has a different task.

After each successful mission, you can buy upgrades for your train carts, making the later stages a little easier. However, in the later stages, the train will move faster and faster, giving you less time to complete the track.

When your little train crashes, it is game over. All progress, upgrades and carts are lost, and you may start over again. 

Unrailed! uses simple, "Minecraft" graphics which are fine for a simple game like this. The character models look silly and hilarious, especially when moving.

The sound effects and music are alright and just play nicely in the background.

Control wise, this game is very simple and easy to learn. 

Overall, I liked Unrailed! especially with some friends on a Saturday night. It offers some quick casual fun and with its unique concept, I would surely recommend it.

author: IliaGlobal
review_text:
Unrailed! - это захватывающая кооперативная игра, которая оставляет за собой след в сердцах игроков благодаря своей простой, но увлекательной механике и динамичному геймплею. Путешествие через бесконечные просторы генерируемого случайным образом мира, поезда и ваших навыков командной работы - вот что делает Unrailed! настоящим приключением. Задача строить железную дорогу перед движущимся поездом может показаться простой на бумаге, но в игре это становится настоящим испытанием реакции, координации и планирования.
Графика и звуковое оформление игры выполнены в простом, но привлекательном пиксельном стиле, что добавляет игре шарма и делает её приятной для глаз. Благодаря динамическому изменению местности и разнообразию препятствий каждая игра остается уникальной и заставляет вас снова и снова возвращаться за новыми вызовами.
Однако, несмотря на все свои достоинства, Unrailed! страдает от отсутствия глубины геймплея после нескольких часов игры. Вместо того, чтобы предложить игрокам более сложные механики или разнообразные цели, игра остается верной своему простому концепту, что может привести к быстрому насыщению. В целом, Unrailed! - это отличная игра для вечерних посиделок с друзьями или для релаксации в одиночку. Она обладает множеством ярких моментов и заставляет вас чувствовать себя частью эпического строительного проекта. Однако, она может оставить желать большего в плане долгосрочной привлекательности.

author: Fuchsfell05
review_text: This gameis insanley fun. Even with just one other player. Even when you crash your train, it doesn't get frustrating because next time you have another tactic and will do better.

author: robbe69
review_text: An addictive, relaxing cooperative experience that can be nerve wracking at times. Our runs always end in the most stupid situations which on paper shouldn't be that hard. Frustrating. It's hard to not blame your friends for screwing up, since everyone is kind of playing their own game. Other cooperative games are much more communicative which can be better or worse depending on your mood. Still worth the money.

author: OrangeRood
review_text: Great Game, but it is very difficult and me and my friends rarely get very far.

author: nitorita
review_text:
Yet another game to add to the repertoire of co-op indie games like Overcooked. Game is straightforward, but can get hectic. Best played with a friend, and not the AI. The mistakes are what makes the game fun to play.

Alas, Unrailed does get boring after a while, as there is not much to do. It's a game about multitasking, and trying your best to do that well. The difficulty ramps up as you progress, which is the main driver for adrenaline. Overall, it's a cup-of-tea scenario which depend on what you are looking for in a co-op game.

author: Herbalmouse1305
review_text: pretty fun to play with friends, not much to do apart from the main mode, and not much single player to play, neat co-op game

author: volumeunit
review_text: As soon as I started the game with my friends, I played for 5 hours. It's a very immersive game. The price is also very cheap and there are no bugs at all. If there is one downside, it gets bored a bit easily. After 4 days of playing, I felt bored.

author: TheDaniel34
review_text: Best game. I like it. Best game. I like it. Best game. I like it. Best game. I like it.

author: TheDaniel15
review_text:
One of the best game of all time. I like trains and this game. Thank you Indoor Astronaut for this
great job!!!!

author: DolphinReviews
review_text: Tries to force you to join a discord server. Not to mention the outrageous price.

author: YusufBolluk
review_text: Video izlerken, podcast dinlerken veya arkaya bir müzik açıp bir şeyler oynayayım diyorsanız tam aradığınız oyun. Ben yıllardır beyni kapatıp bir şeyler oynamak istediğim zaman açar oynarım. İsterseniz daha zorlayıcı modlarda tryhard da oynayabilirsiniz. Ancak benim için Dead Cells kafayı kapatıp oynadığım bir cozy oyundur. Oynanışı güzel, hikayesini sallamadığım, görselliği güzel bir oyundur.

author: Dbug
review_text:
I'm not a massive fan of Rogue style games, but in Dead Cells, each time you die you somehow manage to unlock a small something that makes you feel like you are progressing: Maybe you reached a new level, got a new weapon, etc... that's motivating.

The graphics and animations are extremely well done, and while not an easy game it does not feel like the designers are trying to punish you.

author: Nazrielau05
review_text:
[Final review after fully beating the base campaign | 16+ hours]

I fell in love with this game after fully beating the campaign. I've said so much regarding the game's presentation and combat mechanics. But genuinely, after beating the base campaign, i could say with confidence that this is my favourite game of all time--at least my favourite Rogue-like entry.This game is a complete, solid, and amazing package in general. Vibrant visual style, immediately memorable soundtrack, tight & satisfying combat mechanics, infinitely replayable--all are my categories for the picture-perfect Rogue-like experience.I can't promise that anyone reading this review would fall in love with the game like i did. However, i could promise that Dead Cells is an absolute must-play for any fan of the Rogue-like genre. 10/10.

author: DosluQ
review_text: Dead Cells, klasik bir rogue-lite oyunu. Oyunu bu kadar popüler yapan en büyük etken, aksiyon ve platform öğelerinin son derece akıcı olması ve silah çeşitliliği sayesinde her oynayışta farklı bir deneyim sunması. Bu da onu türünün en iyilerinden biri haline getiriyor. Ancak buna rağmen her oyuncuya hitap etmeyebilir. Şahsen ben, bir süre sonra sürekli aynı şeyleri yapmaktan sıkıldım.

author: Ali_Akdemir
review_text: Bu oyunu ilk olarak Play Store üzerinden telefon ile oynamıştım. Ne kadar telefon için güzel bir oyun gibi dursa da kesinlikle oyun kolu ile oynanmalı. Oyunda 3-4 tane ana Boss var. Telefonla oynadığımda son Boss u kontroller yüzünden bir türlü kesemiyordum. Oyun koluyla bilgisayardan oynamaya bir başladım oyun kolunun veli nimet olduğunu anladım. O yüzden kesinlikle Oyun kolu ile oynamanızı tavsiye ederim. Oyuna gelirsek oyun sizin ölmenizi istiyor. Oyunda ölmek oyunun normal karşıladığı bir şey. Oyunda çok fazla farkı silah var. Bu sayede çok fazla silah kombin etme yani build oluşturma imkanınız var. O konuda oyun çok fazla tekrara düşmüyor. Oyundaki son Boss u kestiğinizde size bir kök hücre veriyor. Bir daha ki oynayışınızda, bu kök hücreyi kullanarak oyunun zorluğunu arttırabiliyorsunuz. Eğer elinizdeki bütün kök hücreleri aktif ederek son Bossu yine keserseniz o zaman yeni kök hücre veriyor toplamda 5 tane kök hücreniz olduğunda bunların hepsini kullanarak son Boss un arkasındaki odaya girebilirsiniz ve orada oyunun son Boss u var. O Boss uda kestiğinizde oyunu tamamen bitirebiliyorsunuz. Aslında oyunda bir tane kök hücre toplarsanız oyun bitiyor ve sonrasında hep aynı şeyi yapıyorsunuz. Hades oyunu oynadıysanız bu oyuna da bire göz atmanızı öneriyorum.

author: atomlord
review_text: Надто багато хайпу навколо цієї гри. Нічого надзвичайного. Просто непогана в своєму жанрі. Доволі швидко набридає через слабке відчуття прогресу - нові види предметів мало чим відрізняються від старих.

author: thunderhoof
review_text: Saatler gömmelik, görsel olarak şık, oynanış olarak yeterli bir oyun. Oynarken keyif aldığınızı hissediyorsunuz. Ölürken saçlarınızı yolmuyorsunuz çünkü geliştiğinizi de hissediyorsunuz. Güzeldi ve keyifliydi.

author: Chrisonmagic
review_text: The game is absolutely spectacular. The combat in the game is unmatched. It is one hundred percent not for the faint-hearted and it requires perseverance. You will die... a lot. However, you don't start completely from scratch. A problem a lot of people might have with the game is that it forces you to change your weapons. I like some weapons better than others. As I said, this game is not for the faint-hearted. But if you are faint-hearted and you already got it, here's some things to remember before you commit to hating the game:Even if you have your favourite weapon, it will slowly become less and less powerful as you go on. The further you go, the more powerful the enemies and items are, the items you have become relatively weaker. You can still find stronger versions of your items later on, don't get too **** can't choose all of the scrolls. Sure, the extra health is nice but it makes you much weaker in terms of weaponry. Are you forbidden from getting one or two from the scrolls you aren't maining? No. But just pay attention to your weapons and mutations, which class are they? Mutations and damage are affected by scrolls, not just **** you die, it's okay. The fun is not in beating the game but playing it. The story is interesting if you pay attention but it is not the best story ever written. You shouldn't be playing the game for the story, you should be playing it for the action. If you die, it's an opportunity to play again.

author: Hanz7266
review_text:
HECK YEAH THIS GAME IS AMAZING GO PLAY IT :D
It's really good I haven't played much but from what I've seen it's amazing :D

author: Hydrowins
review_text: It is a beautifully directed game with marvelous and well animated graphics. The is simple on the surface but does get pretty deep. Its humor is great and adds value to the game. The best though is the references.

author: RandomBolt
review_text:
This feels a similar game to play compared to PSO or Diablo, when it comes to how you progress.
You get some pre-determined buffs after X deaths and collect cells to unlock upgrades.

What does not look the same is that the randomness aspect means you have to slog through the same dungeons looking for the way out, instead of getting to the new areas fast, as on more classic RPGs. The areas just do not change enough to be interesting.
It is the same type of upgrades scattered, same type of enemies, just spwaned differently.

There is a pretty big lean into increasing difficulty through not restoring your life, which can make this incredibly frustrating. There is not much room in the combat to feel you are getting better, it is much more related to what you pick up and what upgrades you can keep unlocking.

The massive christmas lights also don't help with enemy visibility and further deter from the combat being interesting.

Collectively, this has been the most frustrating game I've played in years. I have given this multiple tries but always put down the controller feeling like this is a waste of time and no fun is to be had here. At most, some 3h-4h of getting to know the game and the fun ends there.

author: vova22379
review_text: While its art style and combat are decent, repetitive gameplay, punishing difficulty, and lack of story drag it down.

author: mugen_is_here
review_text:
The game's way too hard. You're expected to die repeatedly and slowly make the newer character stronger through a process of very slow grind. That's a very artificial way of expanding the time. 

The bosses are usually way too overpowered and they attack almost continously. I used the Assist mode to change that to my liking so can't complain about the normal enemies. They were a fun breeze through.

The levels became more and more maze-like where it becomes less of a platformer and more of a search for the right path by revisiting the old areas over and over again.

Most of the weapons that you get are pretty much a repeat of what you've already seen just with slightly different levels or slightly different extra effects.

Overall it's a pathetic experience.

author: Bluelion32
review_text:
Very good. Please play it. Too hard. Dark souls of rougelikes (ik, overused phrase)
0/12

review_text: Çok keyifli oyun. Çok düşünmeden akıcı ve keyifli bir şekilde zorluk sunan bir oyun oynamak istiyorsam Dead Cells'le birlikte direkt elimin gittiği oyun. Farklı farklı buildler denemek ve oyunu bitirmeye çalışmak kolay kolay sıkıcılaşmıyor. Karakterler de hikayeyi takip etmeseniz bile garip bir bağlanma hissi bir samimiyet oluşturuyor. Her turdan sonra robot gibi hemen yeni tura geçmektense karakterlerin sana tepkilerini görmek güzel bir tazelik katıyor oyuna.

author: Mrnizar11
