author: Pazuu
review_text:
I'm still having a blast. Gameplay is fun and the fact that it's so well related to the story and world of Hades is very good. The art is lovely. Dialogs are nice, voices are even better. Music fits in perfectly.
Very minor mistake is about some weapons not being as coherent/as well integrated as others.

review_text: Increíblemente adictivo. Logra que quieras desbloquear en cada run alguna mejora nueva, que genera esa sensación de progresión en un videojuego. Lo jugué con hades 2 ya publicado para poder ir a su segunda entrega ya instruido. Una joya

author: NianB_505
review_text: Cosa succede se mischi al genere Rouguelite la mitologia greca e una storia di ribellione giovanile con un art design spacca mascella e un gameplay che crea assuefazione beh vi presento Hades e difficilmente vi stancherete di lui. 9.7/10

author: NoobahCritical
review_text: Sehr gutes Rougelike/lite der einzige Kritikpunkt ist das es ein paar mehr Waffen geben sollte, um das Gameplay ein bisschen abwechslungsreicher zu gestalten.

author: Pilson
review_text: Esse jogo pra mim é perfeito em todos aspectos. divertido, desafiador, e satisfatório.

author: KoNgKrEiL
review_text: I can see why Hades is so popular. I just can’t seem to get into the game. There is too much chaos and button mashing for my liking. It just feels to chaotic.

author: Fab75000
review_text: Hades 2 is a very disappointing for such a highly anticipated sequel. The gameplay is still solid, but it feels too much familiar. The story moves too slowly, and the new features don’t really change much. Some bosses feel frustrating rather than challenging. Too bad,  the first game set the bar so high.

author: AhtiMcCloud
review_text: Hades II looks great at first glance, but once you dive in, the cracks show. The combat is messy, progression feels sluggish, and the magic of the first game just isn’t there. It’s not terrible, but it’s nowhere near the masterpiece its predecessor was.

author: Ahti
review_text: I loved the first Hades, but the sequel feels like a step back. The pacing is slow, fights are unbalanced and drag on with spongey enemies, and the new characters lack the charm of the original cast. Technically it’s rough too, with performance drops and clunky controls. Instead of fresh ideas, it often feels like recycled content packaged as a new game.

author: sadboiinfinite
review_text: Got it gifted to me after watching two of my friends froth out the mouth over it and uhhhhh it's fine. Sure, the graphics are really polished and the high speed gameplay is really engaging, but the music and voice lines are legitimately so annoying to me that I've just been playing with most of the audio muted. Not to mention, some of the enemies themselves often end up turning the combat into feeling more akin to something like Contra with the infuriating amount of bullets and attacks being thrown at you. Most of the actual gameplay itself is fine, but there's definitely more I dislike than enjoy.

author: Predpreimec
review_text: this game is one of the worst roguelikes in terms of gameplay. It's literally Click-Click Dash. You just click on enemies from afar, and the game takes the worst aspects of combat in isometric games - the enemies are dumb, there are a lot of them, and they're so fat that you have to click on them for about 30 seconds. The gameplay is terrible, there's no depth, and there's nowhere to explore. The build system is the same - there's no variety or depth to the build - you choose one thing and focus on that for the entire run, because if you try to focus on multiple things, you won't have enough damage. It hurts me to see that many people consider this game to be one of the best roguelikes. It's not a bad game, but it's a shame for the genre as a roguelike. It's a roguelike for those who have never played a roguelike before.

author: Kxr1m_97
review_text: No skill needed for this game, the story is boring. J’aimerais me faire rembourser si je le pouvais. j’espère qu’ils feront faillite eux ainsi que leur compagnie

author: Hoplite
review_text: This game is one of the most original and amazing games ever created. I wish the devs would hire the guy who made the Multiverse mod and create FTL 2. Playing on the PC is slightly less fun than on the iPad as the controls are even more smooth, but there is no Multiverse on the iPad. Please make multiverse for iPad. Please make FTL 2.

author: Merisandus
review_text: Fight or flee? Should I buy this weapon or hire this crew member? Do I hit the weapon control first or the shields? Every decision is a test of my judgment, and winning isn’t just about skill—it’s about a bit of luck too. I love that I can pause anytime and issue orders, completely removing the need for twitch reflexes.

author: ultrasoft
review_text:
FTL. The classic roguelike space captain sim. It's a ton of fun, with maybe a bit too much rng that means on some runs you can feel like you couldn't reallly have done anything more and lose horribly. It'a maybe a bit too punishing. Is that just me being not good though? Potentially. There may well be mods that help balance the game a bit and I would look something like that up if I was going to play it again on PC.

Still highly recommended and probably cheap as chips these days in a sale.

author: FOSSenjoyer
review_text:
Very satisfying roguelike that is made so much better by it's dedicated modding community. 

Multiverse makes FTL so much deeper, complicated and customizable. On average, runs are probably easier with default options on normal mode but the game becomes more well balanced (with some rather extreme exceptions like intentionally over or underpowered cruisers). Overpowered things from base game are nerfed and useless things are made more viable.

author: DonD81
review_text: Fun game to play in between bigger games. Can be quite addictive ('just one more run'). RNG can be brutal, but that's part of the fun. The runs don't take that long, so you can just start another. One of my palate cleansers after I finish a bigger game.

author: Mhaiti
review_text:
BEST. GAME. EVER. MADE.!!!!

I hope god makes a special place for the creators.

Only comparable to BG3, don't try to convince me otherwise.

author: MostaS
review_text:
Recently, I gave Deadcell another go, but unfortunately I found that the game's mechanics ran out of steam rather quickly, and that there was too much linearity in the game's progression, based on collecting cells to unlock upgraded items. This meant that I had to finish the game several times to see what would happen next, and then start again with an extra level of difficulty. After 1 or 2 days, I'd get fed up, drop the controller and never want to pick it up again to continue the adventure, and it was the same with Darkest Dungeon...

FTL is the only roguelike to have kept me going for more than 135 hours. And it's the one with the least scenery, and no carrot for upgrading your ship post-mortem. It's a game that demands insane creativity and great foresight to optimize your ship and the confrontations. All the elements that make up the game are both original and complement each other so well that it's hard to get bored even after hundreds of hours. The possible combinations and strategies are virtually unlimited, making each game unique! That's why, in my opinion, FTL is one of the best roguelikes ever released.
If you want more details, I've put together a review on youtube about this game :
[french review]
 ****/Ik2RGP_LAN

To sum up: 

 The positives
imaginative, diverse and fun combat systemthe number of possible combinations for your ship.
The uniqueness of each game, which forces you to think and find the best strategy to optimize your ship, making every run unique.
The music.

Negative points :

Frustrating RNG, especially for novices.
You have to achieve a run to unlock new ships.
The game is very difficult.

author: GhostSupreme
review_text: A legendary game that was so fun and entertaining, it spawned multiple sequels. The developer was so good at making it, it even spawned countless mods and fan remakes. In addition, one of the few games where DLC was released after launch, for free! This effectively added a significant amount of content to the game for nothing, and further boosted it into the popularity it once had. Easily one of the best strategy games to exist, specifically in the “space” genre.

Game is pretty hard but its like a puzzle where you slowly learn the tricks, once you do you can pretty reliable clear the game without issue.

author: Tabbou
review_text: I don't understand all the 9 and 10/10, just looks like others rogue-lite and strategy games, disapointed

author: Molok
review_text:
FTL is composed of wide variety of possible scenarios that are arranged randomly to create a unique run. Each play is distinct and creates a personal story of individual player's struggle. Here is just another one of them.

I started with federation cruiser. Defying odds I progressed through increasingly difficult sectors before arriving to the Nebula under the control of Slugs. There I resolved a few challenging combat scenarios, taking heavy damage because I didn't encounter any appropriate equipment and didn't really have an opportunity to upgrade weapons in earlier sectors. Luckily I found one more advanced weapon in stock, randomly found earlier. But I couldn't power it yet, needing a separate upgrade. With that in mind I pressed on. Eventually I arrived at a sector that housed a planet with several moons. The slug found on the surface quizzed me about the number of natural satellites orbiting the planet and taking advantage of my momentous distraction stole some of my missiles, drone parts, all of my exp and most of my remaining fuel. With exp gone and without a way to upgrade my system I didn't have realistic way to win future altercations but I pressed on.
I encountered a dangerous ship. I disabled shields using my remaining missiles so I could actually damage systems using my pitiful lasers. All of my shots missed and I without ammo I couldn't switch to missile weapons. I dropped the shields, disabled the weapons, ordered all of doors opened to vent the ship of oxygen and concentrated the crew in one large chamber so they would suffocate. After they slowly and (I hope) painfully died I uninstalled the damn game.

FTL is based entirely on your luck. It is a digital version of Russian roulette. Some weapons, augmentations and systems are just better than others. If you luck out and get them advancing through the game becomes trivial. If you do not it is impossible.
I understand that it is alluring to some people as they like the risk. But I would advise anybody who likes to have any actual agency to stay away from the game.

There are achievements that you can collect and unlock bonus ships. Unfortunately a standard run seems to be at least two hours long and if you die before getting an achievement you don't unlock anything. In that case each minute of your life spent playing is retroactively wasted away. There is absolutely no payoff if you lose. A standard tagline for rogue-lites is "Losing is fun". But this game simply isn't fun.

On the other hand soundtrack is awesome. I would say that if you can get it without the game it's worth buying. Just don't buy FTL and don't give it any bump in it's statistics.

author: Scruffey
review_text:
I can't see why this game gets favourable reviews.
I started the game on the "Normal" setting and got beaten to death in the first system all the time.
OK. Maybe I'm a bit dumb - I said to myself.
I started the game on the "Easier" setting and got beaten to death in the first system all the time.
OK. I'm really dumb - I said to myself.
I modded the game with Twinge's Balance & Bugfix Mod v3.0.6 which is supposed to make the game a lot easier   < : 0 )
I started the game on the "Easier" setting and got beaten to death in the first system all the time.
OK. I'm not just really dumb, I must be a bit moronic !
Enough.
I'm going back to PacMan - at least I might get somewhere with that...

author: Loadstone
review_text:
This game is amazing. It is very fun and gets me exited. But one thing... how the hell do you even launch the game.

it wont even launch in discord or the folder even with administrator. It a good game just this is more about it doesn't work and is glitchy AF. It only works in a virtual machine and that ****.
remember the game is good but if you get it be warned it might not work.

It even says in one of the README folders that "We don't promise that this software works." WHAT... THEN... WHY PUBLISH IT FOR EVERYONE TO BUY YOU... ***A*F**GS*G*A*F*GS*DG. ITS JUST SO STUPID.

They even put a fail safe in their game so if you launch it, it wont work; when you troubleshot it, it says that ITS INCOMPATIBLE EVEN THO THE BLOODY GAMESITE SAID ITS COMPATIBLE FOR WINDOWS. This is **** and i don't want to go through the pain of opening a virtual machine EVERY BLOODY TIME i want to play... AND IT DOESN'T EVEN SAVE.

ITS A GOOD GAME AND VERY INNOVATIVE AND ENJOYABLE BUT IF YOUR LOOKING AT THE USABILITY ITS IMPOSSIBLE TO GIVE IT A POSITIVE RATING!!!!

"Beware that if you get the game it MAY or MAYNOT work."

author: HatTopGaming
review_text: If you think games like enter the gungeon are to easy you gotta try this one. Game can easily be beaten in under 15 minutes but it'll take you hours before you beat the final boss once. Even longer if you happen to stumble on random secrets placed throughout the game that are seemingly randomly discovered without thought or reason. But at its core its a tough roguelike with great challenge, enough randomness and a strong ability to get on your nerves you'll wanna stop playing

author: apokalipto
review_text: Very good game. I enjoyed playing this game a lot. I strongly recommend this.

author: Hatters
review_text: Easily one of my favorite Roguelikes out there, an adrenaline rush of fast paced action and chaos, its fantastic.

author: CharlesDuchemin
review_text: This **** is addictive. That's why it's so good. Play it. Play it. Just play iiiiiiiiit

review_text:
Muuuuuy adictivo, quizás el mejor rogue-lite de la historia, buenardo

Reeeeally addictive, probably the best rogue-lite of all time, **** amazing

author: wiz_
review_text: Обычно прохожу игру на все ачивки и забываю, эта игра одно из двух исключений. Ооооочень реиграбельная при небольшом количестве контента. Багов практически нет. Наиграл 940 часов и пока что не собираюсь останавливаться.

author: MetaKain
review_text:
Un buen roguelike, no he llegado al final todavía, pero todos los jefes con los que me he encontrado (Lil Hunter, Big Dog, Hyper Crystal, etc.) no son muy fáciles de vencer. Con tiempo y dedicación lo pasas de taquito pero vas a tener que intentar mas de una vez para encontrarle el truco.
Buena dificultad, buen diseño, no es malo en ningún aspecto,  y eso que está hecho con Gamemaker Studio.

author: EvgeniLinuxUser
review_text: Live classic in the form of a "Beat them all" roguelike in a post-apocalyptic setting. You just need a fast reaction. Works fine on notebook (Intel video) with Ubuntu 16.04.

author: PanMrkvicka
review_text: pretty hardcore but its still the same level layout and weapons not enough content.

author: Wast23
review_text:
No es mi roguelike favorito pero creo que es bastante decente. Nuclear throne nos ofrece una experiencia frenética y algo complicada, en algunos momentos repetitiva, pero se mantiene entretenido. Puedes echarte partidas rápidamente, y si mueres en nada de tiempo ya estas echándote otra partida en nada de tiempo.
El sistema de armas es simple pero funciona y es divertido, además las destrucciones que se generan son muy entretenidas y espectaculares.
Es cierto que el juego te atrapa y es un poco injusto algunas veces.
Le pongo un 8, ya que no noto que tenga un gameplay muy entretenido como otros juegos como enter the gungeon, aunque me gusta lo frenético que es.

author: Engue
review_text: Normally I don't really play rogue likes but this one has me! Really fun and focuses on the core features of a rogue like. It's nothing new, but well executed. Good job!

author: Mambo7960
review_text: Fantastic game, amazing pixel stile dungeon crawler, large amount of weapons and objects, cool bosses and many npcs

author: APolChrome
review_text: (Reseña sacada de mi cuenta de Steam: APolChrome) Soy bastante principiante en esto de los rogue-lites, pero sé que Enter the Gungeon es un gran referente del género. Y después de jugar durante 10 horas, entiendo por qué. Enter the Gungeon es un juegazo que lleva muy bien el género. Ahora voy a hablar en profundidad del juego así que, **** Enter the Gungeon, tendremos que explorar las Armazmorras, unas dungeons de toda la vida solo que tienen como temática (intentad adivinarlo) las armas. Se dividen en varias recámaras, y en cada una hay diferentes enemigos, tipos de sala y jefes. Jugablemente es una locura. El sistema de combate es sin duda lo mejor, teniendo en cuenta que han hecho un sistema de apuntado que funciona muy bien para ser en 2 dimensiones. Al sistema de combate se le añade la profundidad de objetos (tanto activos como pasivos) y de diferentes armas (algunas muy graciosas por cierto) que hacen cada run realmente única. Los enemigos y bosses de las mazmorras (aunque me quedan muchos por descubrir, sobre todo jefes) están bastante bien y tienen maneras muy diferentes de combatirse, por lo que acabas haciendo estrategias para cada enemigo o boss del **** diseño de mazmorras del juego me encanta. Están se crean procedimentalmente (o en idioma normal, aleatoriamente) haciendo todo tipo de combinaciones. La progresión en estas también se siente muy natural, teniendo muchos tipos de salas que se van desbloqueando poco a poco y haciendo que cada run pueda tener algo de importancia, desde encontrar un nuevo NPC o conseguir un nuevo objeto que no habías visto nunca. El hub principal (que se llama la Brecha) también está bastante bien, aunque siento que es un proyecto muy a largo plazo (como todo el juego en realidad) pero que se siente muy bien al avanzar un poquito.Audiovisualmente, está muy bien. En el apartado gráfico, el juego tiene un estilo artístico muy bonito, que aunque sea pixel-art (algo que ya tenemos sinceramente todos muy visto) es muy bonito, con un diseño de personajes, enemigos y zonas espectacular y animaciones bastante buenas también. Y la OST del juego es una pasada. La verdad que tiene temazo tras temazo y me ha sorprendido mucho en este aspecto.Como me queda mucho narrativamente que ver (aunque puedo decir que los personajes que he visto me han gustado mucho y que el humor aunque a veces sea un poco absurdo, está bastante bien) termino la reseña diciendo que Enter the Gungeon me gusta muchísimo. Es típico juego que es bueno tenerlo instalado siempre por si acaso no tienes nada que hacer y te apetece echar un par de runs. Si te gustan los rogue-lites, es un must-play y si no, empieza con este que te lo vas a pasar en grande

author: giannis2001
review_text: Great roguelike. It's very challenging to beat but it's fair challenge since it's like 90% skill and 10% luck. However, I think the guns/items/ammo you get in the run are kind of limited or bad most of the times. I would love if there were more frequent. It took me 19 hours to clear my first run butI felt so much satisfaction when I did. I highly recommend it if you are into rogue likes.

author: Tacospin
review_text: enter the gungeon is a great game, i honestly wish the devs never got sick of it, because i was obsessed with this game when I played it. that period was so exciting, and is the feeling i want to get more of in games, i just wish i started playing when it was still being updated, curse you exit the gungeon!

author: ElChoclo
review_text: Perfect game

author: fnenamg
review_text: It's a well-crafted roguelike game. Even after playing for a long time, you can continue to have enjoyable experiences.

author: TAVUKLUPILAV
review_text:
Güzel müzik, güzel vuruş hisi, böyle oyunlar için iyi bir hikaye, iyi pixel türüş oyun zor ama bi süre sonra
alışıyorsunuz gerçekten iyi bir oyun. oyunun tek sıkıntısı  roguelike temasına uymaması yenıden başlayınca sadece silah alabilmemiz çok saçma en azından para ile karakterimizi geliştirsek daah güzel
oyun.

author: MasTo
review_text:
Its has  a great and clear art style, there lots to do, intresting things to kill and weird and cool ass weapons to kill with, pretty sure it has lore, dunno what is is tho, but the one of the most addicting and fun and challenging games with the most fun mechanics you can think of you can think of

straight 10/10

author: Quazder
review_text: I have 200 hours on it and its unique feeling kept me playing it again and again. Its ideal game withsome podcast, and just relaxing. A lot of guns and equipments. Just unique.

author: Mene0
review_text:
This game is very good, however, it tries very hard to be more difficult and less fun than it is, especially with the random elements.
While the enemy patterns and boss fights are pretty much skill based, your experience each run varies WIDELY based on the items you get. Some items are great, some are just fine and the vast majority are borderline useless and unfun. I cannot express enough how much more fun rainbow runs are, because you can get some cool weapons and items and just experience more of what the game has to offer you. A lot of the time in regular runs I realized I just wasn't having fun because I'd take a lot more time to clear floors and bosses because I had to use the default weapon, or some terrible item and gun and run out of ammo for it. The ammount of times I'd restart a run on floor one/two because I got 3 D-C quality weapons in a row is more than I can remember.
This is not to mention a bunch of hidden mechanics and item descriptions and synergies left intentionally vague that will just result in you opening a wiki to see what it does. We are not on the SNES days anymore where these things would have to be figured out through repeated playthroughs and discussions with other players, there is not much reason to not have these things explained in game on a menu.
I kinda wanted to give a lower score, but since I've played so much there is definitely something engaging and fun to this game. It just tries really hard to not let you experience it.

author: edxtan
review_text: Enter the Gungeon's massive amount of unique weapons and items can create some wild combinations and interactions, but not being able to see their stats or remove some of them from your item pool can force you to use a lot of weapons that you hate.

author: deadmeme385
review_text: Great game in general but the difficulty ruins everything. I played this game for a couple of weeks and couldn't even get past the first boss. **** game

author: BowLL
review_text:
although the game has a really neat animation, good controls that can be used to with, and great graphics..

this game just doesn't really hit my favor, because of how slow it is just trying to get through everything, and it's deeply repetitive with rooms just being the same with different characters trying to shoot bullets at you as the player, nothing is ever fast in the game.

author: Nazrielau05
review_text: While i don't think I'm madly in love with this game, i do like it quite a lot. The presentation is good despite not being too interesting. The soundtrack is charming i guess, but none of them are anything to write home about.This game's strongest quirk is the mechanics. It's basically a 2D platformer game with metroidvania and rogue-like sauces. Also, in the start of each run, the game gives you an option to pick between 3 characters. These characters have their own class, abilities and quirks. Guess what? You don't control what you get. You only get to choose between whatever options you're presented ****'s not like Dead Cells where you could buy and sell weapons when given the option. It's not like Hades 1 & 2 where you get to put together your own build, combining weapons, boons, and other abilities and you stick with them for the rest of the game. In Rogue Legacy 2, your choices are basically locked in whatever the game's RNG is feeling like. This game does have permanent progression in the forms of upgrading your characters' health, armours, unlocking new characters etc. But the very core of the game's mechanics is still randomly generated. You're not fully in control of your runs.This game is heavily reliant on RNG, which in itself isn't a bad thing. However, it does kinda ruin my lust to 'master' the game's mechanics. Simply because I'm not in control of everything available. Rogue Legacy 2's premise is very arcade-like. Which makes the game perfect for pick-up-and-play whenever you want. Rogue Legacy 2 is a good experience still, and i won't deny that. It's just a very different type of Rogue-like compared to what I'm used to. Of course, that doesn't make this game bad or anything. It's more of an arcade 2D Platformer with Metroidvania and Rogue-like aspects. 8/10

author: Iamiokua
review_text: These games always make me feel like the progression slows too much in the mid game

author: segarulez
review_text:
Unfortunately, too much of everything does not automatically make a better game. Some character classes are practically useless or extremely week compared to others. 

In later NG+ playthroughs, the grinding aspects gets annoying. In addition, many enemies have similar moves to those in the regular game, except that you sometimes die after just 2 hits, depending on the character class and trait. 

Less would sometimes have been more here.

I prefer RL1.

author: ilovemycats
review_text: Very challenging, especially at the beginning when you’re still figuring out the mechanics, but a lot of fun to master. Really recommend it.

author: LegendaryMule
review_text: My new favorite rouge like.  I can't wait to see what is next from Cellar Door.

author: Nema_vrt88
review_text: очень хорошие обновление механик первой части, графика моё почтение. На свитче или иной протативке, будет смотреться совсем классно

author: FancySeal
review_text: I played the first one and loved it and beat it. I’m hesitant for any sequel anymore as Ive been disappointed alot but this was a pretty good one and for once I’m happy with it. Everything is even better than it was before and the artwork and classes got even better. I love it.

author: PyroRaider
review_text: Rogue Legacy 2 starts off very badly. The game is obviously quite hard, but some mechanics, like collision damage and directional damage, can throw you off from the game. But something keeps reeling you back in: the levelling system. You can level a character to Narnia and turn them into an unstoppable beast, but to get to that level you'll need to grind a lot of money, The boss fights are well realized, and some characters are fun to play as, but most of them are embarrassingly sloppy (Mage, Ronin).

author: Wisenerd
review_text: The new reference point of the genre, deep, fun mechanics, very high longevity for an indie title, a little more accessible would have made it a perfect title

author: Cehanson
review_text: Very fun game with a high skill ceiling. A ton of classes to unlock and master. Very generous game in terms of it’s content. You can easily sink hundreds of hours into it if you want to see and unlock everything. Only caveat for me was it can seem pretty grindy at times. Sometimes you just have to levelup/unlock things so multiple runs are dedicated to just that. Not a problem if you have a lot of spare time, but for someone with limited free time this was undesirable.

author: RPGLMNTZ
review_text: Rogue Legacy 2 is a wonderful improvement from its predecessor. It takes all of the most necessary steps forward to making a worthwhile sequel and none of the steps back. It is a fantastic entry for fans of indie games, roguelike RPGs and Metroidvania. Whether you are a fan of the original Rogue Legacy or not, this is an easy game to recommend.

author: bowsers2
review_text:
For all the improvement’s cellar door has made to polish, platforming and more diverse enemies…, the inescapable fact is that combat is still boring due to the 1 note brain-dead moronic enemies that dominate this game.
And when they add in out of balance, hard, mid-level enemies, they just spam attacks in an unfair way because that’s the “tension”…. That actually demonstrates lack of combat design more than anything else.
The fundamentals of combat are still boring. That’s the core gameplay. That part is boring & archaic. Not much different from Ghouls n Ghosts 1000’s of years ago.

Still I really appreciate all the player friendly options like choosing enemy health, turning off enemy contact damage, stopping level randomisation….

author: Alexol
review_text: Rage inducing grindfest. Terrible game design with many areas where you cannot avoid damage. I don't understand why you would make a game just to cause rage. This is Flappy Bird the rogue version. The devs are a joke for making the same game twice.

author: yohewa9979
review_text: The nicest thing I can say about Rogue Legacy 2 is that it really makes me appreciate every other roguelike on the market. This game doesn't have any microtransactions, but it feels as soulless and unrewarding as a game built on microtransactions.

author: Ead
review_text:
A few things ruined this game's loop:
1. You can't touch enemy. It has huge dmg.
2. Most your class attack range or angle is pathetic, while enemies can easily attack outside the screen. Huge dmg too.
3. **** the trap, no, **** the traps.
4. No iframe if you dash, not even if you upgraded the dash.
5. Very little gain from grinding.
6. Latter boss, enemies giant health pool.
7. No build, resolve is the stupidest system.
8. You have armor for dmg reduction, but it is capped at 35%, so the highest defense armor set is a joke.
9. Magic is barely useful.

author: ytmerc
review_text: 0 через те що немає української озвучки в цій грі та навіть немає українського інтерфейса

author: mugen_is_here
review_text:
Reminds me of meat ball. Pretty tough platforming game. And the world is very vast. You can spend hours just navigating through the maze. Story is lackluster. The upgrades are the main selling point of this game. I loved how we can upgrade the main tower, unlock new characters, upgrade weapons etc.

What this game needs is some kind of navigation system to make our lives easier in order to know where we need to go next. Because currently navigating is a major chore on the high level map. It's an even bigger chore as you navigate between trillions of enemies clustered together in every room. Quite unsatisfying.

author: jaywhitaker1987
review_text: It's pretty sad. The first Rogue Legacy was more groundbreaking than actually FUN, but it certainly did push roguelikes forward. This sequel does so, so little to improve upon the first. It plays like DLC for the original that was cranked out in a single weekend 9 years ago.

author: jexewa1856
review_text: It would take too long to outline the things that RL2 does poorly. Combat, movement, exploration, upgrades. Everything looks and feels remarkably shallow. Rogue Legacy 2 is easily the worst roguelite I've ever played; every upgrade feels like an ineffectual waste and every bit of gameplay makes a strong argument to play something.

author: jofim21988
review_text: RL2 adds a lot of complexity to the original game and exactly no fun. The original Rogue Legacy is, at this stage, kind of an old, janky game. This sequel feels even older and jankier.

author: voximed248
review_text: I was a big fan of the first Rogue Legacy and am pretty soundly disappointed with the follow-up. The original came out almost 10 years ago and the formula has seen virtually no improvement. It's truly shocking how little the devs seemed to have learned from making the first game, and how little they gleaned from the subsequent 10 years of rogue games becoming streamlined and dominant. Playing Rogue Legacy 2 feels like playing a 10 year old game, and not in a good way.

author: theflu
review_text:
this is the first card game I've found that can really hold my attention in a similar way to slay the spire did when I first found card games.

i really like how the game let's you customize your upgrades on spells and units (you slot in gems that power them up in different ways)... this gives run progression more depth than most i've seen in the genre.

monster train is definitely a top tier deck-builder

I have no experience with the sequel, but OG monster train is still well polished, satisfying, and deep in 2025. I would recommend for anyone who is into deck-building games

author: iKen
review_text:
Gameplay: GREAT. 
Story: GOOD. 
Graphic: GOOD. 
Music/Sound: GOOD. 
Voice Acting: NA.

author: princekael
review_text: If you like Slay the Spire, you'd love this. It's quite different but satisfies that itch, this time you're the dungeon! You defend your train with different classes, I found it quite fun.

author: Peaceshaker
review_text: on metacritic you have to watch out for fake gamers like user whathefaq, although its kinda funny reading all their reviews. they tell a tale of massive skill issue

author: Saume
review_text:
This is a great deck builder.

The concept of combining 2 classes (or races) is always great and underused in games. It leaves so many potential combos, and surprisingly many of them work well. Each race has their unique cards and combining 2 races' cards leaves some interesting potential combos.

Runs include a card selection after every encounter, as well as 2-3 activities of choice, including various types of shops, recruiting a unit, removing cards from your deck, copying a card in your deck, relics, special events, etc.

There are also "challenges" that you can toggle on or off on some encounters to increase your reward, but also difficulty. These can be interesting because the extra rewards is not always worth it depending on the circumstances.

This feels more complex than Slay the Spire and you need to manage which units you put at the front, which units on which floor, which enemies will skip a floor, etc. This is not that similar to Slay the Spire though, as you don't directly control a hero that attacks & casts spells, you summon units & use spells from the "outside". It's more about managing the battle, the 3 floors of your train and the health of your Pyre.

author: Sepherim
review_text:
Monster Train es un juego bastante entretenido, a medio camino entre roguelike deckbuilder y autobattler. La idea es que vamos por el mapa escogiendo rutas aleatorias y formando el mazo, más o menos lo esperado. Pero las batallas se luchan jugando cartas en los distintos pisos del tres y luego dejando que las criaturas invocadas luchen automáticamente según sus posiciones. Los enemigos intentan matarnos y sobrevivir hasta llegar a la parte alta del tren, nosotros intentamos evitarlo y matar al boss. Hay cinco mazos de juego en el juego básico y lo cierto es que son muy distintos entre sí, dando pie a jugabilidades muy diferentes y estrategias muy originales con algunos de ellos; y, como se pueden combinar siempre en parejas, da para interesantes combos. Los enemigos y bosses quizás no son tan variados como podrían haber sido, pero cumplen bien su labor. Quizás lo que más me falla es la falta de una historia que anime a seguir jugando, ya que no hay historia como tal.

Gráficamente el juego no es ningún portento, especialmente en las animaciones que son bastante flojas, pero cumple con una estética llamativa y colorida. La música también cumple, sin grandes aspavientos, lo mismo que los efectos sonoros. Y, al menos en mi tiempo jugándolo, no me he encontrado ningún bug.

Por todo ello, es sin duda un juego recomendable. No será rompedor ni le cambiará la vida a nadie, pero si que os mantendrá entretenidos un buen puñado de horas. Un 7.

author: Kaprawiec
review_text: If Youre a card games fan like me You cant go wrong with monster train. It offers tons of options, probably most complex deck builder created to this date. Definitely recommended, hundreds of hours of great gameplay. One of the best along with Slay the Spire and Castle of Morihisa.

author: gabriot
review_text: There is no other game I've ever been able to put over 2k hours into and still find it fun and engaging.  It's so much better balanced than other card roguelites, I was a huge Sts fan (over 1k hours) but this just blows sts out of the water IMO.  True, technically it's easier, but for 99% of us that doesn't matter.  I still can't win every game of MT, and only a select few players in the world can.  And I like that - unlike StS where the best players can only hope to achieve around a 50% winrate, it shows that MT relies far less on RNG and allows proper tactics to usually overcome even the worst RNG that can occur in the game.

author: Hypemeup
review_text: If you eat deckbuilders for breakfast, this game might not be the challenge you are looking for.

author: Jenga
review_text: The negative reviewer doesn't know what he's talking about, imo. I have so much time in Slay the Spire (A20 on all characters) but this game is much better to me! It is not quite as difficult, but assuming you are trying for Divinity wins on Cov25, it has plenty to offer in that regard. Besides, top players frequently achieve a low win rate on StS A20 Heart runs (sometimes 25% win rate, and that is the best players in the world). To me, that is not just difficult, but in many ways impossible. In Monster Train,a run is almost always winnable - if you play perfectly. And to me, that's much better, as if I lose it was my fault! Long story short, it's plenty hard and well worth your time, just go straight for Covenant wins to start unlocking the highest difficulty where (imo) the game truly shines.

author: savvym
review_text:
Monster train is a turn based card strategy where you fight your opponent inside the train, protecting the Spyre. It's very much like Slay the Spire with extra layers to the combat system. It's also less RNG as you know where you're heading to.

Each run starts by selecting one of two (three in total) superpower options for the champion and an artifact of our choice. There is also a temple (from DLC) which allows us to gain artifacts and various rare upgrades for an additional difficulty.

Our goal is to get through 9 rings of frozen hell in a monster train; that is 8 battles if we get to the final boss.

Each combat starts off with deploying your champion unit against waves of enemies. Most of the time, the enemy boss will be flying between the floors deploying some distractions and joining the forces at the last wave into the combat phase or simply spawn last. Until that time you're supposed to fill up all floors with units and buffs to survive.

The boss destroys the floor once it clears it from our units and it means we have less space to put units and less turns to beat the level. If the spyre falls, it's game over. Luckily, spyre still shoots back so it can serve as a 4th floor well if you've got dazed cards and increase its strength. We can also upgrade our Spyre with additional damage, armor, health and apply dazed to enemies entering it.

The cards have various effects and can be upgraded, having 2 upgrade slots by default. The best part is 5x duplicating double, triple or even quadruple upgraded cards but having so many upgrades on one unit is uncommon. Each unit takes up space in the floor so when they're full we can use magic on top of it, and it's wise not to have too many units without enough buffs because they will be easily wiped out in the late game so there should be a nice balance.

Another great feature is the alliance. We get to receive cards from two races depending on which railroad we choose or when we receive after battle rewards. We can make useful synergies, but sometimes allied cards just do not fit with our main one and only take up valuable space in our deck, but we can still get rid of them.

Between battles, there are events like merchants for units, spells and artifacts, special caverns, duplicate hellvents, remove vortexes and health wells. We can even gain an extra gold. And the best part is, we can preview our run from start to finish, however we do not know the outcome of special events. So it is always wise to first take gold, buy upgrades, visit cavern, and then take artifacts, duplicate and regain health.

Apart from those, we will be able to upgrade our champion 2 more times, once in mid and once in late game. We can have as many different artifacts as we get. They make the run easier in a way.

Early game offers 5+1 champions, starting at level 1. We can also play Daily Challenges which are always Covenant 1. That is where the PvP element comes in. We can create our own runs and share them with friends. Our rankings are saved after we finish the run. We can also play simultaneously with other players at the same time, being only time limited.

In mid game, we unlock the second champions and higher covenant ranks, probably reaching covenant 10 and getting used to all of the races in the game and learning some useful strategies. Now it is about making the perfect decks with a bit of luck from rewards.

We will understand the whole concept of the game once we reach Covenant 20. Upon reaching 25, we gain even more difficult challenges that are usually available to mix up in custom games. The game is significantly more challenging than Covenant 1 and we can even easily lose the first battle with all challenges accepted.

The game has a very high skill ceiling and me as an occasional card player, now only became an addict thanks to this game. I usually gain half or third of the best players ranked in the daily and custom challenges.

There are 5 races + 1 in the Last Divinity DLC;
Hellhorned - high damage multi strikers, rage and armor gainers focused on melee combat.
Awoken - high health gainers, multi strikers and sweepers with abilities to draw more cards.
Stygian Guard - incanters, frostbiters and spell users, low melee damage and starting HPs.
Umbra - unit eaters, lifestealers, damage shield gainers, a lot of small units, late high stats.
Melting Remnant - stealthers focused on resurrecting units and slow stat and gold gainers.
Wurmkin - eggs and worms, echo infusers, focused on making the floors magically strong.

Every run is unique, we can replay the same alliances and get different starting decks and meet different bosses.

There are 3 major bosses and 12 minor bosses; they are accompanied by many heavy and support units. There is also a bonus level with 1 more boss but I only got there once.

author: Pixelwarrior
review_text:
Coming from Slay the Spire, I was really feeling like a similar game and I quite found it with Monster train. Nice concept, nice monsters, and a good replay value with the different races.
I was just slighlty disapointed by the very low number of bosses that makes every run feel the same and some races like Umbra that are nice to play but a bit of a one trick pony.

author: whathefaq
review_text:
this game is worse than Slay the spire in everyway possible
- excessive animations
- not well balanced
- quite poorly optimized
- too many animation
- wonky animation
- everything looks the same with the background
- non transparency. You have no idea what card is discarded and what card is gone forever, unlike Slay the spire
- again, unbalanced, none rewarding. Instead of killing some bosses for big reward you just randomly get some broken relic and upgrade by doing absolutely nothing
- victory and defeat feel the **** same, there's no sense of achievement

In short its bad, its not fun

author: skovik
review_text: I give it a 9 but part of me wants to give it a 0 because this game is like METH IT IS SO ADDICTIVE AND MAKES MY BRAIN CRAZY it is literal dopamine fed directly to your brain. I don't know if I recommend it because as soon as you start playing you will lose hours without realising it and your brain will be overstimulated to a point where you see the little monsters and the projectiles flying in front of you when you close your eyes. It's perfect for when you're stressed or feeling down though because it requires 0 thinking and distracts you from everything in your life...

author: RefinedInsights
review_text: Its a fun time, but as you upgrade your skill tree, it gets boring real fast so overall its above average as a game but the fun doesnt last.

author: Zareli
review_text:
One of the best games of 2022.Simple gameplay mechanics, incredible depth and hidden stuff, lot's of extra content added after they received love from the public.
I had to substract one point because the game got unapproachable at some point that they added too much stuff and it became more like bloated than a grower game. I didn't understand anything after not playing for a couple of months and never could pick it up later.

author: ddtv0236
review_text: Genre-defining game right here. Endless fun with wacky stages, brain-melting bullet hells and frustrating yet rather enemies really made this game a must-play.

author: ZzTopNemesis
review_text:
Score: 7.4

A very fun and somewhat addicting game, however i would like it to have a more present and engaging story to promote the progression besides my ADHD will the try and get all achievments

author: HatTopGaming
review_text: got recommended this game by jake baldino and it was one of my first buys on steam deck. no fps issues no hit box issues, no cheese, no annoying extra mechanics. just solid nonsensical fun

author: bariemai666
review_text: Time flies like crazy when you play this game. Great references and Easter eggs. Wholesome gameplay, relaxing and visually appealing.

author: LordLoc75
review_text: Vampire Survivors – Review SummaryVampire Survivors is an addictive and deceptively simple roguelike shoot-’em-up where your character auto-attacks through endless waves of monsters, collecting upgrades, evolving weapons, and trying to survive for as long as possible—usually up to 30 minutes per stage before the inevitable arrival of a death-dealing Reaper. With minimalistic controls but deep progression systems, it’s easy to pick up and hard to put down.Developed by Luca “poncle” Galante, this indie gem began as a small solo project in 2021 and exploded into popularity thanks to its affordable price, nostalgic Castlevania-inspired art, and wildly satisfying gameplay loop. What starts off slow quickly turns into chaotic bullet-heaven mayhem, with the screen packed with colorful enemies, projectiles, and loot. Despite its visual simplicity, it’s mechanically rich, offering endless combinations of characters, weapons, power-ups, and unlockable **** game constantly rewards experimentation and persistence. Each run earns gold that you can use to unlock permanent upgrades, characters, and relics, and players are encouraged to explore different builds and gameplay modifiers. Its DLCs (both paid and free) continue to expand the content with new stages, characters, weapons, and crossover content from franchises like Castlevania, Among Us, Contra, and SaGa.Content-wise, the game now includes local co-op, mobile cross-platform versions (with ads), and ports on nearly every major platform—including Tesla cars—and even has a live-action film adaptation in the works.With nearly 53 hours of playtime, one player likened the experience to a serotonin bomb, comparing it to the addictive mind-control game from Star Trek. It’s thrilling, hypnotic, and overwhelming in the best way—though not for the photosensitive.Final Verdict: An exceptional indie time-sink bursting with charm, challenge, and replayability. Highly recommended.Score: 9.5/10

author: vleatherback
review_text: The junk food of video games. It isn't good for you, there isn't much there, but its reliable and good and you just want it now and then. Playing this game mindlessly while watching a show or YouTube is a great experience.

author: Mehdi21k
review_text:
Sympathique, ça fait bien passer le temps.
Marrant a plusieurs !
Le meilleur jeu dans son genre.

author: ramonkaguya
review_text: Well, there is a lot to say, but I think it is unnecessary. This powerful game only serves to enhance something that should be the key to interpreting any game. Games are defined, essentially, by their mechanical aspect. And this is the best of the genre. A game is not art, nor music, nor realistic graphics. A game is mechanics; the rest is adornment.

author: Ghoster
review_text: What was that? That kind of games was fun 40 years ago. Are good reviews bots or time machine travelers?!?!

author: barril76
review_text: The worts indie in my life I ever player. This it's like those Altari's games that nobody cares. I think this is worts than E.T. never play this

author: WaffleEnjoyer
review_text:
I read a lot about this game online. How amazing and addictive it is. So I got it, played it on Steam Deck.

I really tried to like this game, but after about one and a half hours of trying, I can't see why others love this game so much. As I see it, I spawn in, pick up a few items, hope to the digital gods that the automated attacks hit even one of the monsters (that's right, you can't actually attack anything, the game does that for you - and often times fails, unfortunately) and then die. That on repeat. If that's the type of game you enjoy, go for it. Maybe I just haven't sunken enough time into it. But I definitely wouldn't buy it a second time.

author: freakybit
review_text: An absolute gem. Pure fun. If you are interested in something that focuses on the gameplay, look no further.

author: mattmars
review_text:
I love Brotato — I’ve purchased this game three times on different platforms: Xbox One X, Steam, and iOS!
This game is incredibly addictive, simple yet absolutely genius. I play Brotato everywhere — it’s my favorite 2D game of all time. I really appreciate the addition of the co-op feature and all the new content.
Easily a 10/10 — a brilliant tactical masterpiece!

author: gfutyyhgh
review_text:
brotato is a really good game its combat mechanics are really good its got good progression in terms of difficulty its character selection means that it never becomes dull plus its one of the most cheapest games you will ever buy plus its dlc is really good too
rating 10/10

author: Adreil044
review_text: I tried brotato in an extremely perfect time where I was exhausted  by hard games and desire a short fabulous game that feels challenging but not frustrating. It did the job well, the game don't provide you tedious instructions but it doesn't overwhelm you with a bunch of new things. In conclusion,  It is good, cheap and worth a try.

author: BigTtheKind
review_text: really fun game,I like the variate of weapons and characters to choose from, and I love how challenging this game is, even without seeming it,I'm on danger 2 rn, I'm not very good at it yet, but this game is so simple, yet they did it so good even tho it is,Icant name a problem rn, but I dont think this game is a 10.

author: JKaiya
review_text: Pretty fun addicting rougelike, but the game is so simple that there isn't any real variety to everything, as even with the likely hundreds of options, they are in reality very similar. Like for weapons the only real variation is melee and ranged. There are tons of its own categories within those that give different set bonuses for using that class of weapon, and different weapons with some different abilities within those, but they all feel the same when you play. The game is very very very addicting, but fun wise it is pretty much the same from the get go with little actual variety.

author: Korelis
review_text:
This game is really great. It is quite simple, as you are just left in a rectangle map with survival as your only goal, but man does this simple concept allow for a fun, smooth gameplay. The weapons synergise very well with the different characters, and have their own feeling. Some characters may be too easy to beat the game with, whereas some characters really are a hard mode, but I'd say you can still enjoy the game with any character, as long as you find the appropriate build.
Another thing this game does very well is shopping. Unlike some similar games, items in Brotato feel impactful and a single item can save your run, get your character to another level, or, at the complete opposite, completely ruin it. Definitely recommand this game.

author: m1rza2092
review_text: Dude this game is really good, it's like Vampire Survivors, there are different classes, they have their own starting weapons, so it's a fun game

author: DosluQ
review_text: Brotato, boş vakitlerde zaman geçirmek için oldukça keyifli ve bağımlılık yapıcı bir oyun. Farklı karakter türleri ve yapılabilecek birçok kombinasyon sayesinde uzun süre oynanabilirlik sunuyor. Ancak bana göre en büyük eksisi, oyunun genel olarak kolay olması. Maksimum zorluk olan 5. seviye bile yeterince zorlayıcı değil. (Sonsuz mod da var ama aynı düşmanların sadece daha güçlü hâlde tekrar tekrar gelmesi pek keyifli değil.) Kısacası, Brotato eğlenceli bir oyun ama basit zorluğu nedeniyle bir süre sonra sıkıcı hale gelebilir.

author: HatTopGaming
review_text: i feel like the trailers dont do this game justice. ive had the game in my library for a while but only recently started playing it but i see the draw to it now. If you like metrovania rogue lites or something similar in that regard you'll like this one for sure. Easy to understand stat modifiers, plenty of characters to unlock and play with. enough weapon variety to change play style. good progression system

author: lstep26tsjdiisf
review_text: Back in 'nam I was warring in guns a go go and I was going through hell but I  thought to myself at least I'm not in London.This game was a severe PTSD trigger for me due to all the realism but it is very 'MERICAN so 10/10 I tell you hwhat. GOD BLESS AMERICA!

author: nebirosity
review_text: Balance is absolutely non-existent, which renders Brotato insanely difficult and unfun at higher levels. Plenty of characters but that just makes the game feel wide as an ocean and as deep as a puddle. Fine to mess around with for a couple hours but not even worth the five bucks they're asking for it.

review_text: Bland enemies and bland gameplay. The weapons and item combinations don't synergize well at all. It's so repetitive. This is the worst vampire-survivor-like game I've played.

review_text: I got mixed feelings about this game. you dont get anything handed to you. Every runs start you from the start. There is no meta progression at all. Even insanely lucky runs with op items and perks can fail in seconds. The game is the first game I'm close to saying that its too hard. It took me about 15hr for my first win, so hang in there. Im satisfied with my win but I wont be going for another because its just too much rng.

review_text: Very good game. I enjoyed playing this game a lot. I strongly recommend this.

author: K1jyu
review_text:
The inclusion of physics in every dot is a kind of madness.
The replayability and the ease of death may not match the game in some aspects, but I can definitely recommend this roguelite action game as a fun game!

I recommend you to be very careful, as the difficulty level is quite high!

author: adamflame7
review_text: Such a unique game. At it's most basic level, it is a side scrolling rogue-like/lite action game where you try to get better wands and spells and make it to the bottom and "win", all the while featuring a very cool set of physical, chemical, and sometimes bizarre interactions from their cool custom game engine. Only after you have "won" might you start seeing that you've only touched the surface and start to see how far down the rabbit hole goes. Just a heads up, if you're an unlucky lad like myself (or even if you are lucky), this game can be punishingly brutal at times.

author: tonedef
review_text: Overrated. As a pixel fan who owns almost every type of game I can say Noita has some of the best physics which most pixel games don't have. I think most gamers are just caught up in the environment but not so much the gameplay. Its like a RNG, hide and seek simulator. You dungeon crawl very carefully on a handful of dungeons and RNG some wands and spells along the way. You have to take it super slow so you don't RNG yourself to death. What good is having those physics if you cant go crazy battling monsters and creating havoc on the world around you. Just wasn't my style of gameplay and felt more inhibiting then fun.

author: all_i_need
review_text: Meh story, weak animations, it's just whatever. Wouldn't recommend in all honesty. But that's just me and i like quality.

Terrible game. First, it crashes constantly. Second, the dev doesn't respond to attempts to contact. Third, the game just kills you with RNG. Fourth, recent changes make the game even more random for no reason.

1 star instead of 0 because it looks nice.

author: S3XU4LH34L1NG
review_text: Like the first game its an absolute banger. Especially during the main story the quality and content density is insane. beat the main story in about 20 hr and I was engaged for another 20 hrs in the endgame. If you are so inclined you can continue with insane "challenge" runs. But this is where i stop. 10/10 voice acting and art btw.

author: kotokoto
review_text:
The amount of variations and the continuity in dialogues, character progress and quests are absurd (there're problems during ea and 1.0, but after the newest patch I really have nothing to complain). During my 100+ hrs gameplay I only have a few vague dejavu about those characters' comments.
Combats are also refined: non-repetitive elements are natural and immersive, repetitive ones are also posh enough to make me want to repeat. It can give you everything in between broken cakewalks and tough stressful wars at your will and things are almost always playful with either strong builds or wacky funny builds.

author: Funny7Cloud
review_text: 从EA购入到正式发布，这么一长段的时间的体验，没有理由不给一个好评。EA开始音乐就已经非常抓人了，美术延续了一贯风格，人物个性设计，对话，剧情都带有着其浓郁的风格，大家都知道这就是Hades。制作组在EA期间有在认真工作是最让我满意的，因为现在太多的EA游戏开了骗钱白烂，毫无职业精神，对自己的作品事业毫不在意，他们就是一意孤行的骗钱，很高兴Supergiant没有，放心的购买，放心的游玩，游戏好玩，能带来快乐，让玩家享受。制作组了解自己的作品，与玩家交心，产品自然也不会差。还有什么可说的呢，互相尊重在这个行业真的难能可贵了。

author: T-Opel
review_text:
One of the best games ever. Infinite replayability, plenty of options to customize the difficulty, great characters, voice acting, music, and I could go on - I don't think there is a single thing I disliked. Even the ending, which I learned that people have issues with, seemed perfectly appropriate given the time-related main plotline.

If you love roguelike games, you must absolutely not miss this one!

author: yipee0304
review_text: Such a breath of fresh air in a time where every game is just a mindless pew pew with guns. I find it hard to find something that I hated about this game, but if there's any con to point out, I'd say the requirement to reach the true ending really tests your patience at how many runs you need to repeat, which is why it's a 9 for me. But other than that, I love everything, the music, the graphics, the combat, the story, the dialogue, the **** the anime art is just...they knocked it out of the park.

author: Silentwalker
review_text:
What can I say about Hades 2? Well, not much. The only thing it really has going for it is it's combat and that's it. 

The Combat in Hades 1 however was better, well everything about Hades 1 is better than 2. The characters are boring, their designs are horrible and uninspired. 

When you think of these types of gods you think yeah they're going to look awesome! Amazing Armour and styles that fits what they're based on. But nope, bland, poorly designed and for the life of me why are they taking away from what they should look like? 

For example, you have a god in a wheelchair... I'm sorry but what? You're a god, make a new pair lol.

It got to a point where I didn't care about the story at all and just became annoying to listen to so I just tried skipping past them all just to get back to the game play but it just got too boring with everything that surrounds it.

author: Kerosenne
review_text:
It's just worse than the first. The boons are either nerfed or boring.
It's more bullet hell than the first one. The weapons don't do anything interesting. The enemies spawn from the first moment with armor.
It seems they got feedback alright, from the jobless squad to ensure they make this game feel like a chore. My bad for trying to have fun and not enjoying the x3 boon of weakness. WOW "30% less damage" never seen that one before. Miss me with this sh**.
The story is good, the graphics are also good but... It's a game. It should be better in gameplay. If all you wanted was to recycle the gameplay so you can tell some spinoff you could have made a visual novel.

author: Atratzu
review_text:
-Quick Review-Crypt of the NecroDancer is a roguelike rhythm game, developed by Brace Yourself Games and released in 2015. Crypt of the NecroDancer combines all the elements of a 2D Top-down Roguelike with procedural generated levels, picking up different weapons gear and items to make your “build”, all the while digging through walls and battling monsters in an underground dungeon to the beat of the music.

-Detailed breakdown review-Story: At the start of the game, there’s a cutscene of the first playable character named “Cadence” digging in a graveyard to uncover the truth of her long-lost treasure-hunting father. She falls underground and the NecroDancer steals her heart and forces her to move to the rhythm of the **** Cadence plays through the acts, she will unlock new characters which will have different quirks, some helpful, some not so helpful, for example one character has infinite bombs, and another character can’t attack at all.

Gameplay: Movement is up, down, left, and right, some items require you to tap two directions at the same time, like down + left to drop bombs, and up + left to use an item (The Steamdeck assigns buttons rather than directional inputs. This game is great on Steam deck by the way). You attack by moving in the same direction as an enemy or attackable **** the previous mentioned movement must be done at the rhythm of the music, if you miss or skip the beat your character will NOT be injured however you’ll be at a “disadvantage”. You lose your gold multiplier, and the rest of the dungeon will move around you to the beat of the music, sometimes you’ll miss a critical turn and die because the monster got an extra turn. I have used this to my advantage once or twice… but the game definitely rewards and incentivizes the player to move with the **** experience at the start of each zone was “Oh no… there’s no way I’m going to figure out how to play this game”. Then after playing and dying on the same level for a bit, I’d make progress and get lucky with my weapon, armor, items, etc… then I’d get to the next zone, and we were right back at square one “oh no… this is when I’ll need to quit, it’s too hard”. But I did slowly learn the monsters’ attack patterns through lots of trial and error.

Conclusion: Crypt of the Necrodancer is a good game. I’d recommend it to people who enjoy rhythm games… maybe more so than recommending it for people who like roguelikes. Certainly, it has roguelike stuff in it, but you really need to like the rhythm-based gameplay, if you don’t like rhythm-based gameplay the game really won’t appeal to you in the same way. However, it does have options to make the game easier too, so it can be more accessible to **** you don’t commit to getting everything, you’re looking at roughly 13-15 hours playing the game as Cadence. (More or less playtime will be required depending on how naturally good you are at the game, and how lucky you get on your runs) And if you’ve got the time and motivation to really learn the game you’re looking at hundreds of hours of play. The game is a completionist nightmare, I wouldn’t recommend doing that to yourself… but completionists already subject themselves to that agony… what’s there to lose to a little indie game, right? 

…There's more to the review... If you want to know more, please check out my YouTube Video or Steam Review.

author: Yargghhh69
review_text: Crypt of the NecroDancer is a brilliantly unique rhythm-based roguelike that blends dungeon crawling with beat-matching mechanics. Its pulsating soundtrack, addictive gameplay loop, and quirky charm make every run a thrilling dance of strategy and reflexes. A must-play for fans of both roguelikes and rhythm games.

author: ddtv0236
review_text: Crypt of the NecroDancer completely surprised me. I didn’t think a rhythm-based roguelike would hook me, but the moment I started syncing my moves to the beat, I was hooked. The soundtrack is electric, the gameplay feels like a constant high-stakes dance, and every run feels fresh and intense. It’s one of those rare games where I catch myself nodding along even after I’ve closed it.

author: giannis2001
review_text: Very challening but great game. I am not that good in the game but I love it. It's mostly trial and error. If you keep playing, you will eventually get good. I don't think you need you necessarilyneed any experiance with other rythm games.

author: dogukansapmz
review_text: Crypt of the Necrodancer bir rogue-like oyun olmasına rağmen rakiplerinden oldukça sıyrılarak önümüze orjinal bir iş koymayı başarıyor. Oyunun genel yapısı her bölümün kendisine özel şarkısının ritmiyle hareket etmek. Bu oyunun direk core mekaniği çünkü rakiplerimiz de aynı ritimle hareket ediyor ve biz ritimi kaçırırsak onlar ilerleyebiliyor. Bizim ritmi kaçırdığımız durumlarda kendi saldırı hakkımızı kaybediyor bazen de durduğumuz özel bloklara göre hasar alabiliyoruz. Oyunda 15 tane oynanabilir karakter var ve bu karakterler düz skin'ler değiller de oynanabilir oyun mod'ları gibiler. Mesela birinde sadece bomba kullanabilirken bir diğerinde hiç para almadan oyunu bitirmeye çalışıyorsunuz. Oyunda 10'larca farklı mob var. Aynı zamanda 7-8 tane miniboss tipi düşman ve 5-6 tane ana boss tipi düşman var. Bu mob'ların ve miniboss'ların aynı zamanda farklı skin'li halleriyle de karşılaşıyoruz ki normalde bu durum diğer tipteki oyunlarda çok göze çarpmasına rağmen bu oyunda düşmanların bu skin değişimiyle ayrı mini mekanikler kazanması ve bir  yandan güçlenmesi oyuna çok çeşitlilik katıyor. Mesela 1 cana sahip kalkanlı iskelete 1 vuran bir silahla vurduğumuzda direk kalkanı düşerken 2 canlı kalkanlı iskelete vurduğumuzda kalkanı yerinde kalıyor , onun kalkanını düşürmek için yandan vurmamız gerekiyor. Sadece mob çeşitliliği değil aynı zamanda en dış tabakası dışında tamamiyle kırılabilir haritadan oluşan bu oyunda aynı zamanda etraftaki blokların da belirli item'larla kırılıp bazılarının kırılmaması , çeşitli tuzaklar , 6-7 tane silah tipi ve bu silah tiplerinin de 4-5 tane tarzı var. 10'larca büyü var. Bunların dışında kafana , göğsüne taktığın zırhların ve taktığın kolyeyle yüzüklerin de her birinin ayrı özelliklerinin olması tamamiyle oynanışı değiştiriyor. Özellikle oldukça cezalandırıcı bir gameplay'e sahip olduğundan item'larınızı tam potansiyeli kullanmak zorundasınız. Aynı zamanda bu sahip olduğumuz item'ları kullanmak için sadece ''q'' ya da ''g'' ye basmak gibi değil de ''aşağı ok+üste ok'' şeklinde olmasından ötürü o hızlı aksiyonun varlığından ötürü elinin ayağını dolaşması , yanlış item'ı kullanmak gibi durumlar oldukça zevkli bir oynanış ortaya tutuyor. Oyunun genel rogue-like elementlerini de güzel kullanıyor. Klasik bir şekilde run'dan kazandığımız para birimiyle kalıcı upgrade'ler , sonraki oyunda karşımıza çıkabilecek silahlar , zırhlar satın alabiliyoruz. Genel oynanış dışında arka planda bir hikaye de ilerliyor ama çok da iyi değil zaten ana odak da bu değil. Hikaye ilerledikçe yeni oynanabilir karakterler açılıyor ki bu da ana oyunun setting'inden sıkıldığında minik bir rahatlama hissi veriyor. Rogue-like oyunlardan artık sıkılsam da türün diğer örneklerinden kendini tamamen ayırmasından ötürü oynanış sürem boyunca bana oldukça güzel eşlik etti. Türün sevenine kesinlikle öneriyorum , sevmeyenine de kesinlikle denemesini istiyorum. 🅖🅤🅜🅤🅢

author: apokalipto
review_text: Very good game. I enjoyed playing this game a lot. I strongly recommend this.

author: klaaz
review_text: An entertaining combination of dungeon crawler and rhythm game. Although it can be a bit difficult and confusing at the beginning, as the hours go by you start to enjoy better the different games in the game.

author: edxtan
review_text: Crypt of the Necrodancer blends real-time and turn-based combat by making players and enemies move to the beats of its infectious music. The varying items and enemies all randomly combine into puzzles that need to be solved on the fly.

it has only four levels with each character and yet it takes long time to master the movements of the enemies and the uses of the weapons.

I find the designs of the characters and enemies in this game to be very good (especially the bishops. My god they look sick), but for all of it's charm, it does start to feel repetitive after a while, especially the base building aspect. Also, maybe it is just me, but my game kept freezing and I constantly had to reset the game. Not a deal breaker (could have just been my computer) and overall, had a lot of fun. (Also rest in peace River Boy. You will be missed.)

review_text: Игра мне понравилась, но есть нюансыБоевка, рисовка, музыка просто супер! Боссфайты в игре просто афигенные, но к 3/4 игры механики с другими локациями и сильным развитием своего культа начинают подзадалбывать. Мне просто хотелось поддерживать характеристики культа на том уровне, чтобы это не приносило мне неудобств, но развивать его или ходить по другим локациям было скучно.Хотелось бы чтобы было две сложности - сложность боев и сложность развития культа.А так, игра супер, не шедевер, но вечерком на часик зайти супер - 7/10

author: WaKZaD
review_text: You realy need to try it special game rougelike and kind of strategies good gameplay

review_text: Insane, the gameplay is awesome but the only problem is that you lose too much faith when you die.

author: luberchris
review_text:
TL;DR Fun deck builder with a good challenge. No bugs.

I have high hopes for the future development of this game. It combines elements of chance through Plinko with deck-building and dungeon-crawling akin to a Slay the Spire clone, which is as refreshing as it is unique. The enemies are challenging, and the unlockable levels of the Cruciball mode add further challenges after each successful run. In addition, the option to speed up the entire game is a nice touch that helps with the grind. 

Negatives are few and far-between, outside of the normal frustration of difficulty. I may argue that more goblin classes (now unlockable), relics, or more orb types could add further variety to the game, but there is absolutely plenty of variety in the current state. I highly recommend this game for fun, quick entertainment if you enjoy deck builders with a touch of mindlessness.

author: hoanns
review_text: Entertaining for a while, good on mobile. Finding synergies in your orb is fun and the game can be quite challenging

author: ArxadeBugQueen
review_text: I'm lost as to what precisely the draw of Peglin is meant to be. For a **** machine it's unsatisfying and uninteresting, for a roguelite it's repetitive and dull, and for a deck builder it's restrictive and lacks variety. At least a small amount of charm and heart shines through, but I think one run is enough to tell you if you will enjoy this game or not.

author: BoogieBomb
review_text: This is the most expansive open world game I've ever played. The possibilities are truly endless. Every play through can be completely different. I couldn't imagine fromsoftware making a a better open world souls game.

author: Garghina
review_text: An open world with various matryoshka dungeons Dark Souls-like. Yes. But that would be reductive. This game takes the open-world formula from Zelda: Breath of the Wild and adapts it to Miyazaki's vision, with incredible results. The journey will be incredible, and the desire for discovery will be great around every corner of the map. Shadow of the Erdtree DLC reinvents the level-based rules of the game, but with dedicated perks that might demoralize level-farming players, but once you get the hang of it, it works much better than the original game, forcing you to change your approach, especially with bosses.

author: astrobean
review_text: One of the all time peak video game experiences of my 30yo life. The game play, the aesthetics, the difficulty, the cheese, the aura, the story, the atmosphere, the loot... just peak. FromSoft is just showing how it's done and they truly deserve all the acclaim, support, and financial success.

author: Gorillaman0609

author: noleme
review_text:
I don't find this game to be much fun. Mostly just tedious. I made it maybe halfway before I decided it just wasn't for me and quit. I stopped after the underground part, after beating ancient spirit I think. This was my first fromsoft game besides sekiro which is awesome. I did like the legacy dungeons. 

The open world is a time waster. You're really just going from boss to boss. The things in between are either worthless enemies or rewards which, 9 times out of 10 are also worthless. 

That'd be ok if combat was good but I find it boring, especially coming from Sekiro. Mostly stay away from the boss or dodge roll until you get an opening. Repeat until boss is dead. Vastly inferior combat system compared to sekiro. People will just say git gud but what's git gud even mean in this game. I had a lot of trouble against an optional boss, ancient hero of zamor I think, so I left and came back much later and whooped it. I hadn't gotten any better at the game. I simply had better weapons and leveled up. So it did not feel satisfying to me. That's really the whole point of these games, the satisfaction of beating a boss, but Elden Ring just feels like a chore to me.

This game got endless praise so I've watched a lot of criticism videos hoping to find I'm not crazy for not liking the game. I think it's odd that many of these videos called it a great game or even a masterpiece with flaws. That makes no sense, a masterpiece to me means as flawless as one can reasonably expect. There seems to be a culture around this game that can't accept criticism. The only thing that is a masterpiece around this game is the marketing campaign that combined with the reputation of fromsoft, created a feeling of fomo and a degree of hype that led to its massive success.

author: LeFourge
review_text:
My advice: Try it for an hour on Steam. If you don’t enjoy the first hour, you can get a refund (as long as you’ve played less than two hours). That first hour gives a clear idea of what the entire game will be like. 
Suspiciously overrated by so-called "pros." 
I gave it 1 star because I personally disliked the game mechanics — not because it’s buggy. It’s an easy game, but frustratingly hard to play. The gameplay is clunky and takes a long time to get used to. There’s no story. No guidance. It’s artificially difficult due to the lack of information needed to play it properly. The difficulty is poorly balanced. The beginner tutorial is a complete joke. Combat mechanics feel outdated and poorly coded. The latency is awful and takes ages to adapt to. I’d estimate you need around 50 hours of practice just to handle the battle interface. Once you finally understand how to play and uncover the hidden mechanics, the game becomes boringly repetitive and ridiculously easy. The graphics are terribly optimized and run painfully slow even on a high-end PC. Don’t buy.

author: Ilves15
review_text: I think that Elden Ring is again one of those games that got popular because of overly glazing users and critics. It drifts the furthest from the basic souls games premise out of all the souls games. It lacks those emotions and gameplay that games like Bloodborne offer you. So the only way I would recommend this to you is if you have some extra big money that you want to spend on something expensive, then buy this game, otherwise buy Bloodborne and experience some real gameplay and emotions.

I still prefer the original DS but this is an excellent sequel.

author: LuceLuna
review_text: До выхода Учан это был лучший представитель СЛ который в принципе и породил данный жанр. В целом игра заслуживает оценки 7, но я поставил 8 только из за того что это культовая игра, теперь о плюсах и минусах. Среди минусов причем для меня очень значимых это сюжет. Его практически нет, и тот факт, что он в данном стиле практически не раскрывается не является оправданием, что игру создали просто как слешер в своем уникальном стиле без надобности для игрока что либо объяснять. Мало текста, мало персонажей, невзрачные пару секундные концовки, всё это огромный минус, для игры которая могла нести в себе оболочку смысла и сюжета, а не быть просто отличной сложной по геймплею игрой. Второй значимый минус отсутствие желания её проходить снова. Почему? А в чём смысл, если сюжета нет и ты не откроешь для себя ничего, что мог бы пропустить в первый раз? НГ+ в этой игре становится крайне лёгким из за типичной инфляции характеристик и уже заученных боссов. Последнее. Это отвратительные модели персонажей. Без шуток, главный герой просто создан быть уродом, как бы ты не старался создать нормального(даже не красивого персонажа), у тебя вряд ли получится. Во первых модели тела ужасны, они не естественны и корявы а лица это вообще кошмар. Самый лучший вариант это надеть броню на всё тело и закрыть это безобразие. Броня это единственное что хорошо сделано в плане моделей связанных с персонажами. Теперь плюсы. Шедевральный саундтрек. Один из лучших в плане погружения и так сказать подходит именно для этой игры на 200%. Геймплей, на первом заходе сложновато, но это также зависит от типа оружия, которым ты решишь проходить. Класс очень решает. Теперь графика, в целом она устарелая, но люди которые занимались конструированием дворцов, замков, архитектуры скульптур, они реально гении. Просто шедевральный антураж, который контрастирует с вашим уродливым персонажем. Странное ощущение. В целом это одна из лучших СЛ игр. Однозначна к прохождению, хотя бы раз.

author: egeiscimen
review_text: Tight level design and refined combat make this a culmination of the Souls formula. Fast-paced yet deliberate, it hits a near-perfect balance of challenge and reward.

author: nirohero
review_text: Weakest soulsborne game. It's the dodge-roll simulator boss rush personified. Dark Souls 3 lacks atmosphere, innovation, immersive level design, cohesiveness and is too fan-servicey. A lot of areas are reused assets from Bloodborne and some of the bosses are straight up bad. This game gets a good rep for its bosses but in truth there's 2 bad bosses for every good one. You can tell Miyazaki was forced to make this game due to the backlash of DS2 but he flopped pretty hard on this one.
