author: SzeBBe
review_text: If there’s even a hint of Soulslike appreciation in a player, it’s hard to imagine they wouldn’t fall in love with Lies of P. The bosses are fantastic: never unfair, always exciting, and the game gives countless ways to customize difficulty—summons, consumables, or powerful weapon options—so how tough it feels is truly up to the player's choices. It’s often called challenging, but with these tools, the real difficulty is self-imposed. Lies of P gave me that “once-in-a-lifetime” feeling I only rarely get—in many ways, it made me feel the same magic as playing Dark Souls 3 for the first time. It isn’t just a clone; it has real identity, a unique story, and NPCs whose fates I genuinely cared about. The motivation to push through tough moments and the excitement of discovery are both strong, thanks to its powerful narrative. Krat, the city you explore, is incredible—dense, atmospheric, and refreshingly straightforward. I’m grateful it isn’t another bloated open world; instead, it strikes a balance, offering side routes and hidden areas to explore, but with purposeful direction. Rarely these days can a game deliver a peak experience in a tight, focused package without unnecessary padding. The story, inspired by Pinocchio, is charmingly unique and walks a perfect line between mystery and emotion. Choices matter and deepen your investment in the journey. That said, the game isn’t flawless. In the latter stages, enemy designs are often reused, sometimes making encounters feel repetitive or dull. It can be disappointing to see an imposing boss earlier in the journey reappear later as a regular foe. Additionally, one or two of the more gimmicky bosses didn’t live up to the challenge or creativity of the rest. While narratively justified, these moments felt like missed opportunities for more engaging gameplay and broke the momentum at times. Gameplay-wise, it delivers crisp, challenging combat with phenomenal weapon variety, thanks especially to its unique blade-and-handle crafting system. Mixing and matching weapon parts kept my experience fresh, allowing for creativity and making every battle unique. For me, Lies of P is more than a game—it’s an unforgettable adventure that I’m genuinely happy I experienced. Despite these minor hiccups, I can wholeheartedly recommend Lies of P, even at full price. The journey it offers is truly worth every penny.

author: Achraf05
review_text:
The game is truly beautiful and stands as one of the best Souls-like experiences, very close to Bloodborne. The bosses are powerful and beautifully designed, and the world is exactly as it should be. There’s only one real issue: the shortcut system. At first, it was well done, but later on, the placement felt completely wrong. However, this doesn’t kill the fun at all, since the save points are perfectly distributed, making it not too bothersome. As for the story, it was good at first but became excellent with the addition.

That’s why I highly recommend it!️️
One more thing for those who say the game is extremely difficult: it’s a Souls-like, what did you expect? The game actually becomes relatively easier once you master perfect parries. That’s why I think those who criticize it for being hard are simply not the target **** thank you ️

author: mattharbour
review_text: Lies of P stands out as one of the most impressive soulslikes in recent years. I'd describe it as a story-driven soulslike, thanks to its focus on narrative, the inclusion of multiple difficulty modes, and the fluidity of both gameplay and storytelling.Combat-wise, it holds its own against FromSoftware's best. The parry system, while challenging to master, offers incredibly satisfying feedback once you get the hang of it. It rewards precision and timing in a way that feels genuinely rewarding. The soundtrack deserves special praise—it's phenomenal. Every track complements the story and the atmospheric setting beautifully. That said, I would have liked to see more engaging and less linear level design. While the ambiance does a great job setting the tone, a more interconnected world could have added another layer of depth to **** area that could be improved is the pacing of difficulty. The game begins in a fairly approachable way, making it welcoming for newcomers, but later boss fights—despite their excellent design—feature abrupt difficulty spikes that might feel discouraging to those new to the genre. A smoother difficulty curve would have made the experience more consistently rewarding. 8/10

review_text: One of my favorite games of the decade. Great combat, art style, level design.

review_text: I hope there are fewer games in this world that increase the difficulty of games by making the protagonist suffer from polio.

author: vitassoulz
review_text: Se você está pensando em jogar "Lies of P", recomendo reconsiderar. O jogo pode até brilhar em alguns aspectos, como seus gráficos dhr e uma trilha sonora envolvente, mas o restante é um desastre completo.O combate é incrivelmente frustrante, com mecânicas mal desenvolvidas que tornam qualquer tentativa de jogabilidade fluida um verdadeiro desafio. Não no bom sentido, como se espera de um Souls-like, mas por pura falta de polimento. Os caminhos no jogo são estreitos e mal desenhados, muitas vezes levando a lugar nenhum, como se tivessem sido feitos apenas para desperdiçar seu **** monstros são totalmente aleatórios e parecem jogados no jogo sem o menor cuidado. Mal configurados, eles não apresentam desafios inteligentes, apenas se tornam obstáculos irritantes e desconexos. sério, não consigo entender como esse jogo ganhou prêmios. A ideia de alguém achar que isso é bom me deixa perplexo, a não ser que você seja um dos poucos que aguenta qualquer coisa só por ser fã de Souls-like.E, além de tudo isso, o jogo é absurdamente caro. Não vale, nem de longe, o preço que estão pedindo. Se essa empresa lançar mais jogos, eu vou lembrar bem do nome, pra não comprar.

author: Danazoid
review_text: The Scorn of Dark Souls clones. It's a 7 from me but a high 7 (green rather than the default yellow colour).  The aesthetics are oppressive and beautiful. The slow methodical exploration and figuring out what to do is way more obtuse than Dark Souls but has a similar feeling of reward.  I'd argue that the mechanics are a little too obtuse and that as a result I didn't commit to any other playstyle rather than my starting one, but the sense of being lost in an aggressive dream-like world is very strong.  The combat for me was repetitive and sluggish and the bosses aren't the best I've seen.  For me the game shines in it's 3 main 'dungeons', and the genuinely scary 'run-backs' to base camp after killing the bosses.  As others have said the long animations and clunkyness are what hold it back, despite it clearly being intended to give the impression of heft - it does but at a cost.

author: Jebuss
review_text:
The game is skeletal and not very fleshed out but still is fun.

Don't expect to want to play all the time but is a really good first-time playthrough and should last 6-10 hours. It is fun to revisit and is worth it if you're ok with not playing a ton.

The game is a bit of a maze if you just wander so use the visions or you might want to look up a quick playthrough.

The biomes are great and are designed so that you don't spend too much time in them so they don't get repetitive too quickly.

Everything that isn't a boss isn't as fun to fight though. Mechanics are fun but I try to avoid using the hardening ability to make it feel less choppy.

The lore is interesting but there isn't a lot to it when playing through unless you dig for it. If you want lore, playthrough, and level as Solomon.

Music is good enough and sets the tone of the game.

author: Lorran2k
review_text: É um bom jogo para iniciar em jogos estilo souls, as batalhas contra chefes não são tão desafiadoras...

author: ErayTellezi
review_text:
Soulslike oyunlara getirdiği bazı yenilikler olsa da combat'taki tekrar eden yapısı, düşman çeşitliliğindeki eksiklik, boss'ların çok az hareketinin olması, combat keskinliğinin düşük olması gibi nedenlerle o kadar da beğenmedim. Dar alanlarda üzerine çok sayıda gönderilen düşmanlar bence oyunun ritmine ve hızına uygun olmamış.

Sertleşme muhabbeti ilginç. Kalkan gibi ama tekrar kullanmak için bir kaç saniye beklemek gerekiyor. Kabuk denilen cesetleri bulup artık o karakter olarak oynama fikri de ilginç olmuş. İstediğiniz zaman oyun stiliniz tamamen değiştirebiliyorsunuz. Ama bir ritim tutturduktan sonra her düşmanı ve hatta her boss'u aynı taktikle kesiyorsun zaten. Başta alışması zor oldu ama sonunda oynadığım en kolay soulslike oyundu.

Item'ları bir kez kullanmadan ne işe yaradığını bilemiyorsunuz. İlk kullanış genelde boşa gidiyor yani, beğenmedim. Bir de item'lıar belli bir sayıda kullanınca aşinalık kazanıp daha çok verim alıyorsunuz, iyi bir özellik.

Haritası bu kadar karmaşık bir oyun görmedim.  Bir de ana boss'ları kesip bir item alınca aynı yolu siste ve karanlıkta dönme fikri çok saçma olmuş.

Neticede iyi veya kötü olmayan ortalama bir iş. Souls açlığı çekenler faydasını görür ama beklenti düşük olmalı.

author: ZionEM
review_text: Desde la perspectiva de un SoulsLike, es excelente su gameplay y ambientacion, tanto como sus mecanicas originales y unicas, tambien es un juego muy versatil a la hora de tu poder cambier de estrategia para un boss o alguna zona en concreto. Pero donde pierde es en la variedad de sus Bosses y enemigos, algo aceptable teniendo en cuenta que no es un juego triple A, pero donde NO me gusto para nada y por lo cual no le doy mas punto es en su Jefe final, es realmente decepcionante.

author: Quelocura8
review_text: He jugado a juegos malos, lentos, tediosos, que no cargaban bien los personajes, con combates aburridos y sin sentido, con parrys malos o inútiles, con escudos inservibles, juegos donde el prota es lento y torpe o donde hay muchísimo delay en las acciones, frustrantes, donde los enemigos te ven desde muy lejos y te atacan, juegos donde los enemigos que normalmente tienen poca vida, tienen más que de costumbre, juegos liosos, sin historia, sin lore, incluso juegos sin sentido, pero este se lleva la palma! A parte de todo lo anterior, no he jugado un souls más malo en mi vida, menos mal que me salió gratis. Parece sencillamente una demo (sin acabar) de un juego, los enemigos no cargan bien, el combate es monótono y aburrido, el parry no sirve de mucho, los objetos y cosas que salen en la pantallas de carga ni siquiera te sirven como consejo o para enterarte de algo, parece claramente que ni lo han testeado, tienes varias armas y no vas a pasar de la principal (la tengo al máximo y el resto todavía no puedo tenerlas ni a la mitad de nivel), las mejoras de los personajes no tienen sentido (porque no son mejoras; hay un ataque que si te conviertes en piedra en el aire haces mucho daño al caer, pero no puedes ni saltar ni caer por los sitios, ¿para que he gastado monedas y vestigios? todavía no he podido usar el ataque) y estas mejoras no se aplican bien (por ejemplo no hay otra oportunidad al matar muchísimos enemigos o no te curas al conseguir vestigios, aunque diga que aumenta la probabilidad de conseguir vestigios los enemigos no sueltan más, etc.), no he visto nada del tráiler en el juego, ni las velocidades de los personajes, ni las habilidades, ni nada de todo lo chulo que parece que promete y además de todo esto, es injusto y muy corto. Está sin pulir, con controles que en mando dejan bastante que desear, controles de cámara bastante malos, esquivas contra una pared que no sabes que está porque no ves a tu alrededor, hay muchos objetos que no son destruibles ni movibles y te entorpecen la batalla (como las tiendas) y muchísimo delay, no tiene nada de profundidad ni en el mapa ni en la historia (no sabes porqué haces nada, no tiene ningún sentido ni motivación detrás, ¿salvo el mero hecho de explorar?) ni con los enemigos (ni con nada), te lo puedes pasar prácticamente corriendo todo el rato y evitando un montón de peleas (son mejores las peleas contra boses que contra los enemigos normales, tienen más sentido). El tema de la familiaridad, que me parece algo innovador, queda totalmente opacado por el resto de cosas (lo pondría como algo "bueno", pero ni si quiera). Los vestigios se quedan en cada armadura (o shell) lo que genera que cuando te cambies de una a otra para mejorarlas, te lleves una desagradable sorpresa, además de obligarte a manejar una clase de personaje que igual no es tu estilo y te deja con clases/armaduras a medio mejorar. Para usar las "habilidades", necesitas determinación, que consigues al rellenar unas barras tipo stamina en los combates pegando enemigos.... pero si dejas de combatir y no has rellenado lo suficiente la barra, desaparece y se vacía (cosa que pasa bastante porque no quieres estar todo el rato peleando), las mejoras de las armas no puedes comprarlas, debes encontrarlas, pero tampoco sirven de mucho ya que consumen muchísima determinación (hasta el parry la consume, quitando un personaje, el resto casi no tienen barras de determinación y no es algo ampliable, encima esta es una de las cosas top que aparecen en el tráiler, pero it's a trap.) En consecuencia a todo esto, el precio base me parece una pasada y que los DLC sean de pago me parece todavía más basto. Hablando de esto último parece ser que han metido en el DLC una 5ª clase al estilo pay to win. No sé de donde habrán sacado nada para hacer el 2, pero espero que sea mucho mejor que esto. Un juego estilo souls no es un juego frustrante, desquiciante, austero o con mecánicas injustas o limitadas, son juegos que te ponen a prueba y con bastante dificultad pero te permiten mediante mecánicas a tu alcance poder probar diferente modos de combate y demás, pero este no lo hace. No sé si es que las nuevas generaciones se conforman con cualquier cosa mediocre (o con cualquier plagio, ya que intenta desesperadamente parecerse a Dark Souls), pero creo que deja bastante que desear. Como culmen de todo esto, además, tiene bugs... No se lo recomendaría ni a mi peor enemigo. Por sacarle algo bueno, los gráficos no están mal (y eso es gracias a UE4) y las canciones del laúd. No pretendo que esta crítica sea un ataque al juego, es simplemente mi experiencia con el mismo y lo que me ha transmitido (decepción). Lo probé desde la beta y ahora que han pasado varios años y lo he vuelto a probar esperando alguna mejora, me he encontrado con lo mismo que en la beta.

author: BlueMoonNyK
review_text:
Theres barely anything redeemable about the game

This is one of, if not the worst, Souls like I have played in my life. This game doesnt feel like it was tested or examined by people other than the devs. Do no waste your time on it, I have died to jank more often than my own lack of skill. The enemy placement is not clever, it is annoying, Dark Souls 2 SOTFS levels of annoying. The bosses are uninspired, or worse, buggy, I have been killed MULTIPLE times by lingering hitboxes after an attack has clearly, visibly and obviously stopped. Theres is no level ups or character builds, you simply unlocks "Abilities" for your current armor that has a probability of procing.

This game is nothing like a fair Souls Like game, This game is either untested, unfinished or the developpers are incompetent

author: MartinEzy225
review_text: This game is just not good. The combat and world building and atmosphere is very lacking and subpar to other soulslike.

author: TwoBe
review_text: ###  **Mortal Shell – A Soulslike That Forgets the “Like” Part**I picked up *Mortal Shell* looking for that classic Soulslike experience — intense combat, memorable bosses, and rich, atmospheric dungeons. What I got instead was a glorified running simulator with the worst dungeon design I’ve ever seen in a video ****’s break it down: **Dungeon Design? More Like Labyrinthine Headache**I spent more time running around in circles than actually fighting enemies. The level layout is so confusing and poorly thought out that I constantly found myself ending up in the **same area I just came from**, only from a different angle — as if someone twisted a maze and forgot to label the exit. Some sections are so large and **completely empty** that I genuinely wondered if I glitched into unfinished areas. Zero enemies, zero atmosphere, just giant hallways for no reason. Whoever designed these environments seriously needs to reconsider their career.️ **Combat: The Lone Shining Light… If You Can Reach It**Boss fights were decent, I’ll give the game that. But the journey to get to them? **An absolute joke.** You’ll have to run a **marathon-length trek** through those same confusing, enemy-scarce hallways just to get back to a boss if you die. No shortcuts, no reasonable respawn points — just a big ol' middle finger to your time and patience. **Item Descriptions? Nah, Figure It Out Yourself**You want to know what an item does? Too bad! *Mortal Shell* gives you **zero info** unless you use the item first — and once you waste it, well, that's just your loss. No forgiveness, no hints, just frustration. This isn't challenge; it's **bad design** dressed up as mystery.🪖 **Shells Are Cool… Until You Try Upgrading**The Shell system — where you can possess different fallen warriors with their own strengths and weaknesses — is actually a **great idea**. It gives you flexibility and encourages experimenting with different playstyles. Unfortunately, the **skill upgrades are mostly trash**. You’ll waste precious resources unlocking garbage-tier perks that barely change anything. What’s the point of customization if it’s not worth the investment? **Final Verdict: Save Your Time, Save Your Sanity**I spent like $2 on this, and honestly, that feels like $1.50 too much. If you’re craving a Soulslike, **replay Dark Souls, Bloodborne, Sekiro**, or even other indies like *Lies of P* or *Nioh*. *Mortal Shell* is **not worth your time**, no matter how cheap it is.️ My Advice: **DO NOT BUY THIS GAME.**Save yourself the pain. Unless you want a walking simulator with a sprinkle of combat and a whole lot of bad design, steer clear.

author: DarkMistress91
review_text: I had high hopes for this one, but unfortunately, it was completely unplayable, so I deleted it. The combat feels too clunky - so after playing DS, Bloodborne and Sekiro, it was way too frustraing. Obvicouly, my opinion is biased based on playing otger much faster paced games with smoother combat style, so if you have not played any of those titles and are going straight fromthe first genre of comsoles, you might have a better time...

author: Hussini
review_text: It's very bad and not funny at all it has bad bosses bad ideas I can't call it souls game

author: Seleten
review_text: Wasted potential. There is no enemy variety, the map is monotonous, checkpoints are insufficient, fast travel should have been accessible from the very beginning of the game. We shouldn't have to collect health replenishing items over and over again.

author: Ignis_z
review_text: Years have passed since this game and the DLC on Switch still cannot be played, you should say that in the analyzes that it has two bugs that cannot be done, it directly gives you an error message when entering a temple. You should say it. On switch that is and only the Dlc

author: Not_too
review_text:
The atmosphere was definitely done correctly but my god is there a lot of jank in this game. Bosses disappearing mid fight so you have to reset. Hardening not working. Mobs not spawning in until they have already shot their arrows at you. Mobs not spawning in until you walk past the spot where they usually are and then spawning in behind you. The list goes on.

And what do Playstack do? They introduce patches that only patch out the speedrunner strats. Why?

It wouldnt be so bad if the boss fights were at least fun after the slog of going through the janky world. But no. Two of the four main bosses have about 3 moves only and the other 2 are gimmick fights.

Not worth checking out unless you are really into the souls-like genre, if even then.

author: KillerBunny
review_text:
This takes every mechanic from a soulsborne, and misunderstands them completely.

Leveling: you don't. There are no stats to speak of in this regard, or rather, you start "level evened" with your enemies and it stays that way. You'd think this is a good thing, but it absolutely is not.  You have "shells" (which you have to find). It's basically a class with extra steps, and you can't develop that class outside its bounds- like giving the no-stamina tank some stamina, or the no-HP rogue some HP.  They're stuck with those stats.

You purchase sidegrades for these shells, of which only half per shell actually relate to combat in any way, and three are universal between shells. Each shell has to have their tree unlocked *individually.*  "oh that's not so bad!" wrong. There's only four. If your playstyle doesn't fall into one of these four ideas the devs had for you, you're S.O.L. It also means that if you DO find one that's your playstyle, and you unlock the stuff you want, the EXP resource of the game becomes completely obsolete besides buying consumables.  There is no fear of death besides having to go back to the starting area of that zone.

Parrying: Parrying isn't a normal thing. It's attached to an item you have to locate. This item needs to be charged in segments, by dealing damage. If you don't, it doesn't work.  If you don't fill the segment, it decays.  Half the enemies in the game ignore parrying anyway, because "they hit too hard" or -surprise- it was actually a throw attack and you were supposed to I-frame it with a dodge. This leads to healing.

Healing: Awful.  Parrying when it's charged, and consumables you have to find in the wild.  No, they are not blood vials- blood vials you have a max you can carry and they actually work. In Mortal Shell, the consumables that heal worth anything tend to remove the resource that lets you parry. Yes, you read that right.  Healing, removes your ability to both parry & by extension, heal more.  By the way, that resource is also the resource used for special moves.  So if you ever have to heal, you can't use special attacks, because those attacks cost so much of the resource, and your healing just deleted that resource.

Weapons: There's only four weapons. Three of them are big beefy two-handers your character swings like they're just waking up. The only short weapon that swings "fast" is dual-wielded, and only does full damage if both weapons in the attack animation hit. This dual attack swing has the same overall attack speed as the big two handers with none of the range.  In addition, all the weapons seem to do the same general damage besides the one small fast weapon, for the reason I just listed (everything has to hit). It's literally just choosing what you want your attack combo to look like, and maybe some consideration to range.  Now, how about upgrades?

To unlock your special move, you have to locate a unique item for that weapon and upgrade it at the workbench or anvil.  You also *cannot switch weapons* without going back to the hub, which you cannot do regularly because there *is no fast travel.* The other alternative is finding a specific item related to that weapon, which is an item you have to "use."  However, these items tend to be hidden. That's right, they made weapon switching an item usage.  By the way, that goes for shells, too.

You can't just stop and switch your class outside the hub. You have to find a *consumable* item to switch your class out in the wild (no joke, these do NOT refresh on rest).  If you want to swap out before a boss, since there's no fast travel, you have to go *all the way back to the starting hub* or burn an item.  How bout travel, then?

There's no fast travel from point to point.  There is an infinite use item to go back to the start of the zone you're in and lose your important resource, glimpses, which don't drop on death anyway.  It's literally simpler to teleport by letting enemies kill you and respawning. If you have your shell's sidegrades unlocked, which is all glimpses do, you won't even care then.

Finally, enemies.  Half the ones had throws that'll eat huge chunks of HP, can't be parried, and are long-range lunges.  Some bosses have them and they ignore parrying AND blocking.  There's an abundance of snipers that always stun when they hit you, overlooking fight zones with heavy enemies that can two shot you.  There's multiple ambushes in every zone that are completely untelegraphed, and no way to trigger them early when you DO know about them. There's no dogs, but there's worse- poisonous suicide bomber frogs.  It's actually impossible to hit them due to how the combat animations work, their size, and when they explode.  You whiff high on every attack as they approach, and angled attacks are aimed where a torso would be, but they're on the ground.  Furthermore, they're in thin tunnels, so you just have to accept getting poisoned or burn a poison immunity.

Even Salt and Sanctuary did things better.

author: dogukansapmz
review_text:
Giriş

Salt and Sanctuary; Ska Studio'nun yaptığı, oyun dünyasının ilk büyük çaplı souls-like metroidvania yapımı. 2016 çıkış yapan bu yapım cidden bu 2 türü de kendi içinde çok iyi bir şekilde birleştirmiş. Sadece iki türü birleştirmekle kalmayıp aynı zamanda iki türün özelliklerini cidden aşırı üst seviyede yaparak başarısını ortaya koyuyor.

Oyunun Türkçe dil desteğine sahip olması da ayrı şekilde güzel.

Hikâye ve Atmosfer

Krallıklar arasında savaşın neredeyse patlak vereceği kaotik bir dönemde , ortam biraz sakinleşsin ve barış yapılsın diye iki krallık evlilik yapmaya karar veriyor. Biz de diğer krallığa prensesi götüren ekibin bir parçasıyız. Gemiyle yolculuğumuzu yaparken gemi saldırıya uğruyor ve saldırı sırasında gemi batıyor. Bu olaylar sırasında bir şekilde bayılan biz de uyandığımızda kendimizi bir kıyıda buluyoruz. Amacımız prensesi bulmak ve her neredeysek buradan çıkmak. Temel hikaye örgüsü bu. Aslında çok güzel bir dünya yaratılmış. Şu an spoiler olacağından anlatmıyorum ama çok güzel bir lore yaratılmış.

Hikaye anlatımı souls oyunlarının çoğunda olduğu gibi çevresel anlatım şeklinde ilerliyor. Yollarda ilerlerken gördüğüm şeyler , insanların anlattıkları falan bilmediğim olayları gün yüzüne çıkarıyor ve olaylara derinlik katıyor. Tabii ki de bu anlatım hikayenin çok büyük planda olduğu yapımlar kadar iyi olmasa da , aradığımız şeyi tamamiyle verdiğini düşünmekteyim. Oyunun iki sonu var. Ama bu olay gene her Souls oyununda olduğu gibi çok minik olayları yapıp yapmadığımıza göre değişen bir yapıda. Yani yapımı değil de varlığı tatmin edici son tarzlarından.

️Oynanış Mekanikleri️

Oyunun kontrolleri eski bir oyun olmasına rağmen oldukça akıcı ve genel oyun şeması kolay. Ama yeni başlayanlara çok yardımcı bir yapıda olduğunu söyleyemem. Bazı kendisine özgü mekanikleriyle Souls oyunlarından ayrılıyor ve bu durumun işimizi kolaylaştırmıyor. Oyunun genel zorluğu Souls oyunlarından biraz daha az olsa da kolay olduğu kesinlikle söylenemez. Hatta zor demek aşırıya kaçmaz.

Silah çeşitliliği oldukça fazla. Ama genel olarak belirli bir sınıfa kısıtlı kaldığımızdan ve skill tree de kullandığımız puanları yeniden düzenleme mekaniği olmadığından direk başka bir sınıfa geçme durumunuz olmuyor. Mekanikler klasik souls mekanikleri zaten. Stamina kontrolü , dodge , parry , hafif atak , ağır atak falan. Oyunda çoğu Souls oyununda olan mezhep mekaniği var. Bu mezhepler bu oyunda diğer souls oyunlarına göre çok daha önemli yer tutuyor. Çünkü direk sağladıkları kaynaklar senin oyun tarzını etkiliyor. Mesela rahip sınıf büyülerini sadece bir mezhep veriyor kalan hiçbir mezhep sana bu büyüleri sağlamıyor gibi gibi. Aynı zamanda bu mezheplerin getiridiği çok güzel bir mekanik var. Oyunda sandıklardan falan belirli totemler buluyoruz. Bulduğumuz bu totemleri bulduğumuz checkpoint'lere yerleştirerek o checkpoint'in içerisine farklı özelliklere sahip dükkan tarzı yerler açabiliyoruz ve bu totemleri koymamız aynı zamanda totem koyduğumuz bölgelerde bize ek özellikler kazandırıyor. Mesela keşif totemi bize farklı checkpoint'ler arasında fast travel imkanı sunarken aynı zamanda koyduğumuz bölgede mob'lardan düşen itemların düşme oranını arttırıyor.

Genel düşman ve boss yapay zekası oldukça kaliteli. Ama boss'ların kalitesi hakkında bunu söyleyebileceğimi sanmıyorum. Boyutu küçük boss'ların çoğu güzel fight'lar sağlarken boyutu büyük boss'ların çoğu genel mekaniksel kısıtlıklardan dolayı oldukça kolay boss'lara dönmüş. Bazı boss'lar ise zor olmasını sadece 1-2 bozuk harekete borçlu olduğundan bu konuda tam bir tutarlılık sağlanamamış. Zaten oyunda genel olarak boss'ların hasarının az olduğunu düşünüyorum. Ama aynı şekilde bazılarının belirli saldırıları var , bir kere vurduğunda kombo yapıp sana tek atabiliyor. Yani bu konuda minik sıkıntılar olduğunu söyleyebilirim.

️Grafik ve Sanat Tasarımı ️

Başta çok basit bir tasarıma sahip gibi görünse de aslında oldukça hoş bir yapısı var. Genel renk paletinin tercihinden dolayı zaten karanlık hava içimize işliyor. Çevre tasarımı da oldukça hoş. Her bölgenin birbirinden farklı yapısı oldukça belli oluyor. South Park misali karakter tasarımları insanı rahatsız edebilir cinsten ama ona da alışıyorsun. Animasyonların öyle aşırı mükemmel tarafları yok ; yeterli ve güzeller.

Sonuç ve Değerlendirme

Klasik mekaniklerin oyuna çok güzel entegre edilmiş olması
Mezhep mekaniği
Harita tasarımı
Düşman çeşitliliğinin fazla olması

Map'in olmaması
Bazı boss tasarımlarının basit kaçması

Oyun dünyasının ilk büyük çaplı souls-like metroidvaniası olan Salt and Sanctuary; bu türün ilki olmasına rağmen bazen nasıl bu kadar iyi olmasıyla insanı cidden şaşırtıyor. Her iki türün sevdalısını da kendisine çekebilecek bir yapım. Oyun beni o kadar içine çekti ki oynamaya başlamamın 3. gününün sabahı oyuna nokta koydum. Bayıldım.

🅐🅛🅣🅘🅝

author: prostoN
review_text:
Salt and Sanctuary is a weird experience, and it's the best I can describe it. It is all a metroadvania game should not be. It has an interesting gameplay, a bit sloppy controls, OK sound design and overall has tough as nails boss fights and a over-simplistic story. Its souls-like elements feel unfinished. All of the classes - even the Rogue - feel slow to control, this feels like a huge step-down from its competitors such as Hollow Knight. This game has too much gore, it remains a mystery as to what the developer was smoking. The game's sinister atmosphere creates unease.
My verdict is 7/10: it has good character customization and an OK gameplay.

author: seriousboris
review_text: Прошел я salt and sanctuary, игра неожиданно оказалось очень крутой. Игры серии souls изначально по сути своей были переносом жанра метроидвания на рельсы 3D, очень уникальным и своеобразным но все же. Salt and sanctuary еще раз перевернула ситуацию, она перенесла dark souls на рельсы 2D. С самого начала игра дает понять на что она опирается и вообще этого не скрывает, скорее прямо заявляет, что вот мы - фанаты dark souls и сделали игру под копирку, так как ее обожаем. Изначально я скептически отнесся, но когда влился оказалось что это нереально круто, жанр метроидвания идеально сочетается с dark souls, как атмосферой, так и боевкой. Тут присутствует почти все элементы присущие souls - ковенанты, души, множество разного оружия и брони, боссы и т.д. Ты как будто реально играешь в dark souls но в 2D. Боссы очень простые, проходятся с 1-2 раз, последнего босса убил с первого раза, но возможно я собрался как имба, играл фулл хэви билдом с двуручником и щитом. Основная проблема игра - отсутствие карты, насколько вы можете знать - в дарск соулс карты нет, но дарк соулс это не метроидвания, а тут огромный 2д мир И БЕЗ КАРТЫ! Скорее всего большинство людей сошли бы с ума из-за отсутствия карты и дропнули игру еще на середине или даже раньше, но поскольку я топографический гигант, то я выдержал, люди не готовые перманентно держать карту в голове не перенесут такого напряжения. Однако, если вы любите дарк соулс и метроидвании, ТО БЕГИТЕ ИГРАТЬ СРОЧНО ИГРА ИМБА! 8 из 10

author: tonybroos
review_text:
Recomendo à todos. Joguei em minhas férias de trabalho por um bom tempo, e tenho que dizer que o jogo só me impressionou de acordo com o tempo. Ele me lembra os antigos jogos de plataforma e também me lembra os jogos com características de SoulsLike, sua ambientação é muito boa e sua história é ótima de acompanhar. Para quem está acostumado com Dark Souls, esse jogo é mais fácil e rápido, porém muito divertido.

Notas:
Se você foca em diversão o jogo é: 10/10
Se você procura dificuldade e tenta se provar:7/10
Dito isso, 9/10

author: Babutto
review_text: For metroidvania fans. Pros.: story; locations, map, upgrades. Cons.: no minimap and map access; overall difficulty and forcing into grinding.

author: Saume
review_text: Good souls-like metroidvania side scroller. Despite being among the first in this genre, it still holds up well. The character creator looks weird and almost makes it feel light-hearted, but once in game, everything is a lot darker and looks much nicer.

author: AbrahFP
review_text:
RECOMENDADÍSIMO
Me he pasado 95 juegos en mi vida(sí, llevo la cuenta con una lista, soy un friki),  y he jugado a muchísimos más.
Quiero dar ese dato para demostrar que soy un gamer empedernido y darle el valor que este juego se merece al decir que lo situaría en el top 5 de los juegos que más he disfrutado en mi vida. Y escribo esto 6 años después de haberlo jugado, (no es la calentada de según te terminas un juego, lo digo con la mente fría).
La música de los combates contra jefes, que sigo recordando aún a día de hoy, la atmósfera oscura, un diseño artístico fabuloso, los mil escondites y secretos que hay por el mundo, los combates tan difíciles y desafiantes que tiene, las infinitas posibilidades de personalización y enfoque del personaje para el combate...y pensar que esta obra maestra fue creada tan solo por 2 personas...
Lo último que quiero decir es que tiene una "secuela" que se llama "salt and sacrifice" y que pongo secuela entre comillas porque no sigue la trama del primero y porque es una absoluta BASURA, que no le llega ni a los pies a esta primera entrega original y no exagero al decir que lo empeora absolutamente todo. En mi vida he visto una decadencia tan bestia de una segunda parte de un juego(a la altura del bajón de Dragon Age II). Pero lo dicho, SALT AND SANCTUARY ES DIOS.

author: Aenorr
review_text:
Oh well, this one was LIT! I received Salt and Sanctuary as a free epic store game at christmas, and I couldnt stop playing it during the whole holidays.

As a Dark Souls and metroidvania fan, I couldnt be more surprised, how this synergy of genre works in this game. The art style is just perfect, gameplay and combat is just as punishing as in souls games. The exploration element, skill gaining and backtracking - things that are defining metroivania works here more then well.

As for the combat itself, maybe it could be more "complex", but the difficulty is ramping up with few bosses. Overall it keeps the metroidvania's combat style and feel.

If you like metroidvanias and/or dark souls, this is a game for you as even if you will get bullied over and over, you won't be able to stop playing until you finish it.

author: S3XU4LH34L1NG
review_text:
As many other have described this is a mix of DS / Castlevania. Overall I loved it and considering the team behind this i have to give it a 10 / 10. I dont know if theres a lot of replayability because at the end of the day its pretty linear. My mage playtrhough was very fun and challenging altough the end of the game got way easier.
+ graphics, music, atmospehre, builds, mechanics / - replayability, navigation

author: Deniman
review_text: Сначала игра не понравилась совсем, убивали через каждые пару минут...разобраться было сложно ...какое оружие и броню выбрать...во что вкачивать левел апы...что за религия...что за "соль"...куда идти...карты нет...но потом более менее разобравшись затянуло...Даже пройдя игру так и не разобрался во всём :) После посмотрел прохождения на Youtube, понял чуть больше...про религии, про бафы на оружие...оказалось что не убил 2 босса...просто потому что запутался где я был, а где я ещё не был :) Игра не без минусов, но достойная :)

author: Sacred
review_text: Единственный недостаток этой игры является отсутствие карты, с возможностью оставлять метки. Ведь просто нереально в метроидвании запомнить карту всего мира.(( Очень бы хотелось вернуться в неисследованные места после получения способностей, но я, как игрок, просто забываю о таких местах, и без подсказок просто невозможно их вспомнить.

author: Wavew
review_text:
Una absoluta basura.

Estoy reseñando la ultima versión de agosto del 2024, donde se ha introducido un modo Ramdomicer. El resultado es terrible, carece de cualquier lógica el desequilibrio del juego, lo que te lleva a repetir la "run" hasta que mínimamente es accesible.

Este juego nunca estuvo inteligentemente equilibrado, es profundamente injusto y desbalanceado desde el principio, pero el modo random es ya un insulto.

Ni un céntimo a estos VAGOS incapaces de corregir los problemas que lleva arrastrando el juego 8 años.

author: Chowan
review_text: Pomysł nie jest zły. Stylistyka ładna i to koniec plusów. Sterowanie jest nieintuicyjne a hit-box'y  są zrobione gorzej niż te w DS2. Kombinacje ataków raz działają raz nie. Na ekranie strasznie się wszystko zlewa z tłem. Fajny eksperyment jednak nie polecam.

author: OberiousLocke
review_text:
Update: As it seems that the developers have made the regrettable choice to commit to EGS exclusivity (even if it only ends up being temporary) I can't stand by my previous score of 10/10 and have updated it accordingly. Original review as follows:

With 200+ hours in S&S and 600+ across all 3 Dark Souls games, this is about as close to it as you can get without actually playing Dark Souls. Beautiful art, music is meh with a few exceptions, and fun gameplay.

author: Kaizek1
review_text: Да какого хрена у противников не прерываются атаки и каст спеллов, а мувсеты у боссов начинаются практически одинаково? И кто-то всерьёз ставит этому шлаку что-то больше ноля не видя, что даже основная механика сломана к чертям!

author: Defoxx
review_text: Souls-like платформер, который по началу интересен, но к середине как то поднаскучил.

author: omerulas25
review_text: bored, no funny, not interesting and very colourless. why am i playing this game? for only boss fight or something?

author: nervengas
review_text:
S&S is pretty much advertised as '2D Dark Souls', but it falls short of it's 3D inspiration on many accounts. The graphics are mediocre mid to upper flash game tier. Forget about feeling something like immersion in this game. The general theme of the background music, if present at all, alternates between repetitive and repetitive & annoying.
Weapon and armor balance is probably S&S's weakest part. Items are tiered from 1 to 5. High tier weapons are awkwardly placed and mostly useless filler - by the time you get to craft tier 3/4 stuff you can already access tier 5, making the former pointless. Lower tier weapons are simply not worth upgrading, unlike in dark souls. Lore consists of RPG boilerplate mediocrity sprinkled with the expected DS references - same for level design. It's not bad, but nothing really stands out as innovative or memorable either.
Combat.... sigh. It quickly becomes cheap and unrewarding - there is only so much you can do in this regard in a 2D engine. Total opposite to the original. There are enemies that pounce you or have some other lockdown (in some  cases instant kill) mechanic if you get close, enemies that have long range melee which you need to evade between attacks ( rinse and repeat) and various projectile attacks. The parrying system is a bit easier than in DS. High HP pools on the mob side combined with limited HP and few opportunities to attack on your side feel like something in between an attempt between a ramped up version of Dark Souls difficulty. Bosses basically require learning of patterns as well as their faster alternates which trigger once the 50% HP mark is reached, making for very drawn out fights. If that's your thing, or if you enjoy spending hours just getting through one boss pretty much every single time, this might be the one thing that will give you some enjoyment in this game. But if you think ornstein and smough or manus type fights felt least rewarding about DS, chances are you wont enjoy the boss fights in S&S because 'fast and aggressive' is the common theme here.
Blending out the copious boss fights there's actually pretty little content in the game. Excusable because there are only two devs from what I've heard but it's another thing that makes the game feel a bit too much like something that evolved from a cheap flash game hobby project. Which makes you wonder why you had to pay to play it.

author: Coldest13
review_text:
Una auténtica lástima.

Desearía que me gustara este juego, pero no va a ser posible. Salt and Sanctuary solo se ha dedicado a matarme injustamente y a robarme mis merecidas almas; pero el mayor pecado de SaS es, sin duda, el olvidar que SaS es otro juego, no un remake de Dark Souls en 2D.

Había jugado en el pasado un remake de DS para Spectrum, un pequeño juego hecho en coña parodiando el original. Ese remake para Spectrum, aún siendo una parodia hecha por un fan, aportó elementos en su jugabilidad que no se habían visto en el DS original, no muchos, pero algo nuevo metió.

Esto no lo ha hecho SaS, se ha olvidado de su propia identidad, y se ha limitado a calcarlo todo de DS, solo dejando sin copiar los elementos imposibles en un entorno 2D. Además, ha fallado al entender porqué DS funciona, lo que tampoco le ayudó a copiarlo bien.

Es una auténtica lástima, insisto, llevo siguiendo este juego durante años y lo he jugado ahora solo para llevarme un batacazo y una decepción, con todo lo que prometía.

Tal vez, no sé, los developers ahora hagan un DLC arreglando el juego básico y añadiendo más contenido, copiando lo que ocurrió con DS 2, pero algo me dice que no va a ser así, y que este juego llamado SaS que parece un prototipo, seguirá siendo un prototipo toda la eternidad.

Insisto, una verdadera lástima.

author: Beowulf0711
review_text:
Criminally under-appreciated game. OverBorder studio (which is a team of only 7 people, to the best of my knowledge) made a game who's biggest flaw was that I just wish there was more of it. It's not perfect, sure. But the music, atmosphere, and gameplay make for a truly enjoyable souls-like experience.

Towards the end, I was a little disappointed with enemy variety. I think they probably needed a couple more tough later game enemies. Additionally, I was begging for one or two more unique and challenging bosses by the end. The Odur fight at the beginning is notoriously challenging, but I absolutely LOVED it. It was incredibly satisfying to learn the timings and movements of his combos. Unfortunately, I don't think any of the following bosses are nearly as good as that first one, but they're still all pretty respectable.

TLDR, great game, wish there was a little more content.

author: Strawberry11062
review_text: I love the lore of the fallen kingdom and should 100% be continued, it distracts me all day and it is one of the best games ive played in a while

author: Zeneko90
review_text: Kurzweiliges Action-RPG/Soulslike welches gut 10 Stunden unterhält. Man merkt dem Spiel an, dass es ein Indie Titel ist. Mit mehr Zeit und Geld hätte daraus noch ein viel größeres und besseres Spiel werden können. Story und Gameplay hätten weiter ausgebaut werden können. So zum Glück haben die Entwickler aber ein Ende gefunden und in dem Moment wo das Spiel dröge wird es auch zu Ende gebracht.

author: afazdavayli
review_text:
GOOD PART
- Battles flow with dynamic and fast mechanics.
- Plague weapon fights are diversified because each attack leaves almost a different effect.
- Great boss fights.
- The system used to fight enemies is very enjoyable.
- The talent system is not bad.
BAD PART
- There are a few shortcomings because they have no money (sound, animations, map...)
- The story does not explain itself.
- Smoke varieties are few.

According to 2024

author: dune10
review_text: Très difficile, très exigent, nécessite un apprentissage long et fastidieux. Mais bon gameplay et ambiance ok. J'espère que s'il y a une suite, le studio aura plus de moyen pour étoffer un peu le jeu et créer un monde/environnement plus complet..

author: SleeplessLena
review_text: Combat System is great and creative while feeling punishing but fair. The plague weapons are amazing and fun to use. The story and level design is good. I would have wished for a little bit more enemy variety though. Most bosses are great, but some of them could use more attacks.

author: VVolf
review_text: I Like The Combat System. Its hard but not unfair. Cool Musik and the Story is ok!

author: jarvitom
review_text: This is an OK soulslike game, the story and setting is nothing much, combat is enjoyable, bosses are good also. I had drive to play and finish it, try out different plague weapons.

author: Tomicsavo
review_text: My first souls like game, it was enjoyable after the first boss, it was hard to get used to at first, but overall it didn't cause a huge problem to my surprise. Nice game, the story didn't excite me so much.

author: S3XU4LH34L1NG
review_text: Short Souls with one excellent memorable Boss. Other than it's not what expected with all that hype. Also what I will also remember is the good awful running animation.

author: 4shi4
review_text: Short and nice, one of the better soulslike

author: TwentyOne21
review_text:
Fine small game if not for its technical issues.

Fighting system works more often not then it does. Thats annoying because fights could be fun if it did.

I dont understand why the industry doesnt spend more money for real developers who know computers. Instead employ wanna be script kiddies who dont even know how to handle game engines.

Nice little game you can play thru in an afternoon. Buy only if you dont mind annoying technical issues. Otherwise look for some quailty software. Dont spend more than 5 bucks on it. Its not worth it.

author: Hevvy94
review_text: Luckily, going into this one I didn't expect much. Thisview would not change while playing. The game is jank, and horribly low effort. Hitboxes are awful, animation and movement feels robotic, and the cutscenes are powerpoints. The game increbidly low budget, and it's an area team 17 isn't experienced in. If you were going to play this, play any other soulslike instead.

author: SpideyTheMighty
review_text: Tried it from psplus. After 10 hours, i unistalled it. Nothing special imo. A good combat system but not with much depth. Enemy and level design are atrocious. And this bloody fog all over the place damaged my eyes. AA product at best.

author: aniketp41
review_text: Not worth the time.... A lot of the level design is confusing as hell......

author: Wavew
review_text:
Que no os engañen las criticas compradas, este juego es: corto, lineal y aburrido. Con unas mecanicas de parri obsoletas y sin rejugabilidad.

Faltan armas, armaduras y cualquier cosa que pueda dar variedad. Los escenarios son horribles y vacios, los enemigos se repiten, en 30 minutos te has aburrido.

author: watchm824
review_text: Many do not understand what is the attraction of Souls Like games. For me, this is not the complexity of the enemies or the mystery of the plot. For me, the main thing is the spirit of adventure and exploration of unknown terrain. This game has it all. The game reminded Hellpoint, but a little worse. Still, I enjoyed the game. The design of some levels is ambiguous. But + 1 point, because The game is budget and some nuances can be forgiven.

author: Fefohell
review_text: Good game. Excelent and unique craft system. A little bit hard for me but not boring at all.

author: JoaoNeto33
review_text: Dolmen is an amazing game, action, suspense and exotic and dynamic scenarios.

review_text: Dolmen is a game that delivers what it promises. Fun game, great graphics, nice gameplay

author: FabricioSC
review_text: Soulslike/Rpg Acao em teceira pessoa com um jogador atmosfericovariedades de armas: ok variedade de cenarios : ok dificuldade: ok 7/10

author: CamyVero
review_text:
Buen juego. Un RPG de acción de tipo soulslike que nosinvita a vivir una aventura durante una revolución francesa alternativa en la cual Luis XVI echa mano de un ejército de autómatas para recuperar el orden del país.

Básicamente es un soulslike de serie B, con muy buen acabado gráfico y de diseño, pero que cojea un poco en cuanto a la dificultad de los jefes ya que no son combates para nada desafiantes. Aún así es un juego entretenido que te va a dar algo más de 20 horas de entretenimiento por poco dinero.

author: dune10
review_text: Très bon jeu mais optimisation du moteur graphique catastrophique ! Bon gameplay, bonne histoire, bon sous like, mais l'utilisation du moteur graphique est mauvais. Le studio Spiders aurait dû faire un jeu plus court et mettre les moyens pour travailler sur le moteur graphique..

author: korzychxp
review_text:
Please do not be discouraged by the beginning of the game, as it is only difficult and looks unimpressive at the start. The storyline is also challenging initially, but later it becomes understandable with notes, videos, conversations – it’s well done. As a long-time fan of Spiders games (still waiting for Mars War Logs 2 and Technomancer 3!), I must add my opinion. Pros:

- Great music and atmosphere (the first time I see robots with souls). 
- Fun combat, though it gets a bit tedious after side missions with recycled locations (if you play just the main story, it remains consistently good). 
- Good graphics in most locations, mainly urban and underground; the worst is the beginning of the game and the bastille when walking by the river (but I play on low settings) – the river is awful, and what’s beneath it    
- Very interesting, though serious story, definitely has potential for development (despite the robotic elements, it’s emotional, and the historical thread picks up later)
- Huge selection of weapons, fewer outfits, but it's okay    Nice protagonist, relatable, has a cool voice   
- Nice storyline characters (though I discarded La Fayette)   
- Cool feature with the vestals where you buy things 
-  Also like the new options over time, such as breaking walls or the rope for climbing higher (though there could be more of this) 
-  Quite a variety of enemies, but towards the end, you know them too well and maybe four more would be needed  
-  Worth buying the Discus Chain DLC, as it can attack from a distance and interrupts many enemy attacks

Cons:  
-  Terrible optimization, on an RX6600 I have to play on nearly minimal settings, and still, the fps can drop from 80 to 30 in many places. Luckily, I like this game enough to grit my teeth; the worst are a few options including textures, which even on high can exceed 8GB VRAM usage, not to mention ultra, and they aren’t even hyper beautiful; the game also takes quite a long time to load on HDD 
-   Lack of newer FSR (1.1 looks ugly and helps little) etc.  
-  Lack of patches for the game, as if the developers abandoned it  
-  A downside is part of the combat where the enemy can attack even if we attacked them; that is, our attacks do not interrupt the enemy's attack animation, though sometimes they do (probably a paralysis issue); the best is to play with the chain as you can hit from a distance, avoiding enemy attacks 
-   Poor character development; I played as a dancer, focused only on strength, health, and stamina, the rest seemed unnecessary (unfortunately)    
- The first location is a downside as it puts many people off the game and they return it, as it’s not as carefully made; once you get through it, it’s great  
-  Zero game balance; I’m someone who kills the monsters on hand, destroys all crates, so I collect various items and have a lot of them 

And yes. The beginning of the game is as hard as Dark Souls, but you can level up and develop your character, so you manage (I play without assists). Then the game is moderately difficult and fun. However, at the end, I play with one hand. At the end of the game, I had around level 40, weapons upgraded to level 5, over 100 healing oils, 50 grenades, lots of HP. Just any boss I encounter takes maybe 10-15 attacks, throw a few grenades at him, add a special attack, and the boss is gone. And I have so many healing tools that there’s no fear of losing life. I just play the game without major emotions, unfortunately. I play only because I like the overall setting, atmosphere, but there’s no challenge.

And I play without assists, so I don’t understand people who need assists. Really only the beginning of the game is hard (indeed too hard). But then not anymore. Then you have various special attacks, the weapon has 2 attacks, you have fire, ice, and lightning attacks. There’s really a lot of it. Therefore, the game offers many development options, equipment, various attacks, it’s overwhelming at the beginning. But later, when you know how to use it, the game becomes very easy. Really very easy. With high endurance, you also easily dodge enemy attacks and don’t get tired, which is obviously a plus for people who don’t like Dark Souls, as there you have to be 10x more careful.

I would buy the game for up to 150 PLN if only it had good optimization, FSR/DLSS updates, and if the developers didn’t abandon it.

Of course, I hope for a Steelrising 2, but seeing that the developers don’t like sequels to their games, I probably won’t get my **** I also hope the game brought some financial success. Because it’s really not bad. The beginning of the game is off-putting, the story is not understood, the game is difficult to master, and the first boss is also very hard, the optimization is terrible, but if these were improved, it would really be a solid 8/10.

author: Sepherim
review_text: Steelrising es un soulslike que innova muy poco (alguna de las armas son algo originales, y puedes saltar y tienes algo más de movilidad que en otros juegos del género) pero ejecuta bien lo que se propone hacer. Para mi tiene una virtud innegable en su ambientación, ya que la Francia revolucionaria está desgraciadamente muy poco explorada en juegos o películas y es un periodo fascinante, incluso en esta versión fantástica. Caminar por las calles del París de la época, visitar palacios y lugares importantes como la Bastilla o Versalles, es genial. La historia en sí está bien pero tampoco es para tirar cohetes, pero sin duda está mejor contada que en cualquier Souls, cuenta con diálogos y decisiones que afectan al final de la historia, etc. Y el combate es ágil y fluido, con una personalización del personaje más simple que en un Souls pero que funciona decentemente bien. Gráficamente no pasará a la historia, especialmente algunas animaciones faciales flojean un poco, pero como ya dije la ambientación me fascina y está muy bien recreada, con lo que a nivel visual acaba resultando un juego distinto y bienvenido. Quizás algunas zonas se hacen demasiado parecidas entre sí. A nivel de sonido está todo lo bien que se puede esperar, tanto en efectos, como voces (me gusta que intercalen palabras en francés) como en el apartado musical. Y en cuanto a bugs, he encontrado muy pocos y todos han sido bastante irrelevantes, lo cual siempre es **** resultado es que, sin ser un juego memorable, sin duda es un buen juego en su género. Un 7.

author: Kramer76

Solid, enjoyable game, a soulslike but with difficulty settings which can make it pretty light.

- the story is OK too, pretty nice side quests and ideas, with a little more thinking it could have been great; especially if you are interested in french revolution history

Overall I enjoyed this game, can be played once but not an instant classic or favorite.

author: WanderinMelmoth
review_text:
Yet another Dark Souls clone - yawn! Enough already! Souls mechanics aren't that great to be copy & pasted over and over again!
There is nothing new to see here, you once again collect [insert game currency] after slaying enemies, when you die you respawn at the last [insert game save point] you rested at and have one chance to reclaim [game currency] by returning to that spot without dying again. Using [game save point] also respawns all enemies except for bosses. The game's main goal is to fight bosses and mini bosses, yada yada, nothing new here.
Steelrising drops the grimdark atmosphere in favor of an overly colorful 18th century France backdrop with robots(!). I prefer the dark fantasy which is why this one rates even lower than Thymesia for me. Graphics themselves are alright but nothing to write home about. Unfortunately the game is very poorly optimized so be prepared for a lot of stuttering - in a game that relies entirely on timing! Frame dips are frequent this is an absolute no-go. How these 10 out of 10 morons simply ignore this is beyond me.
The reason some reviewers seem to get overly excited about Steelrising's graphics probably is due to the fact that the big front runners FromSoft have delivered their games with the same outdated graphics engine from 2011 on and all other titles look next gen by comparison.
Steelrising also makes the mistake of putting a $50 price tag on this game. Sorry it's a C game lacking anyinnovation, worth $20 max! Definitely a wait for a deep deep sale and only if you are a die hard Souls fan and need to own every game in this "genre". There are much better titles (Mortal Shell, Lords of the Fallen) than this. If you want something that isn't dark fantasy (why would you?) Deck 13 has you covered with The Surge 2.
Hard pass & refund on my side. Sorry.

author: jdmsjmsrscgm
review_text:
At its heart, Sea of Thieves revolves around the thrill of exploration and the hunt for treasure. Players set sail across a beautiful, open world filled with islands, shipwrecks, and hidden coves, all packed with treasures to be found. While on these voyages, you can encounter various threats, including rival players who may be looking to steal your loot, or AI-controlled enemies like skeleton crews that provide exciting combat **** shared-world nature of Sea of Thieves adds an unpredictable element to your journeys. You never know when you might cross paths with another crew, which can lead to tense standoffs or full-blown naval battles. The freedom to play either cooperatively or competitively keeps the gameplay dynamic, as your treasure hunts may end in epic victories or heartbreaking **** of the game's most thrilling aspects is the random encounters with legendary sea monsters. You might be peacefully sailing with a hold full of treasure when suddenly the waters turn dark, and the Kraken's tentacles emerge from the deep. Or you may hear the ominous growl of the Megalodon stalking your ship.
One of the standout features of Sea of Thieves is its highly detailed and enjoyable navigation system. Steering your ship is not just a matter of pointing in the right direction and hitting “go.” Instead, it involves a range of ship management tasks: raising and lowering sails, adjusting their angle to catch the wind, managing the anchor, and even patching up holes when your ship takes **** collaborative nature of managing a ship with a crew of friends makes this experience especially fun. Each crew member has a role, from helming the ship to navigating using the map, or managing the cannons during combat. The sense of teamwork needed to successfully sail and survive in the open world is one of the game’s most satisfying elements.While Sea of Thieves nails the navigation and exploration aspects, the combat system leaves much to be desired. Whether fighting other players or AI-controlled enemies, the melee and ranged combat can feel unsatisfying and overly simplistic. The melee combat, in particular, often devolves into repetitive and "spamy" exchanges where players simply mash attack buttons rather than using any sort of strategy or **** some players, the experience of sailing the high seas in Sea of Thieves can come with an unfortunate side effect: motion sickness. The game’s realistic ship movement, combined with the rolling waves and constant swaying, can cause dizziness or nausea for those prone to motion sickness. Spending extended periods navigating the ocean can exacerbate this, especially during storms or rough seas, when the ship’s motion becomes even more pronounced.

author: Khaimin
review_text:
The player base for this game remains one of the most toxic and cheat-ridden that I've come across. The devs also remain some of the most aloof and uncaring that I've ever seen. There is no report function, no solo server function, nothing to get away from toxic players except to sink your own ship and hop to a different server - giving the players harassing you all of your loot and wasting your time. Nothing has been done to address the rising concerns of non-cheating players.

The game is fun, but worthless to those who want to play correctly. You can't enjoy playing the game when you're being killed constantly by players spawning in exploding barrels or shooting you through walls. Until these issues are addressed, i would not recommend this game.

Good points: fun loot system, fun sailing and fishing system, interesting and lore-filled quests.

Bad points: everything above that's stopping you from enjoying it.

Do yourself a favor and don't buy this game until the issues have been addressed.

author: PurelyRated
review_text: Holy peak. Rust is one of the greatest games Ive ever played. You start off with nothing more than a rock and a torch and from there its pure survival. Theres a lot and I mean A LOT of grinding, failed base attempts and setbacks, but that’s all part of the experience. Every failure teaches you something new and every success feels absolutely earned. The game perfectly captures the balance between chaos and triumph. 10000000/10 Definitely recommend. One of the most rewarding survival experiences out there.

author: pedro_team
review_text:
Игра отлично подходит если у вас обнаружены какие либо психические отклонения, в особенности психопатия, социофобия или анорексия. Главный парадокс этой игры найти смысл: Как не взять в рот в этой игре?

Ответ: никак
Пустота: Ум опустел, оставив лишь эхо тщетных усилий. Мысли растворились, как сахар в воде, не оставив ни вкуса, ни следа.Исчерпанность: Все пути исхожены, все методы испробованы. Борьба с оковами разума обернулась бесконечным кругом, ведущим никуда.Принятие: Осознание собственного бессилия. Принятие того, что освобождение – это иллюзия, а разум – это тюрьма, из которой нет выхода.Спокойствие: В опустошенном разуме воцарилась тишина. Утихли бури сомнений и терзаний, оставив лишь безмятежность пустоты.Парадокс: Осознание "никак" одновременно является и поражением, и освобождением. Это отказ от борьбы, но и принятие реальности.

author: Nonameinmind
review_text: Rust was released to an “early access” stage in late 2013, debuting to a peak of 22,000 players in the release month. As of now, Rust has peaked at approximately 260,000 concurrent players in January of 2025, more than ten times increase. Rusts growth has been continuous, due to the “Force Wipe,” a concept that on the first Thursday of every month they release a big update, wiping everyone's progress, across all servers. Rust is from the development studio, “Facepunch,” responsible for games such as “Garry’s Mod,” a sandbox game where anything is possible, and “Chippy,” an arcade style game based on the mechanics of “Space Invaders.” Rust is a multiplayer survival game, comparable to the likes of “Ark Survival Evolved” and “Day Z,” both of which are also set in post-apocalyptic warfare filled maps. These types of games are immensely popular due to their sadistic nature, taking others hard-earned resources for your own gain. Rust has been one of the most consistent games i have ever played, every single month they release a noticeable update to change the meta of the game. This keeps the gameplay fresh, this in addition to the server “Wipes” makes sure that players will be able to play for the whole month without it starting to feel old. However, this makes Rust extremely addicting, and very impactful on social life.  Rust is based on a post-apocalyptic island, leaving the island radioactive. It is rumoured that the island which all players first interact with was infested with the likes of a cold war, the island was used as a testing ground for weapons and personnel to do as they will. This left it in a state of warfare and an idea of “every man for himself.” Rust is a difficult game to learn, and it takes a long time to learn the mechanics, let alone to gather enough knowledge to be able to take fights, at the right time, with the right weapons and with the right amount of people. In Rust you also must learn recoil patterns along with refining your aim to insure you will hit your shots, without learning you are bound to lose every fight you take. In Rust there is not a definitive end, you can always have more resources, raid more people, take more fights. That's the beauty of Rust, you can never actually “complete” the game, this is what keeps players consistent through the month, chasing a never-ending goal. Since you never actually can complete Rust there is no “replay”, however, there is a concept of server “Wipes”, where there is a set schedule and on the day specified everyone's progress gets reset, just for them to go back and get it all again, showing the true nature of Rust. Rust’s settings are vast and varied, however you cannot modify the game farther than they let you, since its multiplier they must discourage and punish third party programs, especially ones that aim to modify the games memory. Rust is available on Steam, PlayStation Store, and Microsoft Store on XBOX, bearing in mind Rust is not cross-platform since PC players would have an advantage. Rust usually sells for £34.99; this is on console stores and on steam. Rust hovers around a 40GB size, reasonable for the large amount of content. Rust pays a large amount of attention to the graphics, the greenery and the buildings all have intricate details to make them look as realistic as possible, and they do an excellent job at it, the interiors of the “monuments” are all rustic, adding to the feel of a post-apocalyptic island. Rust has a variety of sound effects and music cues, the gun sounds are somewhat realistic, although not the best, the music is commissioned especially for rust and gives an aurora of creepy, scary survival. Rust changes the sounds depending on the environment a player is in, for example in a cave, sounds reverb and appear louder and somewhat inaccurate, while above ground there is a distinct sound for everything and a direction of where it came from is recognizable. This is unique and enhances the player experience, really helps in a survival game. Rust usually does not experience many bugs, every update is meticulously tested before being pushed to the main branch, additionally they have a “staging” branch which allows players to play updates before they are officially released, allowing for user-reported bugs to be fixed and community feedback to be taken before a new update. Rust is a multiplayer game, the game requires an online aspect to actually be enjoyable, other players are out to get your resources and you have to protect them, no matter if you’re online or offline, which introduces a sense of urgency to get back to the game and play it for even longer. In conclusion, Rust is absolutely a game to try if you have not played it already, it has a certain player base who chase the adrenaline of losing and gaining resources throughout a period, making it intense and exciting. Although, I'd be careful about the addictiveness of it, it's no joke how many hours you can pour into this game without realising.

author: juan4545

author: DragonulX
review_text: Rust Huh, the game that made my childhood better since I was watching the continuity creators on YouTube back when Zombies were on the map. I ended up playing with a friend for about 140 hours, most of which hours were done on empty servers or done by one of my friends using our monthly subscription initiated servers. Initially, I would have several reasons not to recommend the game, mainly because one of those main reasons is the overpriced price. But instead, I won't do this, because from my point of view, for how many hours I invested in the game and how I didn't feel them passing by me, being the game at the same time and very fun, I suppose they deserved their money. Starting with the worst phases of the game, as long as you don't play on a server made by you, you can't really put your soul into what you created or built on the game. In the game there is the wipe term, which at the choice of the owner who owns the server, can be: weekly, every two weeks, or every month) After this deadline, the whole map returns to its initial form from the beginning without any progress. The houses, your items in the inventory and everything you have mined or collected will disappear and you will basically get it from the beginning every time. It sounds very bad since most players of Survival games grew up with Minecraft, The Forest or Don't Starve, where in these games your progress was saved for the entire period of ownership. But it's not really like that, this only applies to servers officially listed on the server page of the game, if you want to create a server you can keep it for life without giving it a mandatory wipe but it will be unlisted and not you can set it as public, if you want it public you will have to comply with this requirement. It sounds decent so far, but there is another part to come. For you to be able to maintain a server is not as easy as in other games and especially since the game does not maintain the server created by you. Either you use Wireless Lan Party programs to invite others if you have a map and want it to run on your computer, or you have to buy a server domain which is not at all cheap unlike what I was used to do until now. These would be some disadvantages in what prevents its purchase if necessary. (You can have a public server with "No Wipe" only if there are no servers with Survival game mode. (example: PVP)In the rest, apart from these aspects, the game is ingenious, and comes to its base with a lot of new features and monthly or bi-monthly **** updates do not in any way damage the game or its image and even revive it every time something new appears because you always have something to do in it, especially if you are just starting out with the game and especially if you have a server with Wipe. The idea is that having a server with "No Wipe" you cannot expand your creativity as you want on it, most of the time you end up making a construction with the walls upgraded to the maximum and then you think that you have nothing left to do being that everything you did you did during the construction of the house. That's why Wipe exists, to evolve each player individually and all starting from the same point at the time of the Wipe. Imagine Hungar Games with Unlimited Respwn (that is if you don't play on Hardcore Mode) and with several players all evolving differently and attacking each other to capture territories and get materials from the battle or loots found on Map. The idea is very good and I wonder how since its launch it has not received an award or a congratulation for this complex idea, the basis of which is the community that continues to create and maintain active servers even today after a long time. I haven't really seen any bugs or glitches, the game is decent on the optimization side and the difficulty of the AI ​​in the game is to be congratulated. I recommend the game strictly if you have many friends with whom you can have a Party or Squad for Raids because otherwise it would sometimes seem boring to you and you would want to take a break with the game more and more often until you end up losing your interest completely, so that later to return to it again being a good game. On the music side, they tried to copy different ideas from other well-known Survivor games that have good music, and somehow they came out, but not how the developers expected it to come out. All in all, it's good, but it hasn't received updates with the music packet for a long time and I'd be impatient to see that. There are many things I could talk about when it comes to this game, but many of them end up having a positive impact on the game, which makes the final conclusion I recommend it with confidence, especially if you get it at a discount like - I also bought it by the way. I recommend to try for yourself to understand much more than from this review,

author: xzipy
review_text: Rust may be one of the single most innovative games of its time AND in recent times. Those complaining about team sizes could just play solo-only servers, those complaining about time investment could play 2 day wipes, and those complaining about toxicity can just mute people! No matter your availability, game preference, or skill ability, there is a server for everyone and a great experience waiting in Rust.

author: Bonzo101
review_text: Rust is a compelling and intense multiplayer survival game developed by Facepunch Studios, where players must gather resources, build shelters, and engage in PvP combat to survive on a deserted island. Starting with nothing, players quickly scavenge for materials to craft tools and weapons, navigating a challenging day-night cycle and constant threats from other players. The game's building and crafting systems are deep and rewarding, allowing for the creation of complex bases and equipment. Voice chat enhances social interactions, fostering alliances and rivalries within large servers. Despite its brutal and unforgiving nature, Rust offers an enriching experience as players outlast competitors and thrive in a hostile environment, making it a must-play for fans of survival games!

author: EricReviews
review_text: Created by Facepunch, a group known for games such as g-mod, comes Rust. This PvP survival game pits you against both the struggles of surviving on a stranded island with no escape, but also the threat of other people and NPCs. Rust differs from other games in this genre because of its vast plethora of mechanics alongside a seemingly simple premise: survival.  Rust has a reputation for being a very challenging, unforgiving game, but I believe this simply adds to the excitement. Although it might seem that after a short while, there may be nothing new to do, but the constant fear of losing all your progress to either another player or natural causes is what makes this game stand out, as there is no safety for your hard-earned resources when offline.  This does, however, cause many players to develop severe addictions, with many members of the community gaining hour counts into the thousands.  Rust is well known for its steep learning curve, with players being judged harshly by others based on their playtime alone. The gunplay in this game also is quite difficult, making players memorize recoil patterns for many different guns, and get used to the fast time to kill. Even with the short TTK, fights involving larger groups can last hours at a time, with neither side wanting to leave the battle after putting so much time and resources in.   Many servers also introduce prizes and incentives such as bounties for the most competitive clans to compete for. This leads to the formation of very large groups, sometimes with 40+ players, working together to win money on a regular basis. The nature of the game, however, means that to keep a bounty for long enough to be cashed out, the clans have to stay active on a single server for days at a time, often leading to many sleepless nights lying in wait for an attack.  The gameplay loop can vastly vary in length with some so called ‘wipes’ lasting anywhere from a couple days to over a month. However, even though it may seem repetitive, with little variation on the gameplay, each wipe has many different encounters with new people each time, leading to an enjoyable experience for as long as you make it enjoyable.  Rust is available on both console and PC, costing upwards of £20, and can be played on either keyboard and mouse or most standard modern controllers. However, the advantages offered by keyboard and mouse leads to problems in the console community with external devices such as zens.  Graphics/Attention to Detail and Environmental interaction/Scenery/Art Direction and Style Rust has a reasonably minimalistic art style, but this doesn’t detract from the game's positives.  The sound design for the game is both immersive and reliable, with most sounds being easily distinguished between. Rust can be very difficult to run on lower end devices, and can often crash alongside excruciating loading times, but there are very few noticeable bugs, and with the game being updated regularly none stay around for too long. One of the worst and best aspects of this game are the interactions with other players. While some can be kind or funny, most are extremely hostile, and the majority of encounters involve a stream of slurs through the microphone. For this reason, I would definitely not recommend this game to younger individuals as a lot of the language and threats used are quite nerve racking for less confident people.  Overall, the game itself has many strong features, but the community does slightly let it down at times.
