review_text: Cool Overwatch clone in the Marvel universe. Generic graphics, but great regular updates. Can quickly become repetitive and there's a lack of willingness to fulfill all roles from other players.

author: Rubbelritter
review_text: Marvel Rivals is hands down the best live Service game I’ve played in a long time – and honestly, it’s my number one "on going" game! From the very first match, I was completely hooked. The mix of fast-paced action, strategic teamplay, and that unique Marvel flair is simply unbeatable.Each hero feels distinct and powerful, with their own unique playstyle. The combat system is smooth, dynamic, and super satisfying. The maps are well-designed, and the graphic design shows a real attention to detail.What really stood out to me is the cast – the selection of playable Marvel characters is both diverse and perfectly executed, both visually and in terms of gameplay. Every Marvel fan will find something to love here.I could barely stop playing and I’m already excited for what’s coming next. For me, Marvel Rivals is more than just a great game – it’s become my personal go-to game.

author: Spidrkid
review_text: This is currently one of my favorite games to play right now. The gameplay loop is engaging, the art style is incredibly stunning, and the update cycle keeps this game feeling fresh for months on end. The progression for proficiency  feels rewarding with some cool rewards. Each character felt very unique with their own set of lines for every other character and ultimate attacks that feel very distinct and fun to use. The developers are extremely committed to giving the game content at a high frequency, but without rushing the skins, updates, and more out the door unfinished. Despite all that, I cannot ignore the gaping issues within the game. The matchmaking is atrocious, some of the skins are pretty questionable, and the toxic environment can be very unwelcoming. The rank system can sometimes feel like walking through mud. If these things can be fixed, the game has potential to be one of the best multiplayer games on the market, but for now, it stand as an eight out of ten.

author: Nyaatra
review_text:
Was a pretty good game, but Daredevil ruins it. Every Daredevil just uses a macro and pushes one button to instantly delete any non-tank from the game. There's no counterplay to him.

Black Panther's running around with macros as well, instantly 180° dashing pixel perfect through the center of an enemy, that is physically impossible for a human to pull off and should get automatically caught by the anti-cheat.

Spider-man needs a rework. No one likes playing with or against spider-man.

Jeff is the dev's favorite hero. Massive AoE healing for insane amount that also very easily deals damage to enemies at the same time for fairly high damage and can hit around walls. Has 100 ammo for some reason and reloads really fast. Is low to the ground, but has no issues aiming, unlike Rocket who's bullets will hit the floor 90% of the time. Has a tiny hitbox. Moves really fast. Has hitbox issues that have been in the game since launch that the devs for some reason refuse to fix. Always has at least 2 or 3 team-up combos.

I've provided lots of video proof of cheaters to the devs, with hard aim snap and aim lock, sometimes even doing so through walls, which is very easy to spot in a replay where you can see both team's outlines. No one on the enemy team able to see through walls or able to ping the target for the team to see, so it's insanely obvious that they are cheating, but they don't even look at the video and just claim the cheater isn't cheating. They only seem to ban those who receive X number of reports or are caught cheating on some popular streamer's channel.

Also, UE5 runs like ****.

author: smagnaferous
review_text:
Devs lie about their engagement matchmaking, or EOMM, which makes the games a coin flip and either you're getting stomped or you're stomping, there are no equal matches.  When you lose, it's people on your team literally running out solo and instantly dying repeatedly, getting zero kills, standing out in the open basically throwing, while the enemy will be celestial level players getting 30 kills.
The game also has a rising cheating problem which the devs refuse to even address.  Troll players in a growing number of matches are using aim, invincibility, and other cheats, and nothing happens to them.  It's OBVIOUS.  People surviving point blank Ultimate atacks, being hit by your entire team and their health bar not moving.  People just spinning and auto locking you when they didn't even know you were there.
The devs WILL NOT actually ban anyone from the game.  You can use cheats, throw, smurf, call people whatever you want using bigoted language, all they'll do is "limit their competitive matchmaking" for a while.  They'll just log out and be back later.
All Netease cares about is using the Marvel brand to sell skins until this dies.  They put out 3 or 4 battlepasses to buy, WHILE there is still a battlepass you've already paid for.  They put NO effort into reverse the garbage "matchmaking" or stopping the cheating and smurfing making the game unplayable for anyone but trolls.
This game could be SO good, the artists do their job well, as with most games, but the people running the rest don't care about literally anything but making a quick buck off Captain America and crew.

author: zachchapter1
review_text:
Update September 2025. Matchmaking and smurfing made me and literally all of my friends quit this game. The smurfing is absolutely out of control and the matchmaking encourages it. NetEase seriously cannot design proper matchmaking or protection against repeated smurf accounts. They must salivate at the idea of high rank players creating new accounts to steamroll low rank players, because they basically ask for people to do this. 

Update: it's still absolutely terrible. Myself and literally all of my friends who used to play this game have quit because of the abysmal, unfair, toxic matchmaking. Good riddance. NetEase, sorry I won't be spending another penny on your awful game. 

Placement matches. Is it so hard to do NetEase? Guess not because 'something something something' money?  This game is already horrendously terrible enough with matchmaking with "engagement optimized" matchmaking where it literally puts you with/against higher tier players, but the seasonal rank resets and literally non-existent quickplay matchmaking are the icing on the cake. There's a reason you don't see 'casuals' playing anymore......Matchmaking is an absolute joke, you will never ever have a fair match where you feel like you could've made a difference. It was fun in the beginning, but NetEase scared and chased off all the fun, casual players it had in the beginning. So, all that is left is a shell ****, with only the sweatiest, sweat lords you can imagine. I'd say "it's just me", but I used to play with 4-5 friends, daily, for several months. Zero, none, not a single one of those friends play this game anymore because of how toxic and un-fun it has become.

Do better NetEase.

author: James3152023
review_text:
Where it seems most games are hardly worth the time to play Lost Ark is the exception.

The writers of lore seem to be initiates into some mysteries. Even some of the fan base, the way they seem to analyze the goings on in Arkesia and Petrania (The worlds of Lost Ark) seem to be of another class.

It is in fact similar to other games as far as the story / lore goes, but it’s not just killing demons (although it has a lot of that too !). Planets and stars from our own solar system, such as Regulus are revered and worshipped, making this game more believable and in turn, immersing the player in the story and game.

From the lore, to the soundtrack to the graphics and character design this game excels.I can hardly believe i took a break for 3-4 months only to play other popular games. To get disconnected every day, multiple times a day. To experience graphics bugs and glitches, UI bugs and glitches each and every **** this only helped me to realize how poor alot of these other popular games are and how superior Lost Ark is. In fact, if i can recall, i dont think ive been disconnected once on Lost Ark and i dont think ive ever experienced any bugs or glitches

.There is alot going on in this game, the ways to improve your character and abilities can be overwhelming at times and honing can seem next to impossible, even to finish the main story. However it is worth sticking with this game.

Ihr müsst pro Tag mit ca. 6-8h rechnen wenn ihr wirklich einen Fortschritt erzielen wollt.
Dann kommen noch so Dinge hinzu wie das der Itemshop Pay for Progress ist und die Klassen einen Genderlock haben.

Abgesehen dieser schon sehr gravierenden Punkte ist das restliche Game einfach der Hammer aber wie bereits erwähnt ab einem gewissen Punkt für Casual Spieler unspielbar.

Has multiple layers of P2W elements designed to force you to pay up, or else you cannot even access the end-game contents.

Only other option is to grind on 6 characters like it's your 2nd job.   Oh wait, no, like it's your only job.

author: starwar
review_text: Lost Ark falls short of its promise as a captivating MMORPG. Despite its visually stunning graphics, the game suffers from repetitive quests and a lackluster storyline that fails to engage players. The combat, while initially exciting, quickly becomes monotonous and lacks depth. Additionally, the game's monetization practices heavily favor pay-to-win mechanics, creating an unfair advantage for those willing to spend real money.

author: MorfenA
review_text: Dota 2 is not just a game; it's an experience—a challenging, sometimes infuriating, but ultimately rewarding journey. For those unfamiliar, Dota 2 is a highly complex multiplayer online battle arena (MOBA) game that demands strategy, skill, and ****’s be honest: Dota 2 is hard. The steep learning curve can make it feel overwhelming, especially for newcomers. The intricacies of the game mechanics, the vast pool of heroes, and the ever-changing meta can leave even seasoned players scratching their heads. It's not uncommon to feel frustrated, to the point where you might consider breaking your keyboard or mouse after a tough **** that's also what makes Dota 2 the perfect game. The intense emotions it evokes—from the highs of pulling off an incredible play to the lows of a devastating defeat—create memories that last a lifetime. Every game is different, every match a new story.Beyond the gameplay itself, Dota 2 has a way of bringing people together. Whether you're teaming up with old friends or meeting new ones from around the world, the bonds formed through shared victories (and defeats) are strong. Many players find themselves making lasting friendships through the **** conclusion, Dota 2 is a demanding but deeply fulfilling game. It challenges you, pushes you to your limits, but also rewards you with some of the most unforgettable gaming moments. If you're willing to invest the time and effort, you'll find that Dota 2 is not just a game—it's a community, a passion, and a source of endless joy (and maybe a bit of rage too).

author: sakalipsa
review_text:
Throughout history, there have been numerous moments where discoveries embody the "perfect formula" principle, whether it's fire, the wheel, electricity, Coca-Cola... All of these discoveries or inventions are inherently part of a continuum of refinement driven by civilization's evolving needs through time and space. For example, Chess was played thousands of years ago with unlimited time per move, each piece had very different movement rules and overall rules differed significantly from modern ****, the "perfect formula" of Chess itself remains unchanged and will likely endure as long as our cognitive 'modus operandi' remains as it is. To put it more illustratively, these "perfect formula" discoveries and objects resonate with us much like corners resonate with spiders or trees and rivers resonate with beavers. Our minds are wired to engage with these perfect circuits in all their brilliance, because the human mind is a brilliant invention of evolutionary processes and this engagement is simply enjoyable wallowing in our own **** such perfect circuit, among many others in different fields, is Dota 2. This game is flawless in its **** course, you would make a logical mistake in qualitatively comparing Chess with the wheel, or fire with Coca-Cola, or electricity with Dota 2, or even Chess with Dota 2 - which is usually the case. Each of these phenomena holds its own utility field, and their disparate, incommensurable states should be considered within their own contexts and frameworks. Chess and Dota 2 may have superficial similarities, but they are fundamentally different, like "original Cola" VS "DIY Fanta" different, the only similarity might be the carbonated bubbles in both drinks, which metaphorically could resemble your mental engagement through all aspects of being tricky, witty, or cunning in strategizing and anticipating moves of your opponent in Chess, or timing your spells in Dota 2 either alone or in synergy with your... ****, yes, THE TEAM. Damn. This sounds like it's always the same team and holy f, it actually is. The game has SO MANY players and has been out there for so long that it has crystallized a distinct pattern of mentality, which could literally be captured by the term "Team of Dota 2" with its own hypostatized face. The community in this game deserves special attention; it is a phenomenon that needs a separate review. Actually, it deserves a psycho-pathological study. It's no joke. It's unlike anything I've encountered in any online game before and I'm not using now personal experience (or lack thereof) as a validating instrument for this opinion - it's an objective fact, especially in recent times where its collective mind has reached its peak form.Anyway, back to the game, some surrounding aspects: I've seen many people discredit it, saying things like, "Damn, that game seems complex and time-consuming; I don't have the energy to invest in it." Yet they proceed to play Sudoku or Chess 24/7, others invest time in watching bare-bottom TV shows, some work and provide for their families, others gamble, others read books, etc... Everyone is occupied with something, but the 'rational' fear of this game persists, as if it's a virus that will devour their life like nothing else already does. This perception is completely distorted and based on faulty assumptions. As I said, the game is perfect in its core, and that "perfect formula" allows you to enjoy it endlessly...HOWEVER, THIS DOES NOT MEAN you should sacrifice your personality, abandon your character and dreams just to immerse yourself in this sinkhole. I mean, if you're confused about your priorities and lack essential personal values, that's your own weakness and fault. It's not the game's fault if you're inclined to start compensating for that weakness with a dominance-at-all-costs attitude in the game - initially just trying to win every match, and later becoming hyper-toxic towards others. Would you blame a beer company for your careless driving while drunk, or a casino for losing enormous amounts of money?

If you are already individually dissociated and dissolved into the crystallized Dota 2 mentality, of course you would. Noob.

author: Drewfuller
review_text: Ah, Dota 2, that shining beacon of strategic perfection in the online gaming world, where each match is like a musical symphony of plans and tactics. Indeed, it is a game that immensely delights me, melting in the mouth like the culinary creation of a Michelin-starred chef. And the AI incorporated into it? Well, I must admit, its sophistication always astounds me when it pairs me and my "certainly" English-speaking teammates **** is quite astonishing that in this era of technological marvel, which Dota 2 undeniably represents, artificial intelligence has still not found a way to interpret the "Western Europe" and "English" filters so that the outcome matches these settings. As I nobly select these options, I expect to immerse myself in an English-speaking utopia, where each match becomes an oasis of British etiquette and Shakespearean exchange of courtesies. Instead, I often find myself as an unintended guest at a Cyrillic party, where communication is composed of mysterious runes and enigmatic pictograms.I cannot help but wonder if my client is inadvertently a window for the expansion of Russian influence, where every keyboard, regardless of chosen language preferences, is secretly programmed to convert everything into the letters of the Cyrillic alphabet. And I think to myself, oh, how charming, how insightful of Valve to provide me with cultural enrichment without my explicit consent. Indeed, how far can free education go?What an amazing school of patience and interpersonal skills, when this game guides me to mumble phrases in Russian that I've learned amidst the waves of "cyka blyat". Dota 2 is not just a game, but also a language course and a social experiment that broadens my horizons far beyond the usual limits. In its boundless kindness and education, Valve continuously contributes to my personal development. And for that, my endless gratitude.

author: Frostfangwolf
review_text:
Warframe is existing for over 12 years now. It has grown incredibly good. The game and its dev team had quite the journey in all this time and they did A LOT for their community. They are a PRIME example of how a dev team should approach the development of their game/product. Personally, I've never seen any game developer that poured so much heart and soul into his product, worked so well with everybody else and their community and did overall so incredibly much to stay alive.
Warframe offers: one of the friendliest communities in all of gaming, a deep, emotional lore, a huge variety of approaches for the gameplay itself, tons of missions, endless customizations, earnable in-game currency (you don't have to invest a single dime!), a huge variety of systems and content within the game.) and much more. And all that: FOR FREE!
It is an experience! 

Warframe is a big mile stone and a well kept secret.
Believe in the game and you won't be dissappointed.
Stay safe, Tenno.

author: Rither
review_text:
After a certain point of progression in the game it almost seems like the content is endless. It certainly is a hidden gem for players who are just familiar with it. It does have some loose ends though, but pushing a through some time and learning it becomes a real reward.
Warframe lacks in beginner introduction to its game mechanics specifically being the upgrade system and where and how to acquire gear/items. It also lacks in early game story to flesh out the universe and onboard players into the world.
The microtransactions are completely avoidable as players can trade premium currency for in game items.

author: Ervo
review_text:
We could be looking at one of the best F2P in the history of video games. Warframe is a game that mixes fast-paced action action with the precision of a third-person shooter and a great parkour system.
Warframe offers a vast arsenal to suit all playstyles, with over 60 characters with their own unique identities and abilities and a versatile and intuitive build system.
This game will offer you months of fun and content, whether you're playing alone or with friends. And if you ever run out of content, don't worry, Warframe receives new content every few months, expanding its world and possibilities.

The current Warframe is unrecognizable from its version of 11 years ago, many reviews from the time don't do justice to the current state of the game, so don't be intimidated by the old reviews of professional critics.

author: Revoltazer
review_text: With well over a thousand hours, I can say this is probably the best free to play games I've ever played. I can't get tired of it. The story is awesome, and the gameplay is very dynamic with hundreds of weapons and mods to improve them. And the community isn't even toxic, unlike other games. The developers listen to it and bring regular updates with new content. A shame the score in here is barely 65-70, when it should be above 85 because of people who most likely HAVEN'T EXPERIENCED EVERY SINGLE ASPECT OF THE GAME before becoming a self-proclaimed critique.

author: TrapperCZE
review_text: The early platinum grind is not worth it; it makes the game hundreds of hours longer, and mainly, it is not fun.  If you think you can just go FREE and grind for everything, you WILL SUFFER . The new player experience is realy bad. If you are interested in this game, play it for a while, and then when you get your first 75% platinum discount, make a choice. Either buy 4k platinum with a 75% discount to remove the nonsensical and annoying time-wasting grind for absolute necessities like weapon and warframe slots OR decide that you don't want to make this one-time purchase and leave the game. If you are willing to BUY the starting platinum, it will carry you through the whole game, ONLY THEN you can truly enjoy the experience of progress in this game. Just go read all the other negative reviews; they are all about "hitting the wall" and "repetitive grind," which is all caused by the platinum grind that halts your progress; without it, the game is good; with it, you have to pay for the game to be good. Also, everything for real money (not platinum) is absurdly expensive. Everything is bundled up with stuff you do not want/need, like boosters, artificially making things expensive—for example, exclusive skins for 60€, etc. So if you are not rich, you won't get those even if you are grinding for platinum in-game. Lastly the company is woke, and the mods are ban happy. Don't even try to write anything negative or, god forbid, single slur to a griefer in your party; it WILL get you banned. So only play the game, and do NOT interact with anyone in the game; if you want to send a funny message to your friend, do it elsewhere and don't risk it. If you want to send a gift to your friend like platinum to start with, DONT, send them the money irl, otherwise, you will get banned. Basically, the whole community is made of snowflakes, and the company is trying hard to ponder to anyone and anything, so just play if you enjoy it, but don't talk to anyone, it's for your own good and the safety of your account.

author: itsafloater
review_text: EA has made many highly popular games including all FIFA games and PVZ games, including these games comes along Apex a popular battle royale game. Apex has many competitors which are generally any battle royale, however the main competitors it tends to be fighting is games like Fortnite, and call of duty. Apex has its difficulties, whilst having multiple game modes for players to play and enjoy, the game can get quite repetitive, and players can get bored or frustrated with the game over a period of time. Although the game is a multiplayer game so if you find some good friends to play with you can have endless fun. Apex is set on several mythical islands with one that is a giant ship flying high in the sky, and each island have lots of different POIs and lots of decorations such as huge creatures that look like dinosaurs and some players can even interact with and fight against to collect valuables in the game that will help the player later on in that game. The main aim of the game is to kill every other squad, trio, duo, or person and be the last remaining survivor and be pronounced the Apex champion, although to become a champion, the game has a skill-based matchmaking system, so based on your skill level of the game you will always get put against someone your skill level although sometimes it does have its faults, however there is always something new to learn such as new movement which can confuse your enemies however takes hours of practice to perfect. Apex is a battle royale based game so if you lose one match you can instantly go into a new one giving it constant replay ability and you can play until your hearts content. It is a somewhat modable game where you can access controls within the game files which allow you to set multiple movements to 1 key and set a timer for it which specifically helps in Apex as it helps players who are struggling with all the movement techniques do the with ease.                                                                                             Apex is a cross-platform game allowing players to play with friends on all sorts of game consoles, however apex is a mildly big game as it is 56g to install the base game which may cause problems for some players.                                                                                                Apex legends is a free to play game however some long-time players would argue that buying certain skins in the game would highly benefit the player, but the game is free however what comes with this is that apex can be a very aesthetically pleasing game if played on a powerful enough device and high enough graphics, otherwise the game may look extremely basic, and you may suffer performance issues.                                                                                                                          Apex has a large variety of soundtracks that each player can collect different soundtracks that add a sense of either intense music or fun exciting music, apex also has quite a stable game most of the time with few glitches but sometimes a player can get severely unlucky and run into many glitches or bugs with the game. And sometimes the server. In conclusion Apex is a fun multiplayer game with lots of different game modes for players to enjoy with a constantly changing game modes that will keep players engaged with the game.

author: jdmsjmsrscgm
review_text: Apex Legends is one of EA’s most notable titles, a battle royale game that continues to captivate players around the world even after several seasons. Since its launch, the game has managed to maintain an impressive relevance, not looking its age, thanks to regular updates and the introduction of new content. One of the main reasons for Apex Legends’ continued success is its competitive and accessible development. The game is structured in a way that is friendly to new players, with a gentle learning curve that allows newcomers to quickly adapt to the game’s mechanics. At the same time, the game offers enough strategic depth to keep veteran players challenged and engaged, with a constantly evolving meta and a variety of characters, each with unique abilities. EA has managed to find an effective formula to keep players engaged season after season. The introduction of new characters, game modes, seasonal events, and map updates keep the gameplay experience fresh and exciting. This constant stream of new features and improvements keeps players coming back regularly, avoiding the stagnation that can plague other games in the genre. Despite its success, it’s inevitable that some players have dropped out of the game over time. However, Apex Legends’ player base remains robust, with only a small portion of the original audience having left the game permanently. This is a testament to EA’s ability to keep the game engaging and relevant, ensuring that the majority of players continue to find reasons to stick around and explore the dynamic world of Apex Legends.

author: LT_Gruber
review_text:
Great Battle Royale game with high tension.

When the Battle Royale genre came to market, I played a couple of them. After PUBG, which I found fun for a while, but eventually bored me, Apex Legends hit the scene and it was an amazing experience.

In Apex Legends, you start in a team (with friends or random people) and choose a character and class. Each class has its own starting layout and proficiencies and, depending on the play style, can really make the difference between winning or losing.

An epic cutscene plays in which you are dropped from a plane, and while descending, you can choose where on the map to land. On your drop, you can also see the spread out other players, so you can determine somewhat how close they are going to be. After landing, you can explore a giant map in search of new weapons, enemies and gear.

Every so often, the playable area gets smaller and running into other players will be more likely by the minute. The tension is great and with each passing second, the chance for victory or annihilation gets closer. In the end, the combat arena is not bigger than a living room in a house and the combat en tension rises to a whole new level. It is them or you.

Apex Legends looks great. The huge map, the forests, the water, character models and color pallet, it is beautiful to look at. For me, the way the game looks, really enhanced my experience and made me choose this game over other Battle Royale games in the genre.

In terms of sound, the game is also outstanding. The glorious battle music at the start, the ambient, threatening tracks when exploring the map, it is just great.

The overall atmosphere of the game feels like a whole crowd of fans and supporters is watching. It has some sort of “Super Bowl vibe” if that makes sense. Sure, players who have been eliminated can watch you struggle (or die) but most move on to another game, which makes sense. Still, Apex Legends has this appeal.

I really liked the overall setting of the game. The action, the constant alertness of your surroundings, finding cool stuff, the adrenaline rush combat when you turn around a corner and the enemy is standing there, and one time, I even won the match with my team and I felt like a God.

The game is, of course, most fun to play with friends and the coordination and teamwork is just great. You are playing a video game, but it feels like you are in the army.

My only personal problem with Battle Royale games like this, is that you find a lot of cool stuff, get one-shotted in the head, and the game is over. This has nothing to do with the game, it is just how it is played, but I always get a little bumped out over building up something cool and strong, and then lose it all in a second.

Overall, I think Apex Legends is a great game and I would recommend it to everyone.

author: Revengy
review_text: Path of Exile is nothing short of a masterpiece in the action RPG genre, offering players an unparalleled experience that combines depth, complexity, and engagement. The game excels with its vast character customization options, particularly through the intricate passive skill tree and the unique skill gem system, allowing players to create truly personalized builds that cater to their playstyle. The dark, immersive world of Wraeclast is rich with lore and filled with challenging enemies and epic loot, making exploration feel rewarding and exhilarating. The frequent updates and expansions demonstrate the developers' commitment to constantly evolving the game, introducing new mechanics, leagues, and content that keep the community excited and engaged. Additionally, the game’s free-to-play model is executed flawlessly, offering a fair experience without pay-to-win elements, making it accessible for everyone. Overall, Path of Exile stands as a benchmark for what an online RPG can achieve, combining deep mechanics, a thriving community, and an expansive world into a consistently rewarding adventure that sets a high standard in the genre.

author: lucasbaile
review_text: The only downside of PoE is the barrier of entry for new players. Being such a complex game, with years of deep complex, and meaningful systems accumulated, the game can be quite intimidating for new players. But I can guarantee that if you like the genre and keep playing past the initial learning curve, you will not be disappointed. The character progression and build creation potential are honestly almost endless, and this paired with a solid campaign and an AMAZING (and almost a bit addictive) endgame array of options, makes this my all-time favourite game to play continuously.

author: Mind87
review_text: I’ve now played POE 2 for over 90 hours, and I’m completely disappointed. The only aspects that make the game remotely interesting are the graphics and the skill tree. The regular mobs on the maps are generally no challenge at all. Bosses simply spam countless AOE attacks and throw trash mobs at you. There’s no noteworthy mechanic or significant challenge behind the boss fights. They just deal massive damage and have an endless health pool. When it’s supposed to be “especially difficult,” the boss room is artificially shrunk until you’re forced to fight an AOE-spamming boss in a tiny square, or they use damage types against which it’s nearly impossible to have sufficient **** 1 is far more entertaining and enjoyable to play. In this case, it feels like they tried to create a Dark Souls **** my opinion, POE 2 doesn’t deserve any attention, and the price for early access to a free-to-play game is outrageous, especially since you’re not really getting anything special for it. Sure, let the test players pay for the privilege of being test **** sum up POE 2 in bullet points:Boring mapsAbsurdly stupid boss fightsZero innovationExtremely long farming due to almost no useful gear dropsMindless grindAcceptable graphics but poor performanceThe game isn’t worth a single cent! If you’re considering buying it, I can only advise against it. Wait until it’s free to play.

author: Sixgate
review_text: POE fanboys will defend this shiny, polished turd to the death. Fact of the matter is this game is badly designed in so many ways, that GGG should strongly consider firing whoever came up with some of this. The skill tree is a disaster and needs to be completely reworked. Map bosses need fixed. Loot system needs fixed. Endgame needs a total overhaul. Endgame has no viable builds, you are gridlocked into one of the "templated" builds because experimentation does not work. Overall, these types of games are supposed to enforce risk and reward- this game has no reward. They tried to copy the dark souls formula and dropped the ball. POE fanboys will say "ph well i had no problem sinking 12 hours of my day into getting a weapon that does 4-12 more dmg than my current one" as if that's anything BUT bad game design. Skip this one.

Performance wise the game stutters a lot and floats between 40-50 FPS with a 2080 on medium.

I'm so tired of devs labelling their game dank souls because they are too lazy to balance their game and then to top it off throwing in instant death attacks to further ruin the game.

There is no cool gear or skills that you will find while playing. The players that look amazing bought their skins. Your character will always look like you are wearing a bag of potatoes. 

Seriously this is not worth your time and it doesn't respect your time.

author: klementineQt
review_text:
It's an insult (especially in the age of Overwatch 2) to call this game a clone, especially if you're aware of the development cycle and timeline of both games. But I do feel that I have to mention that first, due to the image the game has and how much that oversimplification has harmed the game's reputation.

This game honestly feels infinitely more balanced than OW foundationally. OW forces you to play certain team comps, on certain maps, with each character usually having a single viable playstyle with little room to budge. Paladins offers tons of playstyles for each character through options like talents, in-game store abilities (think MOBAs, not actual cash stores), and even a loadout system using deckbuilding to sway your characters skills to your playstyle, optimizing exactly how you play.

Overwatch is such a frustrating experience because of how thin its meta is and how you're forced into certain playstyles and comps. If you don't follow them, you're going to get steamrolled. If you play support or tank and don't have reliable teammates, you're going to get steamrolled since you can't manage enough to defend yourself. Paladins gives you the option to play your role and hold your own when you need.

This game is not an Overwatch clone, it is better. You have options, you're not limited in how you can play characters, and while you probably aren't going to win without solid teamwork, you can at least have more freedom to sway the game in your direction and keep yourself alive by fighting back.

Also horses so it doesn't take 7 years to get to the objective, Zenyatta could certainly use one lmao

Not only is this game bland, unbalanced, pay-to-win and boring, it also ensemblifies everything that the average ""gamer"" does not want in the video-game industry, including (but not limited to):

*Treating video-games as if they were a banal product, look, I get some kind of capitalistic business practices if you're producing regular goods, but by riding into trends and trying to get money out of every single aspect of anything, at the point of making the game p2w, are practices that should be frowned upon and bashed within the video-game community, yet we accept pieces of **** like this game

author: kiozen
review_text: *Destiny 2* is a sequel that expands and refines the experience of the original game, taking players on an epic journey across the galaxy to save humanity. The main story is more cinematic and accessible, with a plot that sees the Guardians facing Dominus Ghaul and the Red Legion, an army threatening to destroy Earth and the Light of the Traveler. The campaign is well-structured, offering a clearer narrative arc than the original, with engaging cutscenes and memorable moments that enhance players' understanding of the *Destiny* **** gameplay in *Destiny 2* retains the series' signature fluidity and responsiveness, with precise shooting mechanics and unique abilities for each class. The three main classes—Titan, Hunter, and Warlock—return, each with new subclasses that bring variety and strategic options to combat. PvE content has expanded significantly, with missions, new explorable planets, and activities like Adventures and Lost Sectors that add depth to exploration. Raids remain a highlight of the endgame experience, featuring complex mechanics that demand strong player **** the PvP front, *Destiny 2* offers a wide range of modes, with a 4v4 structure that creates a tighter, more competitive pace. However, the initial progression system faced criticism for a lack of rewards and incentives, which Bungie has improved over time with updates and new expansions.Visually, *Destiny 2* is stunning, with breathtaking environments and rich artistic detail. Each planet has a unique and distinctive aesthetic, and the attention to visual details further elevates immersion. The soundtrack, featuring epic orchestral compositions, adds emotional depth to the game’s key **** essence, *Destiny 2* provides a visually and narratively richer experience, blending polished gameplay with expansive content, making it a standout continuation of the *Destiny* saga.

author: Sint_of_XG
review_text: хороший бесплатный шутер, да разрабы поступили стандартно, игра бесплатная есть донат и платные DLC. но это игру не портит, ведь донат даёт только красивый транспорт или корабль на который большинству игроков плевать. DLC тоже не дают какого-то особого преимущества над другим игроками только премиум валюта, дополнительные битвы локации и собственно дополнительная сюжетная линия которая не так и важна для прохождения основной. так что можно смело скачивать. и да тут есть сюжет в отличии от других подобных многопользовательских шутеров. к сожалению отключить мультиплеер нельзя но никто не будет вам мешать сюжет вы проходите один и только один, игру я ещё не прошел но оставить отзыв обязан хоть и поиграл относительно мало. но этого опыта достаточно чтобы понять стоит играть в эту игру дальше или нет. лично я рекомендую!что могу отметить из хорошего и плохого?хорошее:*мультиплеер не бесит(тупые игроки не могут помешать вам проходить сюжет и квесты)*за хорошую оптимизацию контроллера для ШУТЕРА отдельный респект такое встречаю не часто*no pay to win тоже плюс, хотя по поводу DLC тут можно поспорить*русская озвучка*нет тупой системы лутинга, ты не умрёшь из-за того что у тебя слишком слабое снаряжениеи плохое:*когда текстура одежды багается когда вы садитесь на спэрроу не вся но большинство.но не смотря на всё это игра хорошая. стоит попробовать!

author: MoseGaril
review_text: This is my favorite game. The best place to kill time. The game is more suitable for fans of endless farming. This is the twin brother in spirit of Warframe. Almost the same idea, but so different. I definitely recommend it to those who are familiar with Warframe

author: objection01
review_text:
Destiny 2 is a game in a rather rough shape followin (date 12/11/2023) heavy layoffs and the posticipation of the final expansion (which lorewhise was meant to be like marvel's endgame in a place where its infinity war didnt deliver well).
playing this game on its fullest requires roughly an ammount of 180 euros if you want the full fleshed out experience, in a place where doing endgame activities requires a group of people (3 in total for dungeons, 6 for raids), thats rather hard to find in a community that on one side calls the experts elitists with massive egos and one the other views helping new players out a rather big waste of time.
Is destiny 2 worth playing? yes (on pc expecially) despite the downsides a new player has a lot to work with, improving, finding a team/clan and testing themselves on normal and hard versions of interesting raids and (for the more masochist) testing themselves in trials on a pvp ruled by meta ability spam of certain characters, exotics and damn smgs with qa rather **** balancing. (it aint worth it trust me). On a run for normal and adept loot with specific rolls.

Storywhise you have to put a lot of hope on how the story of the final shape expansion delivers, hoping that the season "battle pass" ceazes to exist with the following episodes that will be later introduces. the previous ones were mostly mediocre (apart from the witch queen).
Play this game (which possesses beautiful qualities) only if you ae aware of the risks...

author: PaddyFactory
review_text: I find the haters bitter, twisted & deluded.  I've been gaming for decades & Destiny is unmatched now and for the foreseeable future. As a shooter looter there isn't even a competitor in the ballpark.  Simple as that.  Haters gotta hate, if shooter looters aren't your genre then go back to Minecraft or Sim 3.

author: jewc_pusc
review_text: One word great game.  Don't judge something without paying it.  Fun and great game.

author: bigadel
review_text: le jeux est super même si il faut payer pour avoir plusieurs mode histoire les graphique, les personnage et les dialogue sont sympa et très bien d ailleurs pour les dlc il faudrait juste attendre qu' il soit en réduction  mais le jeux est plutôt bien

author: Roger1868
review_text: Destiny 2 is the best game I have played in years.  An MMO with a great single player campaign.  Customization out the ying yang.  Graphics are just incredible on my Nvidia 1060 3GB, believe it or not.  Runs perfectly and Bungie has created a masterpiece here.  I absolutely do not understand the hate for this game.  I have only 6 hours in and have barely scratched the beginning.  Controls are simple and no tutorial needed.  Get this game!

author: B0ls4k
review_text: Complain about dlc's and prices while i just play the main game witch is largely enough.

author: Objeto704
review_text: The game doesn't work as a whole, and the Tapir error appears. At the same time, the content was not withdrawn on general grounds. The game is not working, the paid content is unavailable because the developers have decided to block the CIS region. In other words, they took the money, but restricted access to the content based on regional and national characteristics. I can't continue using the paid content or the game in general. Those who continue to play in other regions, think about it. The same thing may happen to you one day.

author: Ncalsnx
review_text: Do not buy Edge of Fate. This is one of the most blatant examples of anti-consumer design I’ve seen in Destiny 2. Bungie removed over half of the activities from the previous season, replaced them with shallow, recycled content, and have been asking players to grind the exact same things on repeat as if that’s “new content.” It got old really quick and that isn’t game design—it’s a cash grab. The focus isn’t on creating a rich, engaging experience for players anymore, it’s on squeezing every cent out of the community. Bungie has shown they don’t value their players’ time, only their wallets.With Sony’s acquisition, there’s hope for change—but right now, Destiny 2 is running on a rinse-and-repeat formula that insults loyal players who’ve supported the game for years. Don’t reward this behavior. Spend your money elsewhere until Bungie shows real respect for its community.

author: julian0024
review_text:
The game gates all the gear behind absolutely horrific jump puzzles.

I went 2 hours without firing my gun a single time.

author: Nekkles
review_text: Bungie is actively blocking Destiny 2  to be playable on SteamDeck and Linux. Well, then Bungie, we are done, you won't get anything good from me.

author: Sepherim
review_text: Desgraciadamente, no puedo decir que Destiny 2 valga la pena para jugadores nuevos como yo. La razón principal es que es imposible ponerse al día, no solo por la parte mecánica (he metido muchas horas a Warframe, entiendo que para que un jugador nuevo entre a un juego así y se ponga al día va a necesitar invertir tiempo) sino porque han quitado tanto contenido que literalmente es imposible que nos importe lo que está pasando. Un ejemplo, nos dicen que Cayde-6 está muerto y todo el mundo está tremendamente triste, y entiendo que sea un personaje importante del 1 y el 2, pero como han quitado todo su contenido del juego lo único que podemos hacer es jugar la misión en la que se muere, que falla en tener ningún impacto emocional porque no conocemos al personaje. Y así con todo. Sabía que el vault existía, pero pensaba que habían metido en él cosas laterales, sidequests y demás, pero como han metido campañas enteras, lo que encuentras es un desastre a nivel narrativo que es muy difícil seguir, saber en qué orden hacer, etc. Una de las peores experiencias que he tenido como jugador nuevo en un juego.Y eso que, la parte de combate, las clases, las habilidades, las armas y demás, todo eso es divertido. Bueno, menos las secciones de plataformeo, que son un coñazo ortopédico y parece que les gustan mucho. Pero todo lo demás realmente es muy bueno, y los trozos que te dejan ver de la historia parece un mundo interesante, con buen worldbuilding e ideas chulas. Pero todo eso se pierde bajo la frustración de que la mayor parte de lo que puedes hacer con la parte gratuita del juego es en buena medida irrelevante, carente de razones reales para hacerlo porque no hay ni historia ni nada en muchas de las zonas, etc.Gráficamente el juego está muy bien, el sonido también lo está, y yo la verdad es que me he encontrado muy pocos bugs en las horas que le he metido. Con lo cual a nivel técnico cumple muy **** una lástima que sea este desastre injugable el resultado final, realmente me estaba gustando y estaba bastante decidido a comprarme las expansiones y eso hasta descubrir que en realidad aún con ellas me iba a perder multitud de contenido, historia y demás. Quizás cuando salga Destiny 3 valga la pena entrar, pero como jugador nuevo, la experiencia de entrar al 2 ahora es completamente terrible. Deberían aprender de cómo lo ha gestionado Warframe, que lleva mucho más tiempo de desarrollo, y aún así no priva a ningún jugador de experimentar toda la historia y sus cosas, y gratis además. Así que, en resumen, un 4 que cae aquí, probablmente habría sido una experiencia muy guay cogerlo hace unos años, pero hoy por hoy no.

author: ztokdo
review_text:
Despite a rough launch that led to a divebomb of negative reviews just about that, there's plenty of other things that really make you hate it.  
THE FINAL SHAPE LACKS REAL CHARACTER.   The villain is just annoying to see or even hear any wierd ramblings from.  The amazingly beautiful visuals and gunplay are so contrasting to story and overpowered ability spam.   The final shape is a mediocre offbeat soap opera.  The final shape is lucky that no other game is trying a first person live service looter shooter.    

Honestly Zavala, Ikora, and ghost are relatively annoying.  Did you realize that the story mentions some great apocalypse, then the FINAL SHAPE FEELS NOTHING LIKE THAT.  The missions are tedious and have several "gotcha" moments.  A lot of time I feel like I'm just waiting for some dialogue or something to just play out.

The best parts of Destiny's past have been the speaker, Cayde, Savathûn, and Ghaul.  All of the world and feeling of complete power that Savathûn had in the Witch Queen is just gone since then.

The "end game" still boils down to making the same dozen exotics work.  The grind to get perfect gear and eggballs is aweful. The most recent "events" are all based on FOMO and are horrible to play.   I hardly know anyone who could put in the hundreds of hours to complete the 25 lost sectors or 50 runs of onslaught.  The dev team has completely lost touch with their player base.  

Who wants 2 hour long actitives like the recent raid.  It's great for streamers and aweful for friendship.  People get bored repeating fights in a room with wave after wave of stuff spawning in.  The main way to die is to not memorize where things spawn in for their gotcha kills.  

It's going to be the same thing as usual.  Bungie literally gives Destiny expansions and all current FOMO items to all their streamers to keep them streaming it.  This is public knowledge.  In contrast, I keep running into people with 30-100 clears of dungeons and raids without the exotics or main loot.   It's absolutely repetitive to the point that you hate it and has only double downed on that.

If you feel like it's worth a playthrough of the story and not getting the main items of value that it's probably worth getting it for you.  If you are lonely and have nothing going on in life, it's a great opportunity to stay that way and that may be for you.   The final shape really didn't capture a gaming experience and is really hoping that you buy it for nostalgia of what once was a game.

author: Gorelord
review_text: An enormously wasted opportunity from a game that had the potential to be one of the best of all time but once again got hamstrung by greed

author: somovbiu
review_text: a mega piece of junk. created with money-grabbing and fast food junk type of gameplay in mind.

author: RedMenacing
review_text: This game is bad. There is absolutely nothing else to say about this sorry ****. This game is just bad.

author: Spetty85
review_text: Cheaters everywhere. And Bungie does close to nothing to solve the issue. Frequent problems with the connection to complete the experience. A shame.

author: LT_Gruber
review_text:
Absolutely not the game for me personally.

I did not like Destiny 2. Although my reasons are entirely personal, I just could not get into it. I never liked service model games to start with, and Destiny 2 is no exception.

From the start, I could not care less about the main story of the game. There is a whole universe of lore, story, events, memorable characters etc., but for some reason, I could not give a flying ****. I created my character, finished the tutorial and already felt pointless and bored. Normally I would “educate” the reader of my reviews with a quick recap of the story or main goal, but in this case, I just cared too less.

I played some missions and quests but nothing felt like it mattered. I go to the location, kill stuff, complete the mission, earn my rewards and felt hollow inside afterwards. The thought of repeating this process until I grew to a certain level pained me, and when reaching level ten or so, I was done.

Graphicly, I think Destiny 2 is boring. It is blend, stale and flat. The worst environment with these graphics is the Central Hub location. Weapons and animations look well and polished enough, but the color pallet is just boring.

Sound wise, I think this is one of the worst I have played. Sound effects and music is so generic and dull, and distant enemies do almost not make any sound or grunts at all.

The controls and menus were horrendous and really hard to figure out and understand for me, and the sleek, SQL database design of it did not appeal to me.

Loot was absolutely pointless in my opinion. You get the same weapon or armor twenty million times, but with a different rarity or color. The stats meant nothing to me and I had no freaking clue wat was good and wat was bad. The numbers showed me that an item was way better than the previous one, but when equipping it, I did not notice any difference.

Destiny 2 has a certain “theme/skin/feel” that is the same as games like Anthem or Starfield (in hindsight). It is hard to explain, but revolves about the look of the inventory screens, stat screens, quest markers, etc. It is purely based on the menus and inventory management. For me, that was a problem, because Anthem was one of the worst games I ever played in terms of boredom.

The feeling of a freemium game in which you complete generic missions over and over and over again is just not for me. I constantly got the feeling that I could achieve nothing, unless I pulled out my wallet, although this is technically not the case.

Because the game is “Freemium”, you constantly get confronted with “deals”, “special offers”, “new store items”, and “best values” from the in game store. In the menu’s, at the start screen, at every interactable screen, it just felt like playing a online webstore in a browser. I understand it, because of its model, but I just don’t like microtransactions in games in general and, in hindsight, it is just better for me not to play this kind of games at all.

In conclusion, my own personal experience with Destiny 2 was very miserable. I hated every second of it and was bored out of my mind the second I even started the tutorial.

I personally would not recommend this game.

author: cinnamon97
review_text:
Not worth your time and money, only reused ****.
it was once a good game, now its just the shell of a company, dying and trying to not go down with out a big profit. STAY FAR AWAY FROM IT

author: strangermoon
review_text: best graphics modern fps game sicne battlefield 3 on pc maps not fully openworld but larga. sandly planes and heli ony called for support no control. look better than cod mw and bf 2042. game have offline bots. best realistic weapon in any game acording to gamespot weapon guy jonhathan.

author: TechnoSC
review_text: I like it. I love realistic shooters, such as tarkov or Insurgency. But in this game, it's like "Arcade-ly" realistic. You die instantly when you get a head shot, which is good, but in the next moment you recovered from a grenade that just exploded besides you? And you hold your gun in the perfect aim position after running 50m? Arcade or a "realistic" shooter? But that's of course not a really bad thing. The game itself is fun and with the right team and mods (open mod support), the game can be really fun. Especially during role-play or intense fighting areas.

author: Bendy52
review_text:
I assume the game is at its final stage of its life cycle. and to be fair if Livewire is its last update i wouldn't be that sad, the game is in good place. i would say missing only a competitive mode.
Gameplay is solid and dare i say better than COD MWF 2022. punchy sound and lovely non woke cosmetics that fits the theme of the game mostly. Performance has come along way.
Sure the player base is not that HUGE. but u will have no issue finding a match.

83/100.

author: argentshard
review_text:
There is a stark difference between the base game and the ISMC mod.

Do not play without ISMC. Period.

7/10 for base game, 10/10 for ISMC mod.

author: LCDDL
review_text: J'ai eu une mauvaise expérience avec Helldivers 2, mais ils sont majoritairement dûs à l'affreux portage PC qui a de nombreux problèmes très irritants. Le jeu en lui-même est fun entre amis, mais je ne me verrais jamais jouer seul, c'est simplement, car il est très répétitif dans le fond, mais spectaculaire dans la forme. Jouer avec des amis nous fait oublier que c'est la même chose en boucle due au chaos environnant et des moments drôles. Malheureusement, le portage PC apporte des problèmes qui m'ont fait mettre le jeu de côté pendant 1 an. Je n'ai pas une bonne connexion et si le jeu ne détecte plus votre connexion pendant un court instant, il vous déconnectera instantanément voir même ferra crash le jeu. Et si on combine ça avec le fait que les touches clavier sont réinitialisées à chaque lancement, ça devient rapidement insupportable. Cependant, ces problèmes ont été résolus depuis donc je ne peut que le recommander si vous comptez jouer avec des amis.

author: hugodesu
review_text: Es el juego que no sabía que necesitaba. Soy un fan de Starship Troopers. Y este juego le hace honor. Ha tenido momentos malos, pero ahora está muy equilibrado. Es muy divertido.

author: assiscmp
review_text: o jogo é otimo!, mas vamos lá a analise, o jogo não vale 150 reais, pra mim nenhum jogo vale esse preço, no maximo 80 , mas caso vc queira comprar, saiba q vc ta pagando mais pela marca do playstation do q pelo jogo em si, pontos negativos que encontro, o jogo só tem 3 diferentes espécies de inimigo, tendo como base passes para liberação de equipamento ( q ou vc vai demorar mt pra liberar eles ou vc paga e consegue mais rapido, porém da pra conseguir gratuitamente) , o jogo e seu sistema de nivel acho bem rapido, com vc chegando ao nv 25 e ja conseguindo tudo do melhor do jogo ( onde pra mim seria mais divertido dar mais dificuldade na liberação dos mesmos, por ex em vez de 25 ser um 50 ) , lados positivos, sua comunidade é incrivel ! , sendo de fato uma das melhores comunidades q ja fiz parte , grafico perfeito, ambientação ainda mais, gameplay extremamente divertida e dificil quando vc põe na dificuldade 10 , seu hormonio de serotonina vai subir absurdamente kkkkk, e por esse motivo recomendo o jogo, mas sendo franco também com seus pontos negativos, minha nota seria um 8 /10 pro mesmo , vale apena

author: zaratti
review_text: Absolutely fantastic game. The gameplay is incredibly fun and satisfying. The overall style of the game, the parody that is Super Earth, the power the game gives each player etc. I definitely recommend this game. However, it does have a decent amount of glitches and bugs, some breaking the game you're in.

author: sammy447
review_text: Holy **** ****. This is the greatest roguelike of all time. Nothing tops the incredible soundtrack, visuals, and item combinations that this game achieves. It's hard to overstate how consistently fantastic this game is.

author: Perol23
review_text: Buen juego roguelike, sobre todo para pasártelo con amigos. Una cantidad de objetos abrumante y el hecho de que se puedan acumular hace que puedas llegar a unos niveles de poder increíbles donde eres básicamente una maquina de matar inmortal. En este juego vas a morir mucho, muchísimo, pero esa es la gracia. Lo único que le echaría en cara es la variedad de ciertos enemigos según el nivel y el hecho de que, una vez que te lo pasas, solo te queda rejugar para desbloquear algún personaje.

author: riskofrain3
review_text:
This is the best game I have ever played. They are planning on adding Big Boss next DLC which will make it definitively better than 
MGS 3: Snake Eater

author: Jaldou3
review_text: I had it in my library of quite a while when i decided to play it realised i was sleeping on a hidden gem, it's grate if you like roguelike game also fun to play with friends.

author: Consar
review_text: bad optimization. terrible movement. still a very fun game. getting constant updates and fixes.

author: Rrichard
review_text: Campaign makes it finally worth buying. Epic combat, great teamplay, great  for fans of RO2. Only downside is outdated UE3 engine.

author: KitchenBags
review_text: I have played many shooters. There is an appealing fear factor with RS2. A complete novice can get the drop on you, no matter how experienced you, are as a player. The weapons have real-world recoil and sound. You feel the tracers whiz past your head. My only disagreement with other reviews is that, the Commander is not the most important role. SQUAD LEADER is the most important, as you are on the front, in the trenches with your men, capturing points and painting targets for the Commander...while under fire. Also responsible for digging tunnels for spawning purposes. Without the SQUAD LEADERS, the Commanders have no drops. In my opinion, this is one of the hottest shooters to date. Even with its age, you still have no problem finding a 64/64 brimming with death and destruction. I luv it!

author: garethvk
review_text:
The trend in war based shooters of late is to literally take a blast from the past. Battlefield 1 looked at WW1 and Call of Duty returned to its WWII roots for the most recent game in the series. As such when Rising Storm 2: Vietnam was announced, it seemed like a good progression and one that holds a lot of potential for gamers. The previous game in the series focused on the Pacific Rim conflicts and focused on the conflict with Japan.
This time out the focus is Vietnam and players can opt to fight for either the Vietnamese or U.S. forces and they will also be able to select a class and loadout unique to each side before entering the fray.
The matches I took part in showed off the large and detailed maps which provided plenty of options to flank and enemy or attack from cover. Fields, towns, temples, and more were all an option and I had intense battles in a multi-level building, trenches, fields, and in a town. The weapons were varied but I opted mainly for an M-16 or AK-47 depending on which side I was assigned to. I did have a great opportunity early in the match to ride on a Helicopter and took my position manning one of the machine guns, which allowed us to strafe enemy targets as we traveled.
Our focus was a mix of taking and securing an objective and of course eliminating as many enemies as I could. Using a mix of grenades and rifle shots I was able to dispatch a few enemies but you could tell that there were some seasoned players online who used to the map to their advantage and were masters at striking without being seen.
I also experienced some people who were more than happy to call in a Napalm strike without any concern to the number of friendly troops in the target area. Naturally as you progress you will rank up and have more options for your character and loadouts.
The graphics of the game were solid but did seem a bit dated compared to other shooters. But this does a great job of giving a rough and battle-worn look to the game and not trying to make a blasted and remote area looked like an over-polished presentation.
If you are a fan of team-based online shooters and want some great action in the Vietnam setting; then Rising Storm 2: Vietnam just might be the game for you.
3.5 stars out of 5

author: Mitya64
review_text: Неплохая игра про вьетнам. Куча карт и видов оружия. Геймплей похож на оркестр, только теперь все с автоматами бегают. 4 режима, все в основном на 1 играют. Несколько классов бойцов, у некоторых разные оружия. Техника в виде вертолетов, за гуков туннели и мины. Оптимизация слабая и графон так себе. Для 800 графон очень слабый (2011) год. Куча багов. еще с убийством и попаданием в врага проблемы. Вышел на челика 5 пуль попал с каллаша, а он выживает и убивает тебя (интересно как). Преготовтесь к тому что вы будете жить меньше минуты т.к постоянные артобстрелы, гранаты, и просто челы из какой нибудь жопы вас убьют. Игру могу посоветовать только любителям вьетнама и реализма (мазохисты). И лучше дождитесь скидок, я ее за 270 рублей взял. Фулл Прайс  она не стоит это точно

author: cyberdamn
review_text: Bugs seem to never being fixed, and there are lots of them! Also illogical gameplay decisions, also """character customization""" that makes literally everyone rook the same

author: i76
review_text:
Just another average shooter in a massive pool of average shooters.

RO/RO2/RS are far better games.

author: GiZmoNiSmo
review_text:
dreadful game. Hit detection is a joke ... dont believe me try hipfiring an AK at 3ft and see who dies first. Get killed by Napalm that extinguished 15 seconds prior. Get killed by shotguns that have better range than AKs and M16s. Get cooked with Flamethrower that kills you from utterly ridiculous ranges and it matters not if you are behind a wall or inside a room.

Game is utterly dreadful

author: RiftTV
review_text: Absolute joy to play. Simple premise anyone can pick up: Run as fast a possible and shoot everything in sight while listening to the fast-paced music that perfectly accompanies the surreal visuals. You die, you start over. The rooms seem to be randomly generated, so starting over doesn’t ever feel like a chore. Definitely the best indie shooter I’ve played in a long while.

author: SterNebula
review_text: I won't say much but this is a must play for DOOM and old FPS shooters enthusiasts , great gameplay and environment style, good movements, a generous selection of enemies, and to top it all, banger music. Try it out, it is a lot of fun.

author: Traxillion
review_text:
The chainsaw leg mechanic is one of the best mechanics I have ever seen in a video game. Sliding around chopping enemies up at Mach 10 with your chainsaw leg never gets boring.

The game itself is excellent, from the incredibly solid shooting to the level design and music that pumps you up during different arenas.

My only big gripe is that the bosses are kinda of bad and made redundant with the turbo time ability which makes every single boss in the game a piece of cake.

Other than that it's an incredible game

author: Faunymaroo
review_text: Very fun game with a great aesthetic. Fast and slick combat. It goes on for too long (in particular the ending) and the story is not especially well-written, but overall very enjoyable

author: Bigbossbalrog
review_text: [SPOILER ALERT: This review contains spoilers.]

author: WackyJaber
review_text: This is one of the best FPS games ever made. Absolute GOAT of the retro shooter genre, in my humble opinion, and I would even argue one of the best games in the FPS genre at all. If you love Quake, this game takes a lot of inspiration from that, but has increased weapon and enemy variety. The level design can be downright inspired, and I don't think there's a bad level in the entire game. Do yourself a favor and play this game.

author: bakpak
review_text: One of the best boomer shooters out there. Imagine the original doom modernized, and cranked the action and horror to 11, and add half-life 2 physics. The weapons are pretty good and you use all of them pretty frequently and the enemies are very creative and fun to fight against, and the levels constantly innovate on the previous one to keep it fresh. The boss fights are the only part of the game that i wish was better

author: JussaGamber
review_text:
Everything was put together really well, but...
Episode 1 is great, Episode 2 is fine, Episode is mostly good. Levels are either the size of a stadium or a McDonald's playplace. Gunfights are fun, that grenade launcher Weapon is awkward to use. I believe a 7/10 is good, but metacritic doesn't.

author: DinoBeam
review_text: This game is pretty cool and pretty sick. Feel free to save like you would in Skyrim, or to bump the difficulty down, it's going for that frantic Quake/Doom combat, and sometimes it can get quite tuff. Sometimes it has meme or meme-like humor instead of taking itself seriously, and there is often cheesy metal playing, I would have liked less of that. The overall art style is fantastic, the Wendigo enemies are one of my favorite designs in any videogame, and it also features some great ambient tracks.

author: TheRealMan
review_text: I went in expecting an already great game, but it blew me away on how amazing it was. The fast-paced action shooter went way above my expectations. While I can say that you can beat most stages with decent practice, it is still a spectacular experience that any player should immerse themselves in. The graphics are reminiscent of old shooter games, such as Doom. Overall, great game if you like shooters, and there is quite a bit of lore as well. Therefore, I say 10/10.

author: kwstas2
review_text: Prodeus is an old school classic FPS which takes inspiration from both the Doom and Quake series. It is a pretty good game and a satisfying shooter though is not perfect by a long shot in my opinion. What is best about it is the shooting and the sound design especially when it comes to gunfire sound effects. The level design through a decent amount of missions it provides is almost superb at its best to almost quite **** at its worst. The guns are pretty amazing overall and they are extremely fun to use with some being even better than others. Visually is alright even with the retro thingy that is going for but still I wouldn't exactly say it's anything spectacular. what keeps it down for the most part in my eyes it's a lack of viriety in general whether it's the enemies, the environments, the textures etc. there is not much of any of that really. What annoyed me personally is the respawn system after death which is something similar to bioshock, I could explain why but I will just say that it just doesn't work for me. And the final thing which is not exactly a problem but maybe is worth mentioning is that the game is pretty short, it can get 10 hours give or take to do most things in the game.

author: Nmaa18
review_text: Short review: I have three main issues. I noticed after 10 hours of playing that I had never died from an enemy, the difficulty is in finding the ores and the exploration/platforming more than the enemies themselves unlike in Doom where both are difficult. Secondly, I find that finding these ores is incredibly difficult, to the point where I often need to look online for their locations. Even getting the map doesn't help much, as it lacks clarity and is convoluted. The issue is that the store is an integral part of the game, and not getting ores holds you back gameplay-wise. Finally its a little bit repetitive, but I guess this is an inherent/vestigial trait of this sort of old school FPS-style game. Nevertheless, the game is still fun, and the sound design, style, and sfx are great and helps set Prodeus apart from the rest. Shooting feels great too. Finally I like the amount of content there is, and the community maps is a great feature that adds a creative aspect and more replay-ability. It's a simple, fun game to briefly play daily. 76/100.

author: TrueOptimist
review_text: Doomy Goodness. Really good level design and weapons that truly feels like a part of the series they are trying to emulate.

author: vipek
review_text: This might be my favorite boomer shooter of all time! And believe me, I played them all :) I grew up on Doom, Quake etc. But Prodeus is SO MUCH MORE. The levels are cleverly designed and full of secrets. The weapons: there's 16 of them, and most of them are cool, clever (again) and really satisfying to shoot.

author: Rysiu
review_text: The game is great, but the missions are a bit annoying and there is no sound of footsteps

author: camekanehir
review_text: SUPERHOT stands out as an independent game offering a unique shooting experience. The game's distinctive feature is the manipulation of time, where time only progresses when the player moves. This grants the player the ability to slow down time when enemies are shooting or launching attacks.Graphics and Design:Graphically, SUPERHOT adopts a minimalist style. Enemies and the environment are highlighted with red accents on a white background. This design choice enhances the player's focus and strategic thinking.Gameplay:The game allows players to progress through challenging levels filled with formidable enemies. However, thanks to the time-slowing mechanic, players can carefully plan each move and foresee dangerous situations. This provides a different and thought-provoking experience compared to traditional first-person shooter games.Story:SUPERHOT's story transports players into a mysterious virtual reality world. As players attempt to complete a game within this world, they uncover secrets embedded within the game. The story keeps players engaged in an immersive narrative.Shortcomings:Some players might find the short story mode less satisfying, but this is compensated by additional content that enhances the game's replayability.Conclusion:SUPERHOT is a standout game with its unconventional gameplay, impressive design, and challenging levels. The time manipulation mechanic encourages tactical thinking, providing players with a unique shooting experience. If you're looking for a different FPS experience, SUPERHOT is definitely a game worth considering.

author: tixi777
review_text: Amazing Game                                                                                       .

author: APolChrome
review_text: (Reseña sacada de mi cuenta de Steam: APolChrome) Después de completar la campaña de SuperHot, puedo afirmar que no esperaba encontrarme con un videojuego tan bueno. Un juego simple pero complejo al mismo tiempo. Un juego que me ha sorprendido narrativamente. Un juego que tiene mucho contenido al terminarlo. Un shooter único en su especie vaya. Voy a empezar hablando del gameplay.SuperHot es un shooter que cuando no nos movemos, el tiempo transcurre muchísimo más lento (casi se para), permitiéndonos hacer auténticas virguerías con los enemigos (unos personajes rojos). Ya está. No tiene muchísimas mecánicas, no te atosiga con armas. No. Tú te inventas la forma de pasar los niveles. La cantidad de interacciones es única y es una gozada ver la repetición de un nivel en el que has hecho alguna fantasmada. Aunque el tiempo se pare bastante, se siente muy frenético y nos da una sensación de adrenalina muy **** variedad de armas que hay me ha sorprendido. Tanto que puedes usar hasta objetos del entorno (cosa que se hace muy divertida de ver) para lanzárselos a los enemigos. La mecánica que más me ha gustado ha sido la del HotSwitch. Consiste en que podemos cambiarnos el cuerpo con enemigos para transformarnos en ellos. Parece raro, pero a la hora de la verdad resulta increíble usarla. Ahora bien, esto se usa a partir de la segunda mitad, por lo que me parece que no se aprovecha todo lo que podría, pero el tiempo que se aprovecha, es un 10.Audiovisualmente, me ha gustado. Es un juego muy simple en este apartado, pero ser simple lo hace tan bien que acaba siendo muy bonito. Un estilo artístico muy limpio y unos sonidos muy buenos hacen de este juego una sorpresa en este aspecto.Y la historia me ha encantado. No porque tenga un guión elaboradísimo, sino por las sorpresas que da por el camino. La manera en la que la enfocan y cómo se va torciendo el juego me han fascinado, a parte de que tiene un transcurso muy natural y poco forzado. Aviso que os va a encantar.Resumiendo, SuperHot me ha gustado muchísimo. Es un juego único que creo que todos deberían darle una oportunidad al menos, porque no dejará indiferente a nadie. Un shooter como ninguno en una experiencia como ninguna. Recomendadísimo

author: kekkov
review_text:
Пробовал эту игру. Вот мой опыт. Я играл где-то месяц, делал регулярно каждый день ежедневные задания, копил внутриигровые ресурсы. Потом случилось так, что я тупо забыл зайти в эту игру и сделать ежедневки. Ну или банально не нашел времени. А потом вдруг я задался вопросом. А нафига я захожу в эту игру делать ежедневные задания и трачу от полчаса до нескольких часов в день, если игра мне особо и не нравится, ну не тянет опять играть. И тут я решил притормозить. Начал играть лишь по одной причине - положительные отзывы из-за ее f2p дружелюбности. Возможно, так и есть, я просто в игре слабо разобрался. Ну вот не хочется в нее играть снова и снова. Игровой процесс утомляет.
Игра имеет еще и мобильную версию. Я играл только на ПК, но мне кажется, что для смартфона эта игра очень даже ничего. Сложно представить современного человека без смартфона с интернетом, вы можете играть в LOR в любом месте, как вам надо будет убить время, доставать смартфон и запускать эту игру, а ПК использовать для других игр
