author: Flemat
review_text:
Solid mechanics, nice art style and card balance is fairly ok. Without the 1 major cons it would be a 8/10.
HOWEVER
the 20 hp that the players have is JUST NOT ENOUGH in my opinion. Why make expensive, decks (why buy or grind), when you can just go "Noxus" / "anything else" but i recommend "Ionia" to just go "face aka. Nexus, and win in sometimes 3, usually 4-6, and at most 8 turns!? Ofc. you can go meta Heimerdinger/Vi or something similar, but again...WHATS THE POINT?!

Because of this kinda game breaking thing (easy to fix, yet still isn't: Nexus hp 20 -> 30) its VERY CHEESE, very EASY to dominate casual players and to grind up EVERYTHING in 2 weeks (inc. Bildgewater). So yea after 2 weeks i'm left with: ok, what now? NOTHING really. So w8 for next big updates / uninstall, that's it.

PS: If you play anything else, it will take you MONTHS to get everything. Some of my friends stopped playing it all together after 2 weeks because "its too grindy" / "too slow to progress". When I told them and showed them my method, they were like " F OFF!!!". Some came back and finished their grind in a few days, some swore to never touch this game again EVER!

In either case, you MIGHT have a solid 2 weeks of fun (by that i mean Strategically and tactically go ONLY Face/Nexus like a totally skilled player. Units live or die? Doesn't matter! Amount of cards in hand and/or deck? Doesn't matter! Mana cost/efficiency? Doesn't matter, only playing with cheap BS units and everything comes on curve 97.50% of the time! Leveling up Hero units? Doesnt matter, if it lives or dies! Strategy, positioning, synergy, tactics? DOESN'T F-ING MATTER!!! FACE FACE FAAAAACE like a total moron. Aaand it actually WORKS XD). Would usually rank it higher for that fact alone, that I had 2 weeks worth of fun, but we are talking about a company that has a lil. bit of che ching ($$$), so nope. League of Legends wanst made to last 2 weeks. I mean COME ON someone rewrite the 2 to a 3 (20 -> 30), if its mixed up! is it THAT HARD? Yes it is :)

3/10
THREE/TEN

author: NDiggy13
review_text:
Another pay to win card game in the same vein as Hearthstone and Gwent.  If you like Hearthstone but would rather play a card game set in the League of Legends universe then this game is worth checking out.  Be forewarned though, just as with Hearthstone, you'll either have to spend a lot of money up front or spend a copious amount of time playing the game over the coming months to be able to build a competitive deck.  Matchmaking is abysmal and deck balance doesn't exist.

The game seems generous at first with rewards, but you quickly learn that the rewards aren't the powerful cards you really need to compete.  And if you decide you do want to spend money, then I hope you have plenty of cash to burn because it will cost quite a bit to build a competitive deck or two with how the shop is structured.

Card balance and mana costs need a lot of tuning, which is surprising since I would have assumed they would have gotten this more balanced before going live.  Some champions are absolutely broken, Tryndemere springs to mind.  He's insanely powerful and once he's on the field it's a guaranteed win.  Doesn't require any set up or intricate card combinations to pull off, just play him and you win 95% of the time.   That's not well balanced, and that's just one example.

Stay away from this game unless you plan on spending a lot of money, or don't plan on having a competitive deck for several months, because it will take at least that long to build with the reward system currently in place.

Riot also employs Bots in ranked play.

author: rvkdizbap
review_text:
Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 transcends the medium and delivers on every single front. Games time and time again try and fail as they expand in scope - this isn't a diss on any production, but it's more so the reality of development. There is so much to do right, leaving many avenues to invariably mess up on. 

Expedition 33 manages to nail every single thing it attempts to deliver on. Its storytelling is masterful: a shockingly emotionally profound journey woven in the backdrop of grief, love, and family. The soundtrack is just... wow. Visuals are stunning, gameplay is addictive and well polished (a singular inconsequential bug during my entire playthrough). 

Truly a generational experience. I implore anyone, irrespective of whatever games are their typical go-tos, to dive headfirst into it. And this is the studio's first game?? Bravo

author: Understanding
review_text: Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 is a stunning masterpiece. Its painterly aesthetic feels alive, with animations that flow like brushstrokes in motion. The voice acting is exceptional, giving every moment emotional weight. But the real highlight is the innovative combat system—fluid, strategic, and refreshingly original. A rare blend of beauty and brilliance.

review_text: 仅是一款游戏，它更像是一部融合了哲学、侦探与奇幻元素的史诗巨作。自2019年发售以来，它以其独特的艺术风格、深刻的剧情内涵和创新的玩法机制，赢得了全球玩家的广泛赞誉。在我心中，这部作品无疑值得一个完美的十分评价。

author: criticaldude
review_text:
Almost 50 hours of playtime, in which 90% (or potentially more) of gameplay is basically just dialogue. If it sounds boring or you just don't like reading (though there is voice acting) i'd still strongly suggest giving it a shot. The writing in this game is beyond impressive. Close to perfection. A masterpiece which is best to explore as blindly as possible. If you are planning to play it anyway, dont look up anything,experience it yourself. 
Its baffling to me how captivating the story is and how the "gameplay" just flows. Multiple times during the first playthrough i found myself sitting there for hours basically just talking to people. An entire dialogue can take up to 20-30 minutes even and at the end of each conversation it leaves you with clue or an idea which you wanna find out more about. If you're up for an epic, incredibly humorous, adventure in this detective role playing game with incredible storytelling, characters, worldbuilding, soundtrack and art direction i beg you, at the very least, give it a try.

author: Hackattaque
review_text:
Like Chained Echoes, Sea of Stars is a beautifully crafted throwback to the 90s RPG era, complete with all the quality of life improvements that we’d expect in the 2020s. No more random battles, painful level grinding and scattered save points; and as for the old-school ways of turn-based combat, it’s been given some clever twists, including a puzzle-lock system that gives you a chance to stop your opponent’s attack with the right spells.

Where Chained Echoes goes for a very elaborate and epic story full of plot twists, though, Sea of Stars goes for a more intimate and cozy tale of friendship and loyalty between three childhood friends who have a clear enemy to defeat. And whereas Chained Echoes had some fairly sprawling level environments, Sea of Stars has a more compact approach to dungeons, with tight puzzles to solve and pretty varied themes.

I would say overall I preferred Sea of Stars for its moment-to-moment gameplay and Chained Echoes for its story. Both have pacing issues and neither quite manages to reach classic status; still, I enjoyed both a lot and hope their developers will put out even better follow-ups.

author: PWC_ee
review_text:
Having found myself stuck deep in 1000+ hours with this game, I believed I could say that it is a great game.  

Overall, this game isn't just about warfare; it has within it intrigues, strategies, and some unpredictable plot twists just like in real life! You wouldn't be surprised to find out about why medieval people love to marry their kin and offspring off to some powerful duke or king. Even though it is sufficient enough to play it with the base game, I highly recommend the extension like "Roads to Power" and "Tours and Tournaments," as it would add more varieties and more engaging content to the game.  

The game mechanic is quite good with a great UI; you can play as historical characters such as Kaiser Heinrich V of the HRE or King William the Conqueror (Duke of Normandy) or even the Mongols Borijin dynasty, and if you're up for something new, you can create your own character and rule the land you choose!  

For the mechanics, first let's begin with cultures. Cultures, of course, determine what we are like; If we are Mongols, then we are good at riding horses, and you can challenge your ruler for the throne or vice versa. While some cultures are more advanced, each culture shows different strengths and weaknesses. Next, the religions: there are also many religions unknown to me in this game, so I'd like to mainly talk about Christianity and what's unique about it; The pope will likely declare a crusade around 12th century, and you can either pledge to support it financially or militarily or both; the worst case scenario would be not to support it, as you'll lose piety and prestige. While participating could lead to a gain in prowess, prestige, and gold, you may have to take the risk of losing your knights or heirs in the battle. You can also create your own religion if you'd like to.  

Now, it's the characters time. So, if you choose some of the historical characters within the recommendation, then you will surely have a great stated character. The stats of a character comprise of prestige, diplomacy, intrigue, learning, stewardship, martial, and prowess: I guess the names already give hints of what they do. The higher the stat, the better your character will be at each task; high diplomacy means you can soothe other rulers and may be easier to make friends with them, etc. There is also an education mechanic where you can raise your child to have a certain personality upon their growth period (0-16 years). Choosing guardian can be a hard task, as you must choose according to the baby's traits such as the "Charming" should be studying diplomacy, and the guardian should have a great number of diplomacy stats, etc.  

To conclude, I do urge you to try this game out. It's got everything you'd expect. As an Asian, I don't think you should buy it full price, as lately, this game has been out on lots of discounts, so I do highly recommend you wait until the next promotional period.  

The rating would be 8.5/10.

author: asketes
review_text: I bought a new Alienware desktop computer to play this game, after watching footage of people playing it on **** and playing Crusader Kings II, which is free on Steam. It is up there with Civilization 6.

author: bskierys
review_text:
6/10 + 1 because of the perfectly executed couch coop.
Short: The game with great combat system, but generic setting and the plot that you don't really care about. I loved levelling up, and hated music and visual style.
Longer: What "Divinity: Original Sin" does very well is the combat system. Levelling up is slow and you rarely gain any new skill - and this was a great decision. After a while you perfectly understand every action you may take, its pros and cons. I played the whole game with my wife in a couch coop way and it was a great way to experience this game.
However, I was expecting more from an RPG when it comes to plot and atmosphere. When playing it, I felt like I was playing a hack&slash game with turn-based combat. The atmosphere is dull, generic and the dialogs are poorly written. We either skipped through them or was bored by them. The silly tone both in visuals and in dialogues was more annoying than entertaining.
We also hated the music that was so much anti-climatic. Especially that you have to listen to it over and over again during many many fights.
The quests were designed in clever way, presenting many ways of solving them, using the game elemental interactions. But beware the riddles. I usually love riddles in the games, but most of them in this game, are based on finding a correct object that you don't know that you are looking for.
Overall, it is a good game, but based on reviews I was expecting more. I was constantly comparing it to Pillars of Eternity, which I liked much more. If you want a good gameplay mechanics I encourage you to play "Divinity: Original Sin". But if you are looking for a good RPG, keep away from it.

author: LDGMDeniel
review_text: Maybe too small sometimes, maybe story is not toogreat. 10/10 anyway and much better than second game.

author: NightGeisha
review_text:
One of the advantages of wait to buy this game is that now (2019) when bought it, I get two different experiences. I get the classic version and a enchanted version.
It may not seem significant, but it is. They are two distinct experiences of the same fantastic game.

I have not finished the game yet, because it is an immense and challenging game, but honestly I think I will not going to finish it for now, at least on this classic version of the game. Little more than 20 hours of playtrough in the classic version I think I have a good feeling of what the classic version have to offer and going to do the same with the enchanted...

But back to the game, it is simply incredible. Visually, mechanically. A pure role playing game experience, where the roots of the genre were transposed to the maximum.
Fighting for me is the most interesting and challenging element and it is necessary to use the head and the elements that surround us against the enemy.

It is a game of elements where fire, earth, water and air annihilate each other in a perfect circle. Its a game where an "area of effect spell" reaches not only the enemy but the ally in that area. And it's so perfectly done every single way, every moment on every fight.

Those small details are also huge and make this game unique. For me it is a masterpiece of the genre, that I strongly recommend.

author: irmscher
review_text: OK I initially gave it 9/10 but closer to the end game becomes ridiculous with its quests. The door to the final boss is locked and I need to find 17 star stones in order to get through. Every star stone is kinda a secret in the game, you don't get them that easily. So I'm 90 hours in to the game and now I need to shovel-through the whole 5 areas again in search for these bloody stones. Devs, REALLY!!?? WTF. It's just fckn ridiculous...

author: MeritCoba
review_text:
Captain Jack dropped us off at a beach instead off at the harbor of Cyseal as the town was besieged by orcs, mostly from the sea. The town, with its sizable harbor, apparently lacked a navy of sorts, which left it at the mercy of the orcish incursions. Well, not quite, for it did have an army called the legion, which would also have failed to defeat the orcs if it hadn't been for some magical crossbows the local hedge wizard had put together.

We didn't really mind to disembark as Jack seemed a bit too much like a pirate with his eyepatch, wooden leg and speech spiced with harrs and yarrs. In fact we were certain he was one as he knew the situation in Cyseal all too well.Since pirates prey on local shipping by hiding out in coastal waters, it stands to reason that they are perfectly aware of the comings and goings of ships and people in that harbor and the associated opportunities and dangers. Anyway, he was crash enough to tell us about the plight of the town only when we were about to reach it and proposed ditching us on a beach as if he was offering us a way out. We suspected that the only other option would have been walking the plank.

We were source hunters. Source was a thing that sourcerers used to power whatever needs powering. Actually we forgot the last part as we were stuck thinking about sourcerers/sorcerers thing. Somewhere a guy behind a screen in a universe far away thought this brilliant or hilarious and he was even able to convince some other guys in other rooms of that fact. It is indie and therefore it is excusable we were informed.

Somewhat further inland we ran into a dead guy. The note on his corpse informed us that some statues convinced him that he could fly. Apparently he took some time to write this down, either before or during his leap of faith. We suspected foul play as it was far more likely that he was killed and then the perpetrator took time to cover this up by planting this note on him.  It is that level of (N)CIS writing we are talking about. We found out later that nothing of the sort happened; he actually did write the note(!).  But at that point we actually didn't really care one way or another as we were not the law in those parts, in fact we soon found out.. nobody was.

After an encounter with a poetic shell(the only highlight) and some undead summoned by some guy which we dealt with by summoning stuff of our own, we encountered two drunk soldiers, then ran into a group of orcs headed by a mysterious man, which would have made mincemeat of us if  three sober soldiers had not taken care of them for us.

Finally we reached the town Cyseal which was noteworthy because of three things. The first were the dozens, nay hundreds, of barrels, chests, caskets, baskets filled with random content running from nothing to incredible powerful, if you happen to require stats improvements for two stats that are diametrically opposed. The second thing were quests that started someplace, continued at another place, without being clear how to go for one place to the other, and then earned you a trifle experience if you finished them. The last was that exiting the town on the other side too soon resulted in instant death as you need at least one or two levels and be equipped with some good stuff to beat even the three undead lurking on the outskirts. And once we did have that we found out that our gear deteriorated at such a rapid pace that we had to repair our gear every second battle.

Furthermore we ran into an imp called ZixZax who was the historian of all events in time, which was really funny, if we had been eight perhaps, a morai who had migrated out of the Greek legends(or a norn out of the Norse mythology) and dozens of more stuff stolen from history, mythology and stories that hailmark this game as superior uninspired as it comes to storytelling, which would not even be so bad if it just had added something original to it, like a twist instead of a silly play of words.
At this point we gave up and went to read a book or watch a movie or redo tombraider.

Original Sin is a LRPG. A looting role play game which is the wet dream for anyone who wants a nickname that spells micromanagement. You get to loot and loot some more and do that save-before-opening-the-random-chest-and-reload-if-it-doesn't-give-you-anything-worthwhile thing. The loot only marginally improves you scores as does the leveling. The whole thing is aimed at having you spend most of you time on deciding things like: should I use this dexterity +1 and strength +1 / + 10 % poison resistant sword or this speed +1 and intelligence +1 club with double durability? Only to find out  weapons either break two battles later or have become worthless after you progress one or two levels. But if you do not micromanage: prepare to die. A lot.

Apparently.. this is what what the people who kickstarted this game wanted.
Have fun guys!

author: EpicCalibur
review_text: Tried game for one hour. The combat is insipid, slow, and thoughtless. Combat is turn based. If this game played like Dungeon Siege, it would have been awesome, but, it does not. The good graphics does not save this game. As a hero, you feel pretty weak and the characters are fragile compared to the enemies. The combat is painfully slow, it takes 10-15 minutes to fight 3 -6 skeletons! Your spells and abilities seem only to pinch the enemies and the enemies heal 2 turns worth of your attacks in one turn. The enemies are also very spread out so you are walking around a lot with nothing to look at except the map. This game absolutely is a chore to play, and is not fun. Don't listen to the hype, this game ****.

author: DarcNaith
review_text: Хорошая игра для любителей серии по Гарри Поттеру. Сюжет средний, саид квесты главных персонажей нормальные. А вот доп квесты вообще интереса не вызывали, за исключения одного квеста. Боёвка раскрывается только на позднем этапе, когда все заклинания уже выучены. Музыка хорошая. Мировая карта однообразная, её вообще не интересно изучать. Вивари и выручай комнату интересно изучать и делать всякие постройки и разводить всяких животных, жаль что их так мало.

author: KleinesMiep
review_text: Diese Spiel gibt einen tollen einblick in den Schulaltag der Schüler*innen von Hogwarts, es ist äuserst schon gestaltet und hat viel kleine deteils und anspillungen auf die Welt von Harry Potter. Allerdings ist es sehr Nervig am nachdem man den Endboss besiegt hat weitere 6 Level zu Farmen um die letzte Mission freizuschalten, das klingt zwar nach nicht viel ist aber totstem sehr nervig vorallen da man nach der letzten Hauptmission trotzdem noch weiter spielen- und somit das spiel auf 100% bringen kann. Das wäre sogar gut und nicht schlecht wenn man nicht nach dem Endboss noch mindestens 10 Stunden Leveln müste. Das ist vörallem nervig wenn man nach dem Endboss das spiel einfach nur noch beennden möchte, das geht sogar so weit das zumindestens ich am ende unr noch genärft da sahs und einfach nur dieses level ereichen wollte und das sollte ja auch nicht sinn der sache sein. Empfehlen würde ich es Trotstem da mir die Zeit vor und werdend des Endbosses äuserst gut gefallen haben.

author: PrincessRose
review_text: I've never been a Harry Potter fan, never read the books or watched the movies or paid much attention to it. It just never interested me. I prefer  GOT. But I did watch gameplay of this game and it interested me as I could create and play as my own **** world is so amazing, unique, wondrous and creative. Interesting to explore at **** Castle is the most interesting to explore. Everywhere else seems like a repetitive boring after thought and wasn't necessary and would of preferred if they put more focus and effort into making NPC's more interesting in dialogue, interactions and choices.Combat is done well even though it lacks enemy **** story is sort of ok.I do like exploring and trying to solve and complete things, but the puzzles and objectives are a bit too repetitive and rather dull. And there is too much of going back and forth as everything is gated behind skills that you get gradually. It took a long time trying to find all 95 Merlin trials and complete all challenges. I got all Revelio pages but it's so boring trying to find and complete the collection, so don't think I'll bother as it feels like a torturous waste of time.I don't like how you can only sell gear, you can't sell potions or materials. Even when you get your own shop. But even so I had so much money left even after buying all seeds, potion recipes and all the items you could for your room.Beast breeding is a bit disappointing the offspring doesn't grow up. All you can do is sell them to the beast shop. So no breeding different mounts or anything fun like that.I feel the game needs much better content. The conversations and narrative are boring, bland and weak. The game encourages you to converse with the professors  but what they say isn't interesting at all. I didn't find the characters interesting at all either. And it feels like the professors talk to you like you are a moron. It seems like this games speech is more catered towards young children than adults. It doesn't feel like a good open world game. It's an alright game. The game play doesn't feel very meaningful. I only kept playing as I am a bit OC about trying to complete a game and I will keep playing an alright game as long as I don't absolutely hate it.I didn't have any technical issues and only minor stuttering in some areas besides the  over bright lighting in treasure vaults making it impossible to see during the day which is an issue caused by a previous patch. This game is a bit too simplistic and seems it's made more for children.I like the castle, Hogwarts is enthralling and it's creatures. Riding around on a broom is fun and love when you finally get a beautiful hippogriff. Summoner's court was fun and it would of be nice if we could play it as much as we like. Everything else is sort of ok to rather meh and the most pointless and boring is most conversations as whatever you decide doesn't affect anything.I'd rate it 7/10. As needs better narrative, characters and deeper more diverse compelling gameplay.

author: navid3000
review_text: 25hours - Really good game but the performance is really bad, specially the big bosses. I had to lower the graphics settings to the lowest just for the final boss to be playable, and even still there were stutters on EVERY move the boss made. The world, combat and story are 9/10s.

author: Tatsuya7
review_text: It is a beauty, it seems that you are playing in a diorama the art is simply beautiful, each story makes you feel that you connect with each character and each ending is convincing and leaves a good taste in your mouth and invites you when you finish it to continue exploring its world, a must buy.

review_text: De lo mejor del 2018 que por suerte lo podemos jugar en PC desde el año pasado, lo jugue en su momento en la switch y ahora tiene una magnifica oferta del 50% en steam y pensar poderlo jugar a **** demasiada la tentacion, compra obligatoria en la plataforma que sea para los amantes del genero.

author: HRChan
review_text: An underrated game that needs more attention, the return of classic turn based jrpg is the best, the characters are amazing, their specific skills are great and useful in situations then you just relate to them one way or another. The soundtrack in this is one of the best, the art style is amazing! I might buy it on the switch for portable playing!

author: juniortiger
review_text: You need check game out one the best game and lot action game and excellent graphic and good music and amazing story and good daY

author: And92
review_text: Just wonderful, little gem that I recommend to anyone! it is very reminiscent of the Final Fantasy of the 90s, excellent for those who have not lived through those times and excellent for those who are nostalgic for that type of work, I think it should not be missed.

author: Tiwill
review_text:
Octopath Traveler II tells us that we don't need to be a superstar in order to bring hope to people. If you can make even just one person smile, you've accomplished something incredible and they will be a ray of happiness to you in return.

It conveys the idea that anyone can lose their way if they let their own pain taint their actions, and that it can be difficult to get out of that state of mind without a helping hand. Being patient with such a person in a time of need may blossom into a lifelong bond. Saving someone from their inner turmoils and giving them a chance to get back on their feet is a worthwhile endeavor.

It urges us to seek our own path, for we can never be truly free when adhering to someone else's expectations unwillingly. Sometimes, if your words fall on deaf ears, the only option left is to remove that person from your life.

It encourages us to be good to people, with no ulterior motive, and not to be insecure when challenged by misguided individuals who perform irrefutably malevolent deeds. If you let yourself be swayed by someone who acts with hatred, resentment or jealousy in their heart, you can quickly become just as lost as they are. It also reminds of the importance of patient critical thinking over immediate emotional response.

It even manages to tackle the topic of technological advancement and the need for wealth redistribution as new things get invented that improve the efficiency of production. After all, if knowledge exists to be shared with all, dough shouldn't just be hoarded either.

It is a tale about enjoying the simple pleasures of life, and spreading warmth and happiness around us.

~ ~ ~

This game is more than everything I had hoped for in a sequel to the first game. Much of the praise I had for that game also applies here, so I won't repeat all of the things Octopath Traveler II took from the first game that didn't need to be fixed, but let's dive into the ways in which it improves upon the original.

Improvements to the skills make it so there are much more ways to break enemies, and classes have been rebalanced in a way that feels like they all complement each other even better than before. The new Latent Power and EX Skills also make each character have a stronger identity in combat, and there is now a way to equip the same sub-class onto more than one character if you want to.

This series continues to have best-in-class music. As catchy as it is epic, as comforting as it is melancholic. Most of it is new, but a couple of melodies from the first game made a return in remixed fashion, striking a chord of nostalgia within me while strengthening the continuity of the series. It gave me the sentiment that these eight new travelers were experiencing emotions that the characters from the first game had also felt on their journey, despite having completely different stories. This is just one example of Team Asano's masterful understanding of emotion. Emotions are not unique; if it's a real emotion, then anyone can relate to it, because we are all human. Hearing those melodies again made me feel those intended emotions twice as strongly, as I thought of my past adventures in the continent of Orsterra as well as my current ones in Solistia.

Something I love about this series is how much the story feels like it ties into the gameplay and vice versa, and they went above and beyond this time to give us some jaw-dropping moments with the path actions at the end of each story. They somehow even managed to weave in the new day/night cycle mechanic into the plot.

The world is even more fun to explore due to the addition of boats and the way the map is less predictable to navigate. I think there are also more bosses to defeat, or at least they are spread out better. I still recommend equipping the Evasive Maneuvers scholar skill to reduce the encounter rate, making it just right as you explore. The chapters are also less formulaic this time around, making it so you don't know for sure what to expect from a given chapter. The post-game is much expanded as well, with some fully voiced side-quests that let you see what happened to some important characters in the story. Speaking of, the Japanese voice acting performances are absolutely fantastic and full of life.

The new cross paths really help tie everything together. And when I say everything ties together in the end, I mean it. Also, in the first game, a lot of the camaraderie between your party members came from your own imagination and roleplay. I'm glad that aspect is still present throughout the game, but there's a lot more jerky around the bone this time around, if you will. The final segment of the game made everyone feel even closer than I imagined my party in the first game to be, boosting the affection I have for these characters even more.

As the end approached, I didn't want to say goodbye. I'm grateful for this warm feeling... thank you for traveling with me.

author: Evinith
review_text: A significant improvement to the original and a perfect example that stunning graphics aren't all that a video game needs (although the stylization of this game will love a timeless vibe). if you aren't a fan a traditional JPRGs, than they may not be the game for you. However, if you grew up on Final Fantasy games before they reach their double digits there is a wonderful adventure to find here. Although its emulates it's older JRPG predecessors too much sometimes (this script needs and editor) the strong gameplay and soundtrack of the Octopath series continues to shine. I have my gripes with the game, such as the story to gameplay ratio at times, however this is still a 10/10 for me. As a long time JRPG fan from the 80s & 90s, I look forward to Asano's next creations as a creator who doesn't make perfect products, but makes products perfect for my niche.

author: NoctisMR
review_text: Jogo bom pra caralho. Me ajudou a copar com situações semelhantes na vida real. A beleza desse jogo é absurda. Existem momentos que você simplesmente para e pensa: "Puta que pariu".

author: jxstjxlius
review_text: Ein sehr schönes, aber sehr kurzes Spiel mit nur maximal 3h Spielzeit, wenn man es das erste Mal durchspielt. Artistisch sehr gelungen und die Message kommt auch sehr gut durch.

author: CharliezardLaw
review_text: Diante de tanta beleza e sentimento, não tem como reconhecer o grande mérito por trás de toda a direção artística e musical. Me tirou em mais de uma vez calafrios, porém, poderia ser algo muito maior. Senti como se fosse uma demo de um futuro projeto, e isso me deixou um pouco decepcionado, algo muito parecido com o que é o jogo: Sky Children of the Light.

author: JonatanRiver
review_text: Excelente juego de plataformas. Muy intuitivo. Los puzzles no son imposibles aunque si te llevan un tiempo.  La banda sonorame parece impresionante.

author: ioxx
review_text: N'étant pas fan de la série des Yakuza, je suis allé vers ce dernier volet sans avis favorable. Le jeu s'avère très prenant et très riche dans les possibilités que l'on a de s'occuper (une floppée de mini jeux en tout genre, allant même jusqu'à intégrer un jeu de kart et de gestion d'entreprise ). Les personnages et l'histoire sont plutôt prenant bien que parfois les scènes trainent en longueur (le gnan-gnan japonais dans toute sa splendeur). Les combats sont plutôt faciles et répétitifs, sauf les derniers boss qui donnent enfin du fil à retordre. Le jeu reste une très bonne expérience, rien que pour la balade dans ce japon citadin et contemporain.

author: KinimodYunmi
review_text: Wegen GameTwo habe ich mir mein erstes Yakuza Game geholt und es war absolut witzig und hatte eine herausragende Story, enorm viel Humor, aber auch sehr ernst und emotional. Man kann hier eine echt klasse gemachte Spielwelt, super Szenen und nicht vorhersehbare & schockierende Storywendungen erleben!Kasuga ist mir als etwas auf dem Schlauch stehender und extrem gutmütiger Ex-Yakuza einfach enorm ans Herz gewachsen und ich freue mich deswegen schon sehr auf Infinite Wealth und hoffe auch viele weitere Like a Dragon Teile!Die Teammitglieder sind auch klasse und es wird viel auf sie eingegangen, sie haben ihre eigenen persönlichen Momente in der Story und abseits davon eine Art Charakterstory freispielbar, die nochmal etwas vertiefter ins Persönliche **** Gameplay ist dynamischer als andere Games dieser Art, nach einigen hundert Kämpfen dann aber iwann doch zu viel, ich konnte auch Mabutchi nicht besiegen, obwohl ich immer alle Nebenquests und Heldenaufträge gemacht habe, bevor ich den nächste Storyschritt angegangen bin. Das Level-Grinden sehe ich als einzige Schwachstelle des Spiels!

author: Kramer76
review_text:
Gioco che merita parecchio,ottima storia anche se sembra troppo diluita soprattutto alcuni dialoghi secondari, ottimo il **** principale cosi come quelli secondari, ci sono tantissime attività secondario che non annoiano (tranne la gestione dell'azienda) il combattimento a turni potrebbe infastidire i vecchi fan della serie Yakuza, gioco divertentissimo pieno di battute e scene surreali

Gioco che merita

author: JimmieRamone
review_text:
I had reservations about Yakuza no longer being a story-based brawler, but this is honestly one of the best Japanese role-playing games I've played in years. There's a fun job system, reminiscent of the ones you'd find in the older Dragon Quest games. Tongue-in-cheek callbacks to other popular JRPGs are everywhere, from direct references to Dragon Quest to more subtle nods like the "New Age Hippie" that was one of the sillier enemies in Earthbound.

The story is just about what you'd expect from Yakuza; the main plot is a somewhat more serious crime drama, while the subplots are every bit as zany as the ones in Kazuma Kiryu's adventures in the previous games. One of the best modern RPGs I've had the pleasure of playing.

author: lanas
review_text:
I remember when this game came out and all world play it. I remember many streamers play it and others continued to play it a long time after its released. By seen it on streams I never got why it was so popular. Some things in the game mighty confuse you when you see it such: The hack system game play or the air gameplay with the robot. 
The time past and I play games like "Final Fantasy online" which was the best mmorpg I ever tried and the time for "Nier Automata" has come for me even a bit late. 
The game is probably the most beautiful game I have ever played and one of the most emotional. Literally the game reach the perfection on any part such: gameplay, story, soundtrack, artwork, characters, boss fighting. All touch the perfection for me and in every city I discovering it was a real expierence for me. All it was so beautiful and the game has something to put you inside. How you move the char and you feel it. Is like you really you are inside in this place and feel all these things around you.
I never expected to play and saw such a game and taste such perfection.This game has many things to offer and is one of the few games out there that is for everyone. Every person can play it and admire it as it deserves. I wish I can put higher ratings for such a masterpiece

author: pigjedi
review_text: NieR's story is a masterpiece when you get to the true ending

author: Valeriaaaaa
review_text: Personally, my expectation from an RPG game is definitely having combo mechanics in combat. In my opinion, this was one of the biggest shortcomings of Nier. When we look at other RPG games like Devil May Cry or Final Fantasy, we see that they do this very well. We experience combat at its peak with dozens of combo mechanics. Nier, on the other hand, only offers us 2 different attack options and doesn't really showcase the combo differences between weapons. For example, I didn't see much animation difference between swords. I don't know. Nier disappointed me in this regard, although the combat animations are quite nice. The second issue is the insufficient variety of enemies. I don't call the same robot with some metal scraps added on top and its level increased a different type of enemy. Another issue is the environment design; I really didn't expect it to be this weak. If you want to understand what I mean, just look at the Abandoned City map. That's all I have to say. This game, which has the potential to be much better and to enter the top 10 of the greatest RPG games, has been left in the lurch. It's sad that it is so little known even with 2B's influence. When I ask anyone around me, I hear that the only reason they play this game is 2B. It actually explains a lot...

author: HarshRatanVerma
review_text:
Not your Casual Masterpiece.
This game is mind breaking, multiple endings,amazing philosophy, great combat mechanics and to top it all an eargasm of a music.
This game is not just a games its a masterpiece of an art.

author: BillMC1
review_text: القصة شي عظيم كيف ان حرفيا انت تتعامل مع الات لكنك تحس بتعاطف معاهم وبعض الاحيان كره التعاطف الكبير الي حسيته مع القطه نفسها كان شي خرافيحسسوني منجد بشعور انهم مقموعين طريقة اللعب ممتعه ايضا مافي ايلحظة حسيت بملل يمكن لان اللعبة اصلا قصيره كانت

review_text: vvery good game just lacs a bit from the story it is very short and still pricey i would wait for a sale

author: Ali_Akdemir
review_text: Tam bir başyapıt. Oyunun gittikçe derinleşen çok iyi de bir hikayesi var. Oyunu oynarken sıkılma ihtimaliniz çok düşük. Man this game, its got it all. ****' portals, killer robots, not so killer robots, POTATOES and space.

-1 tho for the weird cube-bot freaks wheatly puts together.

10/10 masterpiece, like a slice of a well baked cake!

author: matthew5326
review_text: this game is timeless, as in 2025 it still holds the title of the best puzzle game and is recognized one of the greatest games ever. it even holds up well graphically, as it feels every aspect of this game has aged like wine. some of the best characters, worldbuilding, and writing a video game has ever seen, and an unbelievably amazing experience. author: Wrathzo
review_text: Don't Starve is a survival video game developed by Klei Entertainment. The game follows a scientist named Wilson who finds himself in a dark, dreary parallel world known as the Constant and must survive as long as possible. To this end, the player must keep Wilson alive, fed, and mentally stable as he avoids a variety of surreal and supernatural enemies that will try to kill and devour him. The game's Adventure mode adds depth to the sparse plot and pits Wilson against the game's supposed antagonist, Maxwell.

author: metesuzuk
review_text: The art design is AWESOME. It's a lot of fun with its survival mechanics and variety of characters.

author: TiredAlfred
review_text: Assume the role of Wilson, an intrepid Gentleman Scientist who has been trapped by a demon and transported to a mysterious wilderness world. Wilson must learn to utilize his environment and its inhabi

author: Blutchibi1
review_text: Completé el 78% del juego en un total de 30 horas y 58 minutos sin mirar guías ni nada. Estuvo muy divertido. Lo que más me gustó del juego fue el movimiento por el mapa, es bastante fluido al igual que su combate.

author: bolsonarolula
review_text:
no geral o jogo é bom mas tem partes meio chatas como o diário do caçador e fazer 100% no modo alma de aço mas no geral ele é bom

author: Amzaid
review_text: Hollow Knight es un 10/10 absoluto. Un metroidvania con una jugabilidad precisa y desafiante, una banda sonora que se queda grabada en la memoria y una atmósfera inolvidable, reforzada por un diseño artístico fenomenal. Team Cherry creó una obra maestra que no solo redefinió el género Metroidvania, sino que también se consolidó como un referente indiscutible, ganándose un lugar entre los mejores videojuegos de todos los tiempos.

author: JoshySC
review_text: Una reseña no es suficiente para describir lo que este juego ha hecho por los metroidvania, belleza de juego por donde lo mires, el movimiento esta pensado al minimo detalle, como una escultura griega, ningún otro juego se le compara a lo que hizo team cherry el momento en el que se les cruzo por la mente crear semejante juego y no, no es glazing, bueno un poco si la verdad

author: zethix
review_text: Une expérience globalement satisfaisante. J’ai passé un bon moment du début à la fin.

author: Faxi3Maxi3
review_text:
A truly unique indie RPG with good music, interesting combat and a story that will keep you guessing with its creepy, funny and interesting moments. Avoid story spoilers at all costs!

If you like RPG maker games, Classic NES/SNES JRPGS, and games that take you to fantastical locations go play OMORI!

author: SimLau
review_text: Enchanting world. Beautiful music and artistic direction that fit the themes. This game would be a 10 IF the combat gameplay were better. Sure it makes sense thematically and it's clever in the way that abilities are used to give insight in the characters, but in practice it ends up being tedious. I still had some challenging and fun fights though!

author: Falie
review_text:
Feelings! If feelings and heartache is what you look for, Omori is the game to play. Amazingly well done, many layers of meaning and extra stuff to find.
The gameplay is nice enough: turnbased like. Altough, evidently, the battle system is not the core aspect of the game.. it is preety good, you have reasons to change your buils, select which skills to equip and make up your strategy.. it is not meant to be challenging, but is not naive either! I like it for this.
The world is really nice and the design s AMAZING..only downside, and that is a great downside.. is that the main quests are really dispersive and often you wish that there were more main quests but shorter (because you end up losing interest). But that is the only negative aspect of the game. That being said, play the game to feel it not to rush it, experience it and it will talk to you

author: Presepo_Karpov
review_text: Absolute masterpiece, made me cry, i don't any words other than "masterpiece" to describe this piece of art

review_text:
The game is truly amazing, there is some slight flaws about the blinking mechanic when using the camera, but just here and there if you follow the guide on how to set it up correctly.
The story is incredible for a game like this, truly eye opening and emotional.
100% recomend to anyone who is reading the reviews to just buy the game and play it without knowing anything about the story.

author: honestlyreviews
review_text: There aren’t words to describe how beautifully crafted this game is. Everything from the storyline, to the animation, to the background music is perfect. The story is heart wrenching from the very beginning, and the twist is absolutely ****. Though there’s only about an hour to ninety minutes of play time, it’s well worth downloading. Would definitely recommend to anyone, although caution to anyone who cry’s easily, I spent literally the whole time crying. If I had to think of one issue I had with the game it would be the eye tracking, sometimes it was a little too sensitive and would sense a blink when I moved my mouth or hand, overall i’d like to underline that I really did love this game

author: aligunes
review_text: A game that makes you say 'I can speedrun' The mechanics are very clever. The game draws you in more and more.

author: sammy447
review_text:
Neon White is quite possibly the single most replayable game of all time. The movement is absolutely fantastic, the skips and new strategies you can take to improve your time is addicting. I genuinely cannot recommend this game enough to anybody.

Unfortunately, the dialog really is a massive downside for me. It completely takes me out of the admittedly pretty decent story. It doesn't hurt the game that much, since the game clearly isn't focused on the story.

The platforming and shooting feels so satisfying and the grasp for making a new Personal Best is enormous. The soundtrack from Machine Girl fits great while you slay down some demons. It's very unique and fun!

author: Kajav
review_text: Life Is Strange es un juego de estilo novela grafica, quizá algo mas evolucionada. A nivel de historia es muy bueno, casi impresionante con escenas para el recuerdo. El arte y la musica no se quedan atrás, bastante buenos. Cuando lo jugué en su año de lanzamiento recuerdo que me impacto bastante y ahora que lo revisito me parece simplemente fenomenal, con esos aires de innovación (aunque ya no tanto) que hacen comprender por que es tan valorado en la comunidad. Una maravilla en el cual su punto fuerte es la historia. El punto menos fuerte seria su jugabilidad, que se siente muy pesada para el desplazamiento, aun cuando la versión remastered según es mas rápido el desplazamiento, a mi se me hace demasiado lento, mas de lo que el juego requiere.

I LOVE THIS GAME!

author: CnPx98
review_text:
This game is really underrated. I thought the story was amazing and because of the interactions I focused even more then I would whilst watching TV which made it even better. I really loved all the characters and found them all interesting. The game can be slow at times but even during them moments I never lost interest because the story still was moving forward at a good pace.

A couple of things that I didn't like was that the game was way to easy. I know it focusing on Story telling but still would have been nice if on the odd occasion something challenged you like QTEs (Quick time events) or some harder puzzles. A couple missions were kind of detective sort of thing but they were mostly self explanatory.
Another thing that was frustrating but not really an issue with the actual gameplay. For some reason when I 1st installed the game it kept crashing after completing chapter 1 and loading chapter 2. I tried verifying files (Xbox App) and that didn't fix the issue. When I reinstalled it was fine thou. Mite have been a corrupt file or something. It was saying something about a UE4 siren but no error code.
Another thing to note was that throughout the hole game I was getting random screen tearing during cutscenes. I tried messing about with video settings but nothing solved the problem. Apparently it is just an issue with the game. Its annoying thou cos the game has been out half a year and this should be fixed.

Overall the game is amazing and I really enjoyed it. If you enjoy slow pace story games then you should give it a go!

author: Harlequinreal
review_text: Muito bom isso aí simplesmente sensacional bom do começo ao fim, tem uma Partes parada mas outra q por serem bem carregada emocionalmente prendem sua atenção de uma forma sem igual

author: Tuetenhenkel
review_text:
I liked most of the characters from True Colors from the start. Even if one or the other cliché was served here, I found the characters written interesting and I enjoyed following their stories.
The main story itself is neither particularly innovative nor offers many surprises. Still, I liked the way the story was told and it makes you think about it even after you've finished. It changes from sad to happy situations without exaggerating them.

Unfortunately, there are hardly any decision-making options and if there are any, they have little effect, but that didn't bother me personally.

As usual in Life is Strange, you spend most of your time walking around, talking to other people and listening to monologues about things. The last one could have been shortened to a more bearable level for my taste. At least it gives you a bit more context sometimes.

If you don't like games like this, which focus very much on the story and offer hardly any gameplay, you won't be happy with True Colors. Otherwise, I can highly recommend the game because it was a wonderful gaming experience for me, which deals with difficult topics in an unobtrusive way and still leaves you with hope and a good feeling.

author: lazyssj
review_text:
Highly recommend this one as well.

The sequel to LIS 1 in my opinion is just as good taking you on a journey between two brothers and surviving together with exciting twists and turns, a great art style, and improved graphics. Choices actually do matter and it makes you genuinely feel like an older brother and that your guidance has a serious effect on how Daniel turns out. The story can be brutally sad at points though so don't say I didn't warn you.

The only complaint were some of the political topics covered especially in episode 4 and 5 can be a little on-the-nose and cheesy rather than impactful. The message I understand, but perhaps wasn;t delivered with great care.

author: onyxian
review_text:
The Story

The Walking Dead: Survival Instincts brings you into an apocalyptic world where zombies roam the world. Throughout the game you play as Daryl Dixon, one of the main characters from the television show. In Survival Instincts, the story line gives general players and fans of The Walking Dead and insight look of how Daryl, and his brother Merle Dixon, met up with the main group and what they went through before that time occurred as well as show how Daryl achieved his ever-so famous crossbow.

The Graphics

Graphics quality in Survival Instincts somewhat lacks a dynamic punch, for example a walkers, otherwise known as a zombie, hair looks like it was made of glue or clay then molded onto the head. However, the diversity of each walkers face has it's own unique pattern of bite marks, scratches, shapes of the jaw, teeth and more, these all add to a good fright factor at the right moment of time e.g in a dark room, turning round and a walker attacks you out of no where. There are a great amount of bugs relating to graphics, such as broken fence pieces still floating midair, gates flashing black when opened, walkers floating when killed. All around missions have invisible walls, preventing you from going further away from the current map without any sort of police barricade, for example, taking away a bit of the realistic touch.

The Mechanics and sound

The AI is very sloppy, throughout gameplay I had opened a metal fence and the walkers still attacked the fence, paying no attention to me whatsoever, I then began to kill them one by one. When one walker died another took its place, as if they were lining up to die. The scavenging mechanics allow you to gather survivors and send them out to gather supplies, but the amount of survivors depends on the size of the car you currently have. That said, there are missions that allow you to find car keys to either bigger, or smaller, cars. When sending out survivors to scavenge for supplies, there is always a chance of getting them killed by walkers, depending on what item you give them to defend themselves with as each survivor has their own skill trait such as being good at using blunt weapons. There were countless sound bugs within this game, fences breaking with the sound of wood getting chopped, walkers dying with the sound of a metal fence breaking and more. The game includes a feature where the player can choose a method of travel such as highways, streets and backroads. Depending on what method you choose, one method can either consume less fuel or another method may take a road such as backroads where it consumes a lot of fuel with a high chance of breaking down. If, by chance, your car breaks down or runs out of fuel, a side mission will take place allowing you to scavenge the nearby area for fuel or car hose. The issue with the side missions is that they're very repetitive, as there are about 3-4 different areas.

The Gameplay

It felt a bit stiff trying to kill walkers, e.g using the sledgehammer was a lot quicker than normal. One thing that gives a good addition to gameplay is sneaking around, trying to sneak past walkers and stealth killing them by sneaking up from behind and executing the stealth kill action. Like any realistic movie or game, gun fire attracts walkers to your location so be sure to only use your gun in dire situations and ammo is scarce to watch out, you don't want to run out of ammo when you desperately need it. If you ever happen to get grabbed by a walker, it activates a grappling mechanic where the player must place the circle onto the walkers head, activate the attack trigger and stab them in the head. This method breaks fighting gameplay by 50% due to the fact after killing the walker that grabbed you, if there is another walker, it will grab you almost instantly after you let go of the previous walker, this allows you to kill over 15 walkers without using any ammo, losing any health and just drains the fun and realism out of the game entirely. On the last mission, near the very end the last thing you did is mount a military vehicles machine gun and kill any incoming zombies, after which it cuts to black screen and goes to the credits, without showing you how exactly Daryl and Merle met the group like the game was purposely made for.

Final Verdict

The game seems rushed, only to gain quick money. For the price of $49.99 or £31.99 makes the game a complete rip off, due to the lack of effort of the game. I feel the only reason others need to buy this game, is to play as Daryl Dixon and get to see Merle, even though he is barely in the game. A poor effort to a great series that could have become something incredible if more time was put into it.

author: Sky-Moondrift
review_text:
An atrocious game, And possibly one of the worst Ports in video game history. I could only stomach about 40 minutes of this trash until I wanted to throw my mouse at the wall.

The graphics look like a Playstation 1 game, the sounds are repetitive and annoying, but the one thing that makes this game total garbage is the horrifying controls, most notably the forced Mouse Acceleration that makes aiming and navigating a complete disaster.

Not only does it have the most **** Mouse Acceleration, but the mouse aiming will just glitch out and start sticking on different parts of the screen.

An unplayable travesty ****. And to make matters worse, the devs still won't recognize or fix the horrible controls and mouse issues, which shows you how little they care. I couldn't play any more of this if someone was paying me.

Stay well away from this abomination.

author: Simoss13
review_text:
Oxenfree delivers a thrilling experience which delves into the supernatural. You start as a teenager (Alex about 17) and she is accompanied by some friends to have a good time on a remote island. Things suddenly go pear shape as you awaken an ancient spirit that can possess and disorientates you and your friends.
The theme and interaction of characters is top notch, I am always wanting to know more about these characters lives and situations to lead them to being who and why they are. These spirits leech onto Alex's insecurities through the game and provoking unresolved issues.
At this point I should add the voice acting and character interaction is what really executed the plot and brought the game together as a whole. If it wasn't for voice acting and characters, I cannot see how this game would of panned out.
I really like thrillers that also develop characters and showing a 'coming of age' undertone. Movies such as 'IT' is a prime example of this. Although a different plot, it has that common theme. I scare easily so having an emotional personal plot really brings depth making it tolerable.
The art style and visual effects in the game are also breathtaking as it really immerse you in the games theme making me disorientated.
The major complaint I have on this game is the actual gameplay itself. It felt like a visual novel and walking sim, therefore the game play and skill is minimal. You have dialect choices constantly in the game which is great. I just wished they allowed me to select an option after a character has spoken, as the game seems to force me to choose and interrupt another characters dialogue. This can distract on the brilliant voice acting and plot which bothered me.
The game is priced well for a 4 hour adventure and if you want to see alternative endings (like me) you will give a second try to see how you choice matter in the end credits

author: Merse
review_text: A Short Hike es una experiencia hermosa que le deseo a todo el mundo. Es un juego reconfortante, con un arte bellísimo y un estilo pixelado por defecto que lo hace entrañable. La música es otra de las grandes virtudes que hacen de este juego una obra maestra, fuera de Nintendo recuerdo pocos juegos con bandas sonoras tan maravillosas. El personaje que controlas en el juego es Claire, un pájaro que va a la isla de la que viene su familia con su tía para alejarse de la ciudad y pasar el verano. Al despertarse cuenta que está esperando una llamada y no llega, entonces su tía le dice que ahí no hay cobertura, que solo la hay en Hawk Peak, el pico más alto de la isla. Así, Claire se decide a hacer la ruta, y en el camino se encuentra con toda suerte de personajes con actividades e historias interesantes. Aficionados a la pesca, jugadores de una nueva especie de variedad de Volley cooperativo en la que siempre ganas, un atleta que achaca sus victorias a su vincha de la suerte y termina reconociendo que sus éxitos vienen de su trabajo y no de la suerte, un pintor que insiste en pintar cosas que no le convencen para complacer a otros hasta que decide pintar lo que le gusta de verdad, un escritor trabajando en el final de su novela, unos escaladores un tanto lamentables, etc. Al llegar arriba del todo, Claire contempla el espectacular escenario en el que hay una aurora boreal. Entonces recibe una llamada, la que tanto llevaba esperando: es su madre. Conocemos que se ha sometido a una operación, de la cual no avisó a Claire, y por eso ella tenía tantas ganas de recibir la llamada y hablar con su madre. Sabemos que todo está bien, también comenta su madre que Claire ya es mayor y pronto ya no la necesitará. “Nunca dejaré de necesitarte. Te quiero, mamá”, responde ella. Todo esto sucede mientras suena una melodía preciosa, posiblemente la mejor del juego, con lo que es imposible no emocionarse en este momento, que ya es una de las memorias más bonitas que guardo de un videojuego. Otro detalle remarcable es que tras llegar a la cima, un poco más abajo una escaladora te pide que le dejes 6 plumas para subir. Después puedes encontrarla arriba, te lo agradecerá y te devolverá las plumas. Es otro momento muy bonito. El control del juego también es fantástico, volar es muy satisfactorio. No le pongo un pero a nada del juego.

author: Nazrielau05
review_text: After 4 hours of playing Balatro, i think I've shaped up a reasonable opinion;Yes, i could see why this game took the world by storm. It's incredibly intuitive in user interface design and combat mechanics. The soundtrack is cool, the visuals are okay, and the gameplay in general is addicting. But for me, that's when it ends.I absolutely have a certain bias against this game and I'll admit that. When i see reviews on Steam and Metacritic, i feel like people are praising this game just for the sake of it. They're mentioning these, very VERY basic structures and spices for any Rogue-like game entry. "No two Balatro match is truly the same", "The game's deep mechanics deserves so much love", as if those two things aren't always THE standard of a rogue-like game???Maybe my bias is; I'm a very seasoned Rogue-like player. Hades, Inscryption, Slay the Spire, Risk of Rain 2, Dead Cells etc. all of these games shaped up my expectation of a rogue-like entry. While I'm not taking away the fun that people are having with Balatro (I'm absolutely having fun with the game too!), i feel like these things that people give Balatro so much credit for, aren't anything but the genre's standard for me.This game is amazing, i won't deny that. It's a great value for anyone into the rogue-like genre, but i feel like the praises this game gets are a little overblown. Compared to Slay the Spire, and Inscryption, this game stands tall as a deck builer rogue-like with a fun & charming poker game aesthetic. Presentation-wise, Balatro isn't the most interesting thing out there, not even in my gaming library. However, an amazing game is an amazing game. I won't try to deny that. 9/10.

author: micromango
review_text: The very first chapter is amazing and although the game mechanics are not perfect as a strategy card game, the fun is in everything else and the card mechanics are still good enough make you use your brain

author: Luccaixu
review_text: Quero começar essa review com uma frase:"QUE PORRA FOI ESSA?!"Que jogo bom, jogo de carta delicioso e desafiador, cheio de estratégias e muitas maneiras de conseguir fechar o **** começo o jogo parece ser algo simples, mas conforme você vai jogando ele, muitas coisas vão acontecendo, um mistério maior começa a se formar, e quando você finalmente consegue, tudo vira de cabeça pra baixo e vira uma loucura. Transformando o jogo em algo completamente diferente e inovando em **** amei esse jogo, teve um carinho enorme na hora da produção dele.Recomendo a todos que joguem esse jogo sem ver nada dele antes, foi muito foda.E não se preocupe se você não conseguir vencer fácil, ele é difícil mas uma hora vai

author: Waywurd08
review_text: A Dark, and beautiful game about games, showcasing how your life for something can also become your own obsession, your own prison, your life, and your death. Insryption evolves brilliantly as you play and subverts your expectations of what a video game even is. 10/10 gamepla,10/10 music, 10/10 visuals/atmosphere, and 100/10 ending. not only is this game a must play, but it is also a must BEAT.

author: JoshySC
review_text:
Que tanto estas dispuesto a perder con tal de ganar una partida de cartas a un viejo?

Inscryption no pierde el tiempo en atraer al jugador, pues apenas al abrir el juego, su estetica y musica obscura te hacen saber que lo que estas a punto de jugar no es tan simple como parece,  lleno de misterio por donde lo veas, la historia va desenmascarando la verdadera naturaleza del juego inscryption, la mecanica es simple, gana una partida de cartas al viejo Leshy, el principal antagonista del juego, con reglas creadas por el mismo, avanzas por varios mapas en forma de pergamino obteniendo cartas o mejoras para estas, dependiendo que recorrido quieras hacer, pues las cartas tienen varias estadisticas como costo, vida, daño y habilidades que se pueden ir mejorando mientras avanzas en la partida, creando oportunidades de crear un mazo que se ajuste a tu estilo de juego e incluso poder romper el juego, el gameplay es divertido, adictivo y, que mas podria haber en un juego de cartas tipo terror y obscuro como inscryption?. Sin hacer spoiler te recomiendo este juego si eres nuevo en el genero y buscas algo fresco e innovardor.

Nothing else much to say, it is what it means to be.. a dungeon crawler made for quick and pausable runs.

Only downside for me, but unimportant, i would have love a bit more lore
